jobDescription:
Job Summary:

We are looking for a motivated Electrical Design/Engineering Co-op Student to join our Production Engineering team within the Machines Business Group. This co-op position offers hands-on experience in electrical design and engineering, providing valuable support to our team.

Role Description:

  • Electrical Design: Assist with the design and development of systems involving Industrial PCs, digital servo drives, fieldbuses, hydraulic power units, and heat control.
  • Control Systems Development: Support the design and development of control systems for new products.
  • Schematics Creation: Help create electrical schematics, including layouts and bills of materials.
  • Cost Analysis & Design Solutions: Participate in cost analysis, specify electrical hardware, and contribute to developing new design solutions.
  • Troubleshooting & QA: Assist with troubleshooting, participate in QA activities, and support technology development for injection molding machines.
  • Collaboration: Work alongside senior team members, using Manufacturing and Design Process Methodologies.

In this Role, You Can Expect:

  • Training on relevant software and tools.
  • Integration into a collaborative team environment.
  • Opportunities to present your ideas and work to the team.

jobDescription:
This is a 16-month co-op position and has the option of working in our Toronto office full time, or hybrid throughout the week, with a minimum of three (3) days in the office.

As our Associate Solutions Manager, you will design and build Proof of Concept solutions from scratch for our clients to demonstrate how the Vena platform can help Finance teams be more efficient. You will collaborate with the Solutions Consultants to learn about challenges our prospects have and help them understand how Vena can solve these challenges and add value to their business.

Your Impact:

The overall scope of your position will include, but will not be limited to:

  • Work with presales Solutions Consultants to deconstruct a client/prospect business process and define the strategy for delivering a meaningful Proof of Concept solution (POC)
  • Build POCs that are tailored to solving the prospects’ pain points and ensure that all success criteria are delivered, and product differentiators included
  • Collaborate with the Engineering team to understand/design/develop new product features and incorporate into POC solutions
  • Build models for various vertical industries including, but not limited to: Professional Sports teams, Manufacturing, Financial Services, and Real Estate.
  • Develop subject matter expertise in CPM
  • Create and maintain any required POC solution design and architecture documentation
  • Anonymize existing POC solutions for future use in other sales cycles

What You Bring to the Team:

  • Currently pursuing a post-secondary education in any Engineering discipline, Accounting, or Commerce/Finance and/or equivalent experience;
  • Understanding of any financial process (i.e. budgeting, forecasting, month end close, financial reporting, financial consolidation);
  • Advanced Excel skills with the ability to create complex formulas, macros and sophisticated formatting;
  • Knowledge of Relational databases and/or multi-dimensional database cubes;
  • Understanding of coding fundamentals to apply to product and solution innovation;
  • Ability to gather and understand the client requirements, leveraging a consultative approach, and translating those requirements into an effective POC;
  • Strong business acumen and understanding of various vertical industries;
  • Strong communication skills;
  • Self-learner, with sense of initiative, and perseverance to deliver high quality work

jobDescription:
Untether AI is a rapidly growing Toronto startup building a next generation hardware AI accelerator for neural net inference. We're designing integrated circuits that will run neural nets orders of magnitude faster, while using less power. This class of chips will be the standard platform for running image recognition, speech synthesis, text-to-speech, and many other applications in data centers, mobile phones, and self-driving cars within the next 5 years.

With our second generation speedAI silicon up and running in the lab, our hardware team is focused on a few primary areas:

Bringing speedAI to market:

  • Chip, board, and system validation (hands on lab work, scripting, etc.)
  • Firmware development and productization (Low level C++ coding)

Developing the next generation:

  • RTL Design (SystemVerilog, etc.)
  • Verification (SystemVerilog, UVM Simulations, FPV, etc)
  • Custom Digital and Mixed Signal Circuit Design
  • Automating our Work through CAD Tooling and Infrastructure Development

We are looking for self motivated and innately curious candidates. You can expect to be put in charge of an important project that will challenge you to learn and you will be provided with mentoring and guidance from veteran hardware engineers. Because we're building new systems from the ground up, you'll get to work on new unsolved problems.

We encourage interdisciplinarity and learning, so if you have experience in hardware or software, come talk to us. But don't worry if you think your experience is too narrowly focused, we've got great projects for people with a wide range of interests and specializations.

Join our Physical Design team and learn about our hardware projects. We'll work together to set the deliverables for your term with us. In general, expect to work in a team environment with guidance and mentoring from experts.

Some examples of tasks:

  • Design, propose and oversee the analysis/evaluation physical implementations for digital logic blocks
  • Optimize placement and routing plans and present timing and power results
  • Collaborate with micro-architects, synthesis team, and other PD engineers to enable custom IP blocks
  • Scripting and basic software development in support of hardware design - python preferred

We don't have strict skill requirements, but of course prior experience in the tools and skills we use is a plus:
- Tools and programming languages we use: Cadence (Innovus, Virtuoso) , Synopsys (VCS, DC,PrimeTime), spice, Verilog, python, TCL, git
- Topics and skills we are interested in include: CPU design, GPU design, physical design, artificial intelligence, neural net training and inference, digital logic design and analysis

jobDescription:
Who we are

Geotab ® is a global leader in IoT and connected transportation and certified “Great Place to Work™.” We are a company of diverse and talented individuals who work together to help businesses grow and succeed, and increase the safety and sustainability of our communities. Geotab is advancing security, connecting commercial vehicles to the internet and providing web-based analytics to help customers better manage their fleets. Geotab’s open platform and Geotab Marketplace ®, offering hundreds of third-party solution options, allows both small and large businesses to automate operations by integrating vehicle data with their other data assets. Processing billions of data points a day, Geotab leverages data analytics and machine learning to improve productivity, optimize fleets through the reduction of fuel consumption, enhance driver safety and achieve strong compliance to regulatory changes. Our team is growing and we’re looking for people who follow their passion, think differently and want to make an impact. Ours is a fast paced, ever changing environment. Geotabbers accept that challenge and are willing to take on new tasks and activities - ones that may not always be described in the initial job description. Join us for a fulfilling career with opportunities to innovate, great benefits, and our fun and inclusive work culture. Reach your full potential with Geotab. To see what it’s like to be a Geotabber, check out our blog and follow us @InsideGeotab on Instagram . Join our talent network to learn more about job opportunities and company news.Who you are:

We are always looking for amazing talent who can contribute to our growth and deliver results! Geotab is seeking a Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) & Prototype Intern who will support the Hardware Engineering team with the administration of the PLM system and the preparation of hardware prototypes builds. If you love technology, and are keen to join an industry leader - we would love to hear from you!

What you'll do:

As a Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) & Prototype Intern your key area of responsibility will be to ensure efficient operation of our PLM system, while maintaining data integrity and effective use across all of our product life cycles. Throughout this internship, you'll be mentored by the Hardware Project Lead, helping you maximize your professional growth and ensure a successful internship experience.

The opportunity

  • 12-16 month work-term beginning May 2025.
  • Full-time, paid internship: Monday - Friday, 37.5hrs/week.
  • Your first week at Geotab begins with 'GEO Launch' - a one-week Employee Orientation. Click here to learn more!
  • Learn more about the Geotab Campus Program here .

How you'll make an impact

  • Manage the administration of Geotab’s PLM system, by completing data uploads such as Bill of Materials (BOM); library files and other supporting documentation.
  • Review data within the PLM system for data integrity and accuracy for seamless product development and manufacturing processes. Notify the Hardware Team of any discrepancies.
  • Create PLM training material and conduct hands-on PLM system training sessions using Google Workspace.
  • Answer PLM related inquiries, through Google Workspace and/or JIRA with guidance from Hardware Developers (as applicable).
  • Assist in preparing materials (e.g., circuit boards, electrical components) for hardware prototype builds with guidance from the Hardware Project Lead.
  • Collaborate with both internal and external stakeholders (CMs and printed circuit board (PCB) shops) to help meet the requirements for a prototype build from the hardware development team, to adhere to timelines and inventory.
  • Support Hardware Engineering team with designing Altium footprints using Altium Designer (as applicable).

What you'll bring to the role

  • Currently enrolled in a University or College Electrical Engineering program or related field.
  • Ability to read and understand schematics and Bill of Materials (BOM).
  • Independent and deep learner.
  • Excellent organizational skills.
  • Experience in a University or College design team.
  • Hands-on soldering experience.
  • Experience with Altium Designer or any other ECAD software.

If you got this far, we hope you're feeling excited about this role! Even if you don't feel you meet every single requirement, we still encourage you to apply. Please note: Geotab does not accept agency resumes and is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes. Please do not forward resumes to Geotab employees. How we workAt Geotab, we have adopted a flexible hybrid working model in that we have systems, functions, programs and policies in place to support both in-person and virtual work. However, you are welcomed and encouraged to come into our beautiful, safe, clean offices as often as you like. When working from home, you are required to have a reliable internet connection with at least 50mb DL/10mb UL. Virtual work is supported with cloud-based applications, collaboration tools and asynchronous working. The health and safety of employees are a top priority. We encourage work-life balance and keep the Geotab culture going strong with online social events, chat rooms and gatherings. Join us and help reshape the future of technology! We believe that ensuring diversity is fundamental to our future growth and progress and is an integral part of our business. We believe that success happens where new ideas can flourish – in an environment that is rich in diversity and a place where people from various backgrounds can work together. Geotab encourages applications from all qualified individuals. We are committed to accommodating people with disabilities during the recruitment and assessment processes and when people are hired. We will ensure the accessibility needs of employees with disabilities are taken into account as part of performance management, career development, training and redeployment processes. If you require accommodation at any stage of the application process or want more information about our diversity and inclusion as well as accommodation policies and practices, please contact us at careers@geotab.com. By submitting a job application to Geotab Inc. or its affiliates and subsidiaries (collectively, “Geotab”), you acknowledge Geotab’s collection, use and disclosure of your personal data in accordance with our Privacy Policy . Click here to learn more about what happens with your personal data.

jobDescription:
Our student and new graduate programs offer a chance to explore Sun Life from the inside. You’ll make a difference in the lives of our customers and communities, while building the skills and experience that allow you to grow in a meaningful and rewarding way.

Job Description:

Length of term: 1 year, May 2025 - May 2026


The role is part of the central Digital Analytics Team, which is the enterprise hub for the digital measurement practice, Adobe Analytics, Adobe Target, and Tealium iQ administration. The role reports to the Manager, Digital Analytics.

What will you do?

Initial/Ongoing Responsibilities

  • Understand and learn about the role of digital analytics within the company, including how to use Adobe Analytics, one of the world’s leading digital analytics tools.

  • Maintain and update key statistical reports about the company’s web sites.

  • Respond to ad hoc reporting requests from the internal global marketing community and assist in acquiring and analyzing digital marketing data.

  • Effectively identify gaps relating to the reporting infrastructure and training content.

Mid to Long Term Responsibilities

  • Implement new reporting infrastructure, for example Excel scorecards, Adobe Analytics reports and data exports.

  • Assist in the Tealium iQ/Adobe Analytics tag implementation and data collection process. This includes tool configuration and data validation.

  • Support the management of Adobe Target as an optimization and personalization tool.

  • Provide marketers with actionable recommendations on how to improve their web sites and digital marketing campaigns.

  • Support the design of Adobe Analytics tagging frameworks and tag quality assurance.

  • Primary user management lead for tools managed within the team. This includes Adobe Analytics, Adobe Target and Tealium iQ.

  • Education of business partners in the areas of digital analytics and Adobe Analytics.

  • Subject matter expert in the use of Adobe Analytics.

  • Ad hoc projects which could include comprehensive site reviews and internal search optimization, ETL enablement for various tools and data sources, using Tableau as a data visualization tool.

What do you need to succeed?

* Ideal candidate is available for a 12-month co-op term

Preferred Disciplines:

  • Computer Engineering

  • Computer Science

  • Engineering Science (Electrical and Computer)

  • Engineering Science (Math, Stats & Finance)

  • Industrial Engineering

  • Math & Stats

  • Data Science

Technical

  • Understanding of web publishing and usability design

  • Commanding knowledge of MS Excel or other related software

  • Experience with Web/Digital Analytics software an asset (for example, Google Analytics or Adobe Analytics)

  • Experience with programming in JavaScript or Python an asset

  • Understanding of digital marketing (e.g. SEO or social) an asset

  • Understanding of SQL is helpful, but not required

Analytical

  • Be comfortable working with large sets of data

  • Able to synthesize data into conclusive findings that can be used to optimize a site’s performance

  • Strong attention to detail

Soft Skills

  • Passionate about developing digital marketing, consulting and data analysis skills

  • Strong communications and relationship building skills

  • Self-driven, resourceful individual with an ability to work under little supervision

  • Able to meet deadlines and be responsible for all projects assigned

  • Comfortable to network and approach colleagues within the business to gather data and complete projects

What is in it for you?

  • A friendly, collaborative, and inclusive culture where you’re an innovator and trusted partner

  • An environment of continuous learning and improvement

  • We’re honoured to be recognized as a 2022 Best Workplaces in Canada by Great Place to Work® Canada & 2022 Best Workplaces for Inclusion by Great Place to Work® Canada

The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted for.  The Base Pay which you will be considered for will vary depending on the Campus program you are selected for.

Eligible Sun Life employees for various Campus Graduate programs will also participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance

Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.

Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com .

At Sun Life we strive to create a flexible work environment where our employees are empowered to do their best work. Several flexible work options are available and can be discussed throughout the selection process depending on the role requirements and individual needs.

We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

jobDescription:
About Marvell

Marvell’s semiconductor solutions are the essential building blocks of the data infrastructure that connects our world. Across enterprise, cloud and AI, automotive, and carrier architectures, our innovative technology is enabling new possibilities.

At Marvell, you can affect the arc of individual lives, lift the trajectory of entire industries, and fuel the transformative potential of tomorrow. For those looking to make their mark on purposeful and enduring innovation, above and beyond fleeting trends, Marvell is a place to thrive, learn, and lead.

Your Team, Your Impact

We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented PEY student to join our team as a Project Analyst. As a Project Analyst, you will play a crucial role in supporting our project management efforts, ensuring the successful planning, execution, and monitoring of various projects within our organization. This position offers an excellent opportunity to gain hands-on experience in project management and develop a solid foundation for a rewarding career in this field.

What You Can Expect

Job Overview:

We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented PEY student to join our team as a Project Analyst. As a Project Analyst, you will play a crucial role in supporting our project management efforts, ensuring the successful planning, execution, and monitoring of various projects within our organization. This position offers an excellent opportunity to gain hands-on experience in project management and develop a solid foundation for a rewarding career in this field.

Key Responsibilities:

Project Planning and Initiation:

Collaborate with project managers to assist in project planning, including defining objectives, scope, timelines, and resource requirements. Participate in project kickoff meetings and help create project documentation.
Data Analysis:

Collect and analyze project data to identify trends, issues, and areas for improvement. Generate reports and dashboards to provide insights into project performance.
Documentation and Reporting:

Maintain project documentation, including project plans, schedules, status reports, and meeting minutes. Prepare regular progress reports for project stakeholders.
Risk Management:

Assist in identifying potential project risks and issues. Work with the project team to develop mitigation strategies.
Resource Coordination:

Assist in resource allocation and scheduling tasks for project team members. Monitor resource utilization and report on potential conflicts or bottlenecks.
Communication and Collaboration:

Foster effective communication among project team members and stakeholders. Coordinate and facilitate project meetings, ensuring follow-up on action items.

What We're Looking For

  • Engineering, Computer Science, Business, Science, Arts or related fields, or the equivalent work experience that provides knowledge and exposure to theories, principles and concepts
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications, particularly Excel and PowerPoint.
  • Ability to work effectively in a team and adapt to a fast-paced work environment.
  • Eagerness to learn and grow in the field of project management.
  • Training and mentorship will be provided to help you develop essential project management skills.
  • Opportunities for career advancement within the organization may be available based on performance and demonstrated skills.

Additional Compensation and Benefit Elements

With competitive compensation and great benefits, you will enjoy our workstyle within an environment of shared collaboration, transparency, and inclusivity. We’re dedicated to giving our people the tools and resources they need to succeed in doing work that matters, and to grow and develop with us. For additional information on what it’s like to work at Marvell, visit our Careers page.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status.

jobDescription:
Our employees are at the heart of what we do best: helping people, businesses and society prosper in good times and be resilient in bad times. When you join our team, you’re bringing this purpose to life alongside a passionate community of experts.

Feel empowered to learn and grow while being valued for who you are– here, diversity is a strength. You have our commitment to support you in reaching your goals with tools, opportunities, and flexibility. It’s our employee promise.

Our hybrid work model provides the balance between working from home and enjoying meaningful in-person interactions.

Read on to see how you can shape the future, win as a team, and grow with us.

About the role

Launching your tech career at Intact means joining a diverse team of more than 3,000 Digital, Data and Tech experts working at the intersection of what exists and what’s possible. Here, you’ll be supported by forward-thinking leaders who celebrate shared success, and you’ll help push the industry forward with digital solutions that go beyond insurance to offer everyday value to millions of people. You’ll grow personally and professionally with access to cutting-edge technology-driven learning platforms and make lasting connections near and far. Most importantly, you’ll discover how exciting the “real world” can be.

Here, your career will take off

At Intact, we’re leading an insurance transformation to better protect people, businesses and society. We want future talent - like you - to help us lead the charge. Join our team as a DevOps I for the Summer 2025 term. In this role, you’ll make a difference while building the skills and experience that will propel your career forward.

We are looking for an intern to join our Commercial & Specialty SE team, here’s what you’ll do here:

  • Implement and test low to moderately complex code changes to fix identified defects in existing s/w products (e.g., identify and debug an application) or to moderately enhance new/future s/w releases.

  • Troubleshoots low to moderate defects within code (within own component) and provide input into and performs actions as designated in the remediation plan.

  • Contribute to the development of requirements with product management and architects; provides recommendations to enhance design to prevent recurring defects.

  • Provide additional support in solving software/systems monitoring issues and escalations which require moderate technical expertise to troubleshoot.  Complete low to medium configuration activities such as alerts, dashboards, etc.

  • Assisting in automation of deployment of solutions as code (working in a CICD space).

  • Ensure systems are optimal and meet quality standards by analyzing, providing creative suggestions to improve services and user experiences.

  • Be creative and come up with ideas to improve our services and user experiences.

What you bring to the table:

  • Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Software Engineering

  • Available to work with us full-time, 35 hours per week, for the Summer 2025 Term for 16 months (May 2025 to August 2026)

  • Must be returning to school in Fall 2026 following your internship

  • Past internship experience is considered an asset

  • Excellent oral and written communication skills (English and/or French preferred).

  • Ability and desire to learn/adapt quickly to a changing environment

  • Strong team player ready to collaborate with different teams to solve complex problems

  • Experience in Java is preferred

  • Knowledge of CICD (Continuous Integration Continuous Delivery) is considered an asset

Your career starts here.  Apply today!

We can’t wait to learn more about you. When you complete your application, remember to include your resume and University/College transcript. We hire co-ops every semester (Winter, Summer and Fall)!

We’re accepting applications now through October 4. All submissions will be reviewed during this time, as well as after the posting closes.

What we offer

Working here means you'll be empowered to be and do your best every day. Here is some of what you can expect as a temporary member of our team:

  • Inspiring leaders and colleagues who will lift you up and help you grow

  • Access to tools and resources to support physical and mental health, embracing change and connecting with colleagues

  • A dynamic workplace learning ecosystem complete with learning journeys, interactive online content, and inspiring programs

  • Inclusive employee-led networks to educate, inspire, amplify voices, build relationships and provide development opportunities.

  • A Community Impact program, because what you care about is a part of what makes you different. And how you contribute to your community should be just as unique.

We are an equal opportunity employer

At Intact, we value diversity and strive to create an inclusive, accessible workplace where all individuals feel valued, respected, and heard.

If we can provide a specific adjustment to make the recruitment process more accessible for you, please let us know when we reach out about a job opportunity. We’ll work with you to meet your needs.

Click here to review other important information about the hiring process, including background checks, internal candidates, and eligibility to work in Canada.

If you are an employee of Intact or belairdirect, please apply for this role on Contact People.

jobDescription:
Our student and new graduate programs offer a chance to explore Sun Life from the inside. You’ll make a difference in the lives of our customers and communities, while building the skills and experience that allow you to grow in a meaningful and rewarding way.

Job Description:

Length of term: 1 year, May 2025 - May 2026


The role is part of the central Digital Analytics Team, which is the enterprise hub for the digital measurement practice, Adobe Analytics, Adobe Target, and Tealium iQ administration. The role reports to the Manager, Digital Analytics.

What will you do?

Initial/Ongoing Responsibilities

  • Understand and learn about the role of digital analytics within the company, including how to use Adobe Analytics, one of the world’s leading digital analytics tools.

  • Maintain and update key statistical reports about the company’s web sites.

  • Respond to ad hoc reporting requests from the internal global marketing community and assist in acquiring and analyzing digital marketing data.

  • Effectively identify gaps relating to the reporting infrastructure and training content.

Mid to Long Term Responsibilities

  • Implement new reporting infrastructure, for example Excel scorecards, Adobe Analytics reports and data exports.

  • Assist in the Tealium iQ/Adobe Analytics tag implementation and data collection process. This includes tool configuration and data validation.

  • Support the management of Adobe Target as an optimization and personalization tool.

  • Provide marketers with actionable recommendations on how to improve their web sites and digital marketing campaigns.

  • Support the design of Adobe Analytics tagging frameworks and tag quality assurance.

  • Primary user management lead for tools managed within the team. This includes Adobe Analytics, Adobe Target and Tealium iQ.

  • Education of business partners in the areas of digital analytics and Adobe Analytics.

  • Subject matter expert in the use of Adobe Analytics.

  • Ad hoc projects which could include comprehensive site reviews and internal search optimization, ETL enablement for various tools and data sources, using Tableau as a data visualization tool.

What do you need to succeed?

* Ideal candidate is available for a 12-month co-op term

Preferred Disciplines:

  • Computer Engineering

  • Computer Science

  • Engineering Science (Electrical and Computer)

  • Engineering Science (Math, Stats & Finance)

  • Industrial Engineering

  • Math & Stats

  • Data Science

Technical

  • Understanding of web publishing and usability design

  • Commanding knowledge of MS Excel or other related software

  • Experience with Web/Digital Analytics software an asset (for example, Google Analytics or Adobe Analytics)

  • Experience with programming in JavaScript or Python an asset

  • Understanding of digital marketing (e.g. SEO or social) an asset

  • Understanding of SQL is helpful, but not required

Analytical

  • Be comfortable working with large sets of data

  • Able to synthesize data into conclusive findings that can be used to optimize a site’s performance

  • Strong attention to detail

Soft Skills

  • Passionate about developing digital marketing, consulting and data analysis skills

  • Strong communications and relationship building skills

  • Self-driven, resourceful individual with an ability to work under little supervision

  • Able to meet deadlines and be responsible for all projects assigned

  • Comfortable to network and approach colleagues within the business to gather data and complete projects

What is in it for you?

  • A friendly, collaborative, and inclusive culture where you’re an innovator and trusted partner

  • An environment of continuous learning and improvement

  • We’re honoured to be recognized as a 2022 Best Workplaces in Canada by Great Place to Work® Canada & 2022 Best Workplaces for Inclusion by Great Place to Work® Canada

The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted for.  The Base Pay which you will be considered for will vary depending on the Campus program you are selected for.

Eligible Sun Life employees for various Campus Graduate programs will also participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance

Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.

Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com .

At Sun Life we strive to create a flexible work environment where our employees are empowered to do their best work. Several flexible work options are available and can be discussed throughout the selection process depending on the role requirements and individual needs.

We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Job Category:

Temporary Employee

19/09/2024

jobDescription:
Job Description

WHAT YOU DO AT AMD CHANGES EVERYTHING

We care deeply about transforming lives with AMD technology to enrich our industry, our communities, and the world. Our mission is to build great products that accelerate next-generation computing experiences – the building blocks for the data center, artificial intelligence, PCs, gaming and embedded. Underpinning our mission is the AMD culture. We push the limits of innovation to solve the world’s most important challenges. We strive for execution excellence while being direct, humble, collaborative, and inclusive of diverse perspectives.

AMD together we advance_

An exciting internship opportunity to make an immediate contribution to AMD's next generation of technology innovations awaits you! We have a multifaceted, high-energy work environment filled with a diverse group of employees, and we provide outstanding opportunities for developing your career. During your internship, our programs provide the opportunity to collaborate with AMD leaders, receive one-on-one mentorship, attend amazing networking events, and much more. Being part of AMD means receiving hands-on experience that will give you a competitive edge. Together We Advance your career!

JOB DETAILS:

  • Location: Markham, Ontario, Canada
  • Onsite/Hybrid: This role requires the student to work full time 37.5 hrs a week, either in a hybrid or onsite work structure throughout the duration of the co-op/intern term.
  • Duration: 16-months , May 05, 2025 - August 27, 2026

WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING:

We are seeking a highly motivated Product Development engineering intern/co-op to join our team. In this role-

  • We will involve you in supporting Product Development Engineers in characterization and to build production test program through parametric, data and statistical analysis
  • We will train you to perform engineering and correlation studies to ensure yield, coverage and meet target goal to initiate production ramp
  • Your involvement while working with multi-functional teams will help resolve production related issues and improve efficiency
  • We will assign you tasks to build and maintain technical documents, debug manufacturing and characterization test programs for next-generation AMD microprocessors
  • We will encourage you to participate in Product debug and characterization to identify product performance, process, and test sensitivities

WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR:

  • You are currently enrolled in a Canada based University into a Bachelor's degree program majoring in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering or a related field
  • If you have knowledge / experience with any of the following technical skills (or related areas) and are enthusiastic about this role, we strongly encourage you to apply –

  • C++, Linux, Perl, Ruby, Shell script, Java or similar
  • GIT, SVN, CVS, RCS or similar
  • XP, AGILE, Scrum, or Kanban programming paradigms
  • Logic analyzers, voltmeters, oscilloscopes, and debug
  • Solid understanding of transistors and computer basics
  • Courses in computer science, software engineering, digital logic, circuit theory, computer architecture

Note: By submitting your application, you are indicating your interest in AMD intern positions. We are recruiting for multiple positions, and if your experience aligns with any of our intern opportunities, a recruiter will contact you.

Benefits offered are described: AMD benefits at a glance .

AMD does not accept unsolicited resumes from headhunters, recruitment agencies, or fee-based recruitment services. AMD and its subsidiaries are equal opportunity, inclusive employers and will consider all applicants without regard to age, ancestry, color, marital status, medical condition, mental or physical disability, national origin, race, religion, political and/or third-party affiliation, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.   We encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective laws throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process.

jobDescription:
The Power of Dreams is alive and well at Honda of Canada Mfg. (HCM). Located in Alliston, Ontario on 750 acres and employing more than 4,500 Associates, HCM is a 45-minute drive north of Toronto and 25 minutes south of Barrie. HCM began production in 1986 leading the way as the first Japanese automobile manufacturer to establish a production facility in Canada. Today, HCM is one of Honda's premier manufacturing facilities in the world producing the Honda Civic and CRV vehicles, including hybrid production. HCM is excited for its new chapter and journey towards electrification, including the highly anticipated EV and battery production plants that are expected in the coming years!

HCM has an exciting opportunity to work as an Operational Technology Intern for a 16-month work term beginning May 2025 through August 2026. Successful candidates will become a team member in HCM’s Operational Technology department and will be exposed to the latest technology in a highly automated manufacturing facility. During Operational Technology (OT) internship you will be implementing and maintaining various systems and tools that support the production departments as they work towards improving delivery and lowering operating cost. Operating technologies include but are not limited to MES, ECM, CMMS (Maximo), IIoT networks, IIoT security, Data Management and Analytics.

First time working in a professional work environment? Don't worry! All our Engineering Interns are assigned and will work alongside an experienced mentor in your department. You will also receive training and mentorship from the Intern you are replacing – a wonderful way to learn and set an example for the students that follow in your footsteps! Hear from our Interns by clicking this link: https://linktr.ee/HCMRecruitment

Following your internship, you will have a final report and presentation in order to be considered for a permanent (yes, permanent) position within our Engineering Development Program (EDP). What better way to return to school than knowing that you have a permanent position waiting for you following graduation?

Responsibilities:

  • Supporting Operational Technology activity in the process automation, mechatronics, and smart factory disciplines including: assignments / projects of varying degrees of complexity, working with team members on capital investment projects, equipment system integration and value stream mapping to support the introduction of New Models and improving current equipment conditions
  • Supporting commissioning and installation / improving integration of equipment / delivery analysis / system integrations / data governance
  • Supporting department activities for ongoing improvements in the areas Safety, Environmental, Quality, Cost and Delivery
  • Ideal candidate is enrolled in Automation, Mechatronics or similar Electrical, Electronics Engineering programs or relevant automation exposure.

Requirements:

  • Must be within eight months of graduation at the completion of the internship term (currently in year three of a four-year degree, or year four of a five-year degree).
  • Must demonstrate self-motivation and initiative to learn, adapt, and execute projects
  • Must be willing to work hands on – don’t worry, we will provide the training! All skill levels are welcome, you just need to show the willingness!
  • Must have excellent time management and communication
  • Must be willing to work overtime (and a lot of it!)
    • Many roles will require weekend work, including holidays and our shutdowns (1 week in July, 1 week in December). We provide alternate days off throughout the week to compensate for this. Oh, and did we mention overtime is paid?
  • Must be willing to work on the production line (training provided)
    • We will have you work on the production line at the onset of your internship as part of your training. This ensures you are always trained to jump in and help, develop an appreciation for the manufacturing line, and help build a relationship with your customers (production associates).
  • Must be willing to work 2nd shift
    • You will occasionally be required to support our 2nd shift (4:30pm-1:00am). This will be for 1 week at a time (subject to change). It may not sound the most appealing, but we promise you learn a lot on 2nd shift!

Preferred Experience:

  • Ideal candidate is enrolled in Automation, Mechatronics or similar Electrical, Electronics Engineering programs or relevant automation exposure.
  • Microsoft Office Suite (brush up on your Excel skills!)
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills (including presentation skills) in order to communicate complex problems, schedule amongst team members, and/or coordinate with suppliers and vendors
    • We do a lot of presentations – you will be an expert by the end of this internship!
  • Large team project work or technical projects demonstrating ability to succeed in a team environment
  • Ability to work in an open concept environment and be extremely flexible
    • No days are the same at HCM. What makes a successful associate is someone who can pivot and adjust to our ever-changing environment. You may be asked to do something that is completely new to you – embrace it, welcome it, and take it as an opportunity to grow! Future you will thank you.
  • Experience in digital systems and programming (for electrical positions)
    • We use PLCs (Programmable Logic Controller) – want to learn more? We will teach you!
  • Demonstrate knowledge of Industrial Control System (ICS) networking (MELSEC-NET, CC-IE, Controller Link) via experience or school projects
  • Knowledge of Industrial Cyber Security principles (Fire Walls, IP addressing management)
  • Graphical designs for visual management (e.g., Microsoft Visio)
  • Data extraction using structure queries language (SQL) and visualization of data.

Additional Information:

HCM offers many activities for associates to get involved in! We have an on-site recreation center (free of charge) that offers a fully equipped fitness center, full size indoor ice rink, and outdoor and indoor courts. We have a (highly loved) hockey, baseball, and soccer league; we offer exercise classes, cross fit, and yoga; drop-in basketball and pickle ball. HCM hosts a spectacular annual Holiday Party and associates always love our Summer BBQ! HCM is also very involved in our community – we annually participate in the Honda Waterfront Run and the Barrie Dragon Boat Festival.

Become even more involved and join your fellow Intern community! They are always getting together for bowling, pizza nights, games and more!

Thought that was a lot? HCM also has five Business Resource Groups (BRG) you can get involved with (think extra-curricular club, but better):

  • Honda Young Professionals: “Enhance experiences and develop careers of Honda’s Young Professional by building community, improving engagement, and providing career resources and guidance.”
  • Women Powering Honda: “Empowering Women at Honda through impactful engagement, and enhancement opportunities in a safe and supportive work environment.”
  • BIPOC of Honda: “Work to foster professional growth and development and to advocate for pathways for these developmental opportunities for BIPOC individuals at HCM.”
  • EARTH (Environmental Actions Rewarding to Honda): “Cultivate Honda associate opportunities for environmental engagement at the facility and in the community.”

Are you someone that’s into cars (I’d sure hope so)? HCM also has a Velocity Motorsports Club (VMC) ! Join a talented group of HCM associates as they prepare for another exciting race season! Not so much into racing but your personal car needs some work? Students are also eligible to use the fully equipped on-site vehicle service center.

At HCM, Respect for the Individual is a fundamental belief. We recognize, respect and value individual differences in one another. We are committed to creating equal opportunity for all associates to grow in a diverse and inclusive work environment while driving continuous improvement with Passion, delivering Joy and Value to our Customers.

HCM is committed to providing accommodation in its recruitment processes to applicants with disabilities, upon request. The accommodation provided will consider the applicant’s

accessibility needs. If you require accommodation at any time during the recruitment process or to successfully submit an application, please include that information in your application.

Being part of AMD means receiving hands-on experience that will give you a competitive edge. Together We Advance your career!

JOB DETAILS:

  • Location: Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada
  • Onsite/Hybrid: This role requires the student to work full time 37.5 hrs a week, either in a hybrid or onsite work structure throughout the duration of the co-op/intern term.
  • Duration: 12-months, May 05, 2025 - April 24, 2026

WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING:

We are seeking a highly motivated Hardware Design Verification Engineering intern/co-op to join our team and support the testing and verification of AMD’s high-end Machine Intelligence products. In this role you will participate in one or more of (but not limited to) the below assignments –

  • Collaborate with senior engineers and/or designers to build and complete performance verification test plan, simulation test cases and models
  • Write scripts related to tracking and managing resources using Perl/Python
  • We will assign tasks related to test regression flows written in Perl/Python/MySQL/PHP to support our project development
  • You will review new tools, processes and options to improve simulation performance, team efficiency and reduction of duplications
  • Support debugging, improving simulation test cases/models and Verilog/system Verilog coding
  • Build test platforms and perform system level testing
  • Production validation tasks, testing the integrated hardware and software functionalities to ensure problem-free production

WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR:

  • Currently enrolled in a Canada based University into a Bachelor's degree program majoring in Electrical engineering, Computer science, Computer engineering or a related field.
  • If you have experience with any of the following technical skills (or related areas) and are enthusiastic about this role, we strongly encourage you to apply –
    • Programming languages and scripts such as C++ /Python /C /Perl /Shell / UVM
    • Verilog and System Verilog
    • Good understanding of the digital systems and computer organization
    • Building a PC from individual components, installing OS/drivers, basic network configuration, graphic cards
    • CPU/APU
    • System level hardware and software design
    • Development and debugging in Linux / Unix / Windows environments
    • Fundamentals of logic design (FSM, gates, registers, flops, timing, HDL)
    • An understanding of analog and digital transistor device behavior

Note : By submitting your application, you are indicating your interest in AMD intern positions. We are recruiting for multiple positions, and if your experience aligns with any of our intern opportunities, a recruiter will contact you.

jobDescription:
StoneX Group is looking for interns to join us for Summer 2025 - Summer 2026. We are the Canadian division of a Fortune 500 company and our team is rapidly growing. Interns will have the opportunity to work alongside our firm’s best engineers who innovate every day. Our interns and co-ops write real software, and partner with a select group of experienced software development engineers in Quantitative Trading Solutions.

As an intern, you will be matched to a manager and a mentor and given the opportunity to have direct impact on the evolution of our financial technologies, as well as lead mission critical projects early in your career. Your design, code, and raw smarts will contribute to solving some of the most complex technical challenges in the areas of electronic trading.
In addition to an impactful project, you will have the opportunity to engage with us on both personal and professional development and expand your network.

Join StoneX Group and make your mark on the financial world

Responsibilities:

  • Collaborate with senior engineers and data scientists to work with large-scale proprietary trading data to gain insights to optimize trading decisions
  • Using modern data science and machine learning frameworks in Python, SQL
    Participate in daily standups and monthly sprints with other experienced developers
  • Conduct research on a trading hypothesis by analyzing historical data
  • Present research findings to team and drive new implementation of trading algorithms

Job Requirements:

  • Experience with data manipulation tools (Python, NumPy, Pandas, Matplotlib, SQL)
  • Basic knowledge in statistics and math concepts
  • Ability to effectively articulate and present ideas
  • Adept at handling ambiguous or undefined challenges through strong problem solving skills and effective communication
  • Take ownership and pride in your own projects
  • Knowledge of code version control (GIT)
  • Prior knowledge of trading and finance preferred

Benefits:

  • Competitive salary and flexible hybrid work
  • Opportunity to work on cutting-edge technologies in finance
  • Mentorship from senior engineers and quant researchers with multiple years of experience working with PEY students
  • Fast-paced and collaborative startup like work environment

jobDescription:
Student_Testimonials_2024-_HTS_Engineering.pdf

Short Company Profile: HTS Engineering Ltd. is the largest independent commercial HVAC manufacturers’ rep in North America. Many of the 700+ employees across the 16 offices in the US and Canada interned as co-op students at HTS, and many are graduates of well-known Ontario Universities. HTS has recently launched a vibrant new look and brand promise -- one that reflects our companywide commitment to ensure the individual success of all those involved in a project’s HVAC system selection, design, purchase, installation and maintenance.

Job Description :
HTS offers a variety of co-op placements throughout Ontario. There are an array of different responsibilities and depending on your placement you will be designing simple and complex HVAC systems, making engineering selections of HVAC equipment, creating reports, creating pricing and quotation for jobs, and analyzing mechanical blueprints. There will be opportunities to attend site visits, design sessions, job closings, equipment seminars, customer entertainment and more.
Our management style allows for student to grow and gain knowledge during their work term. After a successful work term, your following work placements will provide you with the opportunity to rotate through the different divisions of HTS and have the opportunity of  becoming a  full-time employee after graduation. As a company that has hired co-ops since our foundation, we know how to make your term at HTS a success.

HTS is looking for individuals who:
-Manage their time, prioritize and work independently
-Take pride in their work and can provide high quality work in a fast-paced environment
-Can communicate efficiently and effectively with employees in other departments
-Enjoy building new relationships, interacting with suppliers, customers and co-workers
-Are eager to further develop their project management skills
-Have an entrepreneurial drive and desire to succeed
-Have the ability to learn new desktop-based software quickly
-Have an interest in HVAC equipment system design
-Are looking to expand their technical knowledge in the fields of Heat & Mass Transfer, Thermodynamics and Fluid Mechanics

Note: On your resume, do not be afraid to go beyond your technical skills to include details that let your personality, interests, and experiences shine through, whether you deem them relevant to this position or not. We want to know what kind of a person you are.

HTS Offers

  • An independent work environment in a small team comprised of experienced engineers
  • Work on large name projects, such as UWaterloo QNC & E5, Pearson Airport, TD and Amazon
  • Work with the newest and leading high-efficiency HVAC equipment
  • Insight into the design-build, bid, and procurement process in the construction industry
  • A genuine and co-operative sales approach
  • Understanding of the positions and responsibilities of owners, developers, project managers, architects, consulting engineers, general contractors, sub-contractors, manufacturer’s representatives and manufacturers in the construction process
  • Knowledge of LEED principles, and the barriers and opportunities for green HVAC technology
  • A co-op friendly atmosphere, where everyone is willing to answer your questions
  • A fun work term in a young and dynamic environment, surrounded by co-ops and recent grads
    Competitive wages and flexible work hours

Job Requirements:

We have many different departments and the job requirements vary.  Duties may include:

  • Reviewing and understanding plans and specs related to the bid tender process
  • Identifying equipment on schedules, counts, spec review, tender form review
  • Equipment pricing and selections together with our engineering team
  • Working in our software system TRAX to upload all information required
  • Interaction with contractors for information required on our equipment
    Daily monitoring for new and existing  job requests  along with addenda

Bi-Weekly meetings with our team to review up and coming job takeoffs and job closings

Project Management

  • Shop Drawing submittals process
  • Working with contractors to establish equipment releases
  • Ordering equipment
  • Site visits as required for any coordination, site measuring, etc (following COVID guidelines)
  • Site visits as required for startup or site issues (following COVID guidelines)
  • Coordinating startups/commissioning
  • Sending close out documentation required to contractors

jobDescription:
Who We Are

A proud member of The Smith + Andersen Group of Companies, Footprint is a highly specialized team of engineers, planners, designers, and sustainability professionals. Established in 2011, Footprint experts work side-by-side with clients and project team members on landmark developments and sustainability initiatives in the building consulting engineering industry.

At Footprint our values drive and define everything we do, our team is uniquely organized to effectively analyze sustainability objectives and guide designers, planners, operators and owners toward their sustainability targets.

In addition, we are proud to have been certified as a Great Place to Work® and one of Canada’s Best Workplaces™ for the highly collaborative culture we’ve built and for empowering employees to do great work!

Why Join Us?

Footprint is a national team with local support. We have offices in Vancouver, Calgary, Edmonton, Winnipeg, Toronto, and Ottawa. This allows our team to leverage in-depth knowledge of provincial and national sustainability initiatives, as well as track international trends and how they may affect building design in Canada. The successful applicant will work under the direction of Project Managers and assist in all aspect of sustainable design for multiple projects, ranging from commercial to residential to institutional buildings.

At Footprint, we are committed to empowering the next generation of engineers by offering practical work experiences, designing sustainable buildings that shape our cities, and bridge the gap between academic knowledge and real-world application. If you have a passion for sustainability and are eager to expand your skill set, this is opportunity for you. Join us and be part of team that values your contributions and invests in you!

What You’ll Gain:

  • Hands-on Experience: Work on real projects that make an impact.
  • Mentorship: Be guided by industry leaders who are eager to share their knowledge with you and help you build your career.
  • Skill Development: Enhance your technical skills and soft skills in a supportive, nurturing environment.
  • Career Growth: Our firm values training and skills development for promoting growth. Many of our full-time employees began their careers with us as co-op students at Footprint.
  • Impactful Work: Opportunity to contribute to sustainable building design and make a difference by helping Canada meet its 2050 targets for green-house gas emissions reductions.
  • Consulting Experience: Gain hands-on experience within a consulting firm and learn about the ins and outs of the industry.

In addition to a co-op experience with meaningful work, we offer:

  • Competitive salary
  • Flexible hours and half-day Fridays (all year round)
  • Transit Subsidy Program
  • Hands on training with the industry specific software’s like eQUEST.
  • Wide variety of community and social events including sports outings, potlucks, games nights, community clean up days, and much more! We also have a several recreational leagues including hockey and soccer.

Portfolio

Here are just a few examples of the wide range of projects we have worked on by our Footprint team:

Net Zero | Energy Modelling | LEED Certified:

Helio : London, ON - One of the most energy efficient residential buildings in Ontario.

University of Calgary Mathison Hall Expansion : Calgary, AB - LEED Platinum (Target), Net Zero Carbon (Target)

Centennial College A-Block Expansion : Toronto, ON - CAGBC Zero Carbon, LEED Gold (Target), Net Zero Energy (Target)

North East Scarborough Community and Child Care Centre : Scarborough, ON – Net Zero (Target)

Library and Archives Canada Preservation Storage Facility : Gatineau, BC – LEED Gold, Net Zero Carbon (Target)

Neil Campbell Rowing Centre : St. Catharines, ON - Niagara’s first net-zero building

Healing Spirit House : Coquitlam, BC – LEED Gold certification

Joseph M. Demko School : St. Albert, AB - LEED Silver (Target)

Humber College Learning Resource Commons : Toronto, ON - LEED Gold certification

University of Toronto Environmental Science & Chemistry Building : Scarborough, ON – LEED Gold certification

University of Manitoba Centre for the Advancement of Teaching & Learning: Winnipeg, MB – LEED Silver (Target)

Minto Recreation Complex : Ottawa, ON – LEED Silver certification

For more information about Footprint, please visit: https://sa-footprint.com/who-we-are/ .

What You’ll Do

As a Junior Energy Analyst co-op, you will assist in all aspects of sustainable design for various building types, including residential buildings, community centres, universities, healthcare facilities and more. The focus of this position will be developing energy simulation models of building designs and using that energy model to assist the design team in making optimal design decisions. Some of your key duties may include:

  • Assist in energy analysis of building designs in meeting energy efficiency targets and evaluate design strategy options to improve energy efficiency.
  • Create 3D models using energy simulation software, allowing the calculation and optimization of building energy and GHG.
  • Assist in renewable energy assessments and decarbonization analysis.
  • Assist in managing incentive applications on behalf of clients.
  • Assist in preparation of engineering reports including Preliminary Design Energy Analysis, LEED Energy Modelling Reports, Building Code Energy Compliance Analysis, etc.
  • Perform analysis on historical energy bills and metered data in help identifying trends and anomalies of energy consumption.
  • Assist the creation of daylight model and contribute to daylight modelling.
  • Assist the Project Manager in all aspects of LEED facilitation and prepare submission documentation.
  • Create functional test forms allowing the testing of mechanical and electrical equipment; to ensure it is operating efficiently and consistent with project specifications.
  • Assist in building commissioning activities.
  • Participate in site visits and aid in the collection of data including equipment information, performance rating etc.

For more information about S+A-Footprint’s co-op program, please visit our website: S+A Co-op Program.

Click HERE to watch a video on the typical day-in-the-life of a Co-op at Smith + Andersen.

Who You Are

  • Ideally, completed 3rd year Mechanical, Electrical, Architectural or Environment Engineering with interest in 3-phase power systems, transformers, electric machines, energy systems & distributed generation, electric drives, power electronics and project management.
  • As a minimum, have standard computer and software knowledge (i.e. Microsoft Word, Excel, etc.). Specific energy modelling software will be learned on the job.

Please note all applicants are required to submit a copy of a student examination report showing academic grades.

Office Location

100 Sheppard Ave. East in Toronto, Ontario, is conveniently situated within walking distance to public transit, fitness facilities, restaurants, and retail amenities. The office building offers various amenities, including a tenant lounge, car and bicycle parking, and on-site electric vehicle charging.

Accommodation

Appropriate accommodations will be provided to candidates upon request throughout the recruitment and hiring process. Successful applicants will be advised of Smith + Andersen’s accommodation policies at the time the employment offer is extended.

Diversity

Smith + Andersen is committed to diversity, equity and inclusion and welcomes applications from all qualified candidates of any age, culture, subculture, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, nationality, race, ethnicity, family status, religion, mental or physical status or veteran status.

jobTitle: Business Development Manager – Service Solutions – Specialty
jobDescription:
There’s a New Energy on Board! Our company MHI RJ Aviation Group (MHIRJ) provides comprehensive critical operational, engineering and customer support solutions including maintenance, refurbishment, technical publications, marketing and sales activities for the global regional aircraft industry. Headquartered in Boisbriand, Quebec, and bolstered by an Aerospace Engineering Center, MHIRJ’s network of service centers, support offices and parts depots are positioned in important aviation hubs in the U.S., Canada and Germany. A wholly owned subsidiary of Mitsubishi Heavy Industries, Ltd, MHI RJ Aviation Group includes MHI RJ Aviation ULC (Canada), MHI RJ Aviation Inc. (U.S.A.) and MHI RJ Aviation GmbH (Germany).

As the Business Development Manager, Services Solutions, you are currently studying in both engineering (or an industry-related science field) and sales. You envision, recommend and sell new Aircraft modifications in order to increase our clients' output and profit. Your job, as a future Business Development Manager, is to negotiate aircraft modifications or products sales that would benefit our clients.

In this team, you will contribute to the delivery of….
As a key customer facing sales team, you will oversee the definition of the strategy and execution of aircraft configuration changes in support of in-service aircraft. You will help develops modifications and ideas to support revenue growth for MHIRJ. The Business Development Managers, Services Solutions are the direct contact for the operators for their aircraft customization for their fleet in-service, covering a fleet of over 1,700 aircraft of the CRJ family.

You will join the Services Solutions team to support customer satisfaction throughout their in-service customization and promote MHIRJ’s revenue growth.

Your tasks will include:

  • Serve customers by identifying their needs and suggesting changes to products, equipment and services.
  • Identify current and future customer needs by building personal relationships with potential and actual customers and others who can understand the needs.
  • Provide technical information on products, services or equipment by responding to questions and requests.
  • Establish new customer accounts by identifying potential customers and planning and organizing the sales call schedule.
  • Prepares cost estimates by studying all related customer documents and working with different functions such as engineering, materials logistics, methods and finance to ensure all cost impacts are considered
  • Lead the aircraft modification sales process and evaluate various costs and prices.
  • Obtain customer acceptance by explaining or demonstrating cost reductions and operational improvements.
  • Contribute to the efficiency of the sales process by identifying short- and long-term issues that need to be resolved, recommending options and action plans and implementing guidelines.
  • Contribute to the team's efforts by obtaining results

You will develop the following skills:

  • Development strategy
  • Sales engineering
  • Business acumen and judgment
  • Negotiation
  • Customer facing skills
  • Marketing
  • Teamwork
  • Multitasking
  • Customer Relationship management
  • Management of time
  • Project planning
  • Problem solving

The skills you bring:

  • You are currently completing a bachelor's degree in Aeronautical Engineering combined with a concentration in sales and marketing (or equivalent) or in business administration (or equivalent) with a good technical mastery at a recognized university.
  • You have completed at least 3 years of study in this program
  • You have very good business acumen and a good understanding of costs, prices and margins.
  • You are a team player able to work with varying departments.
  • You have a good level of written and spoken French and English
  • You have good organizational and planning skills
  • You have strong communication skills, both written and spoken
  • You have a good customer service experience
  • You have good judgment and work well in a multidisciplinary team

Additional details:
Position located at Toronto, Ontario – flexible working schedule with expectation to be physically working at the office when required (subject to change while adhering to provincial guidelines for COVID-19)

jobTitle: ML Developer – Software Automation & Dev Infra Intern
jobDescription:
Cerebras has developed a radically new chip and system to dramatically accelerate deep learning applications. Our system runs training and inference workloads orders of magnitude faster than contemporary machines, fundamentally changing the way ML researchers work and pursue AI innovation.

We are innovating at every level of the stack – from chip, to microcode, to power delivery and cooling, to new algorithms and network architectures at the cutting edge of ML research. Our fully-integrated system delivers unprecedented performance because it is built from the ground up for deep learning workloads.

Cerebras is building a team of exceptional people to work together on big problems. Join us!

About The Role:
As a Machine Developer - Software Automation & Developer Infrastructure Engineer, you will use your knowledge of testing and testability to influence better software design, promote proper engineering practice, bug prevention strategies, testability, scalability, and other advanced quality concepts. The position will play a huge role in the quality of Cerebras software. We are looking for engineers that have a broad set of technical skills and who are ready to tackle the biggest at-scale problems in HW-based deep learning accelerators.

Responsibilities:

  • Write scripts to automate testing and create tools to allow easy development of software regression tests
  • Help identify weak spots and potential customer pain points and drive the software organization towards customer focused quality metrics
  • Implement creative ways to break software and identify potential problems
  • Contribute to developing requirements specifications with a focus on developing verification tests

Requirements:

  • Enrolled within University of Toronto's PEY program with a degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or any other related discipline
  • Experience in developing automated tests for compute/machine learning or networking systems within a large-scale enterprise environment
  • Ability to take responsibility for monitoring product development and usage at all levels with an end goal toward improving product quality
  • Strong knowledge of software system design, C++ and Python

Preferred requirements:

  • Strong software testing experience with a proven track record in scaling highly technical teams
  • Knowledge of UNIX/Linux and Windows environments
  • Knowledge of neural network architecture and ML/AI deep learning principles
  • Prior experience in designing and developing test automation for HW systems involving ASICs or FPGAs
  • Prior experience working with live hardware systems and debug tools operating in a real time environment such as networking devices or live computing systems

jobDescription:
Digital Design Engineer (Intern)

What You'll Do

  • Micro architecture and hardware level definitions
  • RTL design in SystemVerilog/Verilog
  • Synthesis, static timing analysis and timing closure
  • Development of verification for functional blocks and systems
  • Debug and support block and system level simulations and models
  • Linting, equivalence checking, clock domain crossing (cdc) analysis
  • Debug silicon in lab on block and system level issues
  • Cross domain collaborations with other AW teams can include: systems, analog, physical design, SoC, FW/SW, marketing, project management

What You'll Need

  • Enrolled in Electrical or Computer Engineering University program
  • Knowledge of RTL coding in SystemVerilog, and Verilog
  • Knowledge of industry standard IC design tools (synthesis, simulation, equivalence checking, static timing analysis) is an asset
  • Experience with scripting, Linux/Unix environment
  • Tools/Languages:  SystemVerilog/Verilog, Python, Perl, C/C++, GNU Make
  • Some understanding of ASIC/IC design flow
  • Design for verification understanding (constrained-random verification with UVM, assertion-based design strategies, code coverage, functional coverage, test planning, etc.) would be an asset.

jobDescription:
Job Description

WHAT YOU DO AT AMD CHANGES EVERYTHING

We care deeply about transforming lives with AMD technology to enrich our industry, our communities, and the world. Our mission is to build great products that accelerate next-generation computing experiences – the building blocks for the data center, artificial intelligence, PCs, gaming and embedded. Underpinning our mission is the AMD culture. We push the limits of innovation to solve the world’s most important challenges. We strive for execution excellence while being direct, humble, collaborative, and inclusive of diverse perspectives.

AMD together we advance_

An exciting internship opportunity to make an immediate contribution to AMD's next generation of technology innovations awaits you! We have a multifaceted, high-energy work environment, filled with a diverse group of employees, and we provide outstanding opportunities for developing your career. During your internship, you will have the opportunity to collaborate with AMD leaders, receive one-on-one mentorship, attend amazing networking events, and much more. Being part of AMD means receiving hands-on experience that will give you a competitive edge. Together We Advance your career!

JOB DETAILS:

  • Location: Markham, Ontario, Canada.
  • Onsite/Hybrid: This role requires the student to work full time (37.5 hours a week), either in a hybrid or onsite work structure throughout the duration of the co-op/intern term.
  • Duration: 16-months, May 05, 2025 - August 27, 2026

WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING:

We are seeking a highly motivated Machine Learning (ML)/ Artificial Intelligence (AI) intern/co-op to join our team and participate in research and development of next-generation product differentiation features with extraordinary ML/AI engineers. In this role –

  • We will help you learn innovative new technologies in Machine Learning | AI | High Performance Compute.
  • We will train you to analyze and implement changes to algorithms to improve AI performance and user experiences.
  • We may assign you to one or more of the following project work -
  • Work on machine learning techniques to build applications for source code analysis and Image Corruption Detection.
  • Research, development, and deployment in machine learning-based and computer vision products on AMD’s current and future products.
  • Fixing and addressing problems with deployed AI to improve user experience.
  • Support AI software teams with roadmap planning, collateral development, and customer engagements.

WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR:

  • Currently enrolled in a Canada based University into a bachelor’s degree program majoring in computer science, computer engineering, data science / analytics, or a related field.
  • If you have knowledge / experience with any of the following technical skills (or related areas) and are enthusiastic about this role, we strongly encourage you to apply –

  • Machine learning, data science, computer vision, statistics, and mathematics.
  • Programming in Python, C/C++.
  • Relational (SQL) and no-SQL databases.
  • Machine learning algorithms and frameworks.
  • Deep learning / AI framework like Pytorch, Tensorflow, Caffe, etc.
  • Familiarity with cloud (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure).

Note: By submitting your application, you are indicating your interest in AMD intern positions. We are recruiting for multiple positions, and if your experience aligns with any of intern opportunities, a recruiter will contact you.

Benefits offered are described: AMD benefits at a glance .

AMD does not accept unsolicited resumes from headhunters, recruitment agencies, or fee-based recruitment services. AMD and its subsidiaries are equal opportunity, inclusive employers and will consider all applicants without regard to age, ancestry, color, marital status, medical condition, mental or physical disability, national origin, race, religion, political and/or third-party affiliation, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.   We encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective laws throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process.

jobDescription:
Get up close with how buildings really perform…and why!

Enerlife Consulting is seeking a candidate with an understanding of the design and workings of building energy systems. The right individual possesses the curiosity and ingenuity to join our ongoing exploration of high-performance low carbon emitting buildings, and our continuing development of hands-on services, processes and tools to make every building the best it can be.   Over the last few years, with more than 500 municipalities declaring “Climate Emergency” in Canada, we have seen a spike in interest tackling climate change and helping buildings achieve low carbon over time to meet municipal, provincial and federal at or near zero carbon timelines. The ideal candidate for this position is equally comfortable on site, in a design office environment, and in meetings with clients and contractors most of which currently is being performed remotely online.  Note that we have a flexible hybrid work policy ranging from working in the office on a regular basis to fully remote.  There typically is some form of communication on a daily basis using “Microsoft Teams” /or ”Zoom” and some possible office time.  Although most of the work will be performed remotely or in the office there is a requirement to be able to visit sites in-person in Toronto and other client specific locations within the country.

Position Profile:

  • Work with clients and employees to help them better understand building performance, and assist them in identifying and implementing performance improvements;
  • Work with and manage sub-consultants under the supervision of an Enerlife senior engineer;
  • Guide evidence-based retrofit and operational solutions for mechanical and electrical systems in commercial and institutional buildings;
  • Analyze and interpret building energy, water and GHG emissions metrics for a wide range of building types and building systems;
  • Assist more senior engineers to apply creativity in achieving practical solutions to meet required business case parameters;
  • Communicate information effectively to a variety of audiences;
  • Assist in the development of new and improved methods and tools for use by internal engineers working with building owners/managers;

•	Systems thinking, analytical and modeling skills
•	Proficiency with Excel
•	Ability to work independently as well as in a team environment
•	Collegial style, strong team dynamics and problem-solving
