jobDescription:
The Power of Dreams is alive and well at Honda of Canada Mfg. (HCM). Located in Alliston, Ontario on 750 acres and employing more than 4,500 Associates, HCM is a 45-minute drive north of Toronto and 25 minutes south of Barrie. HCM began production in 1986 leading the way as the first Japanese automobile manufacturer to establish a production facility in Canada. Today, HCM is one of Honda's premier manufacturing facilities in the world producing the Honda Civic and CRV vehicles, including hybrid production. HCM is excited for its new chapter and journey towards electrification, including the highly anticipated EV and battery production plants that are expected in the coming years!

HCM has an exciting opportunity as a Parts Quality Intern for a 16-month work term beginning May 2025 through August 2026.  The successful candidate will become a team member in HCM’s Parts Quality (PQ) department and will be exposed to the latest technology in a highly automated manufacturing facility.

The Parts Quality department is responsible for both supplied parts quality, and final vehicle quality throughout the vehicle life cycle – from design development input, through to mass production and field quality. PQ supports in responding to concerns from the manufacturing line regarding quality issues, contains part quality concerns from installation onto the vehicle, develops temporary/permanent countermeasures, and accesses and audits countermeasure effectiveness.

Not sure what to expect while working as a Parts Quality Intern at HCM? You will be responsible for performing visual inspections, as well as mechanical and functional verification of parts and design to align with HCM quality standards. You will effectively develop and lead cross-functional process improvements within the department, and investigate the root causes of failures and implement improvements to prevent recurrence. Hear from our Interns by clicking this link: https://linktr.ee/HCMRecruitment

First time working in a professional work environment? Don't worry! All our Engineering Interns are assigned and will work alongside an experienced mentor in your department. You will also receive training and mentorship from the Intern you are replacing – a wonderful way to learn and set an example for the students that follow in your footsteps!

Following your internship, you will have a final report and presentation in order to be considered for a permanent (yes, permanent) position within our Engineering Development Program (EDP) . What better way to return to school than knowing that you have a permanent position waiting for you following graduation?

Responsibilities:

  • Lead/Support complex themes involving manufacturing, design and our supply base.
  • Offer technical viewpoint – drawing/specification interpretation and application to parts.
  • Support department business plan initiatives and daily management.
  • Monitor quality trends; identify root cause; implement cost effective corrective actions.
  • Factory struggle follow up and investigation.
  • Line Support (part verification); judging part quality acceptance levels, while maintaining Honda Quality Systems: Occurrence, Containment, Corrective Action.
  • Outflow prevention support including - yard containment, inspection, part repair and QAV’s at supplier
  • Managing supplier relationships – NARS (North American Reporting System) communicate results to management.
  • Review and approve supplier PQCTs, FMEAs and other quality documents.
  • Support trials of new model tooling, equipment, and manufacturing.
  • Support the part development process by reviewing and approving drawings, manufacturing equipment, inspection fixture and document review.

Requirements:

  • Must be within eight months of graduation at the completion of the internship term (currently in year three of a four-year degree, or year four of a five-year degree).
  • Must demonstrate self-motivation and initiative to learn, adapt, and execute projects
  • Must be willing to work hands on – don’t worry, we will provide the training! All skill levels are welcome, you just need to show the willingness!
  • Must have excellent time management and communication skills.
  • Must be willing to work overtime (and a lot of it!)
    • Many roles will require weekend work, including holidays and our shutdowns (1 week in July, 1 week in December). We provide alternate days off throughout the week to compensate for this. Oh, and did we mention overtime is paid?
  • Must be willing to work on the production line (training provided)
    • We will have you work on the production line at the onset of your internship as part of your training. This ensures you are always trained to jump in and help, develop an appreciation for the manufacturing line, and help build a relationship with your customers (production associates). You are required to provide lineside support, repair activities, checking of finished vehicles and similar functions as required.
  • Must be willing to travel domestically (sometimes internationally)
    • That’s right! You may travel to our Canadian suppliers or even our friends over the border. Valid Canadian Passport or B1 Visa is required for international travel)
  • Valid Full G Class Driver’s license with no restrictions is required
    • I’m sorry, there are no exceptions to this.
  • Must be willing to work 2nd shift
    • You will occasionally be required to support our 2nd shift (4:30pm-1:00am). This will be for 1 week at a time (subject to change). It may not sound the most appealing, but we promise you learn a lot on 2nd shift!

Preferred Experience:

  • Microsoft Office Suite (brush up on your Excel skills!)
  • Demonstrated experience with CAD software’s for electrical or mechanical design, interpretation, and/or analysis (e.g. Catia, Solidworks, AutoCAD, etc.)
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills (including presentation skills) in order to communicate complex problems, schedule amongst team members, and/or coordinate with suppliers and vendors
    • We do a lot of presentations – you will be an expert by the end of this internship!
  • Demonstrated ability to work hands on with basic hand tools and measurement equipment including wrenches, screwdrivers, Digital Multimeters, Soldering iron, air tools…. etc.
    • Anything counts here! No experience? That’s okay! A pro at building Ikea furniture? Great! Show us you are willing to learn!
  • Large team project work or technical projects demonstrating ability to succeed in a team environment
  • Project management experience
    • Lean into your school or extra-curricular projects! We will teach you our Engineering Flow (E-Flow) including developing the project scope, schedule creation, status tracking, and coordinating and supervising contractors. You just need to show us you have the foundation to do so!
  • Ability to work in an open concept environment and be extremely flexible
    • No days are the same at HCM. What makes a successful associate is someone who can pivot and adjust to our ever-changing environment. You may be asked to do something that is completely new to you – embrace it, welcome it, and take it as an opportunity to grow! Future you will thank you.

Additional Information:

HCM offers many activities for associates to get involved in! We have an on-site recreation center (free of charge) that offers a fully equipped fitness center, full size indoor ice rink, and outdoor and indoor courts. We have a (highly loved) hockey, baseball, and soccer league; we offer exercise classes, cross fit, and yoga; drop-in basketball and pickle ball. HCM hosts a spectacular annual Holiday Party and associates always love our Summer BBQ! HCM is also very involved in our community – we annually participate in the Honda Waterfront Run and the Barrie Dragon Boat Festival.

Become even more involved and join your fellow Intern community! They are always getting together for bowling, pizza nights, games and more!

Thought that was a lot? HCM also has five Business Resource Groups (BRG) you can get involved with (think extra-curricular club, but better):

  • Honda Young Professionals: “Enhance experiences and develop careers of Honda’s Young Professional by building community, improving engagement, and providing career resources and guidance.”
  • Women Powering Honda: “Empowering Women at Honda through impactful engagement, and enhancement opportunities in a safe and supportive work environment.”
  • BIPOC of Honda: “Work to foster professional growth and development and to advocate for pathways for these developmental opportunities for BIPOC individuals at HCM.”
  • EARTH (Environmental Actions Rewarding to Honda): “Cultivate Honda associate opportunities for environmental engagement at the facility and in the community.”

Are you someone that’s into cars (I’d sure hope so)? HCM also has a Velocity Motorsports Club (VMC)! Join a talented group of HCM associates as they prepare for another exciting race season! Not so much into racing but your personal car needs some work? Students are also eligible to use the fully equipped on-site vehicle service center.

At HCM, Respect for the Individual is a fundamental belief. We recognize, respect and value individual differences in one another. We are committed to creating equal opportunity for all associates to grow in a diverse and inclusive work environment while driving continuous improvement with Passion, delivering Joy and Value to our Customers.

HCM is committed to providing accommodation in its recruitment processes to applicants with disabilities, upon request. The accommodation provided will consider the applicant’s accessibility needs. If you require accommodation at any time during the recruitment process or to successfully submit an application, please include that information in your application

jobDescription:
The Role

Pason is seeking a Data Science Intern for a 16-month internship from May 2025 until August 2026. You will use your strong analytical and programming skills to extract meaningful insights from IoT-based sensor data. Your responsibilities will include developing data analytics, signal processing, machine learning, and control loop algorithms. You will work with a talented group of algorithm and control system designers in an applied research setting.

This is an opportunity to learn how data science works in a real-world industrial application.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

  • Design algorithms which clean, aggregate, and analyze data from industrial process sensors for the purposes of performance analysis, event detection, and process optimization.
  • Design, test, and deploy standalone and web-based software applications for data analytics.
  • Design real-time signal processing and control loop algorithms and test their performance on historical sensor data as well as live field trials.
  • Learn state-of-the-art machine learning techniques and perform experiments to determine how they are best applied to petroleum oilfield data.
  • Work with Pason account managers to solve mathematical and statistical analysis problems for high-priority customers.
  • Learn and use the following technologies: Matlab, Python (ML and dashboarding libraries), Java, GIT, AWS, SQL databases, HTML/CSS/JavaScript, and web frameworks.
  • Participate in team technical discussions, research paper reviews, and propose novel ideas to solve challenging engineering problems.
  • Present product prototypes to sales, engineering, and/or management teams.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities

  • Programming languages such as Matlab, Python, Java, and SQL
  • Python dashboarding libraries such as Streamlit and Plotly Dash
  • Machine learning, signal processing, and control systems
  • Statistical analysis and data visualization
  • Database architecture, development, and management

Hybrid Work Environment

  • This position allows the opportunity for an employee to work in a hybrid environment where a portion of their role is in the office and the other portion remote.

Education

  • Currently enrolled in 3rd year studies in Electrical, Computer, Software or Geomatics Engineering, Computer Science, or related fields

Pre-employment Conditions

  • Completion of a satisfactory Criminal Record Check

jobDescription:
CORPORATE OVERVIEW

Alberici Constructors, Ltd. is part of Alberici Corporation, a $2.6-billion North American construction firm recently ranked 31st largest General Contractor in Engineering News Record.

Operating in the Canadian construction industry since 1908, Alberici has served countless communities through the development of infrastructure, food manufactories and energy centers amongst others. At Alberici, we are proud of the quality of life our buildings bring to families throughout North America.  Working at Alberici means satisfaction in knowing the work we do improves the lives of others. In turn, we continually invest in the development of our employees to provide them with fulfilling careers.

We build the critical structures that improve lives and strengthen communities.

Our mission is simple — and our approach to delivering on it is equally straightforward. We are as open and honest with our employees and partners as we are with our clients. We are here to work together to do the best work possible to bring this mission to life.

When it comes to our team, Alberici employees are built differently. We seek the best and brightest and are committed to investing in our people and providing the training and resources they need to learn, grow, and advance.

Are you Built for the Challenge ?

Our Values:

  • Working Safely
  • Valuing Diversity
  • Serving Humbly
  • Executing with Integrity
  • Solving Creatively
  • Engaging Fully

POSITION SUMMARY

This position is designed for engineering co-op students. You will be based on project sites in a variety of market-segments including, but not limited to, water treatment, heavy industrial, industrial process, food and beverage, and civil.

On the day to day, you will be responsible for a defined portion of a project and accountable for establishing effective working relationships with clients and managing the flow of information and documents between Alberici and the client.  You will maintain accurate documents for the project including schedule, as-builts, submittals, logs, test results, etc. and work closely with the Superintendent and subcontractors to plan and coordinate upcoming work and obtains, tracks and expedites the delivery of equipment and materials to the site.  You will also assist the Project Manager in monitoring the status of the project and identifying efforts to more effectively manage the project.

Essential Responsibilities & Duties include the following; however, other duties may be assigned. The Company provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with a disability, unless doing so poses an undue hardship on the Company. To be a qualified individual, an employee must be able to perform each of the essential functions of his or her job with or without a reasonable accommodation.

Management Competencies

  • Maintains and manages the Request for Information (RFI) process, daily reports, drawings and submittal logs
  • Obtains and verifies all shop drawings as assigned
  • Maintains documents that records the project as it was constructed (e.g., as-builts).
  • Submits the as-builts to the client/client’s agent upon completion of the project
  • Maintains proper safety records
  • Coordinates support functions, including project start-up, with internal and external team members
  • Manages the change order and billings process and directs meetings
  • Develops and maintains an effective working relationship with subcontractors
  • In conjunction with the Project Manager, evaluates the performance of the subcontractors at the conclusion of the project
  • Creates and engages in relationships with key union contacts
  • Understands and assists in application of buy-out procedures

Construction Means and Methods

  • Ability to stage, prepare, phase and sequence site logistics within budget and schedule; assesses constructability
  • Conducts a visual inspection of the project on a regular basis, looking for deviations from accepted construction practices and for aspects of the project that will not be satisfactory to the client
  • Coordinates inspections with local regulatory bodies and accompanies inspectors
  • Reviews the results of the inspection and keeps the Project Manager apprised of the results
  • Verifies quantities of key materials (loads of sand, yards of concrete) used in the construction of the project
  • Ensures compliance to all applicable and quality-controlled codes/standard

Budget/Schedule/Cost Control

  • Develops, maintains, updates, distributes and manages estimates
  • Develops and documents cost estimates to complete change orders as assigned by the Project Manager
  • Recognizes and manages critical path within the project schedule
  • Maintains the master schedule, updating as changes are made in the project
  • Tracks quantities executed in the weekly labour report
  • Assembles delivery tickets and other documentation used to support invoice to the client
  • Reviews project cost reports, identifying trends and providing ideas for managing costs to the Project Manager

Knowledge, Skills & Abilities

  • Excellent communication skills
  • Ability to establish a good working relationship with many different people, including owners, clients, supervisors, and staff
  • Highly motivated with strong analytical, problem solving and decision-making abilities
  • Ability to multitask and work in a fast-paced team environment
    • Excellent time management and organizational skills with the ability to meet tight deadlines
    • Proficient in MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, etc.)

Education and Experience

Working towards a Degree in Engineering, Construction Management, Architecture or related.

Alberici is a North American company with multiple Operating Companies:

Alberici Constructors, Inc., Alberici Constructors, LTD., Alberici Construcciones, BRC, CAS Constructors, Filanc, Flintco, Hillsdale Fabricators, Kienlen Constructors, and WWPS

jobDescription:
About Arcadis
Arcadis is the world's leading company delivering sustainable design, engineering, and consultancy solutions for natural and built assets. We are more than 36,000 people, in over 70 countries, dedicated to improving quality of life. Everyone has an important role to play. With the power of many curious minds, together we can solve the world's most complex challenges and deliver more impact together.

Places
We work with our clients around the world to create, support, and enhance smart, safe and sustainable places where people live, work, learn and thrive. Places impact on the quality of people's lives. Whether new homes, shops, workplaces, schools and hospitals, manufacturing, research and development facilities, or data and distribution centers. People and communities thrive when the spaces in which they live, work, move and play are designed and managed in a way that best meets their needs.

Role Description

Our Toronto West office (located at 175 Galaxy Blvd.) is searching for an Electrical Engineering PEY to join its growing team for 12-16 months. Arcadis electrical engineers have extensive experience in building electrical systems including power distribution, emergency power, lighting, fire alarm, PA, security, CCTV, data and communications, audio-visual and intelligent systems technology.  Our electrical engineers also complete designs for HV utility substations including power transformers, HV and LV switchgear and P & C systems (Protection and Control).

Job Accountabilities

  • Assist with the preparation of electrical designs and drawings of building facilities electrical systems noted above using computer-aided tools (e.g. EDSA analytical software, AutoCad, MicroStation and REVIT)
  • Develop functional requirements/specifications for the building electrical systems
  • Review electrical diagrams to verify compliance with industry standards and client requirements
  • Prepare designs using the appropriate building codes, electrical codes and CSA Standards
  • Liaise internally with project managers and other discipline personnel to obtain project information, to discuss specific design related problems and complete inter-discipline co-ordination of the building systems
  • Potential site visits to document and verify field conditions and complete field reviews

Qualifications and Experiences

• Currently enrolled in the Electrical Engineering program
• Completed 2-3 years of the program
• Strong communication skills both written and verbal
• Able to work effectively independently and on a team
• Previous work experience is an asset

Why Arcadis?
We can only achieve our goals when everyone is empowered to be their best. We believe everyone's contribution matters. It's why we are pioneering a skills-based approach, where you can harness your unique experience and expertise to carve your career path and maximize the impact we can make together.


You'll do meaningful work, and no matter what role, you'll be helping to deliver sustainable solutions for a more prosperous planet. Make your mark, on your career, your colleagues, your clients, your life and the world around you.

Together, we can create a lasting legacy.

Additional information
As part of Arcadis' selection process, candidates may be requested to consent to background checks relevant to the role under consideration for, prior to receiving a job offer (as applicable under state law). These could include work references, education and credential confirmation, employment verification and driver's license record.

We thank all applicants for their interest. However, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Arcadis is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability.

Join Arcadis. Create a legacy.

jobDescription:
About Marvell

Marvell’s semiconductor solutions are the essential building blocks of the data infrastructure that connects our world. Across enterprise, cloud and AI, automotive, and carrier architectures, our innovative technology is enabling new possibilities.

At Marvell, you can affect the arc of individual lives, lift the trajectory of entire industries, and fuel the transformative potential of tomorrow. For those looking to make their mark on purposeful and enduring innovation, above and beyond fleeting trends, Marvell is a place to thrive, learn, and lead.

Your Team, Your Impact

Connectivity group is leader in PHY devices for AI, cloud data-center and enterprise infrastructure. Our BU’s devices today power the full range of network connectivity from the optics of the AI GPU boards to Top of the rack optical fibers and active copper cables of the data centers and their fabrics. Connectivity verification group works closely with Analog and Digital design teams and Systems/DSP teams to incorporate and build models and testbench infrastructure for mixed signal designs and verify the digital and analog designs and micro-architectures against the system definition and requirements and also works closely with the software team to set up the API building infrastructure and guidelines.

What You Can Expect

Learn how the connectivity devices are dramatically impacting the AI-ML hardware revolution and the datacenters.

Learn the optical PHY module architecture and design.

Learn state of the art UVM and systemverilog based verification environment

Apply the knowledge of Object Oriented programming and its application to UVM/systemverilog to build new features into the verification environment as well as the testsuite.

Work closely with design team to bring up a new design feature and verify it.

Learn modern day techniques of formal verification as well as code and functional coverage.

What We're Looking For

A course on Digital circuits and Boolean logic,

basic circuit analysis (A course in analog circuits is a plus),

a past course/project involving Object oriented programming language such as C/C++ or Java,

a course/project involving basics of verilog/VHDL.

a course on Computer Architecture.

Currently must be enrolled fulltime in Junior or final year of the undergraduate degree in Electrical/Computer Engineering.

Additional Compensation and Benefit Elements

With competitive compensation and great benefits, you will enjoy our workstyle within an environment of shared collaboration, transparency, and inclusivity. We’re dedicated to giving our people the tools and resources they need to succeed in doing work that matters, and to grow and develop with us. For additional information on what it’s like to work at Marvell, visit our Careers page.

jobDescription:
Operational Excellence

Student Placement

Arla Foods, Canada

Do you have a passion for Continuous Improvement? This is your chance! Join the Operations Excellence Team in our Continuous Improvement Student Placement! This exciting role will be the perfect opportunity for you to be part of an exciting team and a dynamic, world-class Consumer Packaged Goods and Dairy Manufacturing company.

Working in our Continuous Improvement team, you will support the manufacturing and processing of specialty cheese products by tracking, analyzing and correcting  technical issues through continuous improvement (CI) work, assisting in troubleshooting and coaching and enabling Operators to meet and exceed daily production, packaging, quality, warehousing and safety objectives.

About the role

Reporting to the Lean & Excellence Team, you will:

  • Collect data on KPIs of production and packaging lines as well as present corresponding action plans to achieve targets
  • Proactively look for CI related opportunities carry out work to optimize work on the lines and ensure maximum uptime
  • Inform and interact with all line staff, to keep supervisors up to date on CI related activities
  • Champion the Lean philosophy and support the development of the Lean culture within the departments to drive Continuous Improvement
  • Perform a broad range of work duties that include assisting with troubleshooting, and basic operator asset care
  • Work closely with the other members of the Line Centric Organization (LCO) Continuous Improvement team and openly share knowledge and ideas on an ongoing basis
  • Support major optimization work and efforts on lines
  • Hold and chair weekly meetings relating to key KPIs as reported in the OEE system, while acting in accordance with the PDCA (Plan, Do, Check, Act) process and carry out relevant processing confirmations
  • Review and check SOPs to ensure they are in place and being utilized
  • Train core team and Operators according to required standards and on CI related processes
  • Coach the line and operational team to ensure that performance meets the required standards with a focus on planned downtime and speed
  • Assist in ensuring results of downtime and technical stops are tracked continuously and transparently
  • Optimize existing processes by running regular Kaizen workshops, SMED analysis and process confirmations
  • Lead and participate in relevant A3 and Root Cause Analysis activities
  • Support LEAN implementation and actively engage in Lean activities within departments, including leading board meetings, assisting in Lean improvements events

Who are you?

You are outgoing, curious, openminded, self-motivated, proactive and independent problem solver who can effectively communicate and interpret a wide variety of information to key stakeholders. Join our team at one of our Oil Sands operations and dive into the world of Plant Reliability Engineering! As part of our plant operations reliability team, you'll work on critical assets like conveyor belts, pumps, and compressors, conducting failure analysis investigations and refining equipment strategies for long-term safety and performance. This hands-on role offers a chance to deepen your engineering knowledge, tackle design challenges, and contribute to our world-class mining operations.

If you are mechanically inclined, passionate about machinery, and ready to roll up your sleeves, this opportunity is for you! Get ready to grow your skills and make a real impact in a collaborative and innovative environment.

jobDescription:
The Microchip FPGA Software Engineering team delivers a comprehensive software suite for designing Microchip’s FPGAs and managing the entire design flow from entry to synthesis, through place-and-route, timing, power analysis, and simulation.  In this role you will join Physical Design group. Within the Software organization, the Physical and Logical Design group is responsible for developing high-performance place, route, and synthesis software.  Our placement and routing tools are distributed commercially to a wide range of customers and are used internally for the exploration of new FPGA architectures.

We research and implement sophisticated approaches for solving gigantic problems -- like finding high-quality placements for millions of movable modules, or routing circuits whose graph representations contain hundreds of millions of edges.  To do this, we draw from a variety of computer science domains, including: numerical optimization, linear programming, machine learning, Boolean satisfiability, stochastic search, graph theory, traffic routing.

We are looking for talented individuals to join us for an internship in 2025. Internships at Microchip technology aim to offer students industry exposure and hands-on experience with research and development.

In this role you will:

  • Participate in developing state-of-the-art FPGA CAD algorithms to improve circuit performance, power, and tool runtime
  • Execute methodical, scientific experiments to validate the extent of algorithmic improvements
  • Study literature in the CAD industry and contribute to research discussions

Minimum Qualifications:


• Currently pursuing a Bachelor's/Master's Degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, or a related technical discipline.
• Solid programming skills, proficient in C/C++ or Python. Familiarity with basic data structure and algorithms.
• Good analytical thinking capability.
Preferred qualification any of the following:
• Exposure to advanced graph algorithms: Dijkstra algorithm, A*, clustering, partitioning, coloring etc.
• Exposure to parallel programming techniques: pthreads, openMP, TBB, CUDA
• Experience with source code management systems (Git, SVN etc.)
• Experience with FPGA, Verilog, static timing analysis
• Familiarity with Linux/Windows development environment.
• Familiarity with artificial intelligence (PyTorch, TensorFlow etc.), linear and non-linear optimization, sparse linear algebra.

Position Title: Transit Management Systems Co-op Student

Start Date: July 28, 2025

Duration: 12-16 months

Salary: $19.66 to $28.63 per hour, dependent on year of study

Hours/Week: 35

Location: Fixed at 8300 Keele Street, Vaughan

Department: Public Works

Branch: Digital and Process Transformation

Reports To: Program Manager, Systems & Infrastructure

Position Purpose:

Reporting to the Program Manager, Systems & Infrastructure, this position is responsible for assisting Transit Management Systems (TMS) staff with day-to-day Intelligent Transportation Systems (ITS) maintenance, customer support and documentation activities and for assisting in providing functional program and operational support for York Region Transit (YRT) fleet, terminal and stations.

Benefits to Student:

  • Gain valuable work experience in their field of study.
  • Enhance their interpersonal and teamwork skills with professionals in the field.
  • Gain direct experience in the public sector environment.
  • Learn about process, policies, and procedures within a large corporate Information Technology group in a Transit Environment.
  • Learn essential and hands-on technical skills required for a successful IT and ITS career.
  • Learn essential 3D printing skills and gain hand-on experience with electrical board soldering.
  • Learn essential customer service skills in dealing with Regional and public sector

Major Responsibilities:

  1. Administrative Activities:
  • Creates technical standard operating procedures and job aids for standard tasks performed by the TMS group to help automate operations and support.
  • Assists TMS staff in the creation of software and hardware support processes and procedures.

  • Create, execute, and document test plans to support new technology introductions.
  • Create training materials, FAQ, job aids and deliver training to support new system business transformation.

1. Technical Activities:

  • Installation, troubleshooting and setup of ITS systems, including power, hardware, software and networking.

2. Liaison, Communication and Customer Service Activities:

jobDescription:
Untether AI is a rapidly growing Toronto startup building a next generation hardware AI accelerators for neural net inference. We're designing integrated circuits that will run neural nets orders of magnitude faster and lower power. This class of chips will be the standard platform for running image recognition, speech synthesis, text to speech and many other applications in data centers, mobile phones and self-driving cars within the next 5 years.

We are looking for self motivated and innately curious candidates to join our Runtime team. You will implement key aspects of our production kernel and user-mode drivers, their APIs, and the corresponding toolchain. You will craft elegant solutions to exciting problems and help form the future direction of our system software, and how our accelerator will be used by our users. You should demonstrate the ability to excel in an environment with complex software and hardware designs.Join our Runtime team and come learn about our software projects. We'll work together to set the code deliverables for your term with us, but in general you can expect to work in C/C++, python and assembly within a loose agile environment (sprints, thorough code review, continuous integration etc.).

Some examples of topics:

  • Design, develop, and verify software that interacts with our chip via PCIExpress
  • Collaborate with hardware engineers and fellow software engineers
  • Identify functional/performance bottlenecks and alleviate them in order to achieve scalable and reliable software
  • Help with chip bring-up, testing and ensuring that our board, chip and associated software all work together

We don't have strict skill requirements, but of course prior experience in the tools and skills we use is a plus, including:
- Experience with C/C++, python, git, bash, make
- Low-level debugging of device drivers and custom hardware
- Experience programming and debugging microcontrollers
- Experience developing Linux device drivers, kernel modules and/or systems software
- Above all - smart, curious and tenacious with a willingness to learn

jobDescription:
About Arcadis
Arcadis is the world's leading company delivering sustainable design, engineering, and consultancy solutions for natural and built assets. We are more than 36,000 people, in over 70 countries, dedicated to improving quality of life. Everyone has an important role to play. With the power of many curious minds, together we can solve the world's most complex challenges and deliver more impact together.

Places
We work with our clients around the world to create, support, and enhance smart, safe and sustainable places where people live, work, learn and thrive. Places impact on the quality of people's lives. Whether new homes, shops, workplaces, schools and hospitals, manufacturing, research and development facilities, or data and distribution centers. People and communities thrive when the spaces in which they live, work, move and play are designed and managed in a way that best meets their needs.

Job Accountabilities

  • Assist with the preparation of mechanical designs and drawings of building facilities mechanical systems noted above using computer-aided tools (e.g. HAP analytical software for analysis of heating and cooling loads, AutoCad, MicroStation and REVIT)
  • Develop functional requirements/specifications for the building mechanical systems
  • Review mechanical diagrams to verify compliance with industry standards and client requirements
  • Prepare designs using the appropriate building codes, ASHRAE, NFPA and CSA Standards
  • Liaise internally with project managers and other discipline personnel to obtain project information, to discuss specific design related problems and complete inter-discipline co-ordination of the building systems
  • Potential site visits to document and verify field conditions and complete field reviews

Qualifications and Experiences

• Currently enrolled in the Mechanical Engineering program
• Completed 2-3 years of the program
• Strong communication skills both written and verbal
• Able to work effectively independently and on a team
• Previous work experience is an asset

Why Arcadis?
We can only achieve our goals when everyone is empowered to be their best. We believe everyone's contribution matters. It's why we are pioneering a skills-based approach, where you can harness your unique experience and expertise to carve your career path and maximize the impact we can make together.

You'll do meaningful work, and no matter what role, you'll be helping to deliver sustainable solutions for a more prosperous planet. Make your mark, on your career, your colleagues, your clients, your life and the world around you.

Together, we can create a lasting legacy.

Additional information
As part of Arcadis' selection process, candidates may be requested to consent to background checks relevant to the role under consideration for, prior to receiving a job offer (as applicable under state law). These could include work references, education and credential confirmation, employment verification and driver's license record.

We thank all applicants for their interest. However, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Arcadis is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability.

Join Arcadis. Create a legacy.

jobDescription:
Analog Devices, Inc. (ADI) is a maker of analog and digital integrated circuits, specializing in high-performance circuits suited for real-world signal processing. ADI's signature products include high-speed amplifiers, high-speed/high-resolution analog-to-digital and digital-to-analog converters, high-performance Digital Signal Processors, and Micro-Electro-Mechanical systems. In the high-speed converter market, ADI's 40% market share is more than double that of its nearest competitor. ADI was founded in 1965 and posted revenues of $11.6 billion in 2023. ADI has more than 25,000 employees worldwide. Approximately 25% of ADI's employees are engineers.

ADI's Toronto Design Center (TDC) is located at the corner of College and Bay, within walking distance of the University of Toronto's main campus. We have a close collaboration with the University of Toronto faculty at the Department of ECE over the years supporting MSc and PhD projects. ADI's TDC employs about 30 engineers including the Canadian branch of the High-Speed ADC group. The mission of the ADC group is to develop high-speed data converter technology, particularly high-performance continuous-time ADCs, as part of ADI's advanced core group in the communication division. We work in close collaboration with the US, Ireland, and India ADI offices. Selected recent publications for some of the technology developed by our team in collaboration with peers at other ADI sites and universities we collaborated (including UofT, MIT, and IIT) can be found in [1-6].

We are looking for bright, enthusiastic students who will work 1-on-1 with senior staff during various phases of the development of new high-speed converter ICs using advanced CMOS processes.

Job Description
1. Work with a small industry-leading IC design team to complete the development of a new high-speed converter IC for next-generation wireless communications.
2. Assist in the design and verification, especially physical design, and post-layout simulation, of IC sub-blocks.
3. Assist with laboratory evaluation and debugging.

Job Requirements
1. Intuitive understanding of analog circuits at the transistor level.
2. Strong grasp of signal processing concepts: time/frequency domain, s- and z- transforms, and digital signal processing.
3. Familiarity with schematic capture and transistor-level circuit simulation.
4. Conceptual understanding of IC physical design, i.e., IC layout.
Any experience with software tools such as MATLAB, SPICE, Cadence Virtuoso, Calibre LVS, and DRC, or with printed circuit board design/debugging, or with lab evaluation, will be regarded favourably.

This position offers motivated students the opportunity to learn from some of the best engineers in the industry, while also pushing the technology envelope in the form of a new and aggressive product. This is the ideal opportunity for a smart, hard-working student who is driven to know more about integrated circuits than is taught in class.

[1] S. Patil et al ., "22.2 A 700MHZ-BW −164dBFS/Hz-Small-Signal-NSD 703mW Continuous-Time Pipelined ADC with On-Chip Digital Reconstruction Achieving <-85dBFS HD3 using Digital Cancellation of DAC Errors," 2024 IEEE International Solid-State Circuits Conference (ISSCC) , San Francisco, CA, USA, 2024, pp. 390-392.

[2] R. Mittal et al ., "A 6.4-GS/s 1-GHz BW Continuous-Time Pipelined ADC With Time-Interleaved Sub-ADC-DAC Achieving 61.7-dB SNDR in 16-nm FinFET," in IEEE Journal of Solid-State Circuits , vol. 59, no. 4, pp. 1158-1170, April 2024.

[3] H. Shibata, "Continuous-Time Pipelined ADC: A Breed of Continuous-Time ADCs for Wideband Data Conversion," in IEEE Open Journal of the Solid-State Circuits Society , vol. 3, pp. 162-173, 2023.

[4] M. W. Ismail, H. Shibata, Z. Li, S. Patil, and T. C. Carusone, "A Design Methodology for Achieving Near Nyquist Continuous Time Pipelined ADCs," in IEEE Transactions on Circuits and Systems I: Regular Papers, 2022.

[5] S. Pavan and H. Shibata, "Continuous-Time Pipelined Analog-to-Digital Converters: A Mini-Tutorial," in IEEE Transactions on Circuits and Systems II: Express Briefs, Jan 2021

[6] H. Shibata et al., "16.6 An 800MHz-BW VCO-Based Continuous-Time Pipelined ADC with Inherent Anti-Aliasing and On-Chip Digital Reconstruction Filter," 2020 IEEE International Solid-State Circuits Conference - (ISSCC), San Francisco, CA, USA, 2020, pp. 260-262, 2020.

jobDescription:
AMD Markham SoC team is hiring for its Markham location in Canada for the next-generation chip development project!

At AMD, we push the boundaries of what is possible.  We believe in changing the world for the better by driving innovation in high-performance computing, graphics, and visualization technologies – building blocks for gaming, immersive platforms, and the data center. Our SoC applications cover a wide spectrum from the state-of-the-art products empowering the current technological innovations in Machine/Deep learning, Virtual/Augmented Reality, and 3D Gaming.

Developing great technology takes more than talent: it takes amazing people who understand collaboration, respect, and who will go the “extra mile” to achieve unthinkable results.  It takes people who have the passion and desire to disrupt the status quo, push boundaries, deliver innovation, and change the world.   If you have this type of passion, we invite you to take a look at the opportunities available to come join our team.

AMD is an innovative technology company dedicated to collaborating with customers and partners to ignite the next generation of computing and graphics solutions. AMD designs and develops cutting-edge computer and graphics processing technology that is used throughout the world in business, enterprise, and consumer markets.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

We are currently looking for a System-on-Chip Performance Verification Co-Op who will be part of a team working on next generation of a complex SOC design for AI/ML applications. The successful candidate will play a key role in SOC verification performing the following duties for functional and performance aspects with RTL simulation and hardware emulation environment.

A truly multidisciplinary function, working in close collaboration with architects and front-end designers on the various SOC verification efforts, interacting with a wide variety of internal and external design verification/development teams, Design Verification methodology, and Silicon IP and tool vendors. Work with SOC and IP architects, Design and Design Verification teams to define, develop and execute SOC performance verification plan.


SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS
• The candidate should have completed 3rd year Computer, Electrical or Engineering Science programs.
• Good C/C++ software skills and Verilog

• Strong knowledge of scripting languages: Python/Perl
• Good understanding for digital system and computer architecture
• Should be a confident coder and be comfortable debugging general hardware/software problems.
• Must communicate well both written and orally
• Must be organized and multitask well

WHAT YOU WILL LEARN
You will gain valuable experience in different aspects of ASIC design/performance verification. Depends on the time you join the team, you may be able to experience the full project cycle – from project planning to implementation to tapeout.
This team is essential to the success of AMD as a growing company. It is a very exciting environment and you will be working with the very best in our technology. You will be working on some of the most exciting projects the industry has to offer

jobDescription:
Being a part of the TUM Learning Systems and Robotics Lab (www.learnsyslab.org), led by Prof. Angela Schoellig, you will have the chance to engage in cutting-edge research at the intersection of robotics, machine learning, and system control. Our research is motivated by the vision of a seamless interaction of robotic systems with the physical world. In particular, our research interests are centred around the challenges associated with robots operating in increasingly unstructured, uncertain and changing environments and over long periods of time. These situations challenge current robot designs, which rely on knowing the specifics of the environment and tasks ahead of time in order to operate safely and efficiently.

As a research intern, you will work in collaboration with graduate students and senior researchers within the lab and develop innovative solutions to push the boundaries of state-of-the-art robot perception and decision-making algorithms. We offer opportunities for you to sharpen both soft and technical skills through the course of the internship.
* Technical areas: Control theory, reinforcement learning, robot simulation, and real-world robotics experimentation
* Software toolboxes: Python, C++, Robot Operating System (ROS), CasADI, OpenAI Gym, PyTorch, and PyBullet
* Transferrable skills: Conduct thorough literature reviews to understand the current state of research in a specific domain, effectively convey complex technical concepts, write a scientific paper, and deliver engaging presentations tailored for both academic and general audiences

Typical tasks of the internship include
* Implementing cutting-edge robot perception and decision-making algorithms (e.g., reinforcement learning, learning-based control, semantic SLAM)
* Contributing to the benchmark software (e.g., safe-control-gym) and maintaining the repository
* Conducting real-world robot experiments (e.g., flying vehicles, mobile manipulators)
* Collaborating with graduate students and senior researchers to develop and verify theoretical findings
* Documenting findings in scientific writing and presenting them to internal and external research groups

Salary: Compensation details, tailored to the candidate's qualifications, experience, and work location, will be shared during the interview.

jobDescription:
Company Background:

Xpan Inc. is an FDA-approved medical device startup based in Vaughan and is part of the University of Toronto Startup community. Xpan’s goal is to develop products that aim to improve the safety, efficiency and economic outcomes of surgeries. We do so by iterating rapidly & working closely with world-class surgeons in Canada and USA. Currently, we are developing expandable surgical ports that aim to solve critical unmet needs in minimally invasive surgery.

We are looking for talented individuals who are passionate about the Medtech industry to join our team. We pride ourselves in providing meaningful and impactful work opportunities and providing high quality tailored training to our team members that goes beyond the work term. We treat our student interns as core team members.

Position Description:

Xpan is recruiting for an R&D engineering co-op position. The candidate will work closely with the development team on tackling design, manufacturing and regulatory related tasks as we work on commercializing our trocar technology. The position will also involve designing, performing bench experiments, collecting & analyzing data and iterating based on results. The candidate will also be involved in leading R&D and creative design efforts of pipeline products, which may involve interacting with end-user clinicians.

**Please Note: The co-op will be expected to work in-person at our Vaughan office location (57 Corstate Ave). A hybrid working environment can be expected after onboarding activities are complete.

Candidates with the following experiences are highly encouraged to apply:

  • Experience in research/lab setting
  • Experience in writing academic manuscripts and publishing
  • Experience in IP development (e.g. writing claims & technical descriptions, technical drawings, prior art searches, etc.)
  • Prior understanding of regulatory pathways & procedures in Medtech
  • Prior leadership positions/experience
  • Prior business development/marketing/sales background
  • Proven excellence & experience in product design and development
  • Experience working in a medical device company or ISO13485 environment

Candidate requirements:

  • Experience in using hand & powered tools & comfortable with machine shop equipment
  • Experience in designing & modeling of parts & assemblies in CAD/SolidWorks
  • Experience in developing parts through rapid prototyping methods such as 3D printing
  • Experience in implementing scientific methods and iterative approaches in design and testing
  • Experience in developing benchtop testing procedures and testing apparatus, performing tests and analyzing data using statistical methods
  • Strong verbal and written communication, organizational and documentation skills
  • Strong attention to human factors & aesthetics
  • Extremely attentive to details and is resourceful
  • Proactive in identifying technical problems, risks and identifying solutions
  • Ability to conduct literature and/or intellectual research and summarize results in succinct and organized methods
  • Able to self-manage (setting high level objectives and granular tasks) especially under aggressive timelines

Educational & Other Requirements:

  • Canadian citizenship, permanent residents, or persons who have been granted refugee status in Canada
  • Aged 30 or under at the beginning of the internship
  • Be enrolled as a full-time secondary or post-secondary student in a recognized institution and recognized as having “full-time student status” by that academic institution prior to the end of the internship .

A wholly owned subsidiary of Mitsubishi Heavy Industries, Ltd, MHI RJ Aviation Group includes MHI RJ Aviation ULC (Canada), MHI RJ Aviation Inc. (U.S.A.) and MHI RJ Aviation GmbH (Germany).

From day one, you will work to enable insights and intelligent decision-making across functions and contribute to the delivery of real projects using the latest technology to solve business problems. jobDescription:
When it comes to forward-thinking homebuilding and thoughtfully planned communities, Canadians think of Mattamy Homes. And that success is centred on a foundation of great people, because our team is as solid as they come. At Mattamy, we are optimistic, hardworking and supportive. Together we learn and grow as we strive to create a positive impact in the homebuilding industry. Contributing to the Mattamy Way means being surrounded by caring people who encourage you to be exactly who you are. It means your opinion is invited and your contributions count. And it means a career filled with pride, knowing you're part of an environmentally-conscious, action-oriented organization with big plans for the future. The opportunity to bring the future of living to homeowners based on what Canadians value is exciting - and we're making it happen.

Learn more about what makes working at Mattamy special and our award-winning culture.

What we offer
Mattamy Homes is currently seeking dynamic individuals to join our Urban Team for an exciting opportunity to begin their career with an industry leader while completing your degree. This co-op opportunity will expose the student to a broad range of disciplines within the realm of Construction Management and Project Management. The student will work closely with members of our High-Rise Construction and Project Management team who are responsible for the planning, engineering, managing, and construction of fully integrated Urban communities.

What you'll do

  • Work alongside a project management team overseeing all aspects of high-rise and mid-rise planning and construction.
  • Assisting with budgeting and cost tracking at various stages during project duration.
  • Going through and understanding different construction drawings/specifications and being able to translate relevant aspects of these documents to create a scope of work for different trades necessary throughout the project's duration.
  • Understanding and distributing shop drawings to appropriate consultants.
  • Working with the design studio to ensure that upgrades to suites are both submitted on time and are constructible
  • Create comparisons of different bids to ensure that all bidders are including the entirety of the scope in their quotation.
  • Coordinating between all consultants to ensure constructability/practicality and harmonization in regard to their respective drawings and specifications.
  • Gaining practical experience through site visits throughout the term.

What you bring

  • Intermediate/Senior students in Engineering (Civil, Mechanical), Planning, and/or Business Real Estate Programs.
  • Excellent communication skills allowing you to communicate with outside trades/consultants as well as with other members of the Mattamy Urban team.
    Demonstrate analytical ability and problem-solving skills.
  • Motivated self-starter that works well independently and in team environments.
    Well-developed problem solving, decision-making, organization, planning and leadership skills.
  • Ability to establish credibility, trust and build relationships with people at all levels of the organization.
  • Ability and willingness to learn and grow professionally.
  • Ability to travel and relocate as required to various office and site locations.
  • Working knowledge of AutoCAD, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project & Outlook.
  • As the position may involve travel to construction sites and consultant offices, a vehicle and a class 'G' license is required.

Bonus points

  • Familiarity with construction practices.
  • We encourage applicants who meet most of the role requirements to hit that submit button and apply! It's okay if you don't have 100% of the requirements. If you're the right candidate, we'll help you learn and grow.

Who we are
Mattamy Homes is the largest privately owned homebuilder in North America, with 40-plus years of history across Canada and the United States. Every year, Mattamy helps more than 8,000 families realize their dream of home ownership. In Canada, our communities stretch across the Greater Toronto Area as well as in Ottawa, Calgary and Edmonton.

Be yourself. We want it that way.
At Mattamy, we're passionate about creating and promoting a diverse and inclusive environment where everyone can do their best work. Diversity and inclusion are important to the work we do to support our homebuyers, colleagues, and communities. From how we build our teams to cultivating our leaders, we're on a journey toward a welcoming, barrier-free culture for everyone.

Mattamy Homes Canada is committed to providing accommodation for people with disabilities. If you require accommodation through any aspects of the selection process, please notify us on your application and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Qualified applicants will be contacted directly by the Talent Acquisition team.

jobDescription:
Specializing in structural engineering, building science, and restoration, RJC Engineers is one of North America's leading engineering firms. With a staff of more than 600 employees in twelve locations across the country, we offer highly personalized service at the local level with the expertise, depth and resources of a large, national firm.

We are proud of our ability to balance creativity with practicality to help our clients achieve their vision, and understand that creativity starts with the ingenuity of our people . We have a culture of learning and facilitating growth of skills and capabilities; of helping our people fulfill their potential through coaching, teamwork, challenging work assignments and open communications. We strongly believe that if you feel engaged and driven to excel, you will enjoy your daily work experience, and that will result in a level of service that will keep our clients coming back.

Candidate Profile
The Building Science Engineering PEY Student will work as an active team member with Project Engineers and Technologists within project teams, from the evaluation and assessment of building envelopes and design through to its construction. The successful candidate is a self-motivated, fast learner with a desire to continually learn and grow and has a passion for Building Science. A commitment to providing exceptional client service and developing technical expertise to deliver practical, creative solutions.

Key Responsibilities
Duties include, but are not limited to:

- Site investigation and evaluation of existing building envelopes
- Preparation of reports and studies
- Preparation of drawings and specifications for various exterior wall and roofing retrofit / rehabilitation projects
- Design and analysis of wall and roofing systems to determine effective repair alternatives
- Work with a Project Engineer/Technologist within the project team environment from conceptual and preliminary stages of the project design through to its completion
- Coordination with other engineering and architectural disciplines
- Contract administration/construction review while implementing the retrofit/rehabilitation work
- Client liaison

jobDescription:
Hi, we’re ecobee. ecobee introduced the world’s first smart Wi-Fi thermostat to help millions of consumers save money, conserve energy, and bring home automation into their lives. That was just the beginning. We continue our pursuit to create technology that brings peace of mind into the home and allows people to focus on the moments that matter most. We take pride in making a meaningful difference to the environment, all while being part of the exciting, connected home revolution.

In 2021, ecobee became a subsidiary of Generac Power Systems. Generac introduced the first affordable backup generator and later created the category of automatic home standby generator. The company is committed to sustainable, cleaner energy products poised to revolutionize the 21st century electrical grid. Together, we take pride in making a meaningful difference to the environment, all while being part of the exciting, connected home revolution.

For more on ecobee: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RR4rKtkf1SY

The Role:

We are looking for an Mechanical Engineer Intern to join our team for the 2025-2026 PEY work term!

Our Mechanical Engineering team works with our Product design team, Manufacturing engineering, and Manufacturing partners in building the best product on the market. In this role you will be interacting with various departments as the primary interface to manufacturing.

Due to the hands-on nature of this role, there would be some expectation to be in our Toronto office for access to the Hardware Lab.

How You’ll Make an Impact:

  • Assist mechanical engineering with the development and sourcing of products and prototypes.
  • Create detailed 3D models and 2D drawings of components and assemblies.
  • Develop product documentation.
  • Conduct design validation testing of product components and assemblies.
  • Develop jigs and fixtures for prototyping and assembly.
  • Assist with assembly and test of prototype assemblies.
  • Create design packages including detailed drawings, BOM’s and assembly drawings and layouts.

We’re up to incredible things. Come and be part of them.

What can you expect as an ecobee student?

  • The chance to meet and work with co-ops across all teams at ecobee
  • The opportunity to work in a fresh, dynamic, and ever-growing industry that is the SmartHome and IoT space
  • The visibility into a company that has an interesting mix of hardware and software consumer-facing businesses
  • Access to our headquarters, located near at the waterfront in Downtown Toronto, overlooking the lake (with complimentary pizza lunches every Thursday!)
  • The ability to make an environmental impact, both in your day job and outside the 9-5 with programs like ecobee acts!
  • Opportunities to learn and grow with our in-house learning enablement team, #ThinkLab
  • Small collaborative teams where you can impact both product and culture
  • Q&A sessions with senior leaders at ecobee
  • Weekly virtual game hangouts hosted by previous co-ops who’ve transitioned to full-time roles
  • Quarterly hack-a-thons, where you get a chance to work on whatever project you want!

ecobee believes all people have equal value and we are committed to providing a safe space for everyone . We welcome all applicants with diverse races, genders, ages, religions, identities, experiences, etc. and we will provide accommodation to all applicants throughout our hiring process.

jobDescription:
Job Description

  • Responsible for modelling and simulating rail network utilization scenarios using industry and best practice standards.
  • Conduct rail network analyses, studies, computer simulation model development or modification, and technical report generation to address a wide range of operating, infrastructure and performance issues.
  • Perform operational analysis using historical data, scenario models, and rail network design.
  • Validate system requirements through operational analysis and rail network planning.
  • Conduct analysis of results and identify trends in rail scheduling issues and recommend efficiencies to methodologies and processes for network expansion, service delivery and cost improvements as related to service expansion and construction activities.
  • Collaborates on assessing impacts on ridership, schedules, equipment, and other corporate resource requirements.
  • Review and update relevant manuals.
  • Provide railway operations resources and interacting with internal and external stakeholders.

Job Requirements

  • Knowledge or interest in rail planning, rail operations, and/or track and signal infrastructure
  • Knowledge of OpenTrack, Rail Traffic Controller (RTC), or equivalent rail network simulation software would be an asset.
  • Programming experience (Python, R, JavaScript, VBA etc,) would be an asset.
  • Knowledge of the theory, principles, and practices of transportation/transit planning, station planning, and data analysis
  • Strong project management and technical analysis skills including data management, qualitative analysis, and quantitative analysis
  • Knowledge of policy analysis and development process
  • Experience using MS Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, etc.)

jobDescription:
About Briza

Briza is the leading developer platform for commercial insurance. We make it easy for developers to embed insurance experiences into their platforms. By writing once to the Briza API, developers can access the many products and carriers required to create great customer experiences for small commercial insurance. Briza enables developers to quote and bind policies over API. Based in Toronto Canada, with a team that spans the US, Brazil and Europe, Briza places a heavy emphasis on working with and developing the best talent in our industry.

Your Opportunity

Product engineering teams at Briza strive to make interacting with commercial insurance products not only better but delightful. There is a large and growing constituent of developers that need API access to insurance carriers but want a single integration, not 100's; this is the value we’re creating at Briza. The way we do this is by making access to the insurance ecosystem simple for developers, and in doing so help developers bring unique value to consumers and businesses.

Briza is a Series A funded venture, with our HQ in Toronto, but with distributed team members across the globe. You can work from our modern office in Toronto, fully remote, or a combination of both.

Who you are:
You have strong foundations and an interest in building software applications, infrastructure/rails, API products or developer platforms
You have some experience or transferable skills to program in Node.js and TypeScript
You are hungry to learn: you’re comfortable with taking constructive feedback (and able to give it!), actively seeking it out to help drive your own growth
You understand the value of automated tests (unit, integration) as a means to ship quickly with confidence


What you’ll be doing:

  • Design, build, maintain and evolve an API product and developer platform with fellow engineers, designers and product managers
  • Get close to customers in order to understand their use cases
  • Debug issues across services and multiple levels of the stack
  • Improve our engineering standards, processes, monitoring and tooling

Qualifications:

  • Backend software development using Node.js and/or TypeScript



Building a Diverse, Inclusive, Distributed Team

At Briza, we believe diversity breeds excellence. We have a global workforce with team members on, or recruited from, 6 continents. At Briza, people live wherever they work best. We have an office in downtown Toronto (steps from Union Station) for those that do want to work onsite.

We also believe in four core values:
Ownership. We make durable decisions that consider the interests of Brizans, customers and shareholders
Ambition. We're rewriting an industry, so that buying business insurance is easy.
Teamwork. It takes a village.  We lean on each other's strengths to grow and succeed.
Honesty. Say what you mean and mean what you say.  We're comfortable receiving and delivering feedback.

We encourage applications from all qualified candidates around the world, including indigenous peoples, racialized people, people with disabilities, people from gender and sexually diverse communities and/or people with intersectional identities. Diversity breeds excellence.

We love working with talented and ambitious students - please apply now!

jobDescription:
Our employees are at the heart of what we do best: helping people, businesses and society prosper in good times and be resilient in bad times. When you join our team, you’re bringing this purpose to life alongside a passionate community of experts.

Feel empowered to learn and grow while being valued for who you are– here, diversity is a strength. You have our commitment to support you in reaching your goals with tools, opportunities, and flexibility. It’s our employee promise.

Our hybrid work model provides the balance between working from home and enjoying meaningful in-person interactions.

Read on to see how you can shape the future, win as a team, and grow with us.

About the role

Launching your tech career at Intact means joining a diverse team of more than 3,000 Digital, Data and Tech experts working at the intersection of what exists and what’s possible. Here, you’ll be supported by forward-thinking leaders who celebrate shared success, and you’ll help push the industry forward with digital solutions that go beyond insurance to offer everyday value to millions of people. You’ll grow personally and professionally with access to cutting-edge technology-driven learning platforms and make lasting connections near and far. Most importantly, you’ll discover how exciting the “real world” can be.

Here, your career will take off

At Intact, we’re leading an insurance transformation to better protect people, businesses and society. We want future talent - like you - to help us lead the charge. Join our team as a Software Developer I for the Summer 2025 term. In this role, you’ll make a difference while building the skills and experience that will propel your career forward.

We are looking for interns to join 2 of our specialized teams: Commercial & Specialty SE and Commercial Lines SE 6. Depending on your team assignment, here’s what you’ll do here:

  • Innovate and develop on our internal dashboard to meet needs from users and fellow co-workers

  • Contribute to Service Oriented Architecture (SOA) application development using GitHub, Docker and OpenShift environments

  • Create applications using industry standard development methodologies, such as Agile/Scrum/Kanban

  • Resolve Incidents, Defects and Problem tickets by finding creative solutions, solving complex problems, coding, testing, and debugging a wide variety of systems

  • Provide deployment support for production systems to guarantee their functionality.

  • Ensure systems are optimal and meet quality standards by analyzing, providing creative suggestions to improve services and user experiences.

  • Be creative and come up with ideas to improve our services and user experiences.

What you bring to the table:

  • Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Software Engineering

  • Available to work with us full-time, 35 hours per week, for the Summer 2025 Term for 16 months (May 2025 to August 2026)

  • Must be returning to school in Fall 2026 following your internship

  • Past internship experience is considered an asset

  • Excellent oral and written communication skills (English and/or French preferred).

  • Ability and desire to learn/adapt quickly to a changing environment

  • Experience in Java is preferred

  • Experience in SQL, Mongo, or any Frontend experience (React, Angular) considered an asset

Your career starts here.  Apply today!

We can’t wait to learn more about you. When you complete your application, remember to include your resume and University/College transcript. We hire co-ops every semester (Winter, Summer and Fall)!

We’re accepting applications now through October 4. All submissions will be reviewed during this time, as well as after the posting closes.

What we offer

Working here means you'll be empowered to be and do your best every day. Here is some of what you can expect as a temporary member of our team:

  • Inspiring leaders and colleagues who will lift you up and help you grow

  • Access to tools and resources to support physical and mental health, embracing change and connecting with colleagues

  • A dynamic workplace learning ecosystem complete with learning journeys, interactive online content, and inspiring programs

  • Inclusive employee-led networks to educate, inspire, amplify voices, build relationships and provide development opportunities.

  • A Community Impact program, because what you care about is a part of what makes you different. And how you contribute to your community should be just as unique.

We are an equal opportunity employer

At Intact, we value diversity and strive to create an inclusive, accessible workplace where all individuals feel valued, respected, and heard.

If we can provide a specific adjustment to make the recruitment process more accessible for you, please let us know when we reach out about a job opportunity. We’ll work with you to meet your needs.

Click here to review other important information about the hiring process, including background checks, internal candidates, and eligibility to work in Canada.

If you are an employee of Intact or belairdirect, please apply for this role on Contact People.

jobDescription:
Independent Electricity System Operator (IESO)

Due to the IESO’s role in the energy sector, please note that a full security check will be conducted.  Job offers will be conditional until you have successfully attained security clearance to work at the IESO.

Why join us?

You've got great skills. And you want to use them in an organization where you know what you do every day matters. We get that.

We also know that ensuring Ontarians have access to affordable and reliable power doesn't happen by accident. So we give you the tools, flexibility and support you need to achieve your goals, and development opportunities to help you grow. You'll thrive in a collaborative, team-based environment that values your unique skills and experiences - and recognizes that when you do better, we become even better too.

Who we are

The Independent Electricity System Operator (IESO) works at the centre of the province's power system, ensuring Ontarians have access to reliable and cost-effective electricity when and where they need it. We operate the province's electricity grid 24/7, design, run and oversee the wholesale electricity markets, and plan and prepare to meet Ontario's electricity needs - now and into the future.

The opportunity
The System Integration department is seeking bright, talented and ambitious Electrical Engineering or Computer Engineering undergraduate and graduate students who are eager to apply their power system engineering skills.


Division/Department:

  • Business Unit: Markets and Reliability
  • Division: System Integration
  • Department: System Models:
  • Teams: Real-Time Applications (RTA) / Performance Validation and Modeling (PVM)

Your work term will be spent in the Markets and Reliability business unit. To learn more about how IESO works on achieving a reliable and efficient operation of the province-wide power system, you can visit our website .

You will be a part of a group responsible for:

The System Models department is seeking bright, talented and ambitious Electrical or Computer Engineering undergraduate and graduate students to join the RTA or PVM teams, and apply their power system engineering skills.

  • A successful candidate is an effective team player, creative problem solver, strong communicator, detail oriented, takes initiative, and shows a high degree of potential to obtain an excellent grasp of power system operations.
  • The successful candidate will acquire job experience through progressively more complex assignments, allowing them to become familiar with the methods and processes related to their specific team’s work functions.

Your work term may be spent in one of the following teams:

  • The Real-Time Applications team (RTA) within the System Models department is responsible for developing and maintaining the on-line model and critical tools needed to successfully execute electricity market operations and ensure the security and reliability of the IESO-Controlled Grid (ICG). The on-line model and associated applications maintained by RTA provide the situational awareness needed by the IESO to make real-time operational decisions to balance Ontario’s supply and demand, while adapting to predictable/unpredictable changing system conditions within and out of the province.
  • The Performance Validation and Modeling team (PVM) within the System Models department is responsible for ensuring equipment connected to the IESO-controlled grid performs as required to maintain reliability, designing equipment test requirements for commissioning new or modified connections and developing models of equipment to ensure accurate representation of the power system to facilitate good planning and operating decisions with regards to the ICG.

What you'll do may include:

  • Interpret electrical facility and equipment technical documentation to assist Power System Engineers/Analysts/Specialists in developing and maintaining accurate and functional on-line and offline network models.
  • Process model change requests via the preparation of equipment parameter data files, generator capability curves, topology diagram, SCADA display, etc. Collaborate with various IESO teams to ensure power system modelling updates are seamlessly implemented on live systems and offline base cases used to operate the provincial grid.
  • Document and effectively communicate modelling changes.
  • Maintain computing and data management tools, including the development of Python scripts and SQL queries.  This may include automating and documenting work processes to improve efficiency.
  • Maintain SharePoint request tool used by various IESO departments to coordinate modeling updates.
  • Assist with the preparation and formulation of documents, reports, presentations, etc.
  • Other work as requested.

This job will provide you with the following professional development:

  • Theoretical and practical knowledge of various power system components.
  • Deepening comprehension of modeling principles.
  • Broaden understanding of power system operations and Ontario’s electricity market.
  • Communication skills by working with multiple groups, including the IESO Control Room.
  • Opportunities to tour generation/transmission facilities which house critical power system infrastructure for the operation of Ontario’s electricity grid.
  • Access to in-person, hybrid, and virtual courses and training opportunities on a variety of power system topics.
  • A maximum of up to 1 year of pre-graduation experience can be claimed towards the PEng licensure requirement.

What you need to succeed

Discipline(s) Required:

  • Electrical Engineering or Computer Engineering – Undergraduate and Graduate Programs

The following knowledge is essential to perform the job:

  • Understanding of 3-phase circuit theory, power system network calculations, basic machine theory, and database architecture. This is normally acquired in Electrical or Computer Engineering disciplines.
  • Demonstrated understanding and experience with programming languages, such as Python, SQL, Microsoft Power Automate, etc.
  • Familiarity with business analysis/visualization software such as Tableau would be an asset.
  • Knowledge of databases, such as Microsoft Access or Oracle, and other Microsoft Office software, including Word, and Excel.

Level: 3rd year

Duration: 16 months (May 2025 to August 2026)

Location: IESO Clarkson - 2635 Lakeshore Road West, Mississauga, ON

Number of Students Required: 3
