jobTitle: Artificial Intelligence and Deep Learning Internship (12mo.)
jobDescription:
By submitting your resume, you’re expressing interest in one of our 2025 Artificial Intelligence or Deep Learning Internships . We’ll review resumes on an ongoing basis, and a recruiter may reach out if your experience fits one of our many internship opportunities.

NVIDIA pioneered accelerated computing to tackle challenges no one else can solve. Our work in AI and digital twins is transforming the world's largest industries and profoundly impacting society — from gaming to robotics, self-driving cars to life-saving healthcare, climate change to virtual worlds where we can all connect and create.

Our internships offer an excellent opportunity to expand your career and get hands on with one of our industry leading Hardware teams. We’re seeking strategic, ambitious, hard-working, and creative individuals who are passionate about helping us tackle challenges no one else can solve. Throughout the internship, students will work on projects that have a measurable impact on our business.

The hourly rate for our interns is 18 USD - 71 USD. Our internship hourly rates are a standard pay determined based on the position and your location, year in school, degree, and experience.

You will also be eligible for Intern benefits . NVIDIA accepts applications on an ongoing basis.

Potential Internships in this field include:

Autonomous Vehicles

  • Developing and training state-of-the-art Deep Neural Networks for path generation

  • Collecting training datasets and real-time inference run-times using simulators/gyms as well as performing in-vehicle tests

  • Course or internship experience related to the following areas could be required: Computer Vision, Mapping, Localization, SLAM, Image Processing, Segmentation

Deep Learning Applications & Algorithms

  • Developing algorithms for deep learning, data analytics, or scientific computing to improving performance of GPU implementations

  • Course or internship experience related to the following areas could be required: Deep Neural Networks, Linear Algebra, Numerical Methods and/or Computer Vision, Software Design, Computer Memory (Disk, Memory, Caches), CPU and GPU Architectures, Networking, Numeric Libraries, Embedded System Design and Development, Drivers, Real-Time Software

Deep Learning Frameworks & Libraries

  • Building underlying frameworks and libraries to accelerate Deep Learning on GPUs

  • Contributing directly to software packages such as JAX, PyTorch, and TensorFlow, integrating the latest library (e.g., cuDNN) or CUDA features, performance tuning, and analysis

  • Optimizing core deep learning algorithms and libraries (e.g., CuDNN, CuBLAS), maintaining build, test, and distribution infrastructure for these libraries and deep learning frameworks on NVIDIA supported platforms

  • Course or internship experience related to the following areas could be required: Computer Architecture (CPUs, GPUs, FPGAs or other accelerators), GPU Programming Models, Performance-Oriented Parallel Programming, Optimizing for High-Performance Computing (HPC), Algorithms, Numerical Methods

jobDescription:
University of Toronto 2025-2026 Professional Engineering Year (PEY) Job Posting
Transportation Systems Analyst & Designer


BA Consulting Group Ltd. is a Canadian firm incorporated in 1974, specializing in urban transportation planning and design. We provide traffic, transit, pedestrian, bicycle, parking and loading solutions to facilitate the design, approval and implementation of facilities and events which attract large numbers of people.

We work with owners, architects and other multi-disciplinary team members to create development plans supported by properly integrated transportation systems. BA Group has thus contributed to the success of thousands of noteworthy projects, including: residential, office, mixed-use, entertainment, retail, sports, education, health care, resort, recreation, parking, transit and industrial land uses.

The organization consists of approximately 90 engineers, urban planners and administrative staff, many of whom are alums of co-op programs from Canadian universities, including the University of Toronto’s PEY program. As a PEY student at BA Group, you will be part of a class of approximately 12 co-op students and can expect to work in collaboration with numerous recent graduates and engineers-in-training.

For the 2025-2026 work term, we are looking to hire 1-2 motivated, responsible individuals with the ability to work both independently and collaboratively as part of small-to-medium sized groups. Candidates will preferably have completed a significant portion of a Civil Engineering, Engineering Science or Industrial Engineering degree and have demonstrated a strong interest in Transportation Engineering and Planning.


Structure of a typical 12 to 16-month PEY co-op term

It is standard for PEY students at BA Group to rotate from working primarily with of the company’s core departments to a different one every 4 to 6 months. The full PEY work term is therefore divided into 3 sub-terms. This exposure to all facets of the organization allows students to gain a wide variety of skills and develop an informed opinion regarding which area of expertise they may wish to pursue at the start of their career. The different departments in which a PEY student can be expected to work, as well as brief descriptions of the tasks associated with each, are listed below:

  • Modelling, Simulation & Data Analytics – development and calibration of traffic, transit and pedestrian simulation models using industry-standard software tools (Vissim, VisWalk, Visum, Aimsun, etc.), analysis and optimization of transportation systems, coding (Python, SQL, MATLAB, VBA etc.) of scripts to efficiently process model outputs and perform analysis of public transit and private vehicle travel time and origin-destination data

  • Analysis & Planning – traffic operations impact assessment using deterministic software analysis tools (Synchro, Vistro, InterCalc, etc.), development of trip generation, trip distribution and traffic assignment forecasts associated with various types and scales of proposed development projects, manipulation of geodatabases using ArcGIS, report writing and preparation

  • Design – design of transportation facilities including intersections, road segments, surface parking lots, loading areas, underground parking garages, etc. using AutoCAD, review of site plan design drawings and preparation of vehicle movement diagrams using AutoTrack

Note that, based on field of study and areas of interest or expertise, it is not unusual for students to spend up to 8 months working in one specific department, while dedicating less time to the other two. For example, Industrial Engineering students will usually tend to spend most of their PEY term with the Modelling, Simulation & Data Analytics group, while Civil Engineering students with a strong CAD background will usually spend most of their term with the Design group.


Job Requirements

Preferred candidates for this position will ideally possess:

• Some familiarity with transportation modelling and traffic operations impact assessment software (Vissim, VisWalk, Synchro, Vistro, SimTraffic, InterCalc, Aimsun, EMME, etc.), technical drawing software (AutoCAD, AutoTrack), and geospatial data analysis software (ArcGIS, QGIS).

• Extensive experience with Microsoft Office software tools (Excel, Word, PowerPoint and Access).

• The ability to code using the Python, SQL, MATLAB, and/or VBA programming languages.

• Some familiarity with database management systems (MySQL, PostgreSQL, etc.).

• Strong written, oral and interpersonal communication skills.

• The ability to work effectively in a team environment, as well as individually.

• An interest in transportation systems engineering and planning demonstrated via course work, projects, research internships, prior co-op terms, etc.

Thank you for your interest in a PEY position at BA Group. If you are motivated by the prospect of working in a fast-paced innovative environment where each project requires solving challenging transportation issues, as part of an organization with a track record of putting PEY students in positions where they contribute to multiple projects and significantly develop their own individual skills, then we’d love to hear from you!

Please visit our website at http://www.bagroup.com.

jobDescription:
Job ID# 3159

Job Title: Co-op - Lifecycle Maintenance Engineering
Date Posted: September 19, 2024
Closing Date: October 20, 2024

Job Type: Student

Location: Calgary

We power Alberta. Our transmission lines deliver electricity to millions of Albertans 24 hours a day, seven days a week. When you’re on our team, you’re supporting our province’s homes, farms, businesses and industries by providing safe, reliable and cost-effective service. Whether working in the field or in the office, every AltaLinker contributes to keeping the lights on.

As a member of the Berkshire Hathaway Energy family, we are part of a global group of companies delivering sustainable electricity and utility services to customers worldwide. Our exceptional customer service, commitment to the environment, and world-class safety record makes us a leader in our industry.

Today, the transmission system is more important than ever. As we connect new sources of renewable energy to the grid and support Alberta’s energy transition to net-zero emissions, AltaLink’s transmission system is the backbone of the changing electricity system. With our head office in Calgary, and regional offices in Greater Edmonton, Red Deer and Lethbridge, we have central and southern Alberta covered.

We offer work with meaning, incredible opportunities for development, work life balance and opportunities to contribute to your community.  Join our team!

Note: The start date is September 2025. The length of the term is 12 months until August 2026.

An opportunity currently exists for an internship/co-op student in the Lifecycle Maintenance Engineering team within the Asset Management department at AltaLink’s Calgary office. Reporting to the Manager, Lifecycle Maintenance Engineering, the successful candidate will be part of a multi-disciplinary engineering team responsible for supporting engineering data analysis, automation, modeling, risk analytics and reporting on AltaLink’s transmission facilities in Alberta, which range from 69kV to 500kV.

Responsibilities:

The successful candidate will perform the following activities under the guidance of technical staff:

  • Support the evolution of AltaLink’s asset risk framework, which includes assessing and making recommendations to improve asset probability of failure and consequence of failure modeling and actively seek and identify where machine learning can add value.
  • Support the Reliability Engineer to report on key reliability metrics and other data analysis tasks including data preparation for industry collaborative engagements and actively seek automation opportunities.
  • Analyze AltaLink outage data and produce visualizations and reports of conducted analysis to assist with development of actionable solutions.
  • Develop and update software code to automate asset failure consequence assessments using AltaLink’s power system model.
  • Assist in automating the extraction and correlation of data from multiple data sources including SAP, Excel, PI Historian and other custom software interfaces.
  • Support the Discipline Engineers to maintain and manage asset failures/saves database.
  • Follow the Condition Based Maintenance process to analyze asset health indices and assess maintenance measures.
  • Support AltaLink’s safety culture and Near Miss / Hazard reporting program.
  • Create and update process documentation and work instructions related to asset risk framework development.

That was just the beginning. We continue our pursuit to create technology that brings peace of mind into the home and allows people to focus on the moments that matter most. We take pride in making a meaningful difference to the environment, all while being part of the exciting, connected home revolution.

In 2021, ecobee became a subsidiary of Generac Power Systems. Generac introduced the first affordable backup generator and later created the category of automatic home standby generator. The company is committed to sustainable, cleaner energy products poised to revolutionize the 21st century electrical grid. Together, we take pride in making a meaningful difference to the environment, all while being part of the exciting, connected home revolution.

For more on ecobee: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RR4rKtkf1SY

We are looking for an Manufacturing Engineer Intern to join our team for the 2025-2026 PEY work term!

Our Manufacturing Engineering team works with our Product design team and Manufacturing partners in building the best product on the market. In this role you will be interacting with various departments as the primary interface to manufacturing.

Due to the hands-on nature of this role, there would be some expectation to be in our Toronto office for access to the Hardware Lab.

  • Supporting implementing equipment solutions to improve productivity. (i.e. designing and implementing automation of device testing)
  • Working with suppliers to propose cost reductions by improving processes
  • Propose new solutions to help manufacturing group by meeting internal quarterly targets and push the envelope further.

We’re up to incredible things. Come and be part of them.

  • The visibility into a company that has an interesting mix of hardware and software consumer-facing businesses

  • Quarterly hack-a-thons, where you get a chance to work on whatever project you want!

jobDescription:
Unique opportunity for joint internship between Cadillac Fairview (12 months) and HH Angus & Associates (4 months). This opportunity provides excellent experience for careers leading into engineering consulting, project management, and commercial real estate.

Role Summary

Cadillac Fairview - 12 Months

Reporting to the Manager, Operations for the Toronto Dominion Centre, the successful applicant will work closely with the senior operations team to assist with management of the largest commercial office property in Canada, the historic Toronto Dominion Centre. You will work on a diverse array of challenges from optimizing energy consumption, analyzing vendor performance data and assisting with management oversight, to planning capital budgets and coordinating construction projects. You will be exposed to all areas of building engineering and operations, including Mechanical, Electrical, Building Automation Systems (BAS), utility metering, and energy management.

HH Angus - 4 Months

Reporting to the Manager, Commercial Division, the successful applicant will take the hands-on knowledge gained at the TD Centre and apply it to the design and engineering of building systems. You will be assigned to assist with engineering design, tender, and construction administration for projects within the commercial sector.

About Cadillac Fairview

The Cadillac Fairview Corporation Limited is one of North America's largest owners, operators and developers of commercial real estate. Cadillac Fairview focuses on developing and managing high quality office, retail and mixed-use properties in Canada and the United States, as well as international investments in real estate companies and investment funds.

At Cadillac Fairview we have been transforming communities for over 50 years.  We are so much more than our properties.  We are building leaders at all levels.  We offer the challenge of interesting work, a great organizational culture, the opportunity to collaborate with the best in the business, and support for your growth and development.  We reward values-based behavior and superior results with a competitive rewards package that includes best-in-class benefits and pension.  Imagine a place where you can make a difference!

At CF our everyday actions and critical business decisions are guided by our CF Values. Achieving results is naturally important for us and we achieve results through behaviors that are consistent with our CF Values.

Are you someone who believes in our values?

- Aim Higher – we strive to exceed expectations
- Own Your Expertise – we empower ourselves and each other
- Collaborate Effectively – we bring the right people together to get the right results
- Engage with Empathy – we objectively consider the needs of others
- Embrace Change – we drive, learn from, and adapt to change

At CF you’ll join a diverse community and award-winning team where your talent and commitment to excellence are welcomed, valued and respected.  We’re ready to meet you there – are you?

About HH Angus

HH Angus delivers innovative engineering design solutions for the built environment to industry leaders, both in Canada and internationally. Our solid reputation is built on 100+ years of success. We’re a privately owned and financially stable company, proud of our history and leading to the future. We’re focused on innovation, on being at the forefront of engineering design and on creating sustainable solutions for our clients across all division projects. We do that by applying the best of current technology, standards and practices and by employing the best people.

JOB RESPONSBILITIES:

The student will support the Environment, Health and Safety (EHS) team with technical discipline proficiencies. A key role includes the data collection, analysis reporting of effluent quality including eventual roll-up report to external regulators. The role also supports the Federal fenceline monitoring program, and performs unit monitoring reports as required.

JOB DUTIES:

  • Environmental (Water) technical support including: water effluent data analysis, compilation of water effluent regulatory reports monthly, quarterly, annually, QA&QC responsibility, support effluent sampling work/coordinate related activities with internal and external staff, and assist in sampling activities, if needed.
  • Support regular environmental inspection activities and supports the regulated fence line monitoring program including sampling and data analysis
  • Supports other on-going environmental programs, i.e. waste audit/waste reduction, composting program.
  • Data collection, trending and analysis of environmental metrics for internal and industry reporting.
  • Provides support for other safety or industrial hygiene projects assigned.
  • Assists with EH&S activities during non-routine operations including plant maintenance turnarounds.
  • Assist with maintenance and calibration of laboratory equipment, as necessary.

WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR:

Arcadis is the world's leading company delivering sustainable design, engineering, and consultancy solutions for natural and built assets. jobDescription:
Hi, we’re ecobee. ecobee introduced the world’s first smart Wi-Fi thermostat to help millions of consumers save money, conserve energy, and bring home automation into their lives. That was just the beginning. We continue our pursuit to create technology that brings peace of mind into the home and allows people to focus on the moments that matter most. We take pride in making a meaningful difference to the environment, all while being part of the exciting, connected home revolution.

In 2021, ecobee became a subsidiary of Generac Power Systems. Generac introduced the first affordable backup generator and later created the category of automatic home standby generator. The company is committed to sustainable, cleaner energy products poised to revolutionize the 21st century electrical grid. Together, we take pride in making a meaningful difference to the environment, all while being part of the exciting, connected home revolution.

For more on ecobee: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RR4rKtkf1SY

The Role:

We are looking for an Embedded Engineer Intern to join our team for the 2025-2026 PEY work term!

As an Embedded Engineer, you will be responsible for helping develop the software that powers our hardware products.  These devices run on a multitude of platforms from small, battery operated microcontrollers to full-blown multicore embedded Linux systems.

The embedded team is in a unique position as we own a wide breadth of the technologies that get built into our devices making each day a unique challenge. You may be working on portions of the low-level software/hardware interactions, but equally important is the development of the user applications that run on device.  Everything from network protocols, to control algorithms to building enticing graphic UI’s.

The embedded team is also responsible for developing the test fixtures used to validate the functionality of each device manufactured.  These devices are truly products on their own and no less complex considering the hardware and software systems they must interface with.

Aside from the in-house technologies, the embedded team is often also responsible for integrating third-party services.  For example, we developed the device software stack that allowed us to become one of the first Apple HomeKit accessories on the market as well as more recently one of the first third parties to integrate Amazon Voice Services for Alexa functionality built right into a thermostat.

How You’ll Make an Impact:

  • Develop objected oriented software primarily in C++
  • Ability to work problems ranging the entire computer stack. All the way from low level driver support and OS upgrades to high level GUI and application development
  • Opportunity to work closely with Third party vendors and integration in order to bring new experiences to our platform. Examples: Spotify, Amazon Alexa, Apple Homekit, etc…
  • Contribute to the hacker spirit at ecobee by taking part in quarterly hackathons
  • To accomplish all of this you will be working closely with your mentor. At any given time you may also be working closely with developers from other teams as well as our Hardware, Product Management, Manufacturing teams and third-party tech companies on integrations.

We’re up to incredible things. Come and be part of them.

What can you expect as an ecobee student?

  • The chance to meet and work with co-ops across all teams at ecobee
  • The opportunity to work in a fresh, dynamic, and ever-growing industry that is the SmartHome and IoT space
  • The visibility into a company that has an interesting mix of hardware and software consumer-facing businesses
  • Access to our headquarters, located near at the waterfront in Downtown Toronto, overlooking the lake (with complimentary pizza lunches every Thursday!)
  • The ability to make an environmental impact, both in your day job and outside the 9-5 with programs like ecobee acts!
  • Opportunities to learn and grow with our in-house learning enablement team, #ThinkLab
  • Small collaborative teams where you can impact both product and culture
  • Q&A sessions with senior leaders at ecobee
  • Weekly virtual game hangouts hosted by previous co-ops who’ve transitioned to full-time roles
  • Quarterly hack-a-thons, where you get a chance to work on whatever project you want!

ecobee believes all people have equal value and we are committed to providing a safe space for everyone . We welcome all applicants with diverse races, genders, ages, religions, identities, experiences, etc. and we will provide accommodation to all applicants throughout our hiring process.

jobDescription:
Environment and Climate Change Canada is looking for students to join our department in the role of a Business Analyst, with the Data Management and Operations Section (DMOS) . Business Analysts play key roles in the delivery of projects that the organization undertakes which have an impact on Canadians. The DMOS undertakes projects that involve ingesting new meteorological datasets, quality assessment of the data ingested and project management for mission-critical data and products to benefit prediction and forecast to meet the needs of the Government of Canada and Canadians. We are looking for enthusiastic students who are interested in making an impact to join us.

Business Analyst duties may include:

  • Developing decoder specifications for ingesting new meteorological datasets
  • Developing business process models, requirements catalogues, use cases, maintaining controlled vocabularies, and detailed data specifications for meteorological data and metadata based on research and engagement of clients and subject matter experts.
  • Developing dashboards and interacting with relational databases via SQL or tools such as MS Access, Power BI, etc.
  • Documenting existing and proposed business processes, policies, and systems, and validating proposed processes, designs, or applications against requirements.
  • Opportunities to explore new technologies (AI, OCR) to provide solutions for data management challenges.
  • Supporting Research & Development and operations to implement data quality assessment techniques.
  • Eliciting and analyzing business requirements through documentation and client engagement and designing solutions to meet organizational needs.
  • Aid in project management by providing support in project tracking and reporting.
  • Technical writing of business processes, policies, and systems, and assessing the impact of proposed changes to the organization and recommending solutions.
  • Working with other business analysts and developers to represent client needs.
  • Supporting project and operational activities, which may include the extraction and validation of data, inventory preparation and post-processing of data, and/or data quality analysis.
  • Supporting software developers and others as they work with the models and data.
  • Performing external scans to determine industry standards and best practices.

You will be assigned to work in multiple project teams, as well as on independent work packages. Students hired into the role are expected to make real contributions to the analysis of business processes and information systems.

You may be assigned to projects in areas such as meteorological and hydrological data management, data quality assessment, information systems renewal, analysis and development of data products, and the development and adoption of metadata standards.

You may also be involved in other major Environment and Climate Change Canada initiatives.

Your application should address how you meet the essential qualifications, along with which assets you may have.

Essential Qualifications:

  • Ability to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing in English
  • Ability to analyze, evaluate, and troubleshoot
  • Ability to manage time effectively
  • Ability to work as part of a team and/or independently
  • Ability to demonstrate initiative
  • Knowledge and experience using Microsoft Excel and Word
  • Demonstrates willingness to learn and fill knowledge gaps
  • Knowledge or understanding of Meteorological data.

Assets:

  • Knowledge of use cases and UML
  • Knowledge of SQL, relational databases, and ER diagramming techniques
  • Knowledge of business process modelling, BPMN, and process improvement methodologies
  • Knowledge and/or experience working with XML
  • Ability to program in object-oriented languages or scripting languages
  • Ability or experience working with large datasets
  • Ability to work with databases, such as Oracle and PostgreSQL using tools such as MS Access.
  • Experience in project management or working in a project management environment
  • Experience in using business intelligence tools (e.g. Microsoft Power BI)
  • Experience using Enterprise Architect, Microsoft Visio, or similar applications

Additional Information
The positions are available for 16-month work terms starting May 2024 through August 2025 at our Downsview (Toronto) office at 4905 Dufferin Street and remotely (hybrid working model).

Preference will be given to Canadian citizens. Preference may be given to students with job-related experience and to students with higher academic standing. Students to whom an offer is made will be required to pass a check for Security Clearance as a condition of employment.

Successful completion of both your educational program and the full work term may lead to temporary or permanent federal public service positions for which you meet the merit criteria and conditions of employment.

Interested applicants must submit:
• Cover letter (with clear indication of their citizenship status)
• Resume
• Complete transcript (unofficial transcripts accepted)

The transcript should contain courses for both fall and winter terms of the current academic year and all previous courses.

INCOMPLETE APPLICATIONS WILL NOT BE CONSIDERED.




ABOUT ENVIRONMENT AND CLIMATE CHANGE CANADA
Environmental issues have wide-ranging implications for social, economic and health decisions for Canadians. The protection and conservation of the environment require the commitments of not only Environment and Climate Change Canada (ECCC) but also all of its partners throughout the federal government and provinces, territories, Indigenous peoples, stakeholders and Canadians. It is for these reasons that ECCC emphasizes partnerships. Ensuring effective engagement helps to advance policies, regulations and services, and provides for a coordinated approach to achieve results that are representative of all interests. ECCC is also relied upon to provide science-based environmental information and services so that Canadians may make informed decisions relating to their health and safety.

There are few major environmental issues for which Canada can find causes or solutions solely within its borders. For this reason, ECCC must engage not only at home but also work with international partners to develop effective solutions to global environmental challenges. The Department seeks to be flexible in order to respond to these challenges and changing circumstances.

Environment and Climate Change Canada is the lead federal department for a wide range of environmental issues. The department addresses these issues through various actions including the implementation of the Pan-Canadian Framework on Clean Growth and Climate Change; engaging with our strategic partners including provinces, territories and Indigenous peoples; monitoring; science-based research; policy and regulatory development; and, through the enforcement of environmental laws. The department's programs focus on minimizing threats to Canadians and their environment from pollution; equipping Canadians to make informed decisions on weather, water and climate conditions; and conserving and restoring Canada's natural environment.

The department's program focus reflects the interdependence between environmental sustainability and economic well-being.

Under the Department of the Environment Act, the powers, duties and functions of the Minister of Environment and Climate Change extend to matters such as:

  • The preservation and enhancement of the quality of the natural environment, including water, air and soil quality, and the coordination of the relevant policies and programs of the Government of Canada
  • Renewable resources, including migratory birds and other non-domestic flora and fauna
  • Meteorology; and
  • The enforcement of rules and regulations

The department delivers its mandate through other acts and regulations, such as the Canadian Environmental Protection Act, 1999 (CEPA 1999), the pollution prevention provisions of the Fisheries Act, the Federal Sustainable Development Act, the Species at Risk Act, the Migratory Birds Convention Act, 1994, the Canada Wildlife Act, and the Wild Animal and Plant Protection and Regulation of International and Interprovincial Trade Act.

The department works closely with the Canadian Environmental Assessment Agency and Parks Canada – its ministerial portfolio partners – to achieve many common goals. In addition, the Minister of Environment and Climate Change has secondary or shared responsibility for delivering on other federal departments’ mandates, including the Arctic Waters Pollution Prevention Act (Transport Canada, Crown-Indigenous Relations and Northern Affairs Canada, and Natural Resources Canada), the Canada Oil and Gas Operations Act (Natural Resources Canada), and the Emergency Management Act (Public Safety Canada).

Please visit our website at: https://www.canada.ca/en/environment-climate-change.html

jobDescription:
About Us

Zynga is a leading developer of the world's most popular social games that are played by millions of people around the world each day. We are headquartered in San Mateo and have additional offices in the U.S., Canada, U.K and India. Since our founding in 2007, our mission has been to connect the world through games and delight consumers with social gaming experiences. To date, more than one billion people have played our games across the Web and mobile, including FarmVille, Zynga Poker, Words With Friends, Hit it Rich! Slots and CSR.

Our Teams

Zynga's software engineers don't just develop some of the world's largest games, they deliver highly scalable infrastructure used by tens of millions of users every day. Our software engineers are blazing trails in all facets of game design, mobile technologies, and massive scalability. Zynga faces a number of challenges - but many are unique to our situation: the large data requirements of online gaming require us to continually push boundaries to discover the best solutions. Zynga software engineers are willing to pick up any of the languages, technologies, or methodologies necessary to smite a challenge - and if a conventional solution doesn't exist, they innovate as necessary. Our software engineers are comfortable moving between front end, back end, and architecture roles.

Job Responsibilities

Team (Experimentation and Targeting):

Our team builds systems and solutions for experimentation/optimization. The experimentation and optimization systems are used by game teams to conduct A/B testing, ramping up features, and optimize various aspects of social gaming. We also work closely with the Data Scientists, and game teams to streamline, automate, and optimize the game experience workflow. Our systems are built using a variety of tech stacks, including React, Node.js, Java (Spring), Python, Go Lang,  Kubernetes, Docker, and various AWS technologies.

Who You Are

  • You are smart, self-motivated, and eager to learn!
  • You love solving difficult problems, and are not afraid of taking on things that you know nothing about!
  • You love coding, and are passionate about making things more robust!
  • You love playing video games, board games, table tennis, or pool :)

What We Are Looking For

  • Working towards a Bachelor in Math, Engineering or a related technical discipline
  • Solid foundation in Computer Science - data structures, algorithms and object-oriented design
  • Experience in Java, Python, React, C/C++, JavaScript, or Go
  • Knowledge of ML, Kubernetes isn't required but is an asset

Past Intern Projects / Technologies used

  • Kubernetes (EKS), Java, Spring Boot, React, Node JS, GoLang, RDS, AWS Lambda, + others
  • Work on roadmap items specific to team and lead full engineering lifecycle of a project (POC, Tech Spec, Release, post-release ops)

Kinectrics Inc. is Canada’s leading provider of innovative science and engineering services to the Electricity Energy Sector.  We are a company built on a 100-year history of serving the energy sector with our advanced problem-solving expertise.  Employing more than 1000 engineers, scientists and technologists our employees are recognized worldwide for outstanding technical excellence in the energy sector.  Kinectrics is unique in that it has an extensive suite of up to date laboratories serving clients in both North America and around the globe.

Kinectrics’ specialists in power generation (nuclear, hydro and fossil), transmission, distribution, industrial energy services, and environmental technologies use innovation science and engineering to help clients improve business performance.  We offer comprehensive services worldwide, in a broad range of disciplines across the energy sector. jobDescription:
Introduction:

Work with Cadence's semiconductor IP team, designing best in-class SerDes in the latest semiconductor processes using  leading industry tools and methodologies. We are seeking an exceptional intern to join our SerDes IP team in Toronto, Ontario. Candidates will be joining some of the brightest inventors and engineers in the world to develop products that make data faster.

Our Approach to Internships:

Make you an integral part of the team by providing training, mentorship, and encouraging your creative Talents. As part of a smaller, tight-knit design group, you will be given opportunities to work on various tasks that span the entire business-engineering cycle. Our goal is to equip students with practical work experience and a big picture view of how business is conducted in the semiconductor industry. You will only be limited by your desire to learn and ambition to assume more responsibilities. We understand that it is best to learn by doing. We will provide tasks that enable you to learn while also making meaningful technical contributions. We also consider interns as full-fledged team members and as your knowledge grows, so does the number of tasks and their complexities. The internship program is also an important step in our full-time post-graduation recruitment strategy, with many of our former interns returning as full-time employees.

Description:
The Digital ASIC Design / Verification Engineering Intern will be reporting to digital engineering director and is a Full-Time position. The team is working on the next generation PCIe SERDES Phy IP. The Intern will work with cutting edge technology and EDA tools to develop and validate Cadence’ designs pre silicon. The intern is expected to interact extensively with logic, verification, physical design, analog and system engineers in the team. By the end of internship, the intern will have full exposure to all aspects of digital ASIC development from RTL design & verification to tape-out.

Company Information:

Cadence is the global leader in software, hardware, and services that is driving the transformation of the electronic design automation (EDA) industry. This application-driven approach for creating, integrating, and optimizing designs helps customers realize Analog & Digital ICs ,  System-On-Chip devices, IP and complete systems at lower costs and with higher quality.

Cadence is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to hiring a diverse workforce.

Responsibilities:

  • RTL coding, simulation, and verification
  • Design and verification flow automation, improvements, and development
  • Compiling timing constraints and performing logic synthesis
  • Interface with application engineering team on design integration issues and technical customer support requests
  • Collaborating with experienced engineers on managing multiple projects, build flows, and design/verification environments.

Skills/Requirements:

  • Students who have completed third year engineering in Electrical, Computer Engineering, or Engineering Science

  • Please include a cover letter, resume, and transcript with your application. Only complete applications will be reviewed.

jobTitle: Preventative Maintenance Engineer Coop, Asset Management
jobDescription:
POSITION SUMMARY:

Facilities & Services on the St. George campus is looking for a highly engaged engineering student interested in buildings and mechanical asset management and enterprise resource planning.

The Preventative Maintenance Engineer Coop is a new role whose focus is to leverage continuous improvement and asset management tactics to develop maintenance plans for the Utilities & Building Operations group. Examples include how daily walkthroughs of mechanical spaces are completed, and reporting on how core equipment is regularly inspected and maintained. These maintenance plans will drive operational improvements and yield savings and efficiencies across Facilities & Services. The role will support redesigning processes, collecting information, designing, building, testing, and deploying solutions.

They will work very closely with and learn from both the Utilities & Building Operations team as well as the Business Improvement and the Systems, Payroll, and Operations Development teams. Under the guidance of senior mechanical engineers, the business and data analyst, and mechanical and building area managers, they will have the opportunity to learn and apply preventative maintenance best practices to proactively manage important mechanical assets.

They would be responsible for the capture, documentation, and analysis of maintenance plans; identification of improvements and preventative maintenance opportunities; and actively build, test, and launch preventative maintenance plans using SAP Plant Maintenance and Asset Management applications.

They would also support knowledge transfer through the creation of high value, intuitive, and transferable artefacts to ensure the sustainability, maintainability, and longevity of their maintenance plans.

This role will work closely with the building and mechanical area managers, mechanical engineers, Plant Maintenance business and data Analyst, process analysts, and other roles across the department including senior management, field personnel, and administrative staff.

RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES: _______________________________________________

  • Collaborate with engineering, operations, and maintenance teams to gather insights and input for designing comprehensive preventative maintenance plans for equipment and systems.
  • Research industry best practices and organizational guidelines to ensure the reliability and longevity of building mechanical and electrical systems.
  • Assist with risk assessments on existing equipment to identify potential failure points and develop strategies to mitigate risks through preventive measures.
  • Analyze historical maintenance data and equipment performance metrics to identify patterns, trends, and areas for improvement in preventative maintenance strategies.
  • Create and maintain detailed documentation for preventative maintenance procedures, schedules, and protocols.
  • Work towards standardizing maintenance processes for consistency and efficiency.
  • Develop training materials and support development of training sessions to educate maintenance teams on use of preventative maintenance plans on SAP platform.
  • Facilitate knowledge transfer to ensure that maintenance personnel are well-equipped to execute the plans effectively.
  • Actively seek opportunities for continuous improvement in preventative maintenance processes.
  • Generate regular reports on the adoption of preventative maintenance plans and provide recommendations for improvement.
  • Maintain an organized and up-to-date repository of all maintenance-related documentation, including schedules, reports, and procedural manuals.
  • Anticipate and mitigate potential technical, data, and user-related issues.
  • Collection, validation, and completion of principle data, and creation of assets in the database

QUALIFICATIONS / SKILLS:

  • Currently pursuing an Engineering degree, with industrial or mechanical focus
  • Excellent logical reasoning, research skills, and critical thinking skills
  • Excellent written and verbal communication, organization, and documentation skills
  • Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills to both anticipate and prevent as well as resolve issues
  • Strong ability to work independently or within a cross-functional team
  • Ability to meet strict deadlines and work effectively while balancing multiple demands
  • Knowledge of working with data sources and connectors
  • Knowledge of data transformation and manipulation
  • Integration skills with various applications (SharePoint) and services preferred
  • Proficiency in MS Excel, PowerPoint, Word
  • Familiarity with software development tools and version control systems
  • Eagerness to learn and adapt to new technologies and software (SAP Plant Maintenance and Asset Management)

What you will learn:

  • Preventative maintenance planning
  • Asset management and enterprise resource planning techniques
  • Business and data analysis
  • Process improvement and design
  • Process and systems management
  • Stakeholder management and communication

jobDescription:
Signal Integrity Products - Semtech
Aanalog IC Design Engineering Internship

Job Summary:
This position is for 12-16 months as an Analog Circuit Design Student Internship at Semtech Canada with the Signal Integrity Products Group (SIP) in the High-Speed Analog and Mixed-Signal Design team in our Burlington Design Center.

Our approach to internship is to make the successful candidate an integral part of our team. We understand that it is best to learn through direct involvement and we will provide you with tasks that enable you to learn and to be productive at the same time. The more you learn the more complex your tasks will become. The internship program is an important part of our recruiting strategy.


Job Responsibilities:

The position contributes to a team working in the development, design, simulation, verification, and post-manufacture characterization of analog integrated circuits for use in Semtech's optical data communication products.

The position includes work related to blocks such as CDRs, equalizers, drivers, and typical support circuits such as bandgap references and opamps. State-of-the-art BiCMOS and CMOS technologies are used for these circuits.

Advanced CAD tools are used for the design, layout, simulation, and verification of the analog blocks plus scripting work for IC design and validation automation.

The position also involves analyzing and characterizing chips in a lab environment using high-speed oscilloscopes, bit-error-rate testers (BERTs), and custom data capture boards all driven by customizable automation software.

The student will work in a team environment and receive mentoring and guidance from seasoned IC designers.

Qualifications:

  • Interest in semiconductor concepts and the industry, and learning about analog and mixed-signal transistor-level design
  • Good understanding of analog electronic circuit fundamentals
  • Ability to learn quickly and work independently or in a team environment
  • Exposure to transistor level circuit design/analysis would be an asset
  • Exposure to CAD circuit design tools (e.g. Cadence Virtuoso) would be an asset
  • Experience with Matlab and/or scripting languages such as Python would be an asset
  • Desired start date May 2023, 12-16 month term, (16 preferred)

Evertz has been recognized as one of the 50 best managed and top100 fastest growing high-tech companies in Canada.   Located within an hour of the Waterloo area (Burlington), we are a worldwide leader in the design and manufacture of leading edge multimedia products for the film & television broadcast industry.

As a leader and innovator in HDTV and IPTV, Evertz has been known for high caliber products without compromise, with features second to none in the industry.  Our innovative approach combines our in house state of the art manufacturing facility and short design cycle time to realize exceptional products sold to our worldwide client base including CBC, ABC, NBC, CBS, HBO, and the BBC.   We are currently seeking a MECHANICAL DESIGN (CO-OP) to join our Research & Development team.

As part of a project driven unit, you will be challenged with the design, prototype and test of precision mechanical devices for film transport and high frequency digital and analog electronic sub assembly enclosures. You will also be responsible for the carry through of the designs to production.  Participate in a wide range of engineering projects and principles including Mechanical Design Process, Mechanical Drafting using Solidworks, thermal Solutions for Electronics, Machining of metal, sheetmetal work, Properties of Materials, some electrical/computer engineering exposure.

  • Interact and communicate with engineers to gather all necessary information to develop a final design
  • Design fixtures, test jigs, tool and gauges as required, manage, control and document design changes

Qualifications:
• Be results-oriented, self motivated and a team player
• Ideal for an intermediate or senior level student

jobDescription:
General Company Information

Kinectrics Inc. is Canada’s leading provider of innovative science and engineering services to the Electricity Energy Sector.  We are a company built on a 100-year history of serving the energy sector with our advanced problem-solving expertise.  Employing more than 1000 engineers, scientists and technologists our employees are recognized worldwide for outstanding technical excellence in the energy sector.  Kinectrics is unique in that it has an extensive suite of up to date laboratories serving clients in both North America and around the globe.

Kinectrics specializes in power generation (nuclear, hydro and fossil), transmission, distribution, industrial energy services, and environmental technologies that use innovation science and engineering to help clients improve business performance.  We offer comprehensive services worldwide, in a broad range of disciplines across the energy sector. Visit our web site: www.kinectrics.com

The Opportunity

  • Department : Project Management Office (PMO)
  • Location : Tiverton, ON

You will be a member of our Engineering Project Management and Controls Team.

The work involves (not limited to):

  1. Coordination with team members to refine processes and improve efficiencies through innovative solutions.
  2. Working in a team environment to solve multiple challenging problems, create new automated reports, and respond to emergent client request (with oversight from technical specialists).
  3. Facilitate effective communication between different branched of the organization.
  4. Interfacing with project managers, project controls specialists, planners, design engineers, etc. to ensure deliverables are completed on schedule and to a high standard.
  5. Data analysis and reporting to find the most efficient solutions to daily problems.
  6. With guidance, participating in the development of project management reports, schedules and costing analysis. Typical projects may include:
  • Performing cost and/or schedule analysis reports to assess project health
  • Interfacing with project managers stationed at the client’s site to assist them with project requirements and metrics
  • Track spending and schedule progress
  • Review financial reports that are used in the invoicing and accrual process
  • Working directly on site with clients

Professional Development
You will learn about the use of project management and project controls in a fast paced and challenging setting.  You will be given the opportunity to create and implement innovative solutions, contributing to the success of our business by undertaking challenging projects with coaching and direction from staff who are highly experienced.

Job Requirements

The following knowledge is essential to perform the job:

  • Sound fundamental knowledge of engineering and/or science principles
  • Strong problem-solving skills and aptitude in project management
  • Excellent written and oral communication, time management, and interpersonal skills
  • Bruce Power Site Access Security Clearance (asset, but not mandatory)

Strong understanding of the following will also be an asset, but not mandatory, to be involved with other high-profile projects and initiatives:

  • Knowledge of Primavera P6 or MS Project
  • Basic understanding of BI tools is helpful but not necessary (QlikView/Power BI)


Discipline(s) Required:
Computer Science, Chemical, Mechanical, Materials, Electrical, Civil or Nuclear Engineering, Engineering Science, Physics, Mathematics, Science, Management/Commerce or equivalent.

Duration between 14-16 months. Possible timelines:

  • May 2025 to June 2026
  • May 2025 to August 2026
  • June 2025 to August 2026

Student Testimonial
“Working at Kinectrics has been an amazing and educational experience. I had the opportunity to work alongside many talented people, and develop my skills in design, programming, and project management.” – PEY Student Analyst 2019-2020

Other Information

Not familiar with Tiverton/Bruce County? Check out the following links to learn more about this beautiful area north of the GTA:

  • https://brucecounty.on.ca/
  • https://explorethebruce.com/

Application Instructions
Qualified applicants, please apply directly through your school's job portal by including a cover letter, resume and transcripts in a single file attachment. Please ensure you include all the required information in order to be considered for this opportunity.  Please note only those candidates considered for an interview will be contacted.

We are an equal opportunity employer that recognizes the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

Kinectrics welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

jobDescription:
E11 Bio is on a mission to make single-cell brain circuit mapping a routine part of every neuroscientist's toolbox. We are a collaborative and interdisciplinary team of scientists and engineers engaged in a neuroscience moonshot project to develop a radical technology platform for scalable mammalian brain mapping. E11 Bio is a non-profit Convergent Research focused research organization located in Alameda, California, pursuing blue-skies neuroscience research yet operating like a nimble, tight-knit start-up.

E11 Bio is seeking a motivated and enthusiastic intern to help develop next-generation expansion microscopy technology for a neuroscience moonshot. You will help our scientists with developing new chemistries for tissue preparation at the scale of the mammalian brain, and have opportunities to hone your skills in material chemistry and fluorescent microscopy.

Responsibilities

  • Independently design, coordinate, and execute bench level experiments.
  • Perform multi-round readout experiments in tissue processed with expansion microscopy, with cycles of immunostaining, imaging, and signal extinction.
  • Perform development work around imaging in brain tissue using expansion microscopy. This includes but is not limited to projects such as:
    • Pilot methods for homogenous penetration of affinity probes into expanded hydrogel/tissue hybrids, e.g. using electric fields. Pilot commercially available devices and design custom built devices (in collaboration with external vendors) to facilitate these experiments.
    • Pilot variations of expansion microscopy protocols focused on optimizing signal retention for multi-round cycles of immunostaining, imaging, and signal extinction.
    • Pilot methods for signal amplification in expansion microscopy, including DNA-based methods.
    • Pilot the integration of readout of additional biological modalities in the existing expansion microscopy workflow, beyond immunostainings for proteins: RNA, DNA, morphology, etc.
  • Work closely with experimental and computational scientists to collaboratively design experiments, analyze experimental data, and interpret results.
  • Source and adapt techniques and methodologies from the literature and scientific community.
  • Maintain excellent laboratory notebook practices, communicate results through reports and presentations, and contribute to and assist in preparation of manuscripts, abstracts and other scientific documents.

Required qualifications

  • Experience with basic molecular biology laboratory techniques (e.g. work with tissue slices, immunohistochemistry, etc.)
  • Excellent communication skills, record keeping ability, and attention to detail
  • Excellent interpersonal and collaboration skills

Preferred qualifications

  • Experience with common computational tools for image processing: ImageJ, Python, Linux, etc.
  • Experience with optical microscopy and immunohistochemistry
  • Experience with expansion microscopy
  • Background in electrical or mechanical engineering

Who will love this job

  • You are passionate about tool development for applications in connectomics, and want to broadly accelerate science through commitment to a high-impact project with a tight-knit team.
  • You have a strong desire and intrinsic motivation to work collaboratively and inclusively as part of an interdisciplinary team science effort.
  • You are committed to the ethos of open science, and want to see your work transparently disseminated.
  • You are seeking a high-leverage, non-traditional opportunity to maximize the impact of your science, establishing relationships with key stakeholders in the neuroscience community.

We offer

  • An opportunity to change the world and work with some of the smartest and the most talented experts from different fields.
  • Excellent medical, dental, and vision insurance through a PPO plan.
  • Wellness allowance for fitness and wellness activities.
  • 8-16 month internships, negotiable start and end dates.
  • Sponsorship for J1 Visas.

jobDescription:
JOB RESPONSBILITIES:

Plant Engineering collaborates with the Maintenance and Operations departments to develop engineered solutions for piping and equipment repairs, replacements, and changes. As the Plant Engineering Co-op, you will:

  • Scope, design and engineer construction work packages, applying both company practices and industry codes & standards
  • Collaborate with designers to issue engineering documentation such as Process & Instrument Diagrams (P&ID’s), piping isometrics, and mechanical detail drawings
  • Work with a multi-disciplinary team to support mechanical, instrumentation, automation, and electrical replacements and upgrades
  • Manage and drive safety mindset through participation in site programs including field level risk assessments (FLRA) and safety peer observations (PPP)
  • Lead one or more special projects with emphasis on development and implementation of solutions to improve safety, reliability or compliance

WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR:

  • Full-time students currently enrolled in a Mechanical Engineering discipline. Other disciplines will be considered based on experience or applicable courses.
  • Strong teamwork/interpersonal skills with ability to communicate ideas effectively
  • Motivated self-starter who can work well independently
  • Multitask competing priorities in a fast paced environment
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills
  • 3D spatial visualization skills and mechanical aptitude
  • Experience with using engineering software such as AutoCAD is preferred
  • Knowledge of Microsoft products such as MS Word, Excel, and PowerPoint

WORK CONDITIONS:

Mix of office and field visits in an industrial manufacturing environment (outdoor) to complete assigned work. This may at times include twisting, crouching, kneeling, making visual inspections, climbing stairs/ladders, and pushing/pulling objects. Safety is our #1 Priority – all required training and Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) will be provided as part of on-boarding.

Reasons to Work at Petro-Canada Lubricants

1. The Culture – home to a tight knit community of talented engineers, most of whom began their careers on-site as new grads or former co-ops themselves!

2. Mentorship – one on one mentorship, opportunity to learn from Subject Matter Experts, and participate in any on-site training offered during the co-op term.

3. Opportunities – wide variety of engineering assignments, opportunities to propose continuous improvement ideas and follow them through to implementation. You’ll rarely see the same thing twice!

4. Experience – apply your academic skills and knowledge in an industrial setting and further develop your understanding of engineering principles.

5. The Fun Side – Social Club and Engineering events such as BBQs, auctions, golf tournaments, volunteer opportunities and more!

About Us

PCLI refines and produces world-class advanced lubricants, specialty fluids, and greases. The base oil refinery is one of the largest in the world and offers a unique employment opportunity within the GTA! The site supports five key production units, including base oil production, support utilities and waste water treatment

Arcadis is the world's leading company delivering sustainable design, engineering, and consultancy solutions for natural and built assets. Candidates will be part of projects related to the application of technology and operational planning in the transportation industry.

Join us if you are interested in working with Canadian, US and international (Europe, Asia and South Africa) clients. jobDescription:
Untether AI is a rapidly growing Toronto startup building a next generation hardware AI accelerator for neural net inference. We're designing integrated circuits that will run neural nets orders of magnitude faster, while using less power. This class of chips will be the standard platform for running image recognition, speech synthesis, text-to-speech, and many other applications in data centers, mobile phones, and self-driving cars within the next 5 years.

With our second generation speedAI silicon up and running in the lab, our hardware team is focused on a few primary areas:

  • Bringing speedAI to market:
    • Chip, board, and system validation (hands on lab work, scripting, etc.)
    • Firmware development and productization (Low level C++ coding)
  • Developing the next generation:
    • RTL Design (SystemVerilog, etc.)
    • Verification (SystemVerilog, UVM Simulations, FPV, etc)
    • Custom Digital and Mixed Signal Circuit Design
    • Automating our Work through CAD Tooling and Infrastructure Development

We are looking for self motivated and innately curious candidates. You can expect to be put in charge of an important project that will challenge you to learn and you will be provided with mentoring and guidance from veteran hardware engineers. Because we're building new systems from the ground up, you'll get to work on new unsolved problems.

We encourage interdisciplinarity and learning, so if you have experience in hardware or software, come talk to us. But don't worry if you think your experience is too narrowly focused, we've got great projects for people with a wide range of interests and specializations.

Join our Digital Design team and come learn about our hardware projects. You can pick your own project from a large number of topics, and we'll work together to set the deliverables for your term with us. In general, expect to work in a loose SCRUM like environment (weekly/biweekly work sprint with code deliverable) where you are submitting your designs or code for team review via git merge/pull request or group presentation.

Some examples of tasks:

  • Design, propose and oversee the analysis/evaluation of hardware architectures
  • Design and code RTL modules written in Verilog/SystemVerilog
  • Simulate and perform hardware-based testing, debug, and verification
  • Scripting and basic software development in support of hardware design
  • Apply Agile development methodologies including code reviews, sprint planning, and frequent deployment

We don't have strict skill requirements, but of course prior experience in the tools and skills we use is a plus:
- Tools and programming languages we use: cadence, synopsys (VCS, dc-shell, primetime), spice, verilog, VHDL, python, cocotb, git, icarus, verilator
- Topics and skills we are interested in include: cpu design, dsp design, artificial intelligence, neural net training and inference, digital logic design and analysis

Job Description

WHAT YOU DO AT AMD CHANGES EVERYTHING

We care deeply about transforming lives with AMD technology to enrich our industry, our communities, and the world. Our mission is to build great products that accelerate next-generation computing experiences – the building blocks for the data center, artificial intelligence, PCs, gaming and embedded. Underpinning our mission is the AMD culture. We push the limits of innovation to solve the world’s most important challenges. We strive for execution excellence while being direct, humble, collaborative, and inclusive of diverse perspectives.

AMD together we advance_

An exciting internship opportunity to make an immediate contribution to AMD's next generation of technology innovations awaits you! We have a multifaceted, high-energy work environment filled with a diverse group of employees, and we provide outstanding opportunities for developing your career. During your internship, our programs provide the opportunity to collaborate with AMD leaders, receive one-on-one mentorship, attend amazing networking events, and much more. Being part of AMD means receiving hands-on experience that will give you a competitive edge. Together We Advance your career!

Data Analyst Intern/Co-Op (Undergrad | Summer, 2025 | Onsite/Hybrid)

An exciting internship opportunity to make an immediate contribution to AMD's next generation of technology innovations awaits you! We have a multifaceted, high-energy work environment, filled with a diverse group of employees, and we provide outstanding opportunities for developing your career. During your internship, you will have the opportunity to collaborate with AMD leaders, receive one-on-one mentorship, attend amazing networking events, and much more. Being part of AMD means receiving hands-on experience that will give you a competitive edge. Together We Advance your career!

JOB DETAILS:

  • Location: Markham, Ontario, Canada
  • Onsite/Hybrid: This role requires the student to work full time 37.5 of hours a week, either in a hybrid or onsite or remote work structure throughout the duration of the co-op/intern term
  • Duration: 16-months, May 05, 2025 - August 27, 2026

WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING:

We are seeking a highly motivated Data Analyst intern/co-op to join our team and work on data, statistical analysis, performance analysis, quality assurance, and data interpretation. In this role –

  • Your responsibility will be to analyze and organize raw data to craft proofs of concepts, prototype, and implement solutions using relevant analysis methods and visualization techniques

We are seeking an ambitious engineer interested in multi-disciplinary systems to work on electronics for microwave synthesis, readout, and control.

We’re casting a wide net and do not expect candidates to be experts. A willingness to learn and develop is essential. We also highly value expertise in adjacent domains (examples: mechanical/thermal design, documentation/test/QC, cryogenics, etc.)

jobDescription:
About Us

Zynga is a leading developer of the world's most popular social games that are played by millions of people around the world each day. We are headquartered in San Francisco and have additional offices in the U.S., Canada, U.K and India. Since our founding in 2007, our mission has been to connect the world through games and delight consumers with social gaming experiences. To date, more than one billion people have played our games across the Web and mobile, including FarmVille, Zynga Poker, Words With Friends, Hit it Rich! Slots and CSR.

Our Teams

Zynga's software engineers don't just develop some of the world's largest games, they deliver highly scalable infrastructure used by tens of millions of users every day. Our software engineers are blazing trails in all facets of game design, mobile technologies, and massive scalability. Zynga faces a number of challenges - but many are unique to our situation: the large data requirements of online gaming require us to continually push boundaries to discover the best solutions. Zynga software engineers are willing to pick up any of the languages, technologies, or methodologies necessary to smite a challenge - and if a conventional solution doesn't exist, they innovate as necessary. Our software engineers are comfortable moving between front end, back end, and architecture roles.

Job Responsibilities

The Analytics Application Platform Engineering team builds systems and solutions for analytics applications and business intelligence. Our business intelligence system enables game teams to discover and gather players insights to make data-driven decisions. Working closely with data scientists/analysts, you will be building high-performance & large-scale systems that bridge big data / machine learning technologies to analyze and optimize within our games. Our systems are built on a variety of tech stacks, including Java (Spring), Python, Node.js, TypeScript, Kubernetes, Docker, React, and various AWS technologies.

Job Requirements:

WHO YOU ARE

  • You are smart, self-motivated, and eager to learn!
  • You love solving difficult problems, and not afraid of taking on things that you know nothing about! + You love coding, and passionate about making things more robust!
  • You love playing video games, board games, table tennis, or pool :)

WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR

  • Working towards a Bachelor in Computer Science, Math, Engineering or a related technical discipline
  • Solid foundation in Computer Science - data structures, algorithms and object-oriented design
  • Experience in Java, Python, Web framework/library (e.g. React)
  • Knowledge of Docker, database technologies (relational, NoSQL ) + AWS isn't required but is an asset

WHAT WE OFFER YOU

  • Daily lunches, tons of snacks and beverages
  • Zynga happy hours and frequent employee events
  • Flexible working hours on many teams
  • Casual dress every single day
  • Culture of diversity and inclusion including employee resource groups
  • Work with cool people and impact millions of daily players

Equal Opportunity Employer Statement

Zynga is an equal opportunity employer. We are proud of our diverse community; we do not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, medical condition, disability, or any other class or characteristic protected by applicable law. We welcome candidates, players, employees, and partners from all backgrounds. Join us!

Zynga will consider for employment all qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with applicable law.

We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with physical or mental disabilities in order to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. We will never ask you for your personal or financial information over unofficial chat channels. jobDescription:
The Mosaic Company (NYSE: MOS) is the world’s leading integrated producer of concentrated phosphate and potash—two of the three most important nutrients in agriculture. We employ more than 13,000 people in six countries to serve farmers all over the world. Our Headquarters is in Lithia, Florida with operations throughout North America (U.S./Canada) and South America.

At Mosaic We Help the World Grow the Food it Needs - Apply today and join our team!

Where will you work:

Mosaic Potash Esterhazy is an underground potash mine located 90 kilometers south of Yorkton. It’s split between three mine sites - K1, K2 and K3 which will be the largest, and one of the world’s most competitive underground potash mines in the world.

Housing and relocation can be provided for qualified candidates.

Term

May 12 - August 22, 2025

Mechanical Integrity Engineer Co-Op/Intern

An MI Engineering Co-Op/Intern at Mosaic will be assigned to projects focused on improving plant stationary assets and assessing and documenting condition of existing assets.

What will you do?

Day to day work assignments could include:

jobTitle: Software Engineering Intern: PolarFire System IDE Developer
jobDescription:
Microchip’s FPGA software engineering team develops the Electronic Design Automation (EDA) software used by our customers to program Microchip FPGAs. Customers perform their entire FPGA design flow using our software: from design entry, to synthesis, through place-and-route, timing, power analysis, and simulation.

The PolarFire System software engineering team is developing the next generation system-level design software for Microchip’s RISC-V based SoC FPGAs. This involves the development of a range of tools, from Integrated Development Environments (IDEs) to software libraries to compilers. We are completely redesigning our software development IDE to build on top of the new Theia framework (https://theia-ide.org/), which looks and feels like VSCode. The new PolarFire System IDE drives a comprehensive platform that enables designers to easily navigate the complex landscape of FPGA-based SoC designs, from software specification to hardware implementation. The IDE streamlines the design process by offering an intuitive graphical interface for compiling, verifying, and integrating SoC designs.

As a software engineer in the PolarFire System team, you will be joining an agile fast-paced engineering team, where you will solve highly challenging problems. You will have ownership over meaningful new software projects from inception to development, testing, writing user documentation, and releasing to Microchip FPGA customers. The PolarFire System IDE is a high priority project that will go into production in 2025. Our previous interns have worked on critical parts of the IDE and some have filed patents on their work.

The software engineering team is based in Toronto. The Microchip office is in the downtown financial core at 67 Yonge Street, only a 10-minute walk from Union Station.

Interns will work in-person from our office 5 days a week.

Responsibilities:

· Develop Theia extensions in object-oriented Typescript

· Perform dependency injection with InversifyJS

· Perform UI/UX design using the React framework and CSS

· Write automated frontend-user tests using Playwright

Minimum Qualifications:

· Excellent programming and debugging skills. Experienced in Typescript/Javascript, React, and HTML/CSS

· Strong knowledge of algorithms, data structures, and object-oriented programming.

Preferred Qualifications:

· Experience working with VSCode/Theia plugins/extensions and UI/UX design are a definite plus.

· Experience with Git source code version control.

· Experience with shell scripting languages (Python, Perl, Bash, TCL).

· Knowledge of digital design and FPGAs.

· Comfortable with large-scale software development in both Linux and Windows environments.

jobDescription:
Seeking a highly motivated engineering student willing to learn Digital Design Verification, which is a critical step of the product development process. Design Verification aims to confirm that the design complies with the Protocol Standards and System Requirements before it is developed into a chip. Exhaustively verifying functionality in the design phase allows engineers to catch bugs early in the development cycle where they are cheaper and easier to fix. Designs have become more complex due to the decreased size of process node technology and to the increase in the number of logic blocks hence the high demand for Digital Design Verification Engineers.

The candidate will be involved in verifying current and next generation Backplane Ethernet, PCIe, USB 3/4, and/or MIPI CPHY/DPHY SERDES products. The position offers an excellent opportunity to work with digital and mixed signal design engineers accountable for delivering high-end mixed-signal designs. Starting in May 2025 , this 16-month internship position will be with our Solutions Group in Mississauga. What you will learn:

  • Defining and tracking Verification Testplans
  • Designing and writing constrained-random SystemVerilog testbenches using a Verification Methodology such as UVM (Universal Verification Methodology)
  • Creating and examining Functional Coverage
  • Writing SystemVerilog assertions
  • Debugging RTL and gate-level simulation failures
  • Firmware Debug
  • Bug Tracking using Software Tools such as Jira
  • Code Coverage Analysis

Skill Requirements:

  • Experience writing scripts in languages such as Perl, Unix shell, or Python
  • Experience with any object-oriented programming language (C++, Java, Python, etc.)
  • Familiar with Verilog or SystemVerilog

Education Requirements:

  • Enrolled in Computer Engineering or Electrical Engineering program, or similar


Our Silicon IP business is all about integrating more capabilities into an SoC—faster. We offer the world’s broadest portfolio of silicon IP—predesigned blocks of logic, memory, interfaces, analog, security, and embedded processors. All to help customers integrate more capabilities. Meet unique performance, power, and size requirements of their target applications. And get differentiated products to market quickly with reduced risk. At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you.

Synopsys Canada ULC values the diversity of our workforce. We are pledged to provide access & opportunity to individuals with disabilities and will provide reasonable accommodation to applicants throughout the recruitment and employment process. Should you require an accommodation, please contact hr-help-canada@synopsys.com .
