jobDescription:
The design and analysis of any rock engineering project for civil or mining applications requires careful mechanical characterization of the host rock. For this purpose, rock cores are drilled on-site and rock samples are prepared for laboratory testing. Then by following various standardized rock mechanics testing procedures, several physical and mechanical properties are determined for subsequent design purposes.

To better help civil engineering and mining companies as well as geotechnical consultants with their rock testing needs, Geomechanica offers standard rock testing services using its laboratory testing facility located in the Oakville, Ontario. We offer a wide range of tests, including: unconfined/confined compressive testing, Brazilian disc tensile testing, slake durability, and point load testing as well as punch penetration and moisture content measurement.

We serve most of the major geotechnical consultants in the Greater Toronto Area and as our work load is increasing, we are looking to hire a lab technician co-op to assist us in performing the above-mentioned tests. The candidate will be responsible for the following tasks:

  • Preparing rock samples for testing based on relevant ISRM or ASTM standards
  • Performing various tests on rock samples based on relevant ISRM or ASTM standards
  • Carefully logging sample behaviour during testing
  • Reporting of results in appropriate formats using our own in-house software tools
  • Simple maintenance of laboratory equipment and reporting to superiors

jobTitle: Quantitative Trading Analyst Co-Op: Natural Gas Trading
jobDescription:
Quantitative Analyst Co-Op: Natural Gas Trading

Castleton Commodities International is an independent global commodities merchant. As a trader, CCI deploys capital on a proprietary basis in the physical and financial commodity markets, providing the Company with market insights and access. As a strategic investor and developer, CCI leverages its market expertise, operations capabilities, and industry knowledge to invest in, and develop, select commodity infrastructure assets. CCI focuses its activities on the markets it understands best, while constantly striving to expand its knowledge base and network of relationships in order to participate in new markets.

CCI’s natural gas activities include the ownership of physical reserves, physical and financial trading, leasing of storage and transport capacity, and transacting with producers and consumers. CCI’s U.S. Natural Gas business consistently ranks among the top marketers of natural gas in the U.S. transacting on approximately 100 pipelines and over 60 storage facilities to create a geographically diverse portfolio of natural gas assets. CCI’s natural gas storage leases comprise one of the largest independent storage portfolios in North America.

Headquartered in Stamford, Connecticut, CCI conducts business from offices located around the world including Calgary, Canada; Houston, Texas; New York, New York; Geneva, Switzerland; London, United Kingdom; and Singapore. The Company has more than 500 employees across the globe.

Co-Op Overview:
This is a 12 to 16 month co-op working closely with the Calgary based Natural Gas trading team primarily focused on in-depth analysis of the North American energy markets.  The role will provide the applicant, the opportunity to learn about natural gas market fundamentals and the structure of the natural gas physical and financial market.  The ideal candidate will be a self-starter who has the ability to work under pressure in an independent manner.  The candidate must have a strong programming, mathematical and statistical background with an interest to learn about a career in the commodity trading industry. This is an ideal opportunity to learn about the commodity markets and more specifically the data impacts that go into the analysis that drives trading decisions.

Daily/Weekly Responsibilities:

  • Develop and increase knowledge of the natural gas market
  • Design and develop visualizations to analyze fundamental and market data
  • Perform natural gas market research and analysis directly supporting trading activities
  • Improve existing visualizations to facilitate efficient viewing of data analytics
  • Analyze large data sets and build statistical models to identify and forecast patterns
  • Partner with traders and analysts to improve trading decisions and research process
  • Identify market pricing trends and discontinuity
  • Participate in regular meetings throughout the week with traders and analysts

Example Projects:

The natural gas market has a number of factors which directly affect the supply and demand balance. These all fluctuate on a daily basis and can result in price changes across the futures curve. Using our fundamental and price data warehouse, build visualization tools to process data and view relationships in supply and demand data.  Interact with traders to determine which relationships have significant market impacts.

Weather is a large driver of price fluctuations in the natural gas market.  It can have an effect on both supply and demand components.  The historical data sets associated with weather are also very large.  Analyze historical weather data and their relationships to natural gas fundamentals across time and regions.  Build visualization tools to view those relationships.

One key feature in the natural gas market is the existence of seasonality in the term structure of the futures curve.  As a result, many seasonal relationships occur in trading patterns.  Analyze historical relationships between storage and market pricing to find correlations in market activity.

Electricity markets are becoming an important driver of demand for natural gas markets. Forecasting electricity demand from natural gas is becoming increasingly challenging with the proliferation of renewable generation sources (wind, solar) in combination with traditional weather volatility. Additionally, fuel substitution potential exists between natural gas and coal at different price levels in various regions. Using proprietary information explore various forecasting techniques to improve electricity demand forecasting.

Proficient in translating mathematical models into code (Python)

Why work for Scotiabank?

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. We are powered by our 97,000 high-performing teammates who make a real difference across the globe as a leading provider of advice, products, digital experiences, and financial services.
This is a place where you’ll get to learn and develop your skills, while being recognized for your hard work. At Scotiabank, we’re passionate about bringing our whole selves to work, allowing us to create inclusive work environments for everyone to enjoy.

Who we are:

Global Banking & Markets provides a full range of investment banking, credit and risk management products and services relevant to the financing and strategic development needs of our clients. Our products include debt and equity financing, mergers & acquisitions, corporate banking, institutional equity sales, trading and research, fixed income products, derivatives, energy, foreign exchange and precious & metals.  We also cross-sell the full range of wholesale products and services offered by the Scotiabank Group.


What’s in it for you?

Modern stock trading is increasingly a technology problem, as firms compete to build the fastest and smartest trading algorithms and systems. Scotiabank's Electronic Execution Services group develops customized algorithmic trading and smart order routing strategies with execute billions of dollars of equity trades each month. We work directly with the equity trading groups to give them the tools needed to compete in an evolving marketplace.
Students are key members of our team. During your term, you will develop, manage, and run systems which are integral to our business, while also gaining a unique view into the workings of trading at one of Canada's largest investment banks. This internship is a great opportunity for anyone looking to launch their career in the FinTech space! Many of the full-time team members started in this position.


Is this role right for you? In this role, you will:

•    Develop trading applications and algorithmic trading tools leveraging new technologies including AI and Deep Learning
•    Assist traders in day to day desk functions
•    Work on full-stack projects for a variety of internal trading desks
•    Create automated reports on trading activity for clients and internal use
•    Design and manage databases containing market data and trade information


Do you have the skills and requirements that will enable you to succeed in this role? – We’d love to work with you if:

•    You are currently enrolled in post-secondary education.
•    You love to learn and envision yourself working for an international organization that heavily invests in your future.
•    You enjoy being involved in extracurricular activities such as conferences, clubs, and competitions/hackathons.
•     You have strong programming and analytical skills with prior experience in one or more of Python, JavaScript, Java, SQL, MongoDB, Angular, HTML/CSS and C# with special emphasis on Python and JavaScript.
•    You have the ability to manage priorities effectively in a fast-paced environment.
•    You have knowledge of or a passion for the financial markets.
•    You have a high level of attention to detail and high professional standards.
•    You have a high level of energy and a keen desire to learn new concepts.


How do I apply?

Please complete all four steps below:
1.    Complete your PLUM Profile here and save as a screenshot.
2.    Complete a short one-way video interview here .
3.    Complete a Codility Assessment here .
4.    Apply to the role and when the application asks for your resume, instead upload the screenshot of your PLUM Profile.

*To be considered for student opportunities at Scotiabank, Tangerine, and MD Financial you must complete all steps above.

Location(s):  Canada : Ontario : Toronto

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.

At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require technical assistance, please click here . Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

jobDescription:
Hi, we’re ecobee. ecobee introduced the world’s first smart Wi-Fi thermostat to help millions of consumers save money, conserve energy, and bring home automation into their lives. That was just the beginning. We continue our pursuit to create technology that brings peace of mind into the home and allows people to focus on the moments that matter most. We take pride in making a meaningful difference to the environment, all while being part of the exciting, connected home revolution.

In 2021, ecobee became a subsidiary of Generac Power Systems. Generac introduced the first affordable backup generator and later created the category of automatic home standby generator. The company is committed to sustainable, cleaner energy products poised to revolutionize the 21st century electrical grid. Together, we take pride in making a meaningful difference to the environment, all while being part of the exciting, connected home revolution.

For more on ecobee: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RR4rKtkf1SY

The Role:

We are looking for an Backend Engineer Intern to join our team for the 2025-2026 PEY work term! This will provide an amazing opportunity to contribute to ecobee’s impact and learn from some strong Engineering Talent.

Our Backend team is packed with experienced developers who are amazing, and we guarantee that you will grow from working directly with them. We use leading edge technologies to innovate highly concurrent, Java-based server applications that directly impact ecobee’s success. You may work on deploying applications within ecobee's infrastructure as well as AWS and Google Cloud Platform. We encourage the freedom to investigate and evaluate new technologies to solve complex problems. As a result, your input will have a significant and direct impact on our company and objectives.

How You’ll Make an Impact:

  • Get hands-on with development of production features along with the rest of your team.
  • Participate in planning, scoping, and creating specification for these production features.
  • Learn about performance testing, unit testing, and debugging of critical high-volume systems.
  • Work with best of breed backend technologies and techniques.
  • Be mentored by senior software developers.

We’re up to incredible things. Come and be part of them.

What can you expect as an ecobee student?

  • The chance to meet and work with co-ops across all teams at ecobee
  • The opportunity to work in a fresh, dynamic, and ever-growing industry that is the SmartHome and IoT space
  • The visibility into a company that has an interesting mix of hardware and software consumer-facing businesses
  • Access to our headquarters, located near at the waterfront in Downtown Toronto, overlooking the lake (with complimentary pizza lunches every Thursday!)
  • The ability to make an environmental impact, both in your day job and outside the 9-5 with programs like ecobee acts!
  • Opportunities to learn and grow with our in-house learning enablement team, #ThinkLab
  • Small collaborative teams where you can impact both product and culture
  • Q&A sessions with senior leaders at ecobee
  • Weekly virtual game hangouts hosted by previous co-ops who’ve transitioned to full-time roles
  • Quarterly hack-a-thons, where you get a chance to work on whatever project you want!

ecobee believes all people have equal value and we are committed to providing a safe space for everyone . We welcome all applicants with diverse races, genders, ages, religions, identities, experiences, etc. and we will provide accommodation to all applicants throughout our hiring process.

jobDescription:
Are you interested in being a part of a company that has a positive social impact? Do you want to join a growing team with a modern engineering culture?

At BiblioCommons, we build SaaS solutions for public libraries directly impacting the lives of millions and fostering learning, literacy and culture within the digital world. We are constantly improving our products through user research, client interaction, and the input of our creative staff. Join a team of passionate professionals making public libraries accessible, delightful, and engaging.

A lot of companies tout 'social impact', here at BiblioCommons we serve over 8 million diverse users each month by partnering with close to 200 public libraries in Canada, the US and New Zealand. Libraries are more than just book stacks-they are public spaces that foster learning, connection, and community and BiblioCommons is bringing that community online with clever software that powers the world's largest libraries.

Engineering @ BiblioCommons

BiblioCommons offers an opportunity to work in an environment that combines the challenges and complexity of a large-scale, data-intensive application with the creativity and fun of a sophisticated consumer web offering, central to the daily web interactions of millions of users.

We’re a highly collaborative team that applies innovative solutions to challenging problems. We believe strongly in automation, and we invest heavily into it to make that possible. We’re also committed to doing things right and always looking for ways to do them better.

We are looking for a Junior Full Stack Engineer for a 16 month internship to maintain and build complex, elegant and high-performant web interfaces that will help discover more physical and digital content for millions of users as part of our Core UI team.

You will enjoy and be successful in this role if you are:

  • Great at debugging and not afraid to step out of your comfort zone.

  • Accountable and take ownership of your work.

  • Supportive and enjoys working as part of a team.

  • Passionate to self-improve, grow and tackle new challenges.

  • Reliable and giving your best effort all the time.

  • Never content with the status quo. You are always looking to automate, improve processes, and follow best practices.

How you will make an impact:

  • Enhance and maintain our platform applications that serve millions of users.

  • Debug and perform root cause analysis on integration issues.

  • Write clean, robust, and performant code.

  • Maintain quality as a priority by writing tests.

  • Improve developer productivity by refactoring key areas of the Core UI codebase.

  • Willingness to work with multiple frameworks and programming languages.

  • Communicate effectively to flag challenges or blockers to deliver on time.

What will you bring to the team:

  • Passionate and motivated to learn new technologies.

  • Knowledge of Javascript, HTML5 and CSS3.

  • Interested in building highly responsive consumer web application interfaces at scale.

  • Previous programming experience or any other object-oriented language.

  • Basic computer networking knowledge (Connectivity issues, LANs, firewalls, etc.)

jobDescription:
Environment and Climate Change Canada is looking for students to join our Data Management System (DMS) development team in the role of Component Developer or Web Developer.

As a DMS Developer, you will have the opportunity to contribute to all aspects of the development process and work on complex scientific weather applications. While many organizations assign students to highly restricted roles, we expect students to grow into a role in which they participate fully in the development process as a part of a larger team. Students will gain experience in a large variety of areas, including design, coding, testing, performance analysis, debugging, system installation/configuration, code reviews, and documentation.

Over the course of their placement, our students are expected to participate in all developer roles, as well as join in reviews of their own and other projects. Students should be able to work effectively in teams and independently. To contribute effectively to our dynamic, team-based approach to software development, strong communication skills are necessary and are a key factor to success. This position is most suitable for students who are seeking to gain real-world software development experience and make a meaningful impact on the lives of millions of Canadians.

About the DMS: The Data Management System (DMS) is a mature data management project designed to modernize IT systems supporting the Meteorological Service of Canada. DMS is a high-performance computing platform that acquires, scientifically processes, quality assesses, archives, and provides access mechanisms to extremely large volumes of meteorological data collected from thousands of stations across the country in a 24/7 mission critical environment. Clients of the DMS include meteorologists, climate researchers, forest fire prevention services, the Canadian Coast Guard and the aviation industry – not to mention the Canadian public.

Data Management System - Component Development

DMS is built on a multi-node cluster running Ubuntu. It incorporates industry leading technology, such as databases, search engines, queueing systems and managers. Most programs are written using Java, though knowledge of C++, SQL and other scripting languages is always welcome. New technologies and ideas are always being incorporated where applicable, and contributions from past students have gone on to become a large part of a system which underlies climate-related activity across Canada.

Data Management System - Web Development

Web application developers on the DMS team are tasked with building a suite of applications to create a user-friendly bridge for our clients to interact with our weather data. Students will be working with the Angular framework and Redux-like libraries to build complex features for these applications. Development emphasizes scalable architecture, reactive design and reusable solutions.

Applicants may specify which of the development streams they prefer, but developers may be expected to work in either development stream if circumstances arise.

Preferred Disciplines:

  • Computer Engineering
  • Computer Science
  • Engineering Science (Electrical and Computer)

Skills and experience required:

  • Experience in object-oriented programming (Java, C++, JavaScipt)
  • Experience in a UNIX / Linux environment
  • Experience working in a team environment
  • Ability to analyze, evaluate, and troubleshoot
  • Ability to communicate effectively
  • Knowledge of software development life cycle methodologies
  • Knowledge of object oriented-design and UML

Assets:

  • Experience with Web technologies (JavaScript, PHP, HTML, CSS)
  • Experience with Web frameworks is preferred (Angular, React, Vue)
  • Experience with GIT and package managers (npm, Maven)
  • Knowledge of relational databases and SQL
  • Knowledge of Agile software methodologies, including scrum

Further Information

will be given to Canadian citizens and permanent residents in accordance with the Public Service Employment Act (S.C. 2003, c. 22, ss. 12, 13). If selected for an interview, Canadian citizens must provide proof of citizenship and non-Canadian citizens must provide proof of permanent residence. Students must also provide proof of address.

Positions are available for 12 to 16-month work terms from May 2025 to September 2026 for students that have completed their 3rd year of a Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Engineering Science (Electrical and Computer) degree. Please indicate on your cover letter your work term preference.

Students must be prepared for technical and behavioral interviews .

Students to whom an offer is made will be required to pass a check for Enhanced Security Clearance.

We provide a flexible/hybrid work environment combining in-office collaboration and remote working.

ECCC Toronto Office: 4905 Dufferin St, North York, ON M3H 5T4

About Environment and Climate Change Canada

At Environment and Climate Change Canada, our business is protecting the environment, conserving the country's natural heritage, and providing weather and meteorological information to keep Canadians informed and safe.

Environment and Climate Change Canada is building on its accomplishments with the environment through credible science, effective regulations and legislation, successful partnerships, and high-quality service delivery to Canadians.

We support sound environmental decisions. We work to repair the damage of the past, collect and pass on knowledge, and develop, implement and enforce policies to prevent future issues. We also work to ensure that Canadians have a safe, clean, and sustainable environment today, tomorrow, and well into the future.

Our workforce is made up of knowledgeable and dedicated employees from diverse backgrounds that are proud of the contribution they make to the environment. We have over 7000 employees from a broad range of fields including biology, chemistry, meteorology, climatology, engineering, commerce, communications, engineering, law enforcement, environmental sciences, hydrology, informatics, law, library science, policy, and more.

Environment and Climate Change Canada’s mandate is to:

Preserve and enhance the quality of the natural environment, including water, air, soil, flora, and fauna; Conserve Canada's renewable resources; Conserve and protect Canada's water resources; Forecast daily weather conditions and warnings, and provide detailed meteorological information to all of Canada; Enforce rules relating to boundary waters; and Coordinate environmental policies and programs for the federal government.

Please visit our website : [ https://www.canada.ca/en/environment-climate-change.html ]
Download the WeatherCAN app at the Google play store or Apple store.

jobDescription:
About Arcadis

Arcadis is the world's leading company delivering sustainable design, engineering, and consultancy solutions for natural and built assets. We are more than 36,000 people, in over 70 countries, dedicated to improving quality of life. Everyone has an important role to play. With the power of many curious minds, together we can solve the world’s most complex challenges and deliver more impact together.

Role Description:

Our Intelligence Group out of our Toronto office is recruiting for the next PEY work term. This student position is open to University of Toronto students who have completed at least 3 years of their program. This student will work on Intelligent Systems projects. Candidates will be part of projects related to the application of technology in the transportation industry, which may include consulting, design, and deployment of software solutions.

Join us if you are interested in working with Canadian, US and international (Europe, Asia and South Africa) clients. Join us if you’re interested in designing and building Smart Cities through the application of technology to create smart infrastructure. Join us if you’re interested in a chance to work with various Canadian provincial agencies, US Department of Transportation agencies, the Bahamas Bridge Authority, and many more throughout the globe. Join us if you’re interested in a mix of small, short term projects, as well as large, complex P3 projects.

Role Accountabilities:

  • Develop functional requirements/specifications and procurement process documents
  • Evaluate vendor proposals and design documentation
  • Document and test software systems and GUIs
  • Document and verify field conditions
  • Prepare schedules and cost estimates
  • Field inspections and acceptance testing, including advance review of proposed test procedures
  • Support business development and proposal initiatives
  • Research technology solutions for Smart Cities, communication systems,
  • intelligent roadway or transit systems, including technology strategic plans development
  • Potential travel to client sites (if applicable)

Qualifications & Experience:

  • Candidates must be enrolled in Engineering program – preference for individuals looking for careers in systems and technology
  • Candidates must have demonstrable above average oral and written communications skills
  • Able to work effectively independently and on a team
  • AutoCAD and MS Visio are useful skills, but not a requirement
  • Valid Ontario Driver's license
  • Preferred candidates would have interest in a career in application of technology within the communications and transportation industry

Why Arcadis?

We can only achieve our goals when everyone is empowered to be their best. We believe everyone's contribution matters. It’s why we are pioneering a skills-based approach, where you can harness your unique experience and expertise to carve your career path and maximize the impact we can make together.

You’ll do meaningful work, and no matter what role, you’ll be helping to deliver sustainable solutions for a more prosperous planet. Make your mark, on your career, your colleagues, your clients, your life and the world around you.

Together, we can create a lasting legacy.

Additional information

As part of Arcadis' selection process, candidates may be requested to consent to background checks relevant to the role under consideration for, prior to receiving a job offer (as applicable under state law). These could include work references, education and credential confirmation, employment verification and driver’s license record.

We thank all applicants for their interest. However, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Arcadis is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability.

Join Arcadis. Create a legacy.

jobDescription:
Untether AI is a rapidly growing Toronto startup building a next generation hardware AI accelerator for neural net inference. We're designing integrated circuits that will run neural nets orders of magnitude faster, while using less power. This class of chips will be the standard platform for running image recognition, speech synthesis, text-to-speech, and many other applications in data centers, mobile phones, and self-driving cars within the next 5 years.

With our second generation speedAI silicon up and running in the lab, our hardware team is focused on a few primary areas:

  • Bringing speedAI to market:
    • Chip, board, and system validation (hands on lab work, scripting, etc.)
    • Firmware development and productization (Low level C++ coding)
  • Developing the next generation:
    • RTL Design (SystemVerilog, etc.)
    • Verification (SystemVerilog, UVM Simulations, FPV, etc)
    • Custom Digital and Mixed Signal Circuit Design
    • Automating our Work through CAD Tooling and Infrastructure Development

We are looking for self motivated and innately curious candidates. You can expect to be put in charge of an important project that will challenge you to learn and you will be provided with mentoring and guidance from veteran hardware engineers. Because we're building new systems from the ground up, you'll get to work on new unsolved problems.

We encourage interdisciplinarity and learning, so if you have experience in hardware or software, come talk to us. But don't worry if you think your experience is too narrowly focused, we've got great projects for people with a wide range of interests and specializations.

Join our Circuit Board and Systems team and come learn about our hardware projects. You will work in a team with other hardware and software designers to deliver on Untether product development. In general, expect to work in a loose SCRUM like environment (weekly/biweekly work sprint with short-term deliverables) mixed with longer term self-guided project deliverables.

Some examples of tasks:

  • Some examples of tasks:Schematic entry and design of circuit boards
  • Perform schematic and layout design reviews
  • Verify circuit boards using lab instruments, software scripts and tools
  • Validate and test firmware in the lab
  • Debug and root cause circuit and system issues
  • Support hardware and software engineering groups in product testing

We don't have strict skill requirements, but of course prior experience in the tools and skills we use is a plus:
- Schematic design and capture
- Tools and programming languages we use: Python, C, C++, shell scripts
- Use of lab instruments such as oscilloscope, multimeter, logic analyzer, power supply, soldering station
- Topics and skills we are interested in include: pcb design, test tools and instrumentation, artificial intelligence, neural net training and inference

jobDescription:
The Power of Dreams is alive and well at Honda of Canada Mfg. (HCM). Located in Alliston, Ontario on 750 acres and employing more than 4,500 Associates, HCM is a 45-minute drive north of Toronto and 25 minutes south of Barrie. HCM began production in 1986 leading the way as the first Japanese automobile manufacturer to establish a production facility in Canada. Today, HCM is one of Honda's premier manufacturing facilities in the world producing the Honda Civic and CRV vehicles, including hybrid production. HCM is excited for its new chapter and journey towards electrification, including the highly anticipated EV and battery production plants that are expected in the coming years!

HCM has an exciting opportunity as a Product Engineering Intern for a 16-month work term beginning May 2025 through August 2026. Successful candidates will become a team member in HCM’s Product Engineering (PE) department and will be exposed to the latest technology in a highly automated manufacturing facility.

Not sure what to expect while working as a Product Engineering Intern? The Product Engineering department is responsible for new model design confirmations (new technology and past problem review), product testing, and generating design changes to support ease of manufacturing. As the PE Intern, you will be supporting our various commodities, including Denso (Electrical) Group, Interior/Exterior Group, Chassis Group, and Complex Quality. You will have the opportunity to support New Model Vehicle Testing Setup, problem investigation, squeak/rattle/wind/vibration testing, and containment activities. Hear from our Interns by clicking this link: https://linktr.ee/HCMRecruitment

First time working in a professional work environment? Don't worry! All our Engineering Interns are assigned and will work alongside an experienced mentor in your department. You will also receive training and mentorship from the Intern you are replacing – a wonderful way to learn and set an example for the students that follow in your footsteps!

Following your internship, you will have a final report and presentation in order to be considered for a permanent (yes, permanent) position within our Engineering Development Program (EDP). What better way to return to school than knowing that you have a permanent position waiting for you following graduation?

Responsibilities:

  • Supporting engineering and project management activities with team members on small and large New Model Prototype development.
  • Support Vehicle Test Setup & data collection utilizing equipment and tools such as Digital Multimeters, Oscilloscopes, Collaborative Robot, Thermal Chambers etc.
  • Support investigations and implement countermeasures for Mass Production/New Model concerns surrounding squeaks & rattles, durability, corrosion, and noise/vibration.
  • Support Critical Control Point verification on vehicle development and manufacturing.
  • Supporting Production/Assembly Line when required

Requirements:

  • Must be within eight months of graduation at the completion of the internship term (currently in year three of a four-year degree, or year four of a five-year degree).
  • Must demonstrate self-motivation and initiative to learn, adapt, and execute projects
  • Must be willing to work hands on – don’t worry, we will provide the training! All skill levels are welcome, you just need to show the willingness!
  • Must have excellent time management and communication
  • Must be willing to work overtime (and a lot of it!)
    • Many roles will require weekend work, including holidays and our shutdowns (1 week in July, 1 week in December). We provide alternate days off throughout the week to compensate for this. Oh, and did we mention overtime is paid?
  • Must be willing to work on the production line (training provided)
    • We will have you work on the production line at the onset of your internship as part of your training. This ensures you are always trained to jump in and help, develop an appreciation for the manufacturing line, and help build a relationship with your customers (production associates).
  • Valid Full G Class Driver’s license with no restrictions is required
    • I’m sorry, there are no exceptions to this
  • Must be willing to work 2nd shift
    • You will occasionally be required to support our 2nd shift (4:30pm-1:00am). This will be for 1 week at a time (subject to change). It may not sound the most appealing, but we promise you learn a lot on 2nd shift!

Preferred Experience:

  • Microsoft Office Suite (brush up on your Excel skills!)
  • Demonstrated experience with CAD software’s for electrical or mechanical design, interpretation, and/or analysis (e.g. Catia, Solidworks, AutoCAD, etc.)
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills (including presentation skills) in order to communicate complex problems, schedule amongst team members, and/or coordinate with suppliers and vendors
    • We do a lot of presentations – you will be an expert by the end of this internship!
  • Demonstrated ability to work hands on with basic hand tools and measurement equipment including wrenches, screwdrivers, Digital Multimeters, Soldering iron, air tools…. etc.
    • Anything counts here! No experience? That’s okay! A pro at building Ikea furniture? Great! Show us you are willing to learn!
  • Large team project work or technical projects demonstrating ability to succeed in a team environment
  • Project management experience
    • Lean into your school or extra-curricular projects! We will teach you our Engineering Flow (E-Flow) including developing the project scope, schedule creation, status tracking, and coordinating and supervising contractors. You just need to show us you have the foundation to do so!
  • Working knowledge of vehicle mechanics, dynamics, and testing
    • Calling all car people! You will get to work very hands on with our vehicles through testing and analysis. If you love cars, this is the job for you!
  • Ability to work in an open concept environment and be extremely flexible
    • No days are the same at HCM. What makes a successful associate is someone who can pivot and adjust to our ever-changing environment. You may be asked to do something that is completely new to you – embrace it, welcome it, and take it as an opportunity to grow! Future you will thank you.

Additional Information:

HCM offers many activities for associates to get involved in! We have an on-site recreation center (free of charge) that offers a fully equipped fitness center, full size indoor ice rink, and outdoor and indoor courts. We have a (highly loved) hockey, baseball, and soccer league; we offer exercise classes, cross fit, and yoga; drop-in basketball and pickle ball. HCM hosts a spectacular annual Holiday Party and associates always love our Summer BBQ! HCM is also very involved in our community – we annually participate in the Honda Waterfront Run and the Barrie Dragon Boat Festival.

Become even more involved and join your fellow Intern community! They are always getting together for bowling, pizza nights, games and more!

Thought that was a lot? HCM also has five Business Resource Groups (BRG) you can get involved with (think extra-curricular club, but better):

  • Honda Young Professionals: “Enhance experiences and develop careers of Honda’s Young Professional by building community, improving engagement, and providing career resources and guidance.”
  • Women Powering Honda: “Empowering Women at Honda through impactful engagement, and enhancement opportunities in a safe and supportive work environment.”
  • BIPOC of Honda: “Work to foster professional growth and development and to advocate for pathways for these developmental opportunities for BIPOC individuals at HCM.”
  • EARTH (Environmental Actions Rewarding to Honda): “Cultivate Honda associate opportunities for environmental engagement at the facility and in the community.”

Are you someone that’s into cars (I’d sure hope so)? HCM also has a Velocity Motorsports Club (VMC) ! Join a talented group of HCM associates as they prepare for another exciting race season! Not so much into racing but your personal car needs some work? Students are also eligible to use the fully equipped on-site vehicle service center.

At HCM, Respect for the Individual is a fundamental belief. We recognize, respect and value individual differences in one another. We are committed to creating equal opportunity for all associates to grow in a diverse and inclusive work environment while driving continuous improvement with Passion, delivering Joy and Value to our Customers.

HCM is committed to providing accommodation in its recruitment processes to applicants with disabilities, upon request. The accommodation provided will consider the applicant’s

accessibility needs. If you require accommodation at any time during the recruitment process or to successfully submit an application, please include that information in your application.

jobDescription:
Software / Computer Engineer Co-op

Employer: Royal Canadian Mounted Police

Branch Name: Technical Investigative Services (TIS) - REVR Term: 4-12 months

Program: Software Engineering or Computer Engineering (2)

Note: The successful applicant must be a Canadian Citizen and will be required to be security cleared at the Top-Secret level prior to being hired. The clearance process is comprised of a full filed investigation dating back 10 years and includes criminal background checks and the interviews of friends, neighbors, employers, and the applicant himself/herself. Some people have done things during their life that they are not proud of or have used poor judgement. We recognize that learning from one’s mistakes is an important part of life. The successful candidates are those who embody the RCMP’s core values of integrity, honesty, professionalism, compassion, accountability and respect.

Work Environment

Participate in multi-disciplinary teams composed of engineers, technologists, programmers, and technical investigators in the research, design, development, evaluation and application of  highly specialized technical tools to aid in on-going and future investigations.

All work is done in our Ottawa office with no possibility of remote work.

Duties

Duties may include:

  • Software research and development in the area of internet communications technologies
  • Reverse engineering software code and communications protocols
  • Developing software for PC systems (Linux, OS X, Windows, )
  • Developing software for Mobile systems (Android, iOS, )
  • Developing software in C/C++/python.
  • Working with engineers and technologists to research, develop and/or enhance devices which are used in police
  • Evaluation/field testing of custom technical solutions
  • Write reports, memoranda, user manuals and other documentation for the above-mentioned development tools

Skills

Preference will be given to the student having knowledge of:

  • Software Development experience, specifically in python
  • In-depth Linux/MacOS knowledge
  • Experience in Mobile development, specifically the use of NDKs
  • Embedded systems knowledge


Salary

The successful candidate will be hired via a Personal Services Contract (PSC), rate of pay for students will range from $16.99/hr to $25.52/ hr. The pay rate for the student will be decided by the Manager.

jobDescription:
By submitting your resume, you’re expressing interest in one of our 2025 Hardware Engineering Internships . We’ll review resumes on an ongoing basis, and a recruiter may reach out if your experience fits one of our many internship opportunities.

NVIDIA pioneered accelerated computing to tackle challenges no one else can solve. Our work in AI and digital twins is transforming the world's largest industries and profoundly impacting society — from gaming to robotics, self-driving cars to life-saving healthcare, climate change to virtual worlds where we can all connect and create.

Our internships offer an excellent opportunity to expand your career and get hands on with one of our industry leading Hardware teams. We’re seeking strategic, ambitious, hard-working, and creative individuals who are passionate about helping us tackle challenges no one else can solve. Throughout the internship, students will work on projects that have a measurable impact on our business.

The hourly rate for our interns is 18 USD - 71 USD. Our internship hourly rates are a standard pay determined based on the position and your location, year in school, degree, and experience.

You will also be eligible for Intern benefits . NVIDIA accepts applications on an ongoing basis.

Potential Internships in this field include:

System Validation

  • These teams are responsible for system validation and post-production activities for datacenter server products, such as HGX baseboards, DGX Servers or DGX Workstations. You will need to maintain a close relationship with all members of the Architecture, Hardware and Software Design teams to ensure rigorous testing and debugging of all new features and changes made during product development.

Hardware Design

  • With strong backgrounds in electrical engineering and a curiosity about hardware product design, Hardware Design Interns work with a close-knit, multi-disciplinary team, enjoying hands-on work, with cutting-edge visual computing platforms. Primary responsibilities may include Hardware Testing, Debugging, and Validation of new products to ensure they meet performance, functional, and quality objectives.

Mechanical Engineering

  • This team helps craft and test new NVIDIA products. You will be part of a diverse, multi-functional team researching and developing new concepts and materials for our next generation of products. You must demonstrate excellent interpersonal skills and a strong academic background in Mechanical Engineering.

Silicon Solutions

  • As a part of the Silicon Solutions Engineering Team, you will be responsible for productizing NVIDIA’s chips into groundbreaking consumer, professional, server, mobile, and automotive solutions.

Qualifications:

Currently pursuing a Bachelor's, Master's, or PhD degree within Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or a related field

Depending on the internship role, prior experience or knowledge
requirements could include the following programming skills and technologies:
-Verilog, SystemVerilog, VHDL, Perl, TCL, Board-Level Design, Datacenter Systems, Linux, CAD Software (i.e. Solidworks, ProE, Creo, Catia, Unigraphics, etc.), Python, MATLAB, MOSFETs

jobDescription:
About Us: The Ministry of Transportation's Compliance Monitoring and Performance Reporting Office is dedicated to ensuring the quality and compliance of driver education training schools. Our team conducts thorough audit reviews, data analysis, and policy reviews to maintain high standards in driver education. We are seeking a motivated co- op student to join our team and contribute to our mission of enhancing road safety and driver training quality.

Duties and Responsibilities:

As a co-op student in our office, you will gain hands-on experience in various aspects of audit and oversight, including but not limited to:

  1. Data Collection and Analysis: Gather and analyze data from various sources to support audit and oversight activities.
  2. PowerBI Reports and Dashboards: Develop interactive reports and dashboards using PowerBI to visualize data and provide insights.
  3. IT System Blitzes: Conduct targeted reviews of IT systems to identify and rectify data integrity issues.
  4. Documentation Support: Assist in documenting processes, procedures, and findings from audits and reviews.
  5. Process Maps and SOPs: Create detailed process maps and Standard Operating Procedures to streamline operations.
  6. Process Improvement Initiatives: Analyze current processes to identify potential gaps, challenges, and pain points. Recommend and implement process improvement initiatives to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.
  7. Financial Document Management: Develop, maintain, evaluate, and interpret financial documents to support projects and initiatives, recommend courses of action, and measure the effectiveness of branch, divisional, or ministry-wide programs and services.
  8. Project Leadership: Lead small-scope, field-related projects that further initiatives, support staff, or communicate messages, and manage and coordinate the work using best practices.
  9. Research and Analysis: Collect information and gather research from media, Internet, relevant literature, policies, and/or legislation. Interpret the results using quantitative and qualitative analysis, identify the most relevant and critical subject matter that supports ministry-wide business objectives and summarize the findings in high-quality reports.
  10. Data System Utilization: Utilize corporate, ministry, and divisional systems to access information and analyze data, generate reports, complete tasks, and ensure the accuracy, currency, and availability of system data.
  11. Committee and Project Team Participation: Participate in a variety of internal and external committees and project teams, developing and maintaining strong working relationships with team members, colleagues, and service providers.
  12. Additional Projects and Assignments: Undertake additional projects and assignments as required.

jobTitle: GBM - Trade Floor Technology Consultant - Summer 2025
jobDescription:
Requisition ID: 206609
Employee Referral Program – Potential Reward:

We are committed to investing in our employees and helping you continue your career at Scotiabank.

GBM - Trade Floor Technology Consultant - Summer 2025 - 12 or 16 Months

Term: 12 or 16 months

Start date: May 2025

Location: Toronto, Ontario, Canada

Application Deadline: 9/30/24

There's no better way to find your dream job than to do a co-op or internship with Scotiabank! During your work term, you’ll have the opportunity to be part of a winning team, build your network, and discover what you love – all while getting paid to do it! There’s a place for every type of student at Scotiabank and all that we ask for is that you have passion and strong AOO (Attitude, Ownership and Opportunity).

Who we are:

Global Banking & Markets (GBM) provides a full range of investment banking, credit and risk management products and services relevant to the financing and strategic development needs of our clients. Our products include debt and equity financing, mergers & acquisitions, corporate banking, institutional equity sales, trading and research, fixed income products, derivatives, energy, foreign exchange, and precious & metals. We also cross-sell the full range of wholesale products and services offered by the Scotiabank Group.

Is this role right for you? In this role, you will:


As a Trade Floor Technology Consultant, you will provide responsive technical consulting and support for solving computer and related technology issues on Scotiabank’s trade floor. As part of the Global Banking & Markets, Trade Floor Support & Automation team, you will:



    • Analyze issues and then resolve, escalate, or redirect such issues to the appropriate channels.

    • Implement leading-edge trading technologies used on the trade floor such as Bloomberg to constantly improve trade floor capabilities.

    • Be responsible for handling and configuring a wide variety of mobile devices, such as laptops, iPhones, and tablets.

    • Work on a variety of projects including new technology initiatives, data analysis, and analytics.

    • May also take on programming tasks such as development of in-house web-based tools for optimization of trade floor processes.



What’s in it for you?

This position offers individuals an excellent opportunity for learning and personal development, especially to those who wish to gain exposure to capital markets and related fields.



    • You’ll be part of a diverse, collaborative, innovative, and high-performing team.

    • In-depth training to prepare you for the role, as well as ongoing coaching and feedback to help you succeed!

    • Exclusive student events such as Scotia Student Day, Lunch & Learns, leadership panels, and much more!

    • Bank-wide orientation to learn more about Scotiabank and gain exposure to senior leadership across the organization.

    • Opportunity to get involved in the Scotiabank Co-op Social Committee and help plan events across Toronto.

    • Work in the heart of the Financial and Entertainment Districts in downtown Toronto.

    • Trade Floor Tours are available, offering a rare insight into modern financial analysis, trading, and sales.

    • On-site cafeteria and free refreshments available.



Do you have the skills and requirements that will enable you to succeed in this role? – We’d love to work with you if:



    • You are currently enrolled in post-secondary education.

    • You love to learn and envision yourself working for an international organization that heavily invests in your future.

    • You enjoy being involved in extracurricular activities such as conferences, clubs, and competitions/hackathons.

    • You have excellent interpersonal and communication skills.

    • You have effective problem solving and analytical skills.

    • You are comfortable troubleshooting computer applications and handling computer hardware.

    • Having knowledge or experience with web or database programming (e.g. HTML, JavaScript, CSS, SQL, C#) will be an additional asset.

    • You have experience in working in the Windows environment (e.g. Windows 10).

    • Having experience with network administration will be useful.

    • Familiarity with the latest computer hardware and electronics and a broad understanding of today’s cellular and wireless technologies are an asset.

    • You have a high level of attention to detail.

    • You have high professional standards.

    • You have a high level of energy and a keen desire to learn new concepts.



How do I apply?

Please complete the three steps below:



    1. Complete your PLUM Profile here and save as a screenshot.

    1. Complete a short one-way video interview here.

    1. Apply to the role and when the application asks for your resume, instead upload the screenshot of your PLUM Profile and the most recent version of your transcript.



*To be considered for student opportunities at Scotiabank, Tangerine, and MD Financial you must complete all steps above.

Location(s):  Canada : Ontario : Toronto

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.

At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. If you require technical assistance, please click here . Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

jobTitle: Electrical Engineering Internship – Automated Test Equipment
jobDescription:
Job Title: Electrical Engineering Internship – Automated Test Equipment

Work Term Length: 12-16 months

The Role (What to Expect):

We seek highly motivated hands-on engineering students for an electrical engineering position on the Manufacturing Test Engineering group as part of the “machine that builds the machine”. The group is focused on creating robust, beautiful, data-centric production testing equipment for Tesla’s power electronic components in vehicle, stationary storage, humanoid robot and charging products.

The ideal candidates take pride in their hands-on work, analytical ability, organizational skills, and attention to detail, and appreciate an environment where superior work is encouraged, noticed, and rewarded.  The candidates look forward to learning an incredible amount on the job, are excited to immerse themselves in the role of electrical engineer, and do not shy away from tremendous levels of responsibility.

Responsibilities (What’ll You’ll Do):

  • Research and specify electrical test equipment such as measurement equipment, power supplies, sensors, I/O devices, and other hardware to meet test requirements
  • Design schematics and layout for industrial electrical control panels which are NFPA79/NEC/UL508A compliant
  • Perform bench testing on electrical components to validate test processes
  • Design custom interface PCBAs for test equipment
  • Debug test equipment and improve throughput and uptime

Requirements (What You’ll Bring):

  • Majoring in Electrical & Computer Engineering, Engineering Science, or Mechatronics
  • Hands-on skills with bench electronics testing tools, instruments, and measurement techniques
  • Versed in AutoCAD Electrical, ePlan, Altium PCB, or similar electrical CAD software
  • Experience designing schematics for machines, PCBAs, and/or wire harnesses
  • Preference for candidates with a portfolio showcasing various professional and personal projects (FSAE, robotic competitions, and similar)

jobDescription:
About Veeva

Veeva Systems is a mission-driven organization and pioneer in industry cloud, helping life sciences companies bring therapies to patients faster. As one of the fastest-growing SaaS companies in history, we surpassed $2B in revenue in our last fiscal year with extensive growth potential ahead.
At the heart of Veeva are our values: Do the Right Thing, Customer Success, Employee Success, and Speed. We're not just any public company – we made history in 2021 by becoming a public benefit corporation (PBC), legally bound to balancing the interests of customers, employees, society, and investors.
Join us in transforming the life sciences industry, committed to making a positive impact on its customers, employees, and communities.

The Role
Join our Engineering Development Program as a front-end, back-end, or full-stack, where you'll work on small teams in a dynamic, agile environment, releasing features every four weeks. Help us design our solutions. Contribute to technical and functional design decisions, troubleshoot and provide technical product support, and be responsible for all aspects of the software development lifecycle.
At the time of application, please attach the most updated version of your academic transcript.
Qualified candidates must be legally authorized to work in Canada. Veeva does not provide sponsorship for employment visa status for this position.
This position requires you to work in the office 4 days/week for the duration of your internship.

Requirements

  • Located near Toronto, Ontario and able to work in the office 4 days/week during your internship
  • Working toward Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or a related technical degree
  • Graduation date is by Summer 2027 or earlier
  • Overall GPA must be 3.3 or higher
  • Proficiency in Java
  • Solid CS fundamentals (data structures, algorithms, and object-oriented design)


Nice to Have

  • Working knowledge of frontend technologies such as JavaScript, HTML, and React
  • Working knowledge of relational databases
  • Relevant internship/project experience is a plus

Learn More

  • Engineer Perspective: 3 Reasons to Consider Veeva
  • Life at Veeva: Generation Veeva

jobDescription:
Monday Girl is looking for a dynamic and passionate Community and Social Media Intern to help grow and engage our community of ambitious women. In this role, you will support the promotion of events, manage our social media presence, and assist with partnerships. You’ll have the opportunity to work closely with our team to create a welcoming, vibrant online space and help bring our brand to life.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Promote and manage meetups using our new templated system
  • Engage with social media comments daily and foster community interaction
  • Assist with partnership account management and communications
  • Post content on social platforms once created

jobDescription:
Untether AI is a rapidly growing Toronto startup building a next generation hardware AI accelerator for neural net inference. We're designing integrated circuits that will run neural nets orders of magnitude faster and with lower power. This class of chips will be the standard platform for running image recognition, speech synthesis, text to speech and many other applications in data centers, mobile phones and self-driving cars within the next 5 years.

We are looking for creative problem solvers who are interested in developing a deep understanding of our technology and applying that knowledge to the creation and maintenance of a high performance compute-kernel library. Interest in computer architecture and register-level debugging / optimization are a plus! You can expect to be contributing to a team effort focused on delivering performant networks servicing real customer and product needs. You would be provided with close mentoring and guidance from senior software engineers. As part of our fast-moving startup, you'll get to contribute to foundational infrastructure development, as well as working on new, unsolved problems.

We encourage interdisciplinarity and learning, so if you have experience spanning hardware and software, come talk with us. But don't worry if you think your experience is too narrowly focussed, we've got great projects for people with a wide range of interests and specializations.

Join our Kernel development team and come learn about our software projects. We'll work together to set the deliverables for your term with us, but in general you can expect to work in Python for framework development and/or in C++ for direct compute kernel development.

Some examples of topics:

  • Compute kernel: Understand, code, optimize and test compute kernels for common machine learning layers (eg convolution, upsample, NMS, etc)
  • Re-usable library components: Define, develop and test reusable library components that build towards the goal of efficient performant compute kernel development.

jobDescription:
YuJa Canada is a premiere software/hardware and AI based Ed-Tech tools and technologies provider located at Toronto, Ontario in Canada and at San Jose, California in United States of America. The company's technology is focused in the areas of application of artificial intelligence in cloud based online education in universities/colleges and corporate training. We use our state-of-the-art proprietary Digital Learning Platform that incorporates audio, video, smart-board and ample amounts of artificial intelligence technologies into products such as automated and real-time software/hardware-based lecture capture, automated remote proctoring, tools to assist persons with disabilities with accessibility needs, interactive polling/quizzing, automated video captioning and adaptive streaming technologies and very large scale digital assets' management software. For more information, visit our product web sites: www.Yuja.com

YuJa Canada is hiring talented Software Developers for our Toronto office to design and implement our latest product suite that includes Multimedia Digital Assets Management System (EVP), Hardware and Software Lecture Capture, Learning and productivity tools for individuals with disabilities (Panorama and EqualGround), Remote Exam Proctoring (Verity), platform for interactive polling/quizzing (Engage), and many other tools for enhancing quality and productivity in Education. YuJa aims to alter the way lectures are delivered in universities and colleges allowing simultaneous delivery of lectures to the in-class and over the internet and OTT (Over The Top) television audiences using our proprietary and patent pending technologies. Lectures are captured and uploaded to the cloud in real-time. Our Digital Learning Platform is used by corporations for training and general team collaboration and also by university Professors and TAs during lectures, tutorials and office hours. jobDescription:
Posterity Group helps governments and utilities understand and reduce energy use and emissions. We provide end-use modeling and consulting services to support demand side management, integrated resource planning, and energy/carbon policy decision-making.

Posterity Group (PG) provides a rewarding and challenging consulting environment. We seek to offer a healthy work environment that is purposeful, motivating and gratifying. Our progressive management policies include a flexible approach to work location and work hours that respects staff time and work/life responsibilities.

We want to hear from talented people with a keen interest or experience in energy efficiency, energy policy, and carbon managements projects to join our team in a full-time Energy Systems Consultant Intern position.  You will work closely with our experienced consultants as a technical resource, and make meaningful contributions to PG’s project work to guide our clients to meet 2030 decarbonization targets. You'll work with colleagues who are experts in their fields and who are keen to collaborate with you.

We prefer candidates with experience (either through academic projects or previous work) conducting research and/or modelling that could:

  • Inform policy decisions in the areas of energy efficiency, distributed energy resources, demand response, and carbon reduction,
  • Support demand side management programs, or
  • Support utility integrated resource planning.

Experience in these areas will be considered assets:

  • Data analysis
  • Energy or scenario modelling
  • Energy or carbon policy
  • Energy efficiency and low-carbon fuels

Job Requirements

To thrive in this role, you should have these skills:

  • Communication: you are a competent writer and can communicate your technical understanding in plain language.
  • Data analysis and visualization: you are comfortable in MS Excel, can analyze data and present results in graphs and tables.
  • Problem-solving: you work hard to solve problems and can develop approaches to respond to open-ended questions.
  • Leadership: you have an open and active curiosity in learning about PG and the industry we serve, and actively seek guidance to improve your performance.
  • Accountability: you take responsibility for your work commitments.

You would also add value to our team if you:

  • Are an advanced user of Excel.
  • Have coding skills (Python, R, etc.)
  • Can speak and write well in French.

Posterity Group is an equal opportunity employer.  We offer a creative work environment, progressive management policies, and rewarding and complex consulting assignments. To help our staff lead balanced and fulfilling work and home lives, we offer a range of benefits including:

  • A flexible approach to work location and work hours that respects staff time and work/life balance
  • Competitive vacation and leave policy, including Fridays off during the summer months

Job Responsibilities

The Energy Systems Consultant Intern will have the following responsibilities, under the guidance of a senior PG staff member:

  • Conduct research and data analysis to inform policy decisions on energy efficiency, innovative technologies, demand response and carbon reduction.
  • Develop inputs and run models to analyze the impact of policies and economic drivers on energy consumption and GHG emissions.
  • Write project reports to summarize findings and provide recommendations to clients.
  • Other tasks depending on experience and interest.

If this position sounds exciting to you, we would love to hear from you. To apply:

  • Write us a 1-page letter showing:
    • How you meet the above criteria, (or if you don’t, why we should consider you anyway)
    • Why you want to work with us, and
    • What kind of projects you would be best suited for based on your interests and previous experience.
  • Attach this to your resume, including employment history and relevant project summary qualifications or courses (2-page limit)

Preferred Disciplines

U of T                 Engineering Science (Energy Systems)

From utensils to cellphones to satellites, our operations simplify daily life and enhance connectivity. Our metals are integral to life-saving medical equipment and the electric vehicles driving the fight against climate change – our work truly matters.

Alphawave Semi builds industry-leading wired connectivity solutions that enable data to travel faster, more reliably, and with higher performance at lower power. jobDescription:
Job Summary

At Left Turn Right Turn (LTRT), our mission (and yours, should you choose to accept it!) is to get people out of cars and onto transit. We work with transit agencies to understand their service and plan, design, and implement improvements to the customer experience and operations. Transit Explorers support a wide range of projects and get full exposure to the glamorous life (or so we tell each other) of a consultant as part of a fun and dynamic team working with Canada's largest and smallest transit agencies.

Projects delivered in the past year include:

  • Undertaking a medium-term master transit plan for a regional transit agency
  • Developing a technology roadmap and organizational plan
  • Undertaking operational and business process reviews of transit scheduling and dispatch
  • Assessing on-demand transit opportunities for low-density geographic areas
  • Analyzing and preparing a capital infrastructure plan including fleet plan

Our DNA

The LTRT team is creative, collaborative, and balanced - it is in our DNA.

Creative: We look for new ideas and methods to inject at the start of each project. This keeps things fresh and relevant for the client, and exciting and interesting for us. We innovate in the work that we do because one can, and one should, always strive to improve.

Collaborative: We communicate effectively, whether in-person, in writing, or by carrier pigeon. We mix working meetings and workshops regularly into our projects to keep us in sync internally as well as with clients. Most importantly, we’ll support each other during crunches so no one bears the load alone.

Balanced: We value a balanced approach to work and life. We’ll crack a joke when the time is right and crack down when it’s not. We’ll follow up that long work week with necessary recovery time off (with some food, drinks, and the occasional board game to accelerate the process!).

Job Responsibilities

Transit Explorers will support and learn through a wide variety of projects, applying their smarts, experience, and creativity at a culture-focused firm. Your responsibilities could include:

  • Researching, reviewing, and summarizing key findings from documents such as Official Plans and Transit Master Plans to assist with report writing.
  • Analyzing operational, financial, horoscope, and other data to derive insights.
  • Evaluating software systems, from the perspective of contract compliance, system accessibility, or the ‘cool-factor’.
  • Writing technical and non-technical reports that bring a (figurative) tear to the reader’s eye.
  • Crafting and designing breath-taking, head-turning PowerPoint presentations and workshop materials.
  • Developing jaw-dropping, project-winning proposals. Researching and documenting cutting-edge industry best practices through the beauty of the interweb, phone, or in-person interviews with vendors and agencies.

Qualifications

  • An interest in public transit issues (bonus points if you have a model railroad collection).
  • A superb eye for detail and accuracy (like, seriously, ok).
  • Excellent writing and communication skills, with a knack for translating technical concepts to a non-technical audience (consulting = smart report writing, it’s true).
  • Experience in analyzing data using Excel.
  • Demonstrated problem-solving, time management, and decision-making skills.
  • Ability to work independently as well as in team environments.
  • Bonus gold stars if you have graphic communication skills (infographics, charts, and graphs), and/knowledge in GIS analysis.
  • Student in good standing at the University of Toronto (Engineering)

Term of Contract

15-month work term: May 2025 – July 2026, our current PEY student is with us until August 1, 2025 so we want to try and make sure you have some crossover. (Exact start and end dates are flexible – we want to make an effort to provide a break between the end of your contract with us and the return to your program in September 2026, so we have built in a month long break. You deserve a vacation!! If you require a small break after school is done in April 2025, we are happy to build in a few days for you before you start your contract with us. Balance is a part of our DNA and rest is important!)

Salary Details

Compensation:  $28.50 / hour

Hours: 37.5 hr / week

Location : Primarily work from home, within the GTHA (Greater Toronto and Hamilton Area). There will be some in-person time at coworking spaces in downtown Toronto.

Application Procedure : Please apply online via U of T Co-op portal and include your cover letter and resume.

jobDescription:
The Opportunity:

Are you a student looking for an exciting opportunity that is full of meaningful, diverse, and ambitious assignments working alongside industry leading professionals? Join Canadian Natural where we strive to provide opportunities based on your abilities, helping you to contribute in a meaningful way and apply your academic experience to challenging and rewarding projects!

As a Civil/Structural Engineering Student for the Oil Sands Major Projects group, your focus will be to support the Engineering team with designing and constructing projects for either the Horizon or Albian Oil Sands sites. Take advantage of the opportunity to be a part of one of the world’s largest Oil Sands operations, work closely with seasoned engineers, and become familiar with the world of design and construction. At Canadian Natural, “developing people” and “creating value” are part of our mission statement.

  • Term length: 8 or 12 months
  • Term start: January or May 2025
  • Job location: Calgary, Alberta – Head Office. Please note, depending on business needs, the work location may change. This would require the successful candidate to work at one of our Oil Sands sites north of Fort McMurray, AB – flights and accommodations would be provided.
  • Shift schedule: Calgary: 5 x 2 – 8 hours (Monday to Friday) or Oil Sands: 4 x 3 – 10 hours (Monday to Thursday)
  • Safety sensitive position: Yes

Key Accountabilities:

  • Work with professional Structural/Civil Engineers and apply engineering principles in the design and construction of oil sands facilities
  • Complete design calculations and drawings
  • Create and analyze structural finite element models
  • Create bill of materials to support cost estimates
  • Write technical reports
  • Inspect construction work on site

What You Bring to The Role:

  • Currently enrolled in a Bachelor's Degree Program in Civil Engineering or within one year of graduation. Specialization in structural is considered an asset
  • Previous engineering experience, Microsoft application, CAD, structural analysis tools (e.g. S-Frame), and proficiency in technical communication are all assets, but not required
  • Possess a valid Class 5 Alberta driver’s license or equivalent out of province license with a reasonably clean driver abstract

What We Offer:

  • Competitive salary
  • Paid time off during Christmas week and summer Fridays in July and August (Calgary)
  • Quality camp facilities with multiple amenities available (Oil Sands)
  • Company Sponsored Fly-In/Fly-Out from Calgary or Edmonton, Alberta (Oil Sands)
  • Bus In/Bus Out to & from Fort McMurray (Oil Sands)
  • Students may be eligible for relocation assistance pursuant to Canadian Natural’s Student Relocation Policy. Students will be responsible for finding their own accommodations during the work term
  • Multiple volunteer opportunities within the community
  • Opportunities to partake in initiatives such as the Intern Social Committee

If you are interested in this exciting student work term opportunity, please include your resume, cover letter and unofficial transcripts as part of your online application.

NVIDIA pioneered accelerated computing to tackle challenges no one else can solve. Our internships offer an excellent opportunity to expand your career and get hands on with one of our industry leading Hardware teams. We’re seeking strategic, ambitious, hard-working, and creative individuals who are passionate about helping us tackle challenges no one else can solve. Throughout the internship, students will work on projects that have a measurable impact on our business.

The hourly rate for our interns is 18 USD - 71 USD. Our internship hourly rates are a standard pay determined based on the position and your location, year in school, degree, and experience.

You will also be eligible for Intern benefits . NVIDIA accepts applications on an ongoing basis.

Potential Internships in this field include:

Development Tools

Cloud

Data Science
