jobTitle: Student, Power System Analyst (OI, RTE, OCRD)
jobDescription:
Independent Electricity System Operator (IESO)

Due to the IESO’s role in the energy sector, please note that a full security check will be conducted.  Job offers will be conditional until you have successfully attained security clearance to work at the IESO.

Why join us?

You've got great skills. And you want to use them in an organization where you know what you do every day matters. We get that.

We also know that ensuring Ontarians have access to affordable and reliable power doesn't happen by accident. So we give you the tools, flexibility and support you need to achieve your goals, and development opportunities to help you grow. You'll thrive in a collaborative, team-based environment that values your unique skills and experiences - and recognizes that when you do better, we become even better too.

Who we are

The Independent Electricity System Operator (IESO) works at the centre of the province's power system, ensuring Ontarians have access to reliable and cost-effective electricity when and where they need it. We operate the province's electricity grid 24/7, design, run and oversee the wholesale electricity markets, and plan and prepare to meet Ontario's electricity needs - now and into the future.

The opportunity
The System Integration department is seeking bright, talented and ambitious Electrical Engineering or Computer Engineering undergraduate and graduate students who are eager to apply their power system engineering skills.


Division/Department:

Markets and Reliability (MR) – System Integration (SI) – Performance, Application and Integration (PAI)

  • Operating Integration (MR.SI.PAI.OI)
  • Reliability Tools Evolution (MR.SI.PAI.RTE)
  • Operation’s Control Room Deployment (MR.SI.PAI.OCRD)

Your work term will be spent in the Markets and Reliability business unit. To learn more about how IESO works on achieving a reliable and efficient operation of the province-wide power system, you can visit our website .

You will be a part of a group responsible for:

The System Integration Division focuses on developing and maintaining suitable models to support Ontario's Electrical Grid and associated Market Systems. You may spend your work term in one of the following groups:

  • (OI) Coordinating Market Registration activities across IESO to support Ontario's Electrical Grid and associated Market Systems. The OI team facilitates the integration of market participants’ new and modified facilities into operations.
  • (RTE) Working on the leading edge of the power sector, collaborating with teams across the IESO to help plan and implement the next generation of toolsets supporting real-time operations – ensuring safe, reliable, and cost effective operation of Ontario’s power grid.
  • (OCRD) Collaborating closely with operations, IT, and other departments within the IESO to ensure the efficient and reliable real-time operation of the IESO-controlled grid (ICG). The OCRD team supports the coordination of NMBs, manages IT outages with Operations, and addresses control room tools issues with IT and external vendors

What you'll do may include:

  • Work with internal stakeholders to ensure they have what they need to operate the IESO-controlled grid (ICG) and IESO-administered market (IAM).
  • Assist Power System Engineer/Analyst/Specialist in supporting the Online and Combined Network model for IESO EMS systems and Market systems.
  • Maintain computing and data management tools, develop scripts and queries using Python, MSSQL.
  • Use business information software for enhanced visualization and process improvement (i.e Tableau).
  • Perform data analysis, validation, mapping, and design.
  • Provide support for applications and analytical studies
  • Test and document changes applied to the power system model and tools.
  • Coordinate control room IT outages.
  • Other work as requested.

This job will provide you with the following professional development:

  • Time spent in the Student Development program will count towards PEng Hours.
  • A maximum of 1 year of Experience can be claimed as supervised work under a licensed PEng holder.
  • Deep understanding of power system operations and planning.
  • Concept of system reliability and power system operating criteria.
  • Development in Tableau for reports and visualizations.
  • Communication skills by working with multiple groups, including the IESO control room.
  • Exposure to control room tools, such as SCADA, MIS, EMS and PI.
  • Exposure to power system analysis tools that provides the capabilities for a complete assessment of system security, including all forms of stability. (i.e. DSA Tools, PSS/E)

What you need to succeed

Discipline(s) Required:

  • Electrical Engineering or Computer Engineering – Undergraduate and Graduate Programs

The following knowledge is essential to perform the job:

  • Understanding of 3-phase circuit theory, power system network calculations, and basic machine theory. This is normally acquired in Electrical or Computer Engineering disciplines.
  • Knowledge of various power system components.
  • Demonstrated understanding and experience with web development and programming languages (i.e. SQL, VBA, Tableau Visualization and Python) is an asset.
  • Knowledge of databases, such as Microsoft Access, Oracle, MS SQL.
  • Knowledge of cloud-based platforms (i.e. GitHub, AWS, MS Azure)
  • Experience in technical writing and documentation; proficiency in Microsoft Word's advanced features.
  • Knowledge of project management.
  • A successful candidate is an effective team player, a creative problem solver, takes initiative, is a strong communicator, and shows a high degree of potential to obtain an excellent grasp of power system operations.

Level: 3rd year

Duration: 16 months (May 2025 to August 2026)

Location: IESO Clarkson - 2635 Lakeshore Road West, Mississauga, ON

Number of Students Required: 3

The Opportunity

May 2025 to August 2026

Are you ready to build the innovative systems that support the progressive needs of the Ontario Teachers’ professionals?!

If so, we are looking for students with business acumen, rigorous technical skill and flashes of creative genius to join our DevOps Automation team. We leverage cutting edge technologies to deliver both software solutions to our investment professionals and tools to enhance our internal development capability. Students in the past have been involved in projects relating to performance and risk measurement, trade order management, portfolio accounting, master data management, business intelligence, and DevOps!

Working in a fast-paced team environment, you will have the opportunity to make meaningful contributions to the IT team’s work. Be part of a group where your input is valued and your solutions are used. Make a difference in the Solution Engineering team!

Who you'll work with

Joining the DevOps Automation team you will work in a project team to deliver automation pipelines. With support from a mentor, you will have the opportunity to engage with colleagues from across the organization; such as project delivery team, and other technical specialists within the development and infrastructure teams.

What you'll do

  • Collaborate and design pipeline jobs to achieve Continuous Integration/Delivery
  • Develop best standards for developing pipelines for DevSecOps
  • Promote the adoption of CI/CD with various customers
  • Implement Infrastructure as Code for provisioning in the cloud
  • Development and integration of software solutions and technical tools
  • Participate in new technology investigations and apply this knowledge through solution delivery

What you'll need

  • Working towards Degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, or Engineering

  • Excellent communication, interpersonal skills and growth attitude

  • Experience using object-oriented programming patterns and designs, with exposure to technologies such as:

    • Microsoft Visual Studio .NET and C#
    • Microsoft SQL Server and Oracle databases
    • Web development using Angular, HTML5, JavaScript frameworks

  • Good scripting knowledge

  • Knowledge of CI/CD methodology and cloud computing

  • Exposure to various software development methodologies and practices such as Test Driven Development, Continuous Integration/Delivery, Scrum and Agile.

  • You should be enrolled in a co-op program or returning back to your studies after the work term is completed

#LI-Hybrid #LI-SS

What we’re offering

At Ontario Teachers', diversity is one of our core strengths. We take pride in ensuring that the people we hire and the culture we create, reflect and embrace diversity of thought, background and experience. Through our Diversity, Equity and Inclusion strategy and our Employee Resource Groups (ERGs), we celebrate diversity and foster inclusion through events for colleagues to connect for professional development, networking & mentoring.  We are building an inclusive and equitable workplace where our talent is respected, accepted and empowered to be themselves.  To learn more about our commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion, check out Life at Teachers'.

How to apply

Are you ready to pursue new challenges and take your career to the next level? Apply today! The following documents are required to be uploaded with your application:

You will also be invited to complete a pre-recorded digital interview as part of your application.

We thank you for applying, however, only those selected for a personal interview will be contacted. Note that candidates must be legally entitled to work in the country where this role is located.

Accommodations are available upon request (peopleandculture@otpp.com) for candidates with a disability taking part in the recruitment process and once hired.

The privacy of your personal information is important to us. Please visit our Privacy Centre to learn how we handle your personal information.

jobDescription:
Hi, we’re ecobee. ecobee introduced the world’s first smart Wi-Fi thermostat to help millions of consumers save money, conserve energy, and bring home automation into their lives. That was just the beginning. We continue our pursuit to create technology that brings peace of mind into the home and allows people to focus on the moments that matter most. We take pride in making a meaningful difference to the environment, all while being part of the exciting, connected home revolution.

In 2021, ecobee became a subsidiary of Generac Power Systems. Generac introduced the first affordable backup generator and later created the category of automatic home standby generator. The company is committed to sustainable, cleaner energy products poised to revolutionize the 21st century electrical grid. Together, we take pride in making a meaningful difference to the environment, all while being part of the exciting, connected home revolution.

For more on ecobee: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RR4rKtkf1SY

The Role:

We are looking for an Android Engineer Intern to join our team for the 2025-2026 PEY work term!

Join our mobile team as an Android Developer and help us build great native apps for our users. Our students work on the same code as our full-time ecopeeps, no side projects that never see the light of day. Gain awesome experience and learn how to become a clean coder.

“ecobee is the perfect company for both personal and technical growth. It’s so rewarding to have the opportunity to get to work with some of the most enthusiastic and intelligent people!” – Previous Co-op

How You’ll Make an Impact:

  • Engage with the development team, project managers, and domain experts to contribute new ideas and design innovative solutions
  • Move through quick iterations and ship frequently to develop features efficiently, gain insights and share feedback and learnings with teammates
  • Collaborate to leverage and improve the tools, libraries and frameworks used to build out the app and platform

We’re up to incredible things. Come and be part of them.

What can you expect as an ecobee student?

  • The chance to meet and work with co-ops across all teams at ecobee
  • The opportunity to work in a fresh, dynamic, and ever-growing industry that is the SmartHome and IoT space
  • The visibility into a company that has an interesting mix of hardware and software consumer-facing businesses
  • Access to our headquarters, located near at the waterfront in Downtown Toronto, overlooking the lake (with complimentary pizza lunches every Thursday!)
  • The ability to make an environmental impact, both in your day job and outside the 9-5 with programs like ecobee acts!
  • Opportunities to learn and grow with our in-house learning enablement team, #ThinkLab
  • Small collaborative teams where you can impact both product and culture
  • Q&A sessions with senior leaders at ecobee
  • Weekly virtual game hangouts hosted by previous co-ops who’ve transitioned to full-time roles
  • Quarterly hack-a-thons, where you get a chance to work on whatever project you want!

ecobee believes all people have equal value and we are committed to providing a safe space for everyone . We welcome all applicants with diverse races, genders, ages, religions, identities, experiences, etc. and we will provide accommodation to all applicants throughout our hiring process.

jobTitle: GBM-Trade Floor Technology Consultant (Full Stack Developer)
jobDescription:
Requisition ID: 206613
Employee Referral Program – Potential Reward:

We are committed to investing in our employees and helping you continue your career at Scotiabank.

GBM - Trade Floor Technology Consultant (Full Stack Developer) - Summer 2025 - 12 or 16 Months

Term: 12 or 16 months

Start date: May 2025

Location: Toronto, Ontario, Canada

Application Deadline: 9/30/24

There's no better way to find your dream job than to do a co-op or internship with Scotiabank! During your work term, you’ll have the opportunity to be part of a winning team, build your network, and discover what you love – all while getting paid to do it! There’s a place for every type of student at Scotiabank and all that we ask for is that you have passion and strong AOO (Attitude, Ownership and Opportunity).

Who we are:

Global Banking & Markets (GBM) provides a full range of investment banking, credit and risk management products and services relevant to the financing and strategic development needs of our clients. Our products include debt and equity financing, mergers & acquisitions, corporate banking, institutional equity sales, trading and research, fixed income products, derivatives, energy, foreign exchange, and precious & metals. We also cross-sell the full range of wholesale products and services offered by the Scotiabank Group.

Is this role right for you? In this role, you will:

As a Trade Floor Technology Consultant (Web Developer), you will work on Scotiabank’s trade floor, providing full stack web development of applications and enhancement of web-based systems. As part of the Global Banking & Markets, Trade Floor Support & Automation team, you will analyze business processes, liaise with various groups within the bank, develop web-based systems, and design user interfaces to meet business needs. You will use state of the art web development technologies, including working with large datasets, bulk editing, advanced reporting, workflow notifications, APIs, web security, and intelligent prediction using analytics/machine learning.

This position offers individuals an excellent opportunity for learning and personal development, especially to those who wish to gain exposure to capital markets and related fields. You will also get exposure to financial products, as well as leading edge trading technologies and applications such as Bloomberg.

What’s in it for you?

This position offers individuals an excellent opportunity for learning and personal development, especially to those who wish to gain exposure to capital markets and related fields.

  • You’ll be part of a diverse, collaborative, innovative, and high-performing team.
  • In-depth training to prepare you for the role, as well as ongoing coaching and feedback to help you succeed!
  • Exclusive student events such as Scotia Student Day, Lunch & Learns, leadership panels, and much more!
  • Bank-wide orientation to learn more about Scotiabank and gain exposure to senior leadership across the organization.
  • Opportunity to get involved in the Scotiabank Co-op Social Committee and help plan events across Toronto.
  • Work in the heart of the Financial and Entertainment Districts in downtown Toronto.
  • Trade Floor Tours are available, offering a rare insight into modern financial analysis, trading, and sales.
  • On-site cafeteria and free refreshments available.

Do you have the skills and requirements that will enable you to succeed in this role? – We’d love to work with you if:

  • You are currently enrolled in post-secondary education.
  • You love to learn and envision yourself working for an international organization that heavily invests in your future.
  • You enjoy being involved in extracurricular activities such as conferences, clubs, and competitions/hackathons.
  • You possess effective programming and analytical skills. Familiarity and experience with full stack web development is preferred including:
  • Front-end languages and frameworks (e.g. HTML, CSS, JavaScript, JQuery, Bootstrap, React, Vue.js)
  • Back-end languages (e.g. C#, ASP, Visual Basic, Python)
  • SQL and relational databases (e.g. Microsoft SQL Server or Microsoft Access)
  • You have good interpersonal and communication skills. These are essential, as you will be required to work in a team environment and communicate with various channels.
  • You are highly self-motivated, and able to work quickly in a dynamic, challenging, and fast-paced environment. The tools being built are constantly evolving and changing according to business needs and technological opportunities, and you will be encouraged to contribute ideas to the design and implementation of such tools as part of a collaborative process.

How do I apply?

Please complete all four steps below:

  1. Complete your PLUM Profile here and save as a screenshot.
  2. Complete a short one-way video interview here.
  3. Complete a Codility Assessment here. There is 1 question on the Codility test: one arithmetic problem (using any of C, C++, C#, Java, Javascript, Python). Time limit to complete the assessment is 30 minutes.
  4. Apply to the role and when the application asks for your resume, instead upload the screenshot of your PLUM Profile and the most recent version of your transcript .

*To be considered for student opportunities at Scotiabank, Tangerine, and MD Financial you must complete all steps above.

Location(s):  Canada : Ontario : Toronto

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.

At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require technical assistance, please click here . Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

jobDescription:
JOB RESPONSBILITIES:

This role works with every department in the plant to support, troubleshoot and optimize our operation and processes. As an intern on our team, you will:

  • Complete field measurements to conduct heat exchanger performance analysis
  • Perform daily assessments of the site's environmental compliance and troubleshoot deviations to ensure best in class environmental performance
  • Assist with the site’s energy reporting and performancing
  • Lead one or more special project with emphasis on development and implementation of solutions to improve safety, reliability and environmental compliance

WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR:

  • Full-time students currently enrolled in a Chemical Engineering program.
  • Strong teamwork/interpersonal skills with ability to communicate ideas effectively
  • Motivated self-starter who can work well independently
  • Multitask competing priorities in a fast paced environment
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills
  • Knowledge of Microsoft products such as MS Word, Excel, and PowerPoint

WORK CONDITIONS:

Mix of office and field visits in an industrial manufacturing environment (outdoor) to complete assigned work. This may at times include twisting, crouching, kneeling, making visual inspections, climbing stairs/ladders, and pushing/pulling objects. Safety is our #1 Priority – all required training and Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) will be provided as part of on-boarding.

Please note, this is a Safety Sensitive position in which a Drug & Alcohol test must be completed along with a pre-placement health assessment prior to a start date.


Reasons to Work at Petro-Canada Lubricants

1. The Culture – home to a tight knit community of talented engineers, most of whom began their careers on-site as new grads or former co-ops themselves!

2. Mentorship – one on one mentorship, opportunity to learn from Subject Matter Experts, and participate in any on-site training offered during the co-op term.

3. Opportunities – wide variety of engineering assignments, opportunities to propose continuous improvement ideas and follow them through to implementation. You’ll rarely see the same thing twice!

4. Experience – apply your academic skills and knowledge in an industrial setting and further develop your understanding of engineering principles.

5. The Fun Side – Social Club and Engineering events such as BBQs, auctions, golf tournaments, volunteer opportunities and more!

About Us

PCLI refines and produces world-class advanced lubricants, specialty fluids, and greases. The base oil refinery is one of the largest in the world and offers a unique employment opportunity within the GTA! The site supports five key production units, including base oil production, support utilities and waste water treatment.

jobDescription:
Looking for self-driven, motivated and skilled engineers looking to get exposure to all sides of IC building process from high level architectural definition, through RTL coding, verification, synthesis and netlisting to customer engagement

What You'll Do

The successful candidate will have the opportunity to work in a fast pace environment on multiple projects in different design stages:

  • Develop RTL code for leading industry IPs such as PCIe, HBM, UCIe, Eth, and more
  • Integrate custom made DFT logic for complex SoCs (System-On-Chip) and CoWoS (Chip-On-Wafer-On-Substrate) designs
  • Build verification test benches and write verification sequences
  • Design and implement automation around RTL and DV processes using Perl and/or Python
  • Assist in synthesis and place & route tasks
  • Perform scan insertion and ATPG, simulate zero delay and SDF annotated test sequences
  • Run and review static timing analysis reports

Why would you want joining our team:

  • Ability to get exposure to all disciplines of IC design process (RTL,DV, synthesis, STA, P&R)
  • No "side kick" tasks, you will be assigned a regular engineering scope of work
  • Flexible options to continue employment after PEY program ends

What You’ll Need:

  • Verilog and/or VHDL knowledge
  • Perl, Python, TCL experience
  • C/C++, SystemVerilog is a plus
  • PrimeTime and DFT tools and/or experience (Tessent) is a plus

Desired qualities

  • Self-starter and curious to learn new things
  • Target oriented and motivated to figure out solutions to new problems
  • Collaborative, team player

Diversity & Inclusivity

Alphawave Semi is based out of one of the most diverse countries in the world. This includes differences related to race, ethnicity, national origin, gender, gender expression and presentation, sexual orientation, religion, age, ability and socioeconomic status. To us, diversity is one our strongest assets to our organization. We commit ourselves to promoting the recognition and appreciation of our diverse and rich culture. We believe that it is critical to our success to promote freedom of thought and opinion in a respectful environment. The decisions we make are rooted by respectfully considering each other’s thoughts and opinions and by working towards a greater common goal.

Accommodation

Alphawave Semi is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from all qualified individuals, including visible minorities, Indigenous People, and persons with disabilities. We welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities. If as a qualified job applicant, you request accommodation, Alphawave Semi will consult with you to provide reasonable accommodations according to your specific needs. If you wish to make a request, you will be provided an opportunity if you’re applications is selected to proceed in our hiring process.

jobDescription:
Job Description

WHAT YOU DO AT AMD CHANGES EVERYTHING

We care deeply about transforming lives with AMD technology to enrich our industry, our communities, and the world. Our mission is to build great products that accelerate next-generation computing experiences – the building blocks for the data center, artificial intelligence, PCs, gaming and embedded. Underpinning our mission is the AMD culture. We push the limits of innovation to solve the world’s most important challenges. We strive for execution excellence while being direct, humble, collaborative, and inclusive of diverse perspectives.

AMD together we advance_

An exciting internship opportunity to make an immediate contribution to AMD's next generation of technology innovations awaits you! We have a multifaceted, high-energy work environment filled with a diverse group of employees, and we provide outstanding opportunities for developing your career. During your internship, our programs provide the opportunity to collaborate with AMD leaders, receive one-on-one mentorship, attend amazing networking events, and much more. Being part of AMD means receiving hands-on experience that will give you a competitive edge. Together We Advance your career!

JOB DETAILS:

  • Location: Markham, Ontario, Canada
  • Onsite/Hybrid: This role requires the student to work full time (37.5 hours a week), either in a hybrid or onsite work structure throughout the duration of the co-op/intern term.
  • Duration: 16-Months, May 05, 2025 to August 27, 2026.

WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING:

There are a wide variety of software engineering opportunities available such as application, kernel, graphics, AI development. As an AMD Software Engineer, you can expect to –

  • Collaborate with teams across the stack from user space, kernel, firmware and hardware
  • Work with globally recognized partner companies to build solutions to real end-user issues
  • Participate in code and design reviews to ensure we build efficient and quality code
  • Create differentiating software features, examples include: AMD Fluid Motion Frames, AMD FidelityFX Super Resolution, FreeSync, and more
  • Take high-performance & efficient computing to a new level with next-gen Ryzen/Radeon Graphics chips

WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR:

  • You are currently enrolled in a Canada based University in a Bachelor's degree program majoring in Computer Engineering, Software Engineering, Software Development, Computer Science or related field.
  • AMD has multiple opportunities that requires different software skills. If you have ANY of the following skills, we encourage you to apply –
  • C/C++ programming and Object-Oriented Design
  • Frameworks like Qt, Javascript
  • Operating systems concepts (including memory management, multithreading, assembly, x86).
  • Computer graphics pipelines (Direct3D, OpenGL, OpenCL)
  • Computer architecture and/or firmware development
  • Version control tools such as Git/Github, Perforce
  • Additional Scripting Languages: Python, Windows PowerShell, Linux shell script, Perl, Java, UML
  • PC assembly and gaming ecosystem knowledge

Note: By submitting your application, you are indicating your interest in AMD intern positions. We are recruiting for multiple positions, and if your experience aligns with any of our intern opportunities, a recruiter will contact you.

Benefits offered are described: AMD benefits at a glance .

AMD does not accept unsolicited resumes from headhunters, recruitment agencies, or fee-based recruitment services. AMD and its subsidiaries are equal opportunity, inclusive employers and will consider all applicants without regard to age, ancestry, color, marital status, medical condition, mental or physical disability, national origin, race, religion, political and/or third-party affiliation, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.   We encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective laws throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process.

jobDescription:
Overview

Safran Landing Systems is the world leader in aircraft landing and braking systems. The company has partnerships with 25 airframers in civil, regional, commercial and military transport, and supports 32,000 aircraft that operate around 80,000 landings daily.

At the Safran Landing System’s Toronto site in Ajax, the engineering team develops and supports the Boeing 787 program, Bombardier programs, several military programs, as well as Advanced Projects and Research & Technology.

SLS engineering is looking for energetic, proactive aerospace inquisitive individuals that can contribute to the engineering team. We are looking for you to learn and return within several areas of engineering.

Application Process:

There are multiple positions that are being offered:

•       Methods & Tools Interns

•       Program Chief Engineers Office Interns

•       Landing Gear Performance Analysis and Methods Development Intern

•       Systems Architecture & MBSE Intern

•       Design & Analysis Engineering Interns

•       Systems Design & Integration Intern

•       Advanced Projects Interns

You may apply to your preferred roles within engineering within ONE application. Based on the applicants, you may be selected to participate in a panel interview, where focals from all areas of engineering will be present. The best fit for the candidates in each area of engineering will be selected. Further, to suit growth of your internship experience, we may move you into alternate areas of engineering to provide you a well rounded experience at Safran Landing Systems.

General Candidate Skills and Requirements

  • 3rd or 4th year university student in Mechanical/Aeronautical Engineering or related discipline.
  • Strong knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel, Power Point and Microsoft Office in general
  • Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to work in a team environment as well as independently
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Interest in the aeronautical industry

Methods & Tools Intern

Job description

Within Safran Landing Systems, there is a stress analysis software development project (“StressApps”) that requires a supporting engineering student resource. This project is an excellent opportunity for any engineering student looking for exposure to traditional static and fatigue analysis theory as applied in landing gear analysis. The student will mainly be involved with the testing and validation of the software.

General duties include:

  • Understand static and fatigue theory that is being programmed
  • Contribute to software definition (GUI mock-up, outputs, presentation of theory to the programmers (external company))
  • Test software for correctness / compare verse hand-calculations

At any given time, there are about several .NET applications being programmed by an external sub-contractor. Each program is a type of static or fatigue analysis, or a utility to helps manipulate data. The student will help at various stages in the development process according to ability and experience.

Specific Candidate skills & requirements

  • Understanding of the fundamental principles of Solid Mechanics and Fatigue.
  • Visual Basic or other coding experience is an asset

Program Chief Engineers Office Intern

Job description

An Engineering student position is available within the Program Chief Engineers (PCE) Office for both development and sustaining programs. This position may also involve engagement with other functions of the engineering team.

Under the responsibility of the Program Chief Engineer and/or Deputy, the successful candidate will provide support in the following capacity:

  • Assist in the tracking of actions assigned to the PCE office
  • Assist in the preparation and/or update of engineering deliverables, including technical reports
  • Assist in the preparation of various presentations, both internal and external
  • Provide engineering support on technical issues and investigations
  • Provide engineering support to Design and Analysis, Systems, Test and Performance Engineering functions as required
  • Prepare, schedule and participate in internal meetings or with customer, and follow up on status with various internal departments and the customer to provide regular updates

Specific Candidate skills & requirements

  • Project management and leadership skills
  • Excellent communication and organizational skills

Landing Gear Performance Analysis and Methods Development Intern

Job description

The intern will be working in the Performance and Methods & Tools Team to perform landing gear performance analysis and to assist harmonized methods development. The project will focus on the landing gear system modeling, simulation and harmonized methods development related with some or all of the following subjects:

  • Landing gear shimmy modelling and analysis
  • Landing and ground handling loads analysis
  • Extension/retraction analysis
  • Shock absorber modelling and dynamics
  • Nose wheel steering performance
  • Steering runaway failure analysis
  • Virtual system/test rig modeling and simulation
  • Harmonized methods & tools development

Specific Candidate skills & requirements

  • The intern will have a good sense for the design of mechanical and hydraulic equipment and a capability to validate and optimize the design by analysis (including simulation).
  • Some knowledge of aircraft systems would be of an advantage.
  • Knowledge of MatLab Simulink, ADAMS, Easy5, AMESIM, VBA, or Python would be an asset

Systems Architecture & MBSE Intern

Overview

The Systems Architecture & MBSE Intern supports activities related to the development of landing gear system specifications and novel architecture definitions. This work involves capturing customer and stakeholder needs, flowing them down to the product design (needs validation), and finally, ensuring that the designed product satisfies them (needs verification). The Systems Architecture and Integration (SAI) team is spread across three offices, Ajax (Toronto), Vélizy (Paris) and Gloucester (England), with frequent collaboration between them. This position is unique in that it gives an excellent overview of the Engineering department’s activities since SAI works with several other teams.

Job description

The main objective of the Systems Architecture process is to capture stakeholder needs for all operating conditions over the entire product lifecycle by:

  • Ensuring the operational needs and constraints are complete and understood.
    • Activities: Describing operational contexts, use cases, and scenarios based on direct interactions with the customer and SafranLS’s prior knowledge
  • Structuring the product design process.
    • Activities: Reviewing and writing requirements, identifying candidate architectures and relevant trade-offs, allocating functions and linking requirements to sub-systems and equipment
  • Completing trade-offs to assess the different architectures and choose the optimal technical solution (with support of all the Engineering functions involved).
  • Reviewing technical coherence of the proposed product.
  • Identifying risks and opportunities within the project (e.g. weight, performance, cost).
  • Leading and documenting collaborative workshops with customers and/or internally.
  • Recording and applying external and internal design best practices and lessons learned.

MBSE Management

As the Systems Architecture tasks are realized within a Model-Based Systems Engineering (MBSE) framework, the Systems Architecture & MBSE Intern will also be involved in some of the following MBSE Management activities:

  • Create and manage MBSE artifacts in the IBM Jazz platform, under the Requirements, Architecture and Configuration domains. This includes modeling at the operational, functional, logical and technical level, and writing or reviewing specification documents.
  • Engage with customers to build collaborative MBSE frameworks.
  • Train and support project teams in following the MBSE process using the methods and tools in the IBM Jazz platform.
  • Capture and document MBSE best practices for the Systems Architecture community.
  • Review MBSE resources to learn and share new skills and ideas related to methods, languages and tools.

Specific Candidate skills & requirements

  • Independent learner who naturally questions unproven assertions and is motivated to study both practical and abstract topics.
  • Big picture thinker that can also pay attention to detail when required.
  • Takes initiative, and able to work both autonomously and in a team.
  • Strong verbal and written communication in English; French is an asset.
  • Has knowledge of Systems Engineering theory and its application on complex embedded systems. An interest in developing this knowledge is sufficient, but a prior understanding of engineering requirements, engineering technical documents, verification and validation is an asset.
  • Familiarity with UML/SysML, MBSE tools, and requirements management tools is an asset.
  • Familiar with modeling and simulation environments in Matlab/Simulink or similar modeling tools.
  • Experience creating and/or reading hydraulic and electrical schematics is an asset.

Design & Analysis Engineering Interns

Design Job description

  • Reporting to the Integrated Product Team - Engineering Group Leader.
  • Design of landing gear components and associated systems using CATIA V5 in support of more senior level Designers.
  • Working with the IPT, responsible for ensuring the design of the equipment meets the applicable specification requirements including CAR, FAR and CS.
  • 3D modelling, drawing creation, dimensioning and annotation of components.
  • 2D and 3D tolerance stack ups of assemblies of parts.
  • Clearance analysis in a 3D, kinematic context.
  • Application, evaluation and development of Design methods and tools.
  • Create and update documents using Product Data Management system.
  • Participate in Concurrent Engineering with various company functions including Stress, Dynamics, Systems, Quality, Product Support, Manufacturing, etc.
  • Ensure that lessons learned are applied to new designs.
  • Ensure that a common design approach is followed using harmonized company standards.
  • Support in-service aircraft for production repair, in-service repair, investigations and associated Material Review Board activities if required.
  • Possible move to a different functional role as required by the business (eg. Stress, etc.).
  • Other company/Engineering related activities as required.

Analysis Job description

  • Responsible for the structural integrity of Landing Gears and Landing Gear Systems in support of more senior level Analysts/Engineers.
  • Strength, Fatigue, Endurance Analysis.
  • Classical and 3D Finite Element Analysis.
  • Weight Optimization of components.
  • Definition and evolution of raw material requirements.
  • Coordination of development test activities.
  • Support to qualification test activities.
  • Application, evaluation and development of Stress methods and tools.
  • Prepare and review structural reports for compliance to airworthiness specifications and customer requirements.
  • Provide support and justification in the disposition of non-conformances and structural repairs.
  • Possible move to a different functional role as required by the business (eg. Design, etc.).
  • Other company/Engineering related activities as required.

Specific Candidate skills & requirements

  • Knowledge of geometric dimensioning and tolerancing.
  • Good understanding of the fundamental principles of Solid Mechanics and Fatigue.
  • Ability to perform both classical strength and fatigue analyses.
  • Experience with PATRAN, NASTRAN, Abaqus/CAE and ABAQUS are a definite asset.
  • Proficiency in computer programs such as Mathcad is an asset.
  • Capability in the use of CATIA V5 or similar 3D modeling software is an asset
  • Intermediate proficiency with MS Office required.
  • Strong verbal, written and presentation skills.
  • Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to work in a team environment.
  • Knowledge and experience with CAR/FAR/CS 23/25 specifications are an asset.
  • Detail and results oriented with a well-developed problem-solving ability.
  • Bilingual (French/English) is an asset.

Systems Design & Integration Intern

Job description

Within this frame, and under the responsibility of the Systems Manager or his delegate, the student will be working within an integrated product team. The student will be part of an systems integration group tasked with design and support for all programs both new and sustaining covering electrical, mechanical and avionics equipment. Duties could include a mixture of the following;

  • Participate on engineering teams (including design, analysis, systems, test, manufacturing, quality and other disciplines) to define landing gear system requirements and design architecture.
  • Collect and document Verification data for the LGS components.
  • Create landing gear actuation and steering system hydraulic simulation models using computerized tools.
  • Prepare or review systems performance analyses.
  • Review Test results and correlate to analysis.
  • Prepare test requirements for development, acceptance and qualification tests.
  • Participate in the preparation of failure analyses.
  • Review failure analyses for adequacy and completeness.
  • Prepare/review drawings and specifications for the electrical/hydraulic system.
  • Prepare system hydraulic and electrical schematics, interconnection diagrams and aircraft wiring diagrams.

Specific Candidate skills & requirements

  • University courses should include: Control Systems, Circuit Theory, Numerical Techniques.
  • Knowledge of aircraft performance or aircraft stability and control an asset.
  • Knowledge of one of the aerospace simulation packages a definite asset.

Advanced Projects Intern

Overview

Within the Research and Technology, Innovation and Eco-Design group at Safran Landing Systems, you will work in a dynamic and innovative team created to support customer engagement and develop innovative new products quickly and efficiently. As part of the team, you will be tackling a variety of diverse and technically challenging subjects, such as the development of new landing system products for the latest innovations in transportation. Current and previous projects include novel aircraft braking solutions, more electric landing systems, and advanced concept development for future aircraft from the world’s leading airframers. You will have the opportunity to work through the rapid development of new products from theory to design to hardware tests in our world class test facility.

Job description

Within the Advanced Projects team you will be responsible for assisting in various aspects of the technical design, analysis, modeling, and simulation of landing gear systems and associated components, ensuring compliance with applicable requirements throughout the development. You will have the opportunity to work on a variety of complex and innovative systems, developing parts and assemblies from conception to fabrication, and developing multi-physics engineering models and associated system control architectures to meet the evolving needs of the various projects.

Throughout this process, you will gain and utilize a wide variety of skills such as design, analysis, modeling, and simulation to successfully execute the product development in support of key customer accounts. You will be responsible for proposing and developing innovative solutions to meet demanding performance and operational requirements, ultimately participating in model correlation based on real-world test results.

Responsibilities include:

  • Develop new landing gear system components; create sketches and 3D models using CATIA V5
  • Establish the feasibility of the design solution, accounting for both mechanical (strength, fatigue, performance) and practical (machinability, assembly process and integration) considerations
  • Resolve engineering problems through analysis and test
  • Create custom dynamic simulations from first principles to drive engineering decisions
  • Develop technical drawings of parts and assemblies for the manufacture of prototypes
  • Work with manufacturers to reduce complexity, costs, and production times while optimizing the concept
  • Drive model fidelity and improvements by planning and executing test campaigns
  • Establish robust control laws that meet the criteria for using the system defined by the end applications

The successful intern will use their technical knowledge and outside of the box thinking to propose cost effective solutions, perform analyses to support design solution validation, and will participate in ongoing design activities. They will be a member of an international team within the Safran organization.

Specific Candidate skills & requirements

  • Experience with one or more of the following engineering software packages through academic and/or professional projects:

- CAD - CATIA V5

- FEA - ABAQUS, Nastran/Patran, ANSYS

- Simulation - Matlab Simulink, ADAMS, AMESIM

  • 1+ years of experience in one of the following domains (previous internship and student design team experience qualifies):

- Mechanical design and analysis

- Hydromechanical/electromechanical design and analysis

- System simulation and modeling

- Thermal modeling and analysis

  • Experience writing technical documentation
  • Strong knowledge of the principles of static and dynamic mechanics
  • Ability to understand and produce engineering drawings

- Familiarization with GD&T principles is a plus

  • Landing gear knowledge is considered an asset

jobDescription:
Do you have a passion for working on electrical, software, mechanical and robotics projects?  Do you like having an impact by working on a small team developing unique leading-edge technologies for space and terrestrial applications?  If so, we may have some interesting opportunities for you!  We are currently looking for an engineering intern to work alongside our staff members on a variety of interesting projects.

As an integrated member of the team, your contribution will have a direct impact on various systems for orbital, near Earth, and deep space applications with a focus on space exploration as well as spin-off technology for terrestrial applications.


The main responsibilities for this role include:

  • Designing and 3D printing prototype parts for various experiments.
  • Assembling mechanical and electrical assemblies.
  • Prototyping and design of  electronic circuits and writing firmware in support of test campaigns.
  • Software design, development and testing.
  • Sourcing materials for prototypes and experiments.
  • Learning and following industry procedures for preparing flight units (working in a laminar flow chamber, staking components, soldering, microscope inspection, ultrasonic cleaning, harness lacing, etc…).
  • Running product test campaigns in-house as well as supporting 3rd party testing (cryogenic temperature cycling, thermal vacuum, vibration, electromagnetic compatibility, radiation).
  • Performing detailed experiments and documenting results.
  • Setting up new facilities / lab equipment

Skills Requirements:
The following skills would be useful for this role:

  • Electrical circuit design (eg. Eagle)
  • Hands-on experience in electronics, mechatronics, mechanical engineering or similar fields.
  • Previous experience with firmware development of applications using embedded platforms (e.g. Raspberry Pi, Beagle Bone, Arduino).
  • Soldering, PCB assembly, wiring harnesses
  • Mechanical assembly
  • CAD modelling, 3D printing
  • C / Python programming experience
  • Good communication and writing skills

Canadensys is an Equal Employment Opportunity.
All applicants must be legally entitled to work in Canada and must be able to meet the requirements necessary for current Government of Canada Controlled Goods clearance and Security clearance (Reliability status or higher). In addition, all applications must be either a Canadian Citizen, permanent resident or a protected person defined by the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act.

jobDescription:
If you are interested in an advanced technology company that provides world class technology for clean air, you may find this position of interest. Safety Power is a provider of environmental control equipment for large scale diesel and natural gas engines used for emergency generators in data centers, banks, hospitals, universities, colleges, government facilities and life safety systems for large office buildings. We are a cleantech company that provides equipment that dramatically reduces air emissions. We are a Canadian company that designs and develops our own environmental systems in our Mississauga office. Our customers include well known names such as Harvard University, Microsoft, Google and Amazon. We are looking for someone who is excited about being a part of a dynamic, and rapidly growing team.

Responsibilities

Assist Senior Engineers with design and project work. You will work under the direction of an engineer in the following areas:

  • Understand the Company’s existing technology and design principles.
  • Be involved in exciting new designs and extensions of existing designs.
  • Interface with fabricators to ensure design requirements are met.
  • Assist Project Managers with design drawings and customer submittals.

You will work on interesting projects which will require the ability to work independently. This job offers the opportunity to be involved in all aspects of a complex project and to see the result of your work in the finished product.

Requirements

• Third year mechanical or engineering science engineering student.
• Knowledge of 3D CAD is a key requirement (SolidWorks preferred).
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
• Must have Ontario Driver’s License for occasional travel to fabricators.
• Ability to work independently on complex problems.
• Time management/organization skills.


We offer a dynamic opportunity with a rapidly growing company in the environmental sector.

jobDescription:
Independent Electricity System Operator (IESO)

Due to the IESO’s role in the energy sector, please note that a full security check will be conducted.  Job offers will be conditional until you have successfully attained security clearance to work at the IESO.

Why join us?

You've got great skills. And you want to use them in an organization where you know what you do every day matters. We get that.

We also know that ensuring Ontarians have access to affordable and reliable power doesn't happen by accident. So we give you the tools, flexibility and support you need to achieve your goals, and development opportunities to help you grow. You'll thrive in a collaborative, team-based environment that values your unique skills and experiences - and recognizes that when you do better, we become even better too.

Who we are

The Independent Electricity System Operator (IESO) works at the centre of the province's power system, ensuring Ontarians have access to reliable and cost-effective electricity when and where they need it. We operate the province's electricity grid 24/7, design, run and oversee the wholesale electricity markets, and plan and prepare to meet Ontario's electricity needs - now and into the future.

The opportunity
The System Integration department is seeking bright, talented and ambitious Electrical Engineering or Computer Engineering undergraduate and graduate students who are eager to apply their power system engineering skills.


Division/Department:

Markets and Reliability (MR) – System Integration (SI) – Performance, Application and Integration (PAI)

  • Power System Limits (PSL)
  • Connections Assessments (CxA)

Your work term will be spent in the Markets and Reliability business unit. To learn more about how IESO works on achieving a reliable and efficient operation of the province-wide power system, you can visit our website .

You will be a part of a group responsible for:

The System Integration Division focuses on developing and maintaining suitable models to support Ontario's Electrical Grid and associated Market Systems.

  • The Power System Limits and Connection Assessments departments are seeking bright, talented and ambitious Electrical Engineering undergraduate and graduate students who are eager to apply their power system engineering skills.
  • A successful candidate is an effective team player, a creative problem solver, takes initiative, is a strong communicator, and shows a high degree of potential to obtain an excellent grasp of power system operations.
  • The Engineering Student will receive on the job experience, through assignments, to become familiar with methods and practices associated with the work functions specific to various engineering studies and their outcomes.

Your work term may be spent in one of the following teams:

  • Our Connection Assessments team assesses the impact of new or modified connections to the power system and specifies connection requirements to prevent an adverse impact to the power system.
  • Our Power System Limits team develops power system operating limits and instructions in support of the real-time operation, operations planning and long-term planning.

What you'll do may include:

  • Support power system engineers in determining operating limits and administering the Connection Assessments process;
  • Prepare data and scripts to support power system simulations and analysis;
  • Assist in summarizing simulation results and preparing reports on findings and results;
  • Develop enhanced visualizations and applications to improve processes;
  • Maintain and develop database and simulation tools related to the Connection Assessments process; and
  • Perform connection assessments for new and modified connections on Ontario's electricity system.

This job will provide you with the following professional development:

  • A maximum of 12 months of pre-graduation experience can be used towards PEO’s experience requirement for licensure;
  • Knowledge of various power system components;
  • Deep understanding of power system operations and planning;
  • Concept of system reliability and power system operating criteria;
  • Development in Tableau for reports and visualizations;
  • Communication skills by working with multiple groups, including the IESO Control Room;
  • Basics of power system studies; and
  • Connection Assessments process for Ontario power system.

What you need to succeed

Discipline(s) Required:

  • Electrical Engineering or Computer Engineering – Undergraduate and Graduate Programs

The following knowledge is essential to perform the job:

  • Understanding of 3-phase circuit theory, power system network calculations, and basic machine theory. This is normally acquired in Electrical Engineering disciplines.
  • Demonstrated understanding and experience with programming languages (i.e. SQL, VBA and Python) is an asset.
  • Knowledge of databases, such as Microsoft Access.
  • Experience in technical writing and documentation; proficiency in Microsoft Word's advanced features.

Level: 3rd year

jobDescription:
Untether AI is a rapidly growing Toronto startup building a next generation hardware AI accelerators for neural net inference. We're designing integrated circuits that will run neural nets orders of magnitude faster and lower power. This class of chips will be the standard platform for running image recognition, speech synthesis, text to speech and many other applications in data centers, mobile phones and self-driving cars within the next 5 years.

We are looking for creative problem solvers who are interested in optimizing neural networks for inference. You can expect to be contributing to a small agile team working on challenging problems in deep learning, software engineering, and mathematics, and be provided with close mentoring and guidance from senior engineers. As part of our fast-moving startup, you’ll be contributing to foundational infrastructure and algorithm development, as well as working on new, unsolved problems.

We encourage interdisciplinarity and learning, so if you have experience spanning hardware and software, come talk with us. But don't worry if you think your experience is too narrowly focussed, we've got great projects for people with a wide range of interests and specializations.

Job Requirements

Join our Neural Networks team and come learn about our software projects. We'll work together to set the deliverables for your term with us, but in general you can expect to work primarily in Python (including TensorFlow and PyTorch), and some C/C++ within a loose agile environment (sprints, thorough code review, continuous integration etc.).

Some examples of topics:

  • Quantization: Develop and implement integer approximations for neural network layers from across myriad application domains (e.g. vision, NLP, recommendation engines)
  • Software development: Build out our customer-facing APIs to enable push-button model quantization, compilation, and on-chip inference acceleration
  • Research: Explore and experiment with automated approaches to optimizing nets for inference

jobDescription:
COMPANY:

Select Equity Group (SEG) was founded in 1990 on the premise that rigorous, independent research and disciplined, long-term investing will generate superior returns for our clients. Today, the Firm has over $35 billion in assets across long-only and long/short strategies utilizing a team-based approach and centralized research effort. Our global client base includes endowments, foundations, public and private pensions, private banks, family offices and high-net-worth individuals. Our more than 200 employees possess diversity of thought, experiences and backgrounds and share a commitment to our Core Principles (below). Our employees thrive in a collaborative environment that empowers them to apply curiosity, creativity, and continuous improvement in pursuit of differentiated excellence for our clients.

Commitment to Giving Back: The Select Equity Group Foundation, established in 2000, makes a positive impact by actively engaging all employees in identifying and supporting charitable organizations of excellence.

Location: This position is based in the Firm’s Toronto office.

POSITION DESCRIPTION:

The Data Engineer Intern will be part of the Firm’s Data & Analytics team and reports to one of the Data Engineers on the team. His/her primary responsibility is to develop innovative and scalable ways to ingest, process, and analyze data – generating deep and unconventional investment insights for companies of interest. The Data team operates in a vertically integrated model, with responsibilities spanning from data sourcing to processing and analytics.

The ideal candidate is an entrepreneurial self-starter who is passionate about continuous learning in a rapidly evolving data space.  Extreme technical competence (but not necessarily in Big Data), intellectual curiosity, and attention to detail are essential, as are flexibility and comfort working in a growing organization.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Sourcing data: supporting technical vendor due diligence (e.g., assessing data quality, systematic backtesting against fundamental metrics); developing bespoke in-house data acquisition programs; interfacing with vendors to ingest data into our cloud-based infrastructure
  • Featuring data: developing in-house algorithms to process data (e.g., sentiment analysis, product matching, SQL enrichment); delivering bespoke insights to investment analysts
  • Predictive analytics: collaborating with Data Insights Analysts to determine statistical significance and error ranges of findings for a wide variety of data sources and analyses; developing data-driven models to predict key company financial and operational metrics
  • Infrastructure development and maintenance: creating custom solutions to continuously monitor our data pipeline; maintaining our underlying cloud infrastructure and platforms; continuous due diligence of new technologies for introduction to the Firm
  • Application development: developing bespoke web-based applications to facilitate data adoption within investment research

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Currently in the 3rd year of an Engineering or Computer Science or Math degree with a minimum 3.6GPA
  • Prior programming experience
  • Proficient with concepts in statistics (e.g., regressions, predictive models, tests of significance)
  • Hands on experience with the following:
    • Cloud architecture (e.g., AWS, GCP)
    • Interacting with data at scale (e.g., Pandas, SQL)
    • Container orchestration (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes, Airflow)
    • Automated data acquisition (e.g., Scrapy)
    • Machine learning, NLP, and/or ML-ops
    • Contributions to the open source community
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
  • Track record of continuous learning
  • Demonstrated passion for data, although past experience not required
  • Highest degree of integrity, professionalism and confidentiality
  • Fit with Select Equity’s Core Principles (below)

CORE PRINCIPLES:

  • Originality: We generate our own ideas and never deploy common practice without skepticism. We strive to avoid the herd.
  • Innate Curiosity: We ask dumb questions. We challenge universally accepted beliefs and seek new levels of understanding.
  • Continuous Improvement: We constantly reassess our investments, policies and processes. We embrace a culture of intellectual integrity, learning, mentorship, self-reflection, entrepreneurship and growth.
  • Charity: We actively participate in our communities and give back to society in meaningful and thoughtful ways.
  • Humility: We seek no acclaim individually or as a Firm other than to earn the respect of our clients.
  • Teamwork: We trust our colleagues and communicate with transparency and respect. We measure success as a team, not as individuals.

jobDescription:
Who We Are

Smith + Andersen is a trusted, Canadian, multi-disciplinary engineering firm with 10 offices in five provinces and approximately 700 employees.

At Smith + Andersen our employees contribute to some of the most sustainable building design projects in Canada. The work we do has meaningful impact on the community by contributing to landmark projects such as hospitals, transit stations, parks, federal and provincial government buildings and post-secondary institutions.

Our values drive and define everything we do, demonstrating a deep commitment to sustainability, mentorship and quality work that spans nearly six decades in business. In addition, we are proud to have been certified as a Great Place to Work® and one of Canada’s Best Workplaces™ for the highly collaborative culture we’ve built and for empowering employees to do great work!

Why Join Us?

Smith + Andersen is a leading engineering firm not only in Ontario, but across Canada. Established in 1965, Toronto was Smith + Andersen’s first office. In and around the Greater Toronto Area, our teams have worked on a wide range of projects that have quite literally shaped city skylines. The expertise and innovation of our office is evident in the work we deliver, which includes everything from geothermal solutions and radiant heating and cooling, to district energy. We take as much pride in our work on a tenant fit-up or building assessment as we do contributing to the city’s tallest towers. For us, work is about connecting, collaborating, and finding creative solutions to problems.

At Smith + Andersen, we are committed to empowering the next generation of engineers by offering practical work experiences that include designing new buildings or renovating existing buildings that shape our cities, and bridge the gap between academic knowledge and real-world application. If you have a passion for electrical engineering and are eager to expand your skill set, this is opportunity for you. Join us and be part of team that values your contributions and invests in you!

What You’ll Gain:

  • Hands-on Experience: Work on real projects that make an impact.
  • Mentorship: Be guided by industry leaders who are eager to share their knowledge with you and help you build your career.
  • Skill Development: Enhance your technical skills and soft skills in a supportive, nurturing environment.
  • Career Growth: Our firm values training and skills development for promoting growth. Many of our full-time employees (including nearly a quarter of our leaders across the country) began their careers with us as co-op students at Smith + Andersen.
  • Impactful Work: Contribute to sustainable building design and make a difference by helping Canada meet its 2025 targets for green-house gas emissions reductions.
  • Consulting Experience: Gain hands-on experience within an engineering consulting firm and learn about the ins and outs of the industry.

In addition to a co-op experience with meaningful work, we offer:

  • Competitive salary
  • Flexible hours and half-day Fridays (all year round)
  • Transit Subsidy Program
  • Hands-on training with industry specific software such as AutoCAD and Revit.
  • Wide variety of community and social events including sports outings, potlucks, games nights, community clean up days, and much more! We also have a several recreational leagues including hockey and soccer.

Portfolio

Here are just a few examples of the wide range of projects we have worked on in the Toronto office:

Post secondary institutions:

  • University of Toronto Myhal Centre , University of Toronto Academic Wood Tower , University of Toronto Robarts Library
  • University of Waterloo Engineering 5 , University of Waterloo Engineering 7 Building
  • Queen's University Mitchell Hall
  • University of Guelph W.F. Mitchell Athletics Centre Renewal , University of Guelph Ontario Veterinary College Hill's Pet Nutrition Primary Healthcare Centre

Healthcare:

  • Bridgepoint Health
  • Humber River Hospital
  • CAMH Redevelopment

Sports + Recreation:

  • Aaniin Community Centre
  • Orillia Recreation Centre
  • Pan Am Sports Centre

Retail:

  • Eataly
  • Restoration Hardware

Commercial:

  • Googles new Toronto Office
  • EY Tower
  • TD Terrace

For more information about Smith + Andersen and our co-operative program, please visit our website: S+A Co-op Program.

What You’ll Do:

The Junior Designer is often a member of several project teams working under the guidance of experienced designers and project managers to assist in all aspects of electrical system design. The activities a Junior Designer performs includes designing lighting, lighting controls, photometric calculations, power distribution including emergency power generation and uninterruptible power supplies and the development of life safety systems such as fire alarm.

The successful candidate will gain exposure to provincial building codes and standards as well as 2D and 3D drafting/modeling software while learning to design electrical systems. Other activities include:

  • Assist in the development of electrical system drawings and specifications, the production of contract documents by preparing schematics, sizing systems, layout of electrical equipment rooms and electrical distribution systems.
  • Assist with contract administration tasks such as construction site reviews, shop and drawing reviews, design revisions and coordination with contractor.
  • Hands-on experience with building codes, industry standards, handbooks and regulations under the supervision of Professional Engineers and/Engineer-in-training.

Click HERE to watch a video on the typical day-in-the-life of a Co-op at Smith + Andersen.

Who You Are:

  • Ideally, completed 3rd year Electrical Engineering with interest in 3-phase power systems, transformers, electric machines, energy systems & distributed generation, electric drives, power electronics and project management.
  • As a minimum, have standard computer and software knowledge (i.e. Microsoft Word, Excel, etc.). Specific engineering software will be learned on the job, however experience with AutoCAD or Revit is an asset.
  • Previous co-op experience in a related industry is an asset.

Please note all applicants are required to submit an academic transcript.

Office Location

100 Sheppard Ave. East in Toronto, Ontario, is conveniently situated within walking distance to public transit, fitness facilities, restaurants, and retail amenities. The office building offers various amenities, including a tenant lounge, car and bicycle parking, and on-site electric vehicle charging.

Accommodation

Appropriate accommodations will be provided to candidates upon request throughout the recruitment and hiring process. Successful applicants will be advised of Smith + Andersen’s accommodation policies at the time the employment offer is extended.

Diversity

Smith + Andersen is committed to diversity, equity and inclusion and welcomes applications from all qualified candidates of any age, culture, subculture, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, nationality, race, ethnicity, family status, religion, mental or physical status or veteran status.

jobDescription:
Our employees are at the heart of what we do best: helping people, businesses and society prosper in good times and be resilient in bad times. When you join our team, you’re bringing this purpose to life alongside a passionate community of experts.

Feel empowered to learn and grow while being valued for who you are– here, diversity is a strength. You have our commitment to support you in reaching your goals with tools, opportunities, and flexibility. It’s our employee promise.

Our hybrid work model provides the balance between working from home and enjoying meaningful in-person interactions.

Read on to see how you can shape the future, win as a team, and grow with us.

About the role

Launching your tech career at Intact means joining a diverse team of more than 3,000 Digital, Data and Tech experts working at the intersection of what exists and what’s possible. Here, you’ll be supported by forward-thinking leaders who celebrate shared success, and you’ll help push the industry forward with digital solutions that go beyond insurance to offer everyday value to millions of people. You’ll grow personally and professionally with access to cutting-edge technology-driven learning platforms and make lasting connections near and far. Most importantly, you’ll discover how exciting the “real world” can be.

Here, your career will take off

At Intact, we’re leading an insurance transformation to better protect people, businesses and society. We want future talent - like you - to help us lead the charge. Join our team as a IT Architect I for the Summer 2025 term. In this role, you’ll make a difference while building the skills and experience that will propel your career forward.

We are looking for intern(s) to join our specialized teams - Software and Data Architecture and Enterprise Architecture . Depending on your team assignment, here’s what you’ll do here:

  • Analyze and understand multi-system integrations and identify risks and propose solutions.

  • Create relationships with multiple stakeholders, build trust, and influence their direction.

  • Adapt to business changes as they arrive and alter complex solutions in real time.

  • Communicate highly technical solutions to multiple levels of stakeholders, from developers to C-level executives.

  • Collaborate with teams of very experienced developers across the organization to build solutions.

  • Assist in the design and development of IT architecture blueprints that align with business objectives.

  • Perform research and stay up-to-date with the latest technology trends, best practices, and industry standards.

  • Support the documentation of architectural standards, guidelines, and reference architectures.

  • Participate in the evaluation and selection of software and hardware solutions that meet business requirements.

What you bring to the table:

  • Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Software Engineering

  • Available to work with us full-time, 35 hours per week, for the Summer 2025 term for 16 months (May 2025 to August 2026)

  • Must be returning to school in Fall 2026 following your internship

  • Past internship experience is considered an asset

  • Excellent oral and written communication skills (English and/or French preferred)

  • Ability and desire to learn/adapt quickly to a changing environment

  • Familiarity with programming languages such as Java, Python, or JavaScript

  • Familiarity with Cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud)

  • Knowledge of DevOps practices and tools (e.g., Jenkins, Docker, Kubernetes) considered an asset

  • Knowledge of software engineering concepts such as, design patterns, systems integration, integration patterns, event-driven patterns, API services, and microservices considered an asset

  • Knowledge of security protocols, encryption techniques, and identity and access management (IAM) considered an asset

Your career starts here.  Apply today!

We can’t wait to learn more about you. When you complete your application, remember to include your resume and University/College transcript. We hire co-ops every semester (Winter, Summer and Fall)!

We’re accepting applications now through October 11. All submissions will be reviewed during this time, as well as after the posting closes.

What we offer

Working here means you'll be empowered to be and do your best every day. Here is some of what you can expect as a temporary member of our team:

  • Inspiring leaders and colleagues who will lift you up and help you grow

  • Access to tools and resources to support physical and mental health, embracing change and connecting with colleagues

  • A dynamic workplace learning ecosystem complete with learning journeys, interactive online content, and inspiring programs

  • Inclusive employee-led networks to educate, inspire, amplify voices, build relationships and provide development opportunities.

  • A Community Impact program, because what you care about is a part of what makes you different. And how you contribute to your community should be just as unique.

We are an equal opportunity employer

At Intact, we value diversity and strive to create an inclusive, accessible workplace where all individuals feel valued, respected, and heard.

If we can provide a specific adjustment to make the recruitment process more accessible for you, please let us know when we reach out about a job opportunity. We’ll work with you to meet your needs.
