jobDescription:
Introduction:

Work with Cadence's semiconductor IP team, designing best in-class SerDes in the latest semiconductor processes using  leading industry tools and methodologies. We are seeking an exceptional intern to join our SerDes IP team in Toronto, Ontario. Candidates will be joining some of the brightest inventors and engineers in the world to develop products that make data faster.

Our Approach to Internships:

Make you an integral part of the team by providing training, mentorship, and encouraging your creative Talents. As part of a smaller, tight-knit design group, you will be given opportunities to work on various tasks that span the entire business-engineering cycle. Our goal is to equip students with practical work experience and a big picture view of how business is conducted in the semiconductor industry. You will only be limited by your desire to learn and ambition to assume more responsibilities. We understand that it is best to learn by doing. We will provide tasks that enable you to learn while also making meaningful technical contributions. We also consider interns as full-fledged team members and as your knowledge grows, so does the number of tasks and their complexities. The internship program is also an important step in our full-time post-graduation recruitment strategy, with many of our former interns returning as full-time employees.

Description:

The Analog IC Characterization Engineer works with ultra-high speed lab equipment to prove Cadence’s designs in silicon.  The job entails silicon evaluation, characterization, debug, and support.  Also, the intern will be part of creating demonstrations of Cadence’ silicon to prospective customers.

Company Information:

Cadence is the global leader in software, hardware, and services that is driving the transformation of the electronic design automation (EDA) industry. This application-driven approach for creating, integrating, and optimizing designs helps customers realize Analog & Digital ICs ,  System-On-Chip devices, IP and complete systems at lower costs and with higher quality.

Cadence is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to hiring a diverse workforce.

Responsibilities:

  • Evaluation of Cadence’ leading edge SERDES designs in lab using cutting-edge test equipment such as BERTs, Oscilloscopes, Spectrum Analyzers, Network Analyzers, Protocol Analyzers
  • Development of software for configuring the device and test automation
  • Test Report generation
  • Development of test methodology and making improvements to current test practices
  • Conducting customer demonstration of Cadence’ products using evaluation boards

Skills/Requirements:

  • Students who have completed third year engineering in Electrical, Computer Engineering, or Engineering Science
  • Strong academic background, excellent verbal and written communication skills, and an ability to excel working in a team environment
  • Proven self-starter with the ability to proactively identify problem situations and propose technically viable solutions
  • Prefer some understanding of practical and theoretical aspects of high-speed analog/mixed-signal testing, including test equipment (BERTs, Oscilloscopes, Spectrum/Network Analyzers), types of measurements (eye diagrams, jitter histograms, bathtub curves, s-parameters, TDR, etc), board design, GUI development, and test automation.
  • Prefer software programming experience using Python or similar object-oriented languages.

Application Requirements:

  • Please include a cover letter, resume, and transcript
  • Indicate preference for internship positions on the cover letter. If more than one internship position is of interest, than please rank your preferences.

jobDescription:
Environment and Climate Change Canada is looking for one student to join the Applied Science Applications - Meteorological Systems Integration in the role outlined below.

You will have the opportunity to contribute to all aspects of the development process and work on complex scientific weather applications. While many organizations assign students to highly restricted roles, we expect students to grow into a role in which they participate fully in the development process - students are treated no differently than full-time employees. Assigned tasks may include design, coding, testing, performance analysis, debugging, system installation/configuration, code reviews, and documentation. All development follows a certified ISO9000 process for which you will receive training. To contribute effectively to our dynamic, team-based approach to software development, strong communication skills are required.

Unified Radar Processor - Software Developer Environment and Climate Change Canada’s Radar Application Team supports and maintains several mission critical scientific applications to aid with the forecasting and data analysis of weather phenomena. These are complex client/server software systems that implement various science algorithms written in C language deployed in a Linux cluster environment. The scientific data generated by these systems are distributed to the Weather Website and other internal and external clients such as the official WeatherCAN phone application used by thousands of Canadians.

Education Requirements

The application is open to students who have completed their 3rd year in a relevant discipline such as these preferred disciplines:

  • Computer Engineering
  • Computer Science
  • Engineering Science (Electrical and Computer)

Qualifications:

  • Experience in C programming
  • Experience in OOP (Java, C/C++, Python, etc.)
  • Experience in command line interface in a UNIX / Linux environment, including shell scripting
  • Experience with version control (Git, Perforce)
  • Knowledge of software development life cycle methodologies (Iterative, Agile, etc.)
  • Knowledge of software testing methodologies

Abilities:

  • Ability to effectively analyze, evaluate and solve problems
  • Ability to communicate effectively and work in a team environment
  • Ability to work independently

Assets:

  • Experience with CI/CD pipelines in a software development environment (Jenkins)
  • Experience working with virtualization (Docker)
  • Knowledge of relational databases and SQL
  • Knowledge of object-oriented design patterns and principles (Factory, Builder, Single Responsibility Principle, Liskov Substitution principle)

Further Information

Preference will be given to Canadian citizens and permanent residents in accordance with the Public Service Employment Act (S.C. 2003, c. 22, ss. 12, 13). If selected for an interview, Canadian citizens must provide proof of citizenship and non-Canadian citizens must provide proof of permanent residence. Students must also provide proof of address.

The position is available for 12 to 16-month work terms from May 2025 to Sep 2026. Please indicate on your cover letter your work term preference.

Preference may be given to students with higher academic standing. Students to whom an offer is made will be required to pass a check for Enhanced Security Clearance.

Students must be prepared for technical and behavioral interviews which will be conducted remotely or in the office.

We provide a flexible/hybrid work environment combining in-office collaboration and remote working where employees will work in the office at least three days per week (subject to change based on operational needs or future policy updates).

Office Location

4905 Dufferin Street, Toronto, ON M3H 5T4

About Environment and Climate Change Canada

At Environment and Climate Change Canada, our business is protecting the environment, conserving the country's natural heritage, and providing weather and meteorological information to keep Canadians informed and safe.

Environment and Climate Change Canada is building on its accomplishments with the environment through credible science, effective regulations and legislation, successful partnerships, and high-quality service delivery to Canadians.

We support sound environmental decisions. We work to repair the damage of the past, collect and pass on knowledge, and develop, implement and enforce policies to prevent future issues. We also work to ensure that Canadians have a safe, clean, and sustainable environment today, tomorrow, and well into the future.

Our workforce is made up of knowledgeable and dedicated employees from diverse backgrounds that are proud of the contribution they make to the environment. We have over 7000 employees from a broad range of fields including biology, chemistry, meteorology, climatology, engineering, commerce, communications, law enforcement, environmental sciences, hydrology, informatics, law, library science, policy, and more.

Environment and Climate Change Canada’s mandate is to:

Preserve and enhance the quality of the natural environment, including water, air, soil, flora and, fauna; Conserve Canada's renewable resources; Conserve and protect Canada's water resources; Forecast daily weather conditions and warnings, and provide detailed meteorological information to all of Canada; Enforce rules relating to boundary waters; and Coordinate environmental policies and programs for the federal government.

Please visit our website at: [ https://www.canada.ca/en/environment-climate-change.html ]
Download the WeatherCAN app at the Google play store or Apple store.

Dissemination development Environment and Climate Change Canada’s Weather Website delivers weather, water, and climate data to Canadians through various technologies (internet, mobile app, web services, and radio). In addition to providing Canadians with up-to-date information on past, present, and future weather conditions, Environment and Climate Change Canada offers multiple data access services to specialized users that require information. Our focus is ensuring that Canadians have access to data in a timely and efficient manner in an accessible format. These highly dynamic web and mobile applications are updated frequently with tight deadlines and undergo rigorous testing for each release.

Forecast Performance Analysis and Reporting development The Weather Forecast Performance and Reporting team works on developing cutting edge data mining software, focusing on providing a foundation of software and tools to improve the performance of the weather forecast operations. We work closely with meteorologists to analyze large amounts of weather data, and present that analysis in new and innovative ways.

Software developers in the Team use modern web framework technologies to create interactive web applications, following a continuous development process. Development emphasizes scalable architecture, reactive design, and reusable solutions.

jobDescription:
ASIC Digital Design Intern
Starting in 2025, this 12/16-month internship position will be with our Solutions Group in Mississauga or Markham , Canada.

What you will learn:
The following are examples of tasks that our past interns were involved in:

  • RTL coding, analog block modeling, and writing testbenches in SystemVerilog.
  • Defining synthesis design constraints and resolving STA issues.
  • Defining Clock/Reset domain crossing design constraints.
  • Debugging RTL and gate-level simulation failures.


Skill Requirements:

  • Proficient in languages such as C, SystemVerilog, Python and Perl.
  • Excellent knowledge of digital design theory.
  • Motivated, eager, and interested in ASIC digital design.


Education Requirements:

  • Enrolled in Computer or Electrical Engineering program, or similar.


Working at Synopsys, you’ll:

  • Be surrounded by people who are motivated by integrity, execution excellence, leadership, and passion.
  • Make an impact right away by helping our customers solve complex challenges.
  • Help us catalyze Smart Everything, where everything is getting smarter, linked, and safer.
  • Be part of a diverse workforce, where different perspectives, ideas, and backgrounds matter.
  • Be inspired by our “Yes, if” mindset, which drives our employees to challenge themselves and each other to shift perspectives and see what is possible, not impossible, when encountering a challenge.
  • Take pride in making a positive impact on our ecosystem, shareholders, each other, customers, communities, and the planet.

The Solutions Group provides high-quality, silicon-proven semiconductor IP solutions for SoC designs. The Synopsys IP portfolio includes logic libraries, embedded memories, analog IP, wired and wireless interface IP, security IP, embedded processors, and subsystems. To accelerate IP integration, software development, and silicon bring-up, Synopsys’ IP Accelerated initiative provides architecture design expertise, pre-verified and customizable IP subsystems, hardening, signal/power integrity analysis, and IP prototyping kits. Synopsys' extensive investment in IP quality, comprehensive technical support, and robust IP development methodology enables designers to reduce integration risk and accelerate time-to-market.

At Synopsys, we're at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we're powering it all with the world's most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you.

jobDescription:
The Power of Dreams is alive and well at Honda of Canada Mfg. (HCM). Located in Alliston, Ontario on 750 acres and employing more than 4,500 Associates, HCM is a 45-minute drive north of Toronto and 25 minutes south of Barrie. HCM began production in 1986 leading the way as the first Japanese automobile manufacturer to establish a production facility in Canada. Today, HCM is one of Honda's premier manufacturing facilities in the world producing the Honda Civic and CRV vehicles, including hybrid production. HCM is excited for its new chapter and journey towards electrification, including the highly anticipated EV and battery production plants that are expected in the coming years!

HCM has an opportunity as a New Model Quality Intern for a 16-month work term beginning May 2025 through August 2025. The successful candidate will become a team member in HCM’s Purchasing New Model (PN) department and will be exposed to the latest technology in a highly automated manufacturing facility.

The Purchasing New Model (PN) department is responsible for both supplied parts quality, and final vehicle quality during the development of our New Model vehicles from design development input, to supplier process development, and preparation for Mass Production launch. PN supports in responding to New Model concerns from the manufacturing departments regarding quality issues, contains part quality concerns from installation onto the vehicle, develops temporary/permanent countermeasures, and assesses/audits countermeasure effectiveness throughout New Model development.  PN ensures that suppliers are prepared and able to provide a quality product on a consistent basis at the required quantity to meet out production requirements for the life cycle of our vehicles.

Not sure what to expect while working as a New Model Quality Intern at HCM? You will be responsible for performing part inspections during event receiving inspection, as well as mechanical and functional verification of parts and design, ensuring parts meet both the drawing and HCM’s quality standards. You will effectively develop and lead cross-functional process improvements within the department, investigate the root causes of failures, and implement improvements within your assigned suppliers to prevent reoccurrence at future New Model events and future Mass Production. You will also collect and review supplier New Model documentation including PFMEA’s, Control plans, Product Validation (PV) Testing plans and PV Testing reports to ensure suppliers meet all Honda’s drawing and quality requirements. Hear from our Interns by clicking this link: https://linktr.ee/HCMRecruitment

First time working in a professional work environment? Don't worry! All our Engineering Interns are assigned and will work alongside an experienced mentor in your department. You will also receive training and mentorship from the Intern you are replacing – a wonderful way to learn and set an example for the students that follow in your footsteps!

Following your internship, you will have a final report and presentation in order to be considered for a permanent (yes, permanent) position within our Engineering Development Program (EDP) . What better way to return to school than knowing that you have a permanent position waiting for you following graduation?

Responsibilities:

  • New Model Part Development
  • Support New Model Problem Solving involving HCM, Design, and our supply base
  • Global Direct Pass (GDP) and Rejections Per Unit (RPU) follow up and investigation
  • Purchasing Completed Body Unit (CBU) investigations, countermeasure implementation, and repairs
  • Managing New Model Supplier relationships using NARS (North American Reporting System)
  • Part or CBU Outflow Prevention support including initial containment, yard / in- house expanded checks, inspection and/or repair support
  • Support trials at suppliers or HCM for New Model Tooling, Equipment and Manufacturing Process maturation
  • Support New Model launch activities at Suppliers or in the Factory
  • Communicating quality issues and related PN/Supplier activities internally and externally
  • Support Mass Production (MP) 2nd shift line calls and problem investigation

Requirements:

  • Must be within eight months of graduation at the completion of the internship term (currently in year three of a four-year degree, or year four of a five-year degree).
  • Must demonstrate self-motivation and initiative to learn, adapt, and execute projects
  • Must be willing to work hands on – don’t worry, we will provide the training! All skill levels are welcome, you just need to show the willingness!
  • Must have excellent time management and communication skills.
  • Must be willing to work overtime (and a lot of it!)
    • Many roles will require weekend work, including holidays and our shutdowns (1 week in July, 1 week in December). We provide alternate days off throughout the week to compensate for this. Oh, and did we mention overtime is paid?
  • Must be willing to work on the production line (training provided)
    • We will have you work on the production line at the onset of your internship as part of your training. This ensures you are always trained to jump in and help, develop an appreciation for the manufacturing line, and help build a relationship with your customers (production associates). You are required to provide lineside support, repair activities, checking of finished vehicles and similar functions as required.
  • Must be willing to travel domestically (sometimes internationally)
    • That’s right! You may travel to our Canadian suppliers or even our friends over the border. Valid Canadian Passport or B1 Visa is required for international travel)
  • Valid Full G Class Driver’s license with no restrictions is required
    • I’m sorry, there are no exceptions to this.
  • Must be willing to work 2nd shift
    • You will occasionally be required to support our 2nd shift (4:30pm-1:00am). This will be for 1 week at a time (subject to change). It may not sound the most appealing, but we promise you learn a lot on 2nd shift!

Preferred Experience:

  • Microsoft Office Suite (brush up on your Excel skills!)
  • Demonstrated experience with CAD software’s for electrical or mechanical design, interpretation, and/or analysis (e.g. Catia, Solidworks, AutoCAD, etc.)
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills (including presentation skills) in order to communicate complex problems, schedule amongst team members, and/or coordinate with suppliers and vendors
    • We do a lot of presentations – you will be an expert by the end of this internship!
  • Demonstrated ability to work hands on with basic hand tools and measurement equipment including wrenches, screwdrivers, Digital Multimeters, Soldering iron, air tools…. etc.
    • Anything counts here! No experience? That’s okay! A pro at building Ikea furniture? Great! Show us you are willing to learn!
  • Large team project work or technical projects demonstrating ability to succeed in a team environment
  • Project management experience
    • Lean into your school or extra-curricular projects! We will teach you our Engineering Flow (E-Flow) including developing the project scope, schedule creation, status tracking, and coordinating and supervising contractors. You just need to show us you have the foundation to do so!
  • Ability to work in an open concept environment and be extremely flexible
    • No days are the same at HCM. What makes a successful associate is someone who can pivot and adjust to our ever-changing environment. You may be asked to do something that is completely new to you – embrace it, welcome it, and take it as an opportunity to grow! Future you will thank you.

Additional Information:

HCM offers many activities for associates to get involved in! We have an on-site recreation center (free of charge) that offers a fully equipped fitness center, full size indoor ice rink, and outdoor and indoor courts. We have a (highly loved) hockey, baseball, and soccer league; we offer exercise classes, cross fit, and yoga; drop-in basketball and pickle ball. HCM hosts a spectacular annual Holiday Party and associates always love our Summer BBQ! HCM is also very involved in our community – we annually participate in the Honda Waterfront Run and the Barrie Dragon Boat Festival.

Become even more involved and join your fellow Intern community! They are always getting together for bowling, pizza nights, games and more!

Thought that was a lot? HCM also has five Business Resource Groups (BRG) you can get involved with (think extra-curricular club, but better):

  • Honda Young Professionals: “Enhance experiences and develop careers of Honda’s Young Professional by building community, improving engagement, and providing career resources and guidance.”
  • Women Powering Honda: “Empowering Women at Honda through impactful engagement, and enhancement opportunities in a safe and supportive work environment.”
  • BIPOC of Honda: “Work to foster professional growth and development and to advocate for pathways for these developmental opportunities for BIPOC individuals at HCM.”
  • EARTH (Environmental Actions Rewarding to Honda): “Cultivate Honda associate opportunities for environmental engagement at the facility and in the community.”

Are you someone that’s into cars (I’d sure hope so)? HCM also has a Velocity Motorsports Club (VMC)! Join a talented group of HCM associates as they prepare for another exciting race season! Not so much into racing but your personal car needs some work? Students are also eligible to use the fully equipped on-site vehicle service center.

At HCM, Respect for the Individual is a fundamental belief. We recognize, respect and value individual differences in one another. We are committed to creating equal opportunity for all associates to grow in a diverse and inclusive work environment while driving continuous improvement with Passion, delivering Joy and Value to our Customers.

HCM is committed to providing accommodation in its recruitment processes to applicants with disabilities, upon request. The accommodation provided will consider the applicant’s

accessibility needs. If you require accommodation at any time during the recruitment process or to successfully submit an application, please include that information in your application

jobDescription:
At The Six Semiconductor (TSS), our mission is to connect people and technology for a smarter world, by accelerating progress and bringing innovative ideas to life. As a semiconductor IP provider with a focus on System-on-Chip (SoC) memory sub-systems, we achieve this mission with our best-in-class mixed-signal designs combined with exceptional service. Our award-winning company is supported by a world-class engineering team with a long list of achievements and accomplishments in the semiconductor industry.

If you love to work and grow in a fast-paced environment where you can innovate and truly enjoy your work, please send your resume to careers@thesixsemi.com .

Responsibilities and Duties

  • Evaluation of TSS’s high speed PHY designs (LPDDR/GDDR/HBM PHYs) using bench lab equipment such as oscilloscopes, logic analyzers, BERTs, etc.
  • Work in a cutting edge electronics lab, applying Analog and Digital circuit concepts to understand and test TSS’ PHY design
  • Develop test methodologies and improvements to current test practices
  • Design and implement automated silicon test suites
  • Author silicon reports including functional and electrical characterization of IP
  • Supporting lab demonstration of TSS’s products
  • Supporting customers issues and debugs
  • Provide inputs for Silicon & PCB design requirements

Requirements

  • Currently in the process of obtaining a Bachelor’s, Master’s, or Doctorate in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or related field
  • Strong interest in circuit understanding and debug
  • Familiarity with some programming languages (i.e.Python, Perl, C/C++, SQL, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Assembly)
  • Experience in setup and operation of test instruments including oscilloscopes, spectrum analyzers, BERTs, logic analyzer and jitter measurements is an asset
  • Excellent communication and problem solving skills
  • Team player and willingness to learn
  • Knowledge in high-speed memory (GDDR/LPDDR/HBM) interfaces is a plus

Evertz has been recognized as one of Canada’s 50 best managed and top 100 fastest growing high-tech companies.  Evertz is a worldwide leader in design and manufacture of cutting edge multimedia products for the film & television broadcast industry.

You will receive tons of feedback and guidance.

• Understand the fundamentals of RF design.

This is our vision: a world with endless insights to tackle the challenges and opportunities of today and reveal the possibilities of tomorrow.

We’re looking for dedicated students who share our passion for ground-breaking technology and want to create a lasting future for you and Snowflake.

WHAT WE OFFER :

jobDescription:
Cerebras has developed a radically new chip and system to dramatically accelerate deep learning applications. Our system runs training and inference workloads orders of magnitude faster than contemporary machines, fundamentally changing the way ML researchers work and pursue AI innovation.

We are innovating at every level of the stack – from chip, to microcode, to power delivery and cooling, to new algorithms and network architectures at the cutting edge of ML research. Our fully-integrated system delivers unprecedented performance because it is built from the ground up for deep learning workloads.

Cerebras is building a team of exceptional people to work together on big problems. Join us!

About the Role:

As a Runtime Engineer, you will directly impact the performance at which deep learning models are trained on our “distributed systems” hardware and be responsible for enabling next-generation AI applications that require substantial computational capabilities. In this position, you will develop algorithms for execution, acceleration, partitioning, and routing of communication for dataflow graphs on a massively parallel, multi-core architecture.

Responsibilities:

  • Be able to understand the flow of data in a distributed system and how to characterize performance pain points
  • Develop algorithms for allocation of compute, communication, and memory resources
  • Measure, analyze, and improve execution of Runtime software (that is responsible for training large models with massive datasets)
  • Integrate successful optimizations into production software stack
  • Implement mathematical models in C++ or Python using discrete optimization techniques and standard libraries and packages

Requirements:

  • Enrolled within University of Toronto's PEY program with a degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or any other related disciplines
  • Strong proficiency in C/C++
  • Familiarity with Python or other scripting language
  • The ability to operate at multiple levels of abstraction in the software stack


Preferred Requirements:

  • Knowledge about distributed systems, memory subsystem of modern computers, and networking solutions

jobDescription:
Are you a dynamic individual with a passion for programming and a drive for excellence? We are seeking talented and enthusiastic Interns to join our R&D team, where you will be at the forefront of integrated circuit technology and workflow automation. This internship offers an incredible opportunity to gain hands-on experience in a fast-paced environment while contributing to the success of our DDR Memory PHY products. If you have a creative mindset and a hunger to learn, we want you on board!

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:

Circuit Technology: Work with different flows associated with integrated circuit design

Circuit Design Methodology: Assist in the definition and testing of integrated circuit design methodologies to standardize our product design process.

Python/Software Programming: Collaborate with our experienced hardware design teams to develop Python scripts and software programs for workflow automation. Utilize your coding skills to streamline processes, reduce manual effort, and improve efficiency.

Technical Documentation: Create clear and concise documentation, including code comments, process workflows, and user guides. Maintain comprehensive records of all decisions to aid team members and future developments.

Team Collaboration: Embrace teamwork and open communication, actively participating in meetings and sharing your insights to achieve collective goals effectively.

REQUIREMENTS:

* 3rd year engineering or computer science student

* Knowledge of electronics and integrated circuit technology
* Expert knowledge in Python programming with a strong understanding of data structures, algorithms
* Proficient in other scripting languages such as Perl, Tcl and shell scripts
* Extensive knowledge of LINUX/UNIX commands and environment
* Experience with version control systems (e.g., Perforce) and code collaboration platforms.
* Strong communication and time management skills, with the ability to work effectively in a team-oriented environment.
* Motivated, curious, and interested in integrated circuit design process

INTERNSHIP DETAILS:

* Location: Markham, Ontario, Canada or Ottawa, Ontario, Canada
* Duration: 16 months
* Start date: May 2025

Whether you're a system-on-chip (SoC) designer creating advanced semiconductors, or a software developer writing more secure, high-quality code, Synopsys has the solutions needed to deliver innovative products. jobDescription:
Untether AI is a rapidly growing Toronto startup building a next generation hardware AI accelerator for neural net inference. We're designing integrated circuits that will run neural nets orders of magnitude faster, while using less power. This class of chips will be the standard platform for running image recognition, speech synthesis, text-to-speech, and many other applications in data centers, mobile phones, and self-driving cars within the next 5 years.

With our second generation speedAI silicon up and running in the lab, our hardware product team is focused on a few primary areas:

  • Bringing speedAI to market:
  • Chip, board, and system validation (hands on lab work, scripting, etc.)
  • Firmware development and productization (Low level C++ coding)
  • Coding to automating data collection and analysis of speedAI silicon
  • Learning Statistical analysis tools (JMP, Galaxy, Spotfire, googlesheet, etc),
  • Creating and presenting customer and management documents

We are looking for self motivated and innately curious candidates. You can expect to be put in charge of an important project that will challenge you to learn and you will be provided with mentoring and guidance from veteran hardware engineers.
Because we're building new systems from the ground up, you'll get to work on new unsolved problems.

We encourage interdisciplinarity and learning, so if you have experience in hardware or software, come talk to us. But don't worry if you think your experience is too narrowly focused, we've got great projects for people with a wide range of interests and specializations.

Join our Product Test team and come learn about our hardware projects. You will work in a team with other hardware and software designers to deliver on Untether product development. In general, expect to work in a loose SCRUM like environment (weekly/biweekly work sprint with short-term deliverables) mixed with longer term self-guided project deliverables.

Some examples of tasks:

  • Schematic entry and design of circuit boards
  • Perform schematic and layout design reviews
  • Learn and use JMP (statistical tools) to ensure product quality and validate perfoemance
  • Verify circuit boards using lab instruments, software scripts and tools
  • Validate and test firmware in the lab
  • Create test specification documents to provide to customer and vendors
  • Support hardware and software engineering groups in product testing

We don't have strict skill requirements, but of course prior experience in the tools and skills we use is a plus:
- Schematic design and capture
- Tools and programming languages we use: Python, C, C++, shell scripts
- Statistical analysis skills
- Use of lab instruments such as oscilloscope, multimeter, logic analyzer, power supply, soldering station
- Topics and skills we are interested in include: pcb design, test tools and instrumentation, artificial intelligence, neural net training and inference

jobDescription:
The Power of Dreams is alive and well at Honda of Canada Mfg. (HCM). Located in Alliston, Ontario on 750 acres and employing more than 4,500 Associates, HCM is a 45-minute drive north of Toronto and 25 minutes south of Barrie. HCM began production in 1986 leading the way as the first Japanese automobile manufacturer to establish a production facility in Canada. Today, HCM is one of Honda's premier manufacturing facilities in the world producing the Honda Civic and CRV vehicles, including hybrid production. HCM is excited for its new chapter and journey towards electrification, including the highly anticipated EV and battery production plants that are expected in the coming years!

HCM has an exciting opportunity for a 16-month work term beginning May 2025 through August 2026. The successful candidate will be working with many different departments at Honda in conjunction with the IT department to ensure we are all working towards the same goal. In addition, there will be opportunity to connect with peers from other Honda sites around North America to understand and foster work relationships that will assist in building technology and implementation standards for IT engineering. The Business Intelligence Intern will focus on data analytics, business intelligence, and database administration. All of these elements play an important role in our push to develop SmartFactory and Industry 4.0 solutions.

Hear from our Interns by clicking this link: https://linktr.ee/HCMRecruitment

First time working in a professional work environment? Don't worry! All our Engineering Interns are assigned and will work alongside an experienced mentor in your department. You will also receive training and mentorship from the Intern you are replacing – a wonderful way to learn and set an example for the students that follow in your footsteps!

Responsibilities:

  • Design, build and deploy BI solutions (e.g. Power BI, Tableau, Qlikview, etc.) into 2 large frame plants based on departmental requirements
  • Reviewing, supporting, and developing in concert with existing Application teams, and Business teams, appropriate database architecture and queries and transform them into visual leading indicators.
  • Developing in concert with existing Data Services, and Business teams, appropriate data analytics solutions to facilitate business units to improve efficiency through evaluation of their operational data.

Requirements:

  • Must be within eight months of graduation at the completion of the internship term. (Currently in year three of a four-year degree, or year four of a five-year degree.)
  • Currently enrolled in an Information Technology related degree (Computer Engineering, Software Engineering, etc.)
  • Must demonstrate self-motivation and initiative to learn, adapt, and execute projects
  • Must be willing to work hands on – don’t worry, we will provide the training! All skill levels are welcome, you just need to show the willingness!
  • Must have excellent time management and communication skills.
  • Must be willing to work overtime (and A LOT of it!)
    • Many roles will require weekend work, including holidays and our shutdowns (1 week in July, 1 week in December). We provide alternate days off throughout the week to compensate for this. Oh, and did we mention overtime is paid?
  • Must be willing to work on the production line (training provided)
    • We will have you work on the production line at the onset of your internship as part of your training. This ensures you are always trained to jump in and help, develop an appreciation for the manufacturing line, and help build a relationship with your customers (production associates).
  • Must be willing to work 2nd shift
    • You will occasionally be required to support our 2nd shift (4:30pm-1:00am). This will be for 1 week at a time (subject to change). It may not sound the most appealing, but we promise you learn a lot on 2nd shift!

Preferred Experience:

  • Experience designing, building, or deploying business intelligence (BI) solutions (particularly Power BI, Tableau, Qlikview, etc.)
  • Database architecture and device experience (particularly familiar with Microsoft SQL Server & IBM DB2)
  • Data Analytics and experience with delivering data solutions for business consumption
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills (including presentation skills) in order to communicate complex problems, schedule amongst team members, and/or coordinate with suppliers and vendors
    • We do a lot of presentations – you will be an expert by the end of this internship!
  • Large team project work or technical projects demonstrating ability to succeed in a team environment
  • Project management experience
  • Lean into your school or extra-curricular projects! We will teach you our Engineering Flow (E-Flow) including developing the project scope, schedule creation, status tracking, and coordinating and supervising contractors. You just need to show us you have the foundation to do so!
  • Ability to work in an open concept environment and be extremely flexible
    • No days are the same at HCM. What makes a successful associate is someone who can pivot and adjust to our ever-changing environment. You may be asked to do something that is completely new to you – embrace it, welcome it, and take it as an opportunity to grow! Future you will thank you.

Additional Information:

HCM offers many activities for associates to get involved in! We have an on-site recreation center (free of charge) that offers a fully equipped fitness center, full size indoor ice rink, and outdoor and indoor courts. We have a (highly loved) hockey, baseball, and soccer league; we offer exercise classes, cross fit, and yoga; drop-in basketball and pickle ball. HCM hosts a spectacular annual Holiday Party and associates always love our Summer BBQ! HCM is also very involved in our community – we annually participate in the Honda Waterfront Run and the Barrie Dragon Boat Festival.

Become even more involved and join your fellow Intern community! They are always getting together for bowling, pizza nights, games and more!

Thought that was a lot? HCM also has five Business Resource Groups (BRG) you can get involved with (think extra-curricular club, but better):

  • Honda Young Professionals: “Enhance experiences and develop careers of Honda’s Young Professional by building community, improving engagement, and providing career resources and guidance.”
  • Women Powering Honda: “Empowering Women at Honda through impactful engagement, and enhancement opportunities in a safe and supportive work environment.”
  • BIPOC of Honda: “Work to foster professional growth and development and to advocate for pathways for these developmental opportunities for BIPOC individuals at HCM.”
  • EARTH (Environmental Actions Rewarding to Honda): “Cultivate Honda associate opportunities for environmental engagement at the facility and in the community.”

Are you someone that’s into cars (I’d sure hope so)? HCM also has a Velocity Motorsports Club (VMC) ! Join a talented group of HCM associates as they prepare for another exciting race season! Not so much into racing but your personal car needs some work? Students are also eligible to use the fully equipped on-site vehicle service center.

At HCM, Respect for the Individual is a fundamental belief. We recognize, respect and value individual differences in one another. We are committed to creating equal opportunity for all associates to grow in a diverse and inclusive work environment while driving continuous improvement with Passion, delivering Joy and Value to our Customers.

HCM is committed to providing accommodation in its recruitment processes to applicants with disabilities, upon request. The accommodation provided will consider the applicant’s

accessibility needs. If you require accommodation at any time during the recruitment process or to successfully submit an application, please include that information in your application.

Cerebras has developed a radically new chip and system to dramatically accelerate deep learning applications. Our system runs training and inference workloads orders of magnitude faster than contemporary machines, fundamentally changing the way ML researchers work and pursue AI innovation.

Cerebras is building a team of exceptional people to work together on big problems. Join us!

As an applied machine learning engineering assistant, you will take today's state-of-the-art solutions in various verticals and adapt them to run on the new Cerebras system architecture. You will get to see how deep learning is being applied to some of the world's most difficult problems today and help ML researchers in these fields to innovate more rapidly and in ways that are not currently possible on other hardware systems.

  • Familiar with state-of-the-art transformer architectures for language and vision model.
  • Bring up new state-of-the art model on Cerebras System and function validation.
  • Train a model to convergence, and hyper-parameter tuning.
  • Optimize model code to run efficiently on Cerebras System.
  • Explore new model architecture that take advantage of Cerebras unique capabilities.
  • Develop new approaches for solving real world AI problems on various domains.

  • Familiarity with JAX/TensorFlow/PyTorch
  • Good understanding of how to define custom layers and back-propagate through them.

  • Design innovative training algorithms to improve model quality and computational efficiency.

  • Design and conduct research experiments to demonstrate the efficiency and robustness of novel algorithms.

jobDescription:
About Arcadis
Arcadis is the world's leading company delivering sustainable design, engineering, and consultancy solutions for natural and built assets. We are more than 36,000 people, in over 70 countries, dedicated to improving quality of life. Everyone has an important role to play. With the power of many curious minds, together we can solve the world's most complex challenges and deliver more impact together.

Mobility

We partner with our clients across the globe to design thriving and connected cities and communities that enable opportunity for all and keep the world moving. Climate change, urbanization and digitization trends are requiring today’s mobility projects and systems to address an evolving set of demands from the world’s growing population. We design connected, sustainable solutions that integrate existing infrastructure with new technologies, and optimize the mobility of people and goods.

Role Description

This is an exciting opportunity for those seeking a career in transportation planning, and are looking make an impact on the future of people and goods movement throughout the Greater Toronto Area and across Canada. Your primary role will be to perform technical analysis, data visualization, and report writing to support rapid transit planning studies, travel demand forecasting, transportation system/network planning and operations, environmental assessments, transportation master plans, and active transportation plans. The work we do is highly analytical and data driven in order predict how travel patterns may change in the future. We're looking for a highly motivated, enthusiastic, collaborative and independent individual who is willingness to learn and take initiative. This position is within the transportation systems practice out of our Toronto office (55 St. Clair Ave).

Role accountabilities

  • Conduct research and technical analysis in support of long-range transportation master plans
  • environmental assessments, business cases and active transportation plans
  • Conduct travel demand forecasting and travel demand model development using Emme, TransCAD, VISUM software
  • Support transit service planning and strategic planning
  • Document and verify field conditions
  • Prepare schedules and cost estimates
  • Support of business development and proposal initiatives
  • Various report writing.

Qualifications & Experiences

  • Candidates must be enrolled in an Engineering, Economics, Planning or Geography program;
  • Candidates must have demonstrable excellent oral and written communications skills;
  • Able to work effectively independently and on a team;
  • Strong interest in transportation engineering and planning;
  • Skills and experience in transportation planning software (e.g. Emme, VISUM, ArcGIS) would be an asset;
  • Ability to analyze, visualize and report data using computer programming tools (e.g. Python, R) would be an asset.

Why Arcadis?
We can only achieve our goals when everyone is empowered to be their best. We believe everyone's contribution matters. It's why we are pioneering a skills-based approach, where you can harness your unique experience and expertise to carve your career path and maximize the impact we can make together.


You'll do meaningful work, and no matter what role, you'll be helping to deliver sustainable solutions for a more prosperous planet. Make your mark, on your career, your colleagues, your clients, your life and the world around you.

Together, we can create a lasting legacy.

Additional information
As part of Arcadis' selection process, candidates may be requested to consent to background checks relevant to the role under consideration for, prior to receiving a job offer (as applicable under state law). These could include work references, education and credential confirmation, employment verification and driver's license record.

We thank all applicants for their interest. However, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Arcadis is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability.

Join Arcadis. Create a legacy.

jobTitle: A&MS Circuit Design Engineering Intern (16 Months)
jobDescription:
Join us as an Analog and Mixed-Signal Design Engineering Intern in the PLL design team. Our designs enable the next generation of datacenters, automobiles and communications networks. Our design environment is best-in-class with a full suite of IC design tools, supplemented by custom in-house tools, and supported by an experienced software/CAD team.

What you will learn:

* Working as part of a highly experienced mixed signal design team, you will gain practical experience in many aspects of high-end SERDES and PLL designs including (but not limited to):
* PLL system and noise analysis concepts - Contributing to the PLL system model (Knowledge in Python and/or Matlab is an asset)
* Simulating and optimizing the performance of analog and mixed-signal circuits
* High speed logic and clock path design, optimization and verification
* Electromigration (EM), IR drop (IR) and aging analysis on high-performance circuits

* Collaboration opportunities with best-in-class EDA (Electronic Design Automation) tools and CAD tools developments/enhancements

Skill Requirements:
* We're looking for motivated and curious individuals that are interested in integrated circuit technology
* You possess excellent knowledge of CMOS principles and circuit theory
* You have taken (or taking) courses related to analog circuits, control theory, digital circuits
* You are proficient in scripting languages such as Python, Perl and/or shell scripts

Education Requirements:

Must currently be a 3rd or 4th year student enrolled in a Bachelor’s Program specializing in Electrical/Computer Engineering, or similar

At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you.

jobDescription:
The Mosaic Company (NYSE: MOS) is the world’s leading integrated producer of concentrated phosphate and potash—two of the three most important nutrients in agriculture. We employ more than 13,000 people in six countries to serve farmers all over the world. Our Headquarters is in Lithia, Florida with operations throughout North America (U.S./Canada) and South America.

At Mosaic We Help the World Grow the Food it Needs - Apply today and join our team!

Electrical Engineer Co-Op/Intern

An Electrical Engineer Co-Op/Intern at Mosaic will be assigned routine electrical engineering-related duties, including projects and management. Our student opportunities allow you to learn from Professional Engineers, offer competitive pay, a relocation package and the opportunity to work with a global leader on exciting projects and much more

Where will you work:

Mosaic Potash Belle Plaine is a solution mine and refinery located 50 kilometers west of Regina on the Trans-Canada Highway. It is the world’s largest solution mine that is full of talented people and is home to over 500 dedicated employees.

Housing and relocation can be provided for qualified candidates.

Term

May 12 - August 22, 2025

Full time Co-Op/Internship. 36-40 hours a week on site.

What will you do?

Day to day duties could include:

  • Electrical power system reliability improvement projects.

  • Participation in root cause failure analysis and execution of associated corrective actions.

  • Troubleshooting of electrical power systems related issues that may arise, such as power outages, electrical faults, and equipment failures.

  • Software based electrical power system modelling (including data collection, field verification, and model modifications).

  • Work on electrical power system relay network expansion.

  • Analysis of existing electrical preventative maintenance plans, and development and implementation of new plans.

  • Participation in inspection and maintenance of industrial electrical equipment including medium voltage switchgear, transformers, motor control centres, starters, variable frequency drives, and various digital protective devices and relays.

  • Communicate with various levels of personnel throughout the organization, including management, engineers (of various disciplines), journeyman tradespersons both electricians and mechanics.

  • Participation in team meetings and meetings specific to the project assignment.

  • Adhering to Mosaic’s mission, guiding principles and priorities, and key competencies.

What do you need for this role?

  • Second year or higher pursuing a bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering.

  • Basic knowledge of electrical theory to include AC distribution and transformation, AC/DC. motor control, power/analog/digital electronics and electromagnetic properties is required.

  • Basic computer skills required, and some computer programming experience preferred.

  • Experience with electrical power system modelling software would be an asset.

  • 72% Percentage or higher.

  • 1-2 years of experience volunteering, working with student/school organizations, or work is required

  • Previous internship or co-op experience is preferred

  • Reliable transportation and valid driver’s license - You will need to be able to travel to and from sites and/or office.

  • Basic computer skills are required

  • Experience working in a team environment is a must

  • Familiarity with an industrial environment is highly desirable

  • Effective verbal communication skills is a plus

  • Physical work environment is occasionally outdoors with exposure to varying degrees of hot and cold environments

  • Selected candidates will be required to successfully complete the following: Post-offer/pre-placement drug and alcohol screening, background check, physical, functional capacity examination.

The physical demands described are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

  • Must be able to safely perform the essential functions of the job without posing a direct threat to the safety of his or her own self, or the safety of others.

  • Able to lift approximately 0-25 lbs. occasionally.

  • Able to climb stairs and work at various heights.

  • Able to distinguish varying or specific colors, patterns or materials.

  • Able to hear, with or without correction.

  • Able to read, write and understand basic English.

  • Able to see, with or without correction.

  • Able to use fine hand motor skills.

  • Able to wear a respirator.

  • Able to work rotating shifts and overtime as required.

  • Must be able to work a 12-hour shift.

  • Must be authorized to work in Canada.

jobTitle: 206630: GBM - Client Insights and Analytics Coop Fall 2025
jobDescription:
Requisition ID: 206630

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

Term: September 2025 – August 2026

Application Deadline: 16/02/2025

How do I apply?

For students applying to our internship/co-op or new graduate programs, we do not require resumes! We believe in evaluating you through relationships over resumes and are focused on learning about who you are and what you’re interested in to uncover your true potential. Instead, we ask that as part of your application you complete the below:

  1. Complete your PLUM Profile here and save as a screenshot.

  2. Complete a short one-way video interview here.

  3. Apply to the role and when the application asks for your resume, instead upload the screenshot of your PLUM Profile.

*To be considered for student opportunities at Scotiabank, Tangerine, and MD Financial you must complete all steps above.

There's no better way to kickstart your career than to do a co-op or internship with Scotiabank! During your work term, you’ll have the opportunity to be part of a winning team, build your network, and discover what you love – all while getting paid to do it! There’s a place for every type of student at Scotiabank and all that we ask for is that you have passion and strong AOO (Attitude, Ownership and Opportunity).

Global Banking and Markets (GBM) provides corporate and institutional clients with lending and transaction services, investment banking, advice, and access to capital markets. GBM is a full-service wholesale bank in the Americas, with operations in 21 countries, serving clients across Canada, the United States, Latin America, Europe, and Asia-Pacific.

Client Insights and Analytics is part of the COO (Chief Operating Officer’s) office in Global Banking and Markets. Our mandate is to lead the execution of our business strategies through powerful reporting and analytics. We are closely integrated with our business partners to drive adoption, and client strategies/insights and opportunities.

Is this role right for you? In this role, you will:

  • Assist our teams in report engineering, data analytics and data engineering and business relationship management.

  • Work with our relationship managers for business lines including Corporate & Investment Banking, Capital Markets, Global Business Payments and International Corporate and Commercial Banking.

  • Help leverage internal and external client data to facilitate opportunity identification.

  • Support adoption, change management and enhancement of our CRM (client relationship management) system.

  • Attend program meetings, and facilitate organization and follow-up as required.

  • Carry out ad-hoc projects and tasks as required.

Do you have the skills and requirements that will enable you to succeed in this role? – We’d love to work with you if:

  • You are currently enrolled in post-secondary education.

  • You love to learn and envision yourself working for an international organization that heavily invests in your future.

  • You enjoy being involved in extracurricular activities such as conferences, clubs, and competitions/hackathons.

  • You are interested in or have knowledge of the capital markets and wholesale banking business.

  • You have experience working on a major project and/or initiative in a team.

  • You are comfortable dealing with ambiguity and a matrix-based environment.

  • You have excellent written and oral communication skills.

  • You have advanced experience with Excel.

  • You have experience with programming languages such as Python and C++.

  • You have considerable initiative, curiosity, creativity, and attention to detail.

  • You have a high level of energy, commitment, and a strong sense of teamwork.

What’s in it for you?

  • You’ll be part of a diverse, collaborative, innovative, and high-performing team.

  • In-depth training to prepare you for the role, as well as ongoing coaching and feedback to help you succeed!

  • Exclusive student events such as Scotia Student Day, Lunch & Learns, leadership panels, and much more!

  • Bank-wide orientation to learn more about Scotiabank and gain exposure to senior leadership across the organization.

  • You will be provided with an excellent opportunity for learning and personal development, especially if you wish to gain exposure to global capital markets, and the critical real-time financial data needed and utilized to move key business lines forward.

jobTitle: Analog and Mixed Signal Layout Intern
jobDescription:
The Analog and Mixed Signal Layout team is seeking a highly motivated and innovative engineer who will be accountable for designing physical layout of custom analog and digital components. As an Analog and Mixed Signal R&D Engineering Intern, you will be working on a variety of advanced SERDES IP projects including the latest standards in 112G and 128G SERDES. This position offers an excellent opportunity to work with skilled local and global teams of analog, digital and mixed signal engineers to deliver high-end solutions for various customers in a fast-paced environment. In this position, you will have an opportunity to explore the latest cutting edge semiconductor technologies and learn from experts in this field. Positions are available in our Markham and Mississauga offices.

The Solutions Group provides high-quality, silicon-proven semiconductor IP solutions for SoC designs. The Synopsys IP portfolio includes logic libraries, embedded memories, analog IP, wired and wireless interface IP, security IP, embedded processors, and subsystems. To accelerate IP integration, software development, and silicon bring-up, Synopsys’ IP Accelerated initiative provides architecture design expertise, pre-verified and customizable IP subsystems, hardening, signal/power integrity analysis, and IP prototyping kits. Synopsys' extensive investment in IP quality, comprehensive technical support, and robust IP development methodology enables designers to reduce integration risk and accelerate time-to-market.

At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you.

Synopsys Canada ULC values the diversity of our workforce. We are committed to provide access & opportunity to individuals with disabilities and will provide reasonable accommodation to individuals throughout the recruitment and employment process. Should you require an accommodation, please contact hr-help-canada@synopsys.com .

jobDescription:
Software Engineer (Co-op)

Mission

Tetra Trust was founded in 2019 and is Canada’s first and currently only registered trust company custodian for digital assets. As a trust company, Tetra is the first to offer a custody solution with the asset protection and the financial controls institutional entities need to operate within the digital asset market. To do so we have partnered with some of the technology leaders in the space and remain committed to stay on the cutting edge of digital asset custody.

We are now looking for a co-op student for a 12- or 16-month term starting May 2025.

What will you do

  • Make meaningful technical contributions to our institutional digital asset custody product by delivering secure, resilient, highly available, and supportable software
  • Work through the phases of discovery, requirements, design, implementation, and deployment on projects
  • Collaborate across the company to build products that have visibility, transparency, and tracking for agreed upon timelines
  • Participate in determining task priorities and deadlines as well as providing feedback on other projects and team milestones
  • Shape the foundation of the product and business that you work on

Why choose Tetra

  • Gain experience with cryptocurrency, cryptography, and cybersecurity
  • Solve interesting, challenging, and unique problems in the ever evolving field of digital asset custody
  • Deliver a high-quality system that will have a growing number of customers
  • Work on a collaborative team that strives to learn and grow
  • Learn to create quality software with well-defined specifications in a supported environment

What we are looking for

  • Working towards a degree in Computer Science, similar technical field of study, or equivalent practical experience
  • Commitment and accountability for quality, technical excellence, and results
  • Curiosity and enthusiasm to learn, experiment, and deliver innovative solutions
  • Excellent communication skills in verbal and written English

Highly desired past experience/future interest

  • Experience designing and implementing high security, mission-critical systems
  • Experience shipping production code with full instrumentation: deployment, logging, monitoring, and documentation
  • Experience creating web services and evolving REST APIs
  • Experience delivering software in a highly regulated environment
  • Familiarity with constructing managed and automated infrastructure
  • Experience with frontend development (e.g. HTML, CSS, React.js)
  • Experience with AWS
  • Knowledge of serverless
  • Strong understanding of blockchain technology and cryptocurrencies including projects outside of professional environments

Tetra’s tech stack currently consists of Node.js, TypeScript, and React.js. However, there are no requirements to be proficient in these technologies. Tetra’s expectation is that the successful candidate can quickly become productive with any existing or new technologies as required for the role—you have the ability and eagerness to learn.

We know diverse teams make strong teams. We welcome people of diverse backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. If you require accommodation during the application process, simply let us know and we’ll ensure it’s a positive experience for you.

jobDescription:
The Opportunity

May 2025 – August 2026

Join our dynamic Cloud team as an Intern - Cloud Analyst and gain hands-on experience in the rapidly evolving field of cloud computing. In this role, you will support the deployment, management, and optimization of cloud resources across Hybrid Cloud environment (Azure, VMware vSphere, Openstack). This internship offers an excellent opportunity to develop practical skills in cloud technology, data analysis, and technical problem-solving while contributing to impactful projects.

Who you’ll work with

You will be a member of the Cloud and Compute Engineering team.  We are a medium-sized team of highly skilled Engineers and experienced IT professionals that work with all areas of IT at the forefront of innovation initiatives. We also support all stable and robust technologies our business partners depend on to enable the business.

What you’ll do

jobDescription:
Environment and Climate Change Canada is looking for students to join the Applied Science Applications - Prediction Section in several roles. Each role requires a distinct skill set and your interest and abilities for each of these will be discussed during the interview.

You will have the opportunity to contribute to all aspects of the development process and work on complex scientific weather applications. While many organizations assign students to highly restricted roles, we expect students to grow into a role in which they participate fully in the development process - students are treated no differently than full-time employees. Assigned tasks may include design, coding, testing, performance analysis, debugging, system installation/configuration, code reviews, and documentation. All development follows a certified ISO9000 process for which you will receive training. To contribute effectively to our dynamic, team-based approach to software development, strong communication skills are required.

NinJo Forecaster Workstation - Multiple Roles The NinJo forecaster workstation project is an international collaboration between Canada, Germany, Denmark, and Switzerland to develop a meteorological visualization and production system to support weather forecasting. NinJo is a mission critical software application, supported 24/7 in forecast offices across Canada and worldwide. The software is written primarily in Java, and is highly configurable using XML.

The NinJo interface uses layer-based visualization of different data types to provide meteorologists with a complete picture of atmospheric conditions. Canada is responsible for several layers including Radar, Lightning, Warning, Hurricane, Satellite and Interactive Graphical Editing (IGE). These components, along with many others, allow meteorologists to create and publish graphical forecast products and text bulletins.

NinJo Forecaster Workstation – NinJo consortium Software Developer A NinJo software developer will work on the development and maintenance of forecasting and production tools written in Java, primarily on the NinJo client. This will involve working with real users to enhance the NinJo software, either through bug fixes or implementing new features. The NinJo project uses various development tools such as Perforce, Maven, Jenkins, TestLink, and VisualVM to name a few. It also uses various commercial project-tracking tools such as Atlassian Confluence and JIRA.

NinJo Forecaster Workstation – Aviation (TAF) Software Developer A Software Developer will work on the TAF Editor and related components that support the production of Aviation Forecast for the purpose of flight planning and airport traffic management. This component is built on top of the NinJo platform and relies on the same technologies and processes as other NinJo components like Java, Perforce, Maven, Jenkins, etc. The development process will involve interacting with users for requirement analysis, developing prototypes, testing, and releasing software into production grade environments.

Warning Project Renewal - Multiple Roles Have an impact on the lives and safety of all Canadians. Be part of a small team that develops ground breaking changes to Canada's weather warning system. This project introduces new interactive tools for the forecasters to create and manage weather warning data, as well as new automated processing of that data to generate corresponding public alerts that are distributed to Canadians through various forms of media. Gain experience in Java and Linux while working on interactive features or on back end data processing.

Warning Project Renewal – NinJo Weather Event Layer Software Developer Become a full member of the project’s client side team. Develop interactive editing and production features for a specialized GIS workstation software. The team has an agile process and uses a series of tools for task tracking, code versioning, code reviews, automated builds, and automated testing. Interact closely with our users (forecasters) and with our international partners.

Warning Project Renewal – DMS backend (MWAS connection) Software Developer Become a full member of the project's backend team supporting the Meteorological Service of Canada (MSC) Weather Alerting System (MWAS). Develop for a complex backend network of individual Java applications that augment, aggregate and disseminate life saving weather related information to the Canadian public in real time. Information issued from Meteorologists on the client side is reconciled into individual products and disseminated to various clients. Become a part of maintaining and supporting a mission critical system with real world impacts, including the dissemination of tornado and severe thunderstorm warnings.

Education Requirements

Positions are available for students that have completed their 3rd year in a relevant discipline such as these preferred disciplines:

  • Computer Engineering
  • Computer Science
  • Engineering Science (Electrical and Computer)

Asset skills and qualifications:

  • Experience with OOP (Java, C/C++, Python, etc.)
  • Experience building GUIs (JavaFX or similar)
  • Experience in a UNIX / Linux environment, including shell scripting
  • Experience with version control (Git, Perforce)
  • Experience working with virtualization (Docker)
  • Ability to effectively analyze, evaluate and solve problems
  • Ability to communicate effectively and work in a team environment
  • Ability to work independently
  • Knowledge of relational databases and SQL
  • Knowledge of software development life cycle methodologies (Iterative, Agile, etc.)
  • Knowledge of object-oriented design patterns and principles (Factory, Builder, Single Responsibility Principle, Liskov Substitution principle)

Further Information

will be given to Canadian citizens and permanent residents in accordance with the Public Service Employment Act (S.C. 2003, c. 22, ss. 12, 13). If selected for an interview, Canadian citizens must provide proof of citizenship and non-Canadian citizens must provide proof of permanent residence. Students must also provide proof of address.

The positions are available for 12 to 16-month work terms from May 2025 to September 2026. Please indicate on your cover letter your work term preference.

This role is hybrid 2 days a week on-site in Toronto (4905 Dufferin St.) starting in May and 3 days a week on site starting in September.

Preference may be given to students with higher academic standing. Students to whom an offer is made will be required to pass a check for Enhanced Security Clearance.

Students must be prepared for technical and behavioral interviews which will be conducted remotely or in-office.

We provide a flexible/hybrid work environment combining in-office collaboration and remote working where employees will work in the office at least one day per week.

About Environment and Climate Change Canada

At Environment and Climate Change Canada, our business is protecting the environment, conserving the country's natural heritage, and providing weather and meteorological information to keep Canadians informed and safe.

Environment and Climate Change Canada is building on its accomplishments with the environment through credible science, effective regulations and legislation, successful partnerships, and high-quality service delivery to Canadians.

We support sound environmental decisions. We work to repair the damage of the past, collect and pass on knowledge, and develop, implement and enforce policies to prevent future issues. We also work to ensure that Canadians have a safe, clean, and sustainable environment today, tomorrow, and well into the future.

Our workforce is made up of knowledgeable and dedicated employees from diverse backgrounds that are proud of the contribution they make to the environment. We have over 7000 employees from a broad range of fields including biology, chemistry, meteorology, climatology, engineering, commerce, communications, law enforcement, environmental sciences, hydrology, informatics, law, library science, policy, and more.

Environment and Climate Change Canada’s mandate is to:

Preserve and enhance the quality of the natural environment, including water, air, soil, flora and, fauna; Conserve Canada's renewable resources; Conserve and protect Canada's water resources; Forecast daily weather conditions and warnings, and provide detailed meteorological information to all of Canada; Enforce rules relating to boundary waters; and Coordinate environmental policies and programs for the federal government.

Please visit our website at: [ https://www.canada.ca/en/environment-climate-change.html ]
Download the WeatherCAN app at the Google play store or Apple store.

jobTitle: Full-Stack Software Developer and Analyst (16 months)
jobDescription:
There’s a New Energy on Board! Our company MHI RJ Aviation Group (MHIRJ) provides comprehensive critical operational, engineering and customer support solutions including maintenance, refurbishment,
technical publications, marketing and sales activities for the global regional aircraft industry.

Headquartered in Boisbriand, Quebec, and bolstered by an Aerospace Engineering Center, MHIRJ’s network of service centers, support offices and parts depots are positioned in important aviation hubs in the U.S., Canada and Germany. A wholly owned subsidiary of Mitsubishi Heavy Industries, Ltd, MHI RJ Aviation Group includes MHI RJ Aviation ULC (Canada), MHI RJ Aviation Inc. (U.S.A.) and MHI RJ Aviation GmbH (Germany). The Reliability and Cost Analysis Services team is responsible for managing aircraft reliability data, business intelligence systems and aircraft maintenance cost.

In this role you will contribute to leveraging data to create value for the internal and external stakeholders. This will be accomplished through the development, delivery and support of new and existing tools and applications.

Your tasks will include:
- Deliver web applications that provide an overview and detailed information about airline fleets
- Build a tool (or set of tools) on MHIRJ's Business Intelligence platform (MicroStrategy or Python
basis tool) that allows for quick and efficient monitoring of the reliability performance of the
CRJ100/200/700/900/1000 products.
- Take ownership of customer success by focusing on their needs when we design features, write
code, write tests and fix bugs;
- Build your own server-side Python code and make use of open source to create a robust high-performance backend
- Implement responsive front-end using React JS
- Make documentation associated with the tool(s)
- Develop and implement high level algorithms using Machine Learning/Deep Learning
- Identify, manage, analyze, and interpret data to support the creation of meaningful and actionable
insights to support the growth of our businesses
- Continually work with data through various parts of the data life cycle (i.e. Build data pipelines,
feature engineering, data deep dives, machine learning model development, etc.)
- Update heavy-check non-routine findings and aging analysis for CRJ by using service center data
- Work with other developers through code reviews and design sessions to refine code
- Continuous development and maintenance of existing applications

You will develop the following skills:
- Software Development and Deployment
- Working in a development team
- Cloud architecture, deployment and authentication

The skills you bring:
- Are enrolled in Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Computer Science or a similar engineering program
- Have knowledge in programming languages: Python, JavaSript, C#
- Have knowledge of databases and SQL language (SQL Server, Oracle)
- Preferred: MS Office suite (particularly Excel, Word and PowerPoint) and business intelligence tools
(one or more of Power BI, Tableau or MicroStrategy)
- Preferred: Have knowledge of GIT and Cloud Infrastructure and Development (MS Azure, Devops)
- Are an excellent communicator and self-starter. Strong team player. Detail oriented.

Additional details:
- Position located at Mississauga, Ontario – flexible working schedule with expectation to be physically working at the office when required
