jobDescription:
Birch Hill is recruiting Co-op Analysts to join Canada’s premier Private Equity Data Science & Strategy team. Our team is growing quickly, and we are looking for motivated, intelligent candidates who love data, strategy, and solving complex problems. We are highly analytical with diverse backgrounds in consulting, investment banking, engineering, and pure and applied math and science. We intensely focus on understanding and improving the inner workings of companies and processes to unlock value. For us, data is the means to an end, not simply the end.

About Birch Hill

Birch Hill is a Canadian mid-market private equity firm with a long history of driving growth in our portfolio companies and delivering returns to our investors. Based in Toronto, we currently have over $5 billion in capital under management. Since 1994, we have made over 71 investments, including MLSE, CCM Hockey, SleepCountry, Softchoice, and Constellation Software. Today, our 14 partner companies collectively represent one of Canada’s largest corporate entities with over $9 billion in total revenue and more than 30,000 employees.

About the Data Science & Strategy Team

The Data Science & Strategy Team focuses on creating value for our companies by enabling data-driven decision making through timely data and advanced analytics.  With appropriate information, systems and processes, our companies optimize their competitive positioning and profitably grow. We lead a wide array of project archetypes, all grounded by a foundational excellence in analytics and measuring success. Informed by Birch Hill’s investment premise, our projects support key components of the company’s competitive strategy.

We partner with portfolio companies as not only technical leaders, but also strategic leaders. We enthusiastically subscribe to the “Where to Play, How to Win, Measure Success” strategic framework. Past projects include, but are not limited to, market mapping, customer lifetime value, Five Forces analysis, sales enablement, digital marketing, constructing supply and demand curves, work- or process-flow studies, and logistics optimization . Our data infrastructure playbook uses best-in-class methods in data engineering, data modelling, and dashboard design to provide our portfolio companies and investment teams with timely and accurate information for measuring success.

We also support Birch Hill’s sourcing and due diligence efforts regarding potential investments including assessing and screening candidates using alternative data sources, optimizing information flow around our deal pipeline, and completing market mapping and customer analytics to inform the investment thesis.

The Co-op Analyst Role

Successful candidates will utilize a variety of tools and skill sets to solve structured and unstructured problems and to support the strategic objectives of Birch Hill’s portfolio companies. Co-op Analysts will work with the team to identify areas of improvement within processes and systems and use analytical skills to produce high-quality analysis. They will also support implementation of their analysis, including working directly with investment professionals and senior executives.

Qualifications

  • Enrolled in an undergraduate program in business, sciences, math, statistics and/or engineering
  • Ability to analytically approach and solve broad and challenging problems
  • Strong communications skills to articulate complex analyses clearly to a variety of stakeholders
  • Curiosity, a desire to be challenged, and the aspiration to continually learn
  • Proficiency in data manipulation languages like SQL, Python, or R
  • Relevant work experience in a data analytics, consulting, or finance role would be an asset

Previous experience with databases, business intelligence tools, ETL pipelines, and/or machine learning systems would be an asset.

Candidates must be legally entitled to work in the country where this role is located.

Qualified applicants are encouraged to apply through the link provided by Wednesday, October 9, 2024 , with cover letter addressed to Mary-Helen Kistner, Recruiting Coordinator and include resume and transcripts.

jobTitle: Student, Market Assessment and Compliance (Multiple Roles)
jobDescription:
Independent Electricity System Operator (IESO)

Due to the IESO’s role in the energy sector, please note that a full security check will be conducted.  Job offers will be conditional until you have successfully attained security clearance to work at the IESO.

Why join us?

You've got great skills. And you want to use them in an organization where you know what you do every day matters. We get that.

We also know that ensuring Ontarians have access to affordable and reliable power doesn't happen by accident. So we give you the tools, flexibility and support you need to achieve your goals, and development opportunities to help you grow. You'll thrive in a collaborative, team-based environment that values your unique skills and experiences - and recognizes that when you do better, we become even better too.

Who we are

The Independent Electricity System Operator (IESO) works at the centre of the province's power system, ensuring Ontarians have access to reliable and cost-effective electricity when and where they need it. We operate the province's electricity grid 24/7, design, run and oversee the wholesale electricity markets, and plan and prepare to meet Ontario's electricity needs - now and into the future.

The opportunity

Division/Department:

The Market Assessment and Compliance Division (MACD) is an independent division of the IESO which is tasked with fostering compliance with market rules and electricity system reliability standards. These rules and standards apply equally to participants in the market and to the IESO itself, which is why MACD’s independence is key to fulfilling its mandate.

Supported by a multi-disciplinary staff, the MACD Vice President independently makes all determinations and exercises all authorities accorded to the IESO in the Ontario electricity market rules concerning monitoring, auditing and investigating possible non-compliance with market rules or reliability standards. These processes may lead to the recovery of market payments and to the imposition of sanctions, including financial penalties.

MACD works proactively to encourage and enable compliance by providing information to participants and the IESO about their obligations under the market rules and reliability standards through a variety of means. These include engaging in public communications, education and rule interpretations.


You will be a part of a group responsible for:

The successful intern(s) would be a member of one of the following teams that are actively working on delivering the IESO’s mandate to support the promotion of an efficient and reliable electricity market and power grid:

  • Market Monitoring and Data Analytics: Responsible for monitoring Ontario’s electricity market for anomalous outcomes and behaviors.
  • Compliance Investigations: Leading the formal enforcement work executed by MACD under its delegations, including investigations, and other formal enforcement actions
  • Payment Recoveries: Responsible for leading certain payment recovery and cost submission audits, leading to the recovery of inappropriate payments on behalf of consumers.
  • Compliance Outcomes: Responsible for assessing potential non-compliance matters, generating case recommendations, investigating matters of potential non-compliance via the Expedited Case Resolution process, and fostering compliance with market rules and reliability standards through a variety of breach prevention and rule education activities.
  • Market Economics: Assess the market design and the efficiency of the wholesale electricity market of Ontario through ad-hoc research. Conduct market impact assessment in the enforcement of market rules and the investigations of non-compliance of market participants
  • Market Assessment Unit: The team’s Market Assessment Unit supports the OEB’s Market Surveillance Panel (MSP) under the terms of the IESO-OEB protocol . The MSP monitors, investigates, and reports on activities and behaviour in the IESO-administered markets.
  • Reliability Standards Investigations & Audits: Accountable for auditing compliance with reliability standards established by the North American Electric Reliability Corporation (NERC), the Northeast Power Coordinating Council (NPCC) and the IESO.

You can learn more about MACD by visiting our ieso.ca website.

What you may do:

Some of the specific activities that interns may be involved in include:

  • Identify, develop and implement new monetary recovery processes and tools to recover certain payments made to market participants;

  • Conduct audits of generation facilities for cost submissions to the IESO’s Real Time Generation Cost Guarantee Program;

  • Audit market participants to ensure they comply with their obligations under the applicable market rules and reliability standards;

  • Process and recover millions of dollars annually for the benefit of the rate-payers of Ontario; and

  • Monitor Ontario’s electricity market for anomalous outcomes and behavior.

This job will provide you with the following professional development:

  • Gathering, summarizing and analyzing market and reliability data, and other sources of evidence;
  • Creating data queries using business intelligence software and simulation tools in various ways (testing hypotheses and developing data models);
  • Automating and enhancing components of existing monetary recovery processes;
  • Developing, testing and refining components of new monetary recovery processes;
  • Assessing compliance with market rules and reliability standards and evaluating reliability and market impacts;
  • Researching, investigating, and reporting on market outcomes and participant conduct using market, operational and other available data sources;
  • Supporting the department in the monitoring, documentation, investigation, enforcement and promotion of market participant compliance with the market rules, regulations, standards, policies and procedures which govern the electricity market in Ontario.

What you need to succeed

Discipline(s) Required:

Engineering Science, Electrical Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering or other Engineering disciplines, Commerce, or Data Science.

This job may provide the following professional development opportunities:

  • Understanding of competitive electricity markets;
  • Regulatory aspects related to maintaining the reliability of the power system;
  • Power systems reliability policy making;
  • Understanding of market rules and reliability standards (NERC, NPCC) ;
  • Economic and power systems engineering theory;
  • Power plant engineering concepts;
  • Applications design and development;
  • Statistical modeling and analysis;
  • Business processes for investigations; and
  • Programming and automating processes.

Duration: 12 to 16 months

Location:

IESO Adelaide [+ Hybrid work model] (Market Assessment Unit team)

120 Adelaide St W

Toronto, ON

M5H 1P9

Number of Students Required: 1

IESO UMR [+ Hybrid work model]

2265 Upper Middle Road East

Oakville, ON

L6H 0G5

Number of Students Required: 6

[If IESO UMR location is not convenient or accessible to you, please indicate so in your cover letter]

What's in it for you

  • A challenging, fast-paced and collaborative team environment, where your perspectives and experiences matter
  • Leaders who support your growth and success through regular feedback and coaching
  • The opportunity to work with some of the brightest minds in the industry

Application Instructions
Please submit a copy of your resume, cover letter, and most recent academic transcript through your school's portal.

Compensation
As per the IESO-PWU agreement, the compensation offered for this role will depend on the number of academic terms completed by the start date. The compensation can range from $23-32 hourly.

At the IESO, we know that achieving great results depends on embracing diversity by attracting, developing and retaining people from a wide variety of backgrounds. We do this by ensuring our recruitment and advancement policies are fair and equitable, and by creating an accessible and inclusive environment - one that values every team member's unique skills and experiences and ensures they have the support they need to achieve their potential. If you require accommodation during the recruitment process, please let us know.

We thank you for your interest in a career at the IESO, but we will only contact those candidates selected for an interview.

Note: The successful candidate must be eligible to work in Canada and will be subject to a background check.

The IESO offers a hybrid work model program to most of our employees, based on business needs. Individuals participating in the program can work an average of three days per week remotely within Ontario. It also offers three flex weeks when individuals can work remotely within Ontario. When working in the office, you will be located at our Toronto or Oakville location.

Join our talent community

Sign up for talent community; stay in touch, find out about new opportunities - and discover how you can make a difference. Discover how we use our expertise and commitment to deliver reliable and affordable electricity to Ontario's businesses and communities, and how we're innovating to secure a stronger energy future for all Ontarians. Visit Careers at IESO and be sure to follow us on LinkedIn .

Find out why we were selected as Greater Toronto's Top 2024 Employers , and what we offer.

jobDescription:
Safran Landing Systems is the world leader in landing gear development and manufacturing, with industrial sites in France, UK, Canada, China and Mexico. It is a prime supplier to Boeing, Airbus, Bombardier and many other aircraft constructors for their landing gears and landing gear systems.

The site in Ajax is one of ten global manufacturing facilities under the Safran Landing Systems umbrella. It specializes in design, manufacturing, testing and servicing aircraft landing gear. Over the last 75+ years, the site has produced landing gear for more than 20 aircraft programs, most recently Bombardier Global 7500 Business Jet and Boeing 787 Dreamliner.

A Technical Writer intern position is available within the Technical Data Team.

Experience is not required, but engineering background would be beneficial.

Must be enthusiastic team player, highly motivated, a quick learner, with very strong organizational and administrative skills.

Why you will love working here:

  • Working with Airframers / customers / suppliers to meet customer tech data requirement to support in-service maintenance activity.
  • This role is both challenging and exciting, offering the chance to work at the forefront of the aviation industry.
  • Dynamic opportunity to make a difference and grow with our expanding Technical Data department.
  • Possibility to continue beyond the Co-op / Internship program.
  • Possibility for flexible hybrid work (model that embraces remote work).
  • Gain real-life work experience with our Tech Data team.
  • Be trusted with important tasks that contribute to the team.
  • People-focused culture.
  • Learning and development initiatives that support employees’ career growth.

Duties & Responsibilities:

Among other assigned tasks, the successful candidate will be primarily responsible for writing, formatting and updating maintenance procedures for landing gear.

This task will include reading and interpreting engineering source data and converting it to useable text based information and procedures to be included in technical manuals.

These technical procedures are designed to meet the customer requirements for safety and economy of maintenance and servicing operations.

Description:

Within the team and under the responsibility of the Technical Data Team Leader, the student will support and provide valuable contributions in the following areas:

  • Assist in designing, proofreading, editing and desktop publishing of in-service maintenance documentation.
  • Support activities and documentation linked to processing customer queries.
  • Help with reviewing drawings / models and design modification for landing gear components for impact in technical manuals.
  • Assist in streamlining existing processes, as required.
  • Perform updates and create performance measurement reports.
  • Participate in various projects, as required.

jobTitle: Mechanical Design Engineering & Project Management Rotation
jobDescription:
Job Title: Mechanical Design Engineering & Project Management Rotation Internship

The Role (What to Expect):

We seek highly motivated hands-on engineering students for a rotation position on the Manufacturing Test Engineering group as part of the “machine that builds the machine”. You will spend one half of your internship in the role of mechanical design engineering, and the next half in the role of technical project management. The group is focused on creating robust, beautiful, data-centric production testing equipment for Tesla’s power electronic components in vehicle, stationary storage, humanoid robot and charging products.

The ideal candidates take pride in their hands-on work, analytical ability, organizational skills, and attention to detail, and appreciate an environment where superior work is encouraged, noticed, and rewarded.  The candidates look forward to learning an incredible amount on the job, excited to try themselves in the role of engineer and a technical project manager, and do not shy away from tremendous levels of responsibility.

Responsibilities (What’ll You’ll Do): (Note: This is 16 months in length and broken into 2 parts)

Mechanical Design Engineering role (8mo):

  • Produce detailed-level CAD models, pneumatic diagrams, create engineering drawings using GD&T practices
  • Verify designs using structural and thermal FEA and CFD, tolerance stack-up analysis
  • Propose innovative solutions for equipment design on part and assembly level
  • Support building, debugging, validation and equipment duplication efforts, and fine-tune equipment for release to production
  • Conduct detailed testing and validation of installed machinery to ensure robustness and quality
  • Perform on-site and off-site acceptance testing (SAT/FAT) of test equipment

Technical Project Management role (8mo):

  • Create schedule (Microsoft Project) to design and deploy test equipment
  • Track project progress and report effectively on status, blockers, and changes to plan of record with effective communication channels to all stakeholders
  • Track resourcing of projects and drive resource balancing between different program priorities
  • Identify creative and timely solutions to key program challenges
  • Drive action with internal and cross functional teams to successfully complete projects within time, budget, and resource constraints
  • Complete appropriate documentation and ensure accuracy of data across Tesla systems (Confluence, JIRA, Microsoft SharePoint, Polarion, SolidWorks PDM)

Requirements (What You’ll Bring):

  • Majoring in Mechanical Engineering, Engineering Science, Mechatronics
  • Hands-on skills with tools, instruments, and measurement techniques
  • Versed in SolidWorks, or similar 3D CAD software
  • Familiarity with various part fabrication techniques (machining, welding, sheet metal fabrication, laser cutting, 3D printing)
  • Preference for candidates with a portfolio showcasing various professional and personal projects (FSAE, BAJA, robotic competitions, and similar)
  • Exemplary verbal and written communication skills
  • Highly organized with meticulous attention to detail
  • Previous engineering or project management internship experience is a plus

jobTitle: Mixed Signal Circuit Design Analysis & CAD (R-51725)
jobDescription:
Job Description

WHAT YOU DO AT AMD CHANGES EVERYTHING

We care deeply about transforming lives with AMD technology to enrich our industry, our communities, and the world. Our mission is to build great products that accelerate next-generation computing experiences – the building blocks for the data center, artificial intelligence, PCs, gaming and embedded. Underpinning our mission is the AMD culture. We push the limits of innovation to solve the world’s most important challenges. We strive for execution excellence while being direct, humble, collaborative, and inclusive of diverse perspectives.

AMD together we advance_

An exciting internship opportunity to make an immediate contribution to AMD's next generation of technology innovations awaits you! We have a multifaceted, high-energy work environment filled with a diverse group of employees, and we provide outstanding opportunities for developing your career. During your internship, our programs provide the opportunity to collaborate with AMD leaders, receive one-on-one mentorship, attend amazing networking events, and much more. Being part of AMD means receiving hands-on experience that will give you a competitive edge. Together We Advance your career!

JOB DETAILS:

  • Location: Markham, Ontario, Canada
  • Hybrid: These roles require the student to work full time (37.5 hours a week), in a hybrid work structure throughout the duration of the co-op/intern term.
  • Duration: 16-months, May 05, 2025 to August 27, 2026.

WHAT TEAM YOU WILL BE JOINING:

You will join the 3rd Party Analog Mixed Signal (AMS) IP Design Analysis and CAD team, which evaluates AMS circuit designs from 3rd party vendors, such as USB and PCIe blocks. The team ensures designs meet specifications, contractual requirements, and align with AMD's chip flows and design blocks.

We also build tools to improve design analysis, providing insight into chip methodologies and CAD workflows. Collaborating closely with internal teams and external vendors, we identify and resolve issues before silicon manufacturing, helping AMD stay on schedule and prevent revenue loss.

As part of this tight-knit team, you'll gain exposure to a range of circuit designs workflows, with strong mentorship and cross-training to foster collaboration and success. This role offers valuable experience in ASIC design, verification, and manufacturing.

WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING:

We are seeking a highly motivated Mixed Signal Circuit Design Analysis & CAD Intern/co-op to join our team. In this role you will be –

  • Understanding, analyzing electrical performance of hybrid Analog / Digital Mixed Signal designs implemented using deep sub micron CMOS technology, and then supporting integration of analog/digital design components into the overall chip system/AMD product.
  • Conduct research on the design to understand & highlight key issues, reviewing flagged issues, analyzing the problem, and then assessing if the design issue must be fixed.
  • Developing, investigating, and improving scripts and test cases to automate the IP design analysis workflow.
  • Working with 3rd party IP vendors to review and discuss analysis results for design fixes and improvements.
  • Work closely with engineers within Markham and other AMD design sites worldwide to enable solutions to these AMS designs.
  • Collaborating with AMD internal teams to cross-reference issues after design integration into the larger chip environment.
  • Use software automation to improve IP design analysis methodologies.
  • Use industry standard physical verification analysis tools to analyze hardware design components before final integration and preparation towards chip manufacture.

WHAT YOU WILL BE LEARNING:

  • The hardware chip development lifecycle from specification to silicon manufacturing.
  • Layout vs. schematic comparison (LVS), design rule checks (DRC/ERC), and circuit topological checks.
  • Schematics, layouts, and industry-standard manufacturing processes.
  • Key topics like electro-migration (EM), power supply analysis (IR), and electrostatic discharge (ESD).
  • Design for manufacturing and silicon reliability.
  • Static timing analysis (STA), SPICE simulation, and parasitic RC extraction.
  • Using EDA tools for analysis and verification at a conceptual level.
  • Revision control software and effective presentation of new workflows.

WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR:

  • 3rd year students in an Electrical or Computer Engineering Bachelor's degree program looking for a 16-month internship.
  • Possess strong hardware and software skills.
  • An understanding of analog and digital transistor device behavior.
  • Desire to develop well-structured and maintainable scripts using languages.
  • Implementing analysis automation using multiple programming/scripting languages such as C, C++ or Perl.
  • Research skills to conduct root cause analysis for software and hardware design bugs.
  • Basic experience in using command line interface with UNIX or Linux, scripting, HSPICE, Verilog or VHDL, and curiosity about transistor level circuits and/or layout.

Benefits offered are described: AMD benefits at a glance .

AMD does not accept unsolicited resumes from headhunters, recruitment agencies, or fee-based recruitment services. AMD and its subsidiaries are equal opportunity, inclusive employers and will consider all applicants without regard to age, ancestry, color, marital status, medical condition, mental or physical disability, national origin, race, religion, political and/or third-party affiliation, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.   We encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective laws throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process.

jobDescription:
Tenstorrent is leading the industry on cutting-edge AI technology, revolutionizing performance expectations, ease of use, and cost efficiency. jobDescription:
Alphawave Semi is looking for a highly motivated, excellent student to join its embedded software team. You will be joining a team whose primary objective is to build reliable core software that operates our high-speed interconnect hardware and devices. This role will span a wide range of fields: low-level C code that runs on embedded microprocessors, C/C++ verification and environment automation, using Python to develop tooling and tests to help support our core team. You will be working closely with Firmware, Digital Design, Design Verification, DevOps, and other Embedded Software team members.

What you’ll be doing:

  • Working on low level drivers to talk to our hardware
  • Optimizing our code to work across various domains like simulation, emulation and silicon
  • Improving development flows and tools
  • Automating testing and integration of our firmware/software across all of our hardware

What we need to see:

  • Student of B.Sc. or equivalent experience in Computer Science / SW / Computer Engineering / Electrical Engineering / Communication Engineering
  • Experience with Python and C
  • Knowledge in Linux
  • Creative, motivated and value driven person

It’d be great if you had:

  • Experience building responsive and reactive web apps

Diversity & Inclusivity

Alphawave Semi is based out of one of the most diverse countries in the world. This includes differences related to race, ethnicity, national origin, gender, gender expression and presentation, sexual orientation, religion, age, ability and socioeconomic status. We believe that it is critical to our success to promote freedom of thought and opinion in a respectful environment. The decisions we make are rooted by respectfully considering each other’s thoughts and opinions and by working towards a greater common goal.

Accommodation

Alphawave Semi is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from all qualified individuals, including visible minorities, Indigenous People, and persons with disabilities. We welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities. If as a qualified job applicant, you request accommodation, Alphawave Semi will consult with you to provide reasonable accommodations according to your specific needs. If you wish to make a request, you will be provided an opportunity if you’re applications is selected to proceed in our hiring process.

jobDescription:
POSITION SUMMARY:

Facilities & Services on the St. George campus is looking for a highly engaged engineering student interested in process improvement and redesign using Lean Six Sigma methodologies combined with automation of processes.

The Process Improvement & Automation Engineer Coop role will be focused on leveraging continuous improvement, user-centered design and institutional automation tools to transform processes, drive innovations and improvements for clients, and yield savings and efficiencies across Facilities & Services. They would support in redesigning processes, and design, code, test, and deploy high-quality flow solutions using applications such as Microsoft Power Platform, Python, and other scripting languages.

This role will work closely with the business improvement team, senior process engineer, process analyst, special projects officer, and other teams across the department including senior management, field personnel, and administrative staff. They will have the opportunity to learn and apply continuous improvement methodologies and cutting-edge technologies to solve real-world problems.

They would be responsible for the capture, documentation, and analysis of business and maintenance processes; identification of improvements and automation opportunities; and actively building, testing, and launching automated solutions using Microsoft Power Platform applications and a variety of programming languages.

They would also support knowledge transfer through the creation of high value, intuitive, and transferable artefacts to ensure the sustainability, maintainability, and longevity of their solutions.

RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES:

  • Conduct interviews and collect data to evaluate internal workflows and business processes.
  • Identify opportunities, gaps, wastes, and areas for efficiencies and automation.
  • Create process and information flow diagrams and visualizations to capture detailed processes and aid in problem solving and optimization.
  • Perform raw data analysis independently and in a team to identify and analyze opportunities to eliminate waste, reduce costs, and improve quality and customer service.
  • Coordinate with stakeholders, conduct meetings and site visits with different staff groups to gather data and information and advise stakeholders on Power Platform opportunities.
  • Document user requirement specifications, standard operating procedures, and standardized work.
  • Apply user-centered approaches in designing new workflows and applications, such as user stories and usability testing.
  • Design, create, build, and test automation solutions using Microsoft Power Platform Applications.
  • Research, evaluate, and implement emerging and best practices when working with the Microsoft Power Platform environment.
  • Integrate Microsoft Power Platform solutions with other Microsoft technologies to optimize the use of the university’s digital Microsoft ecosystem, information sharing, and reporting.
  • Write clean, efficient, and well-documented code following established coding standards for transition to other owners after launch.
  • Assist in the design and implementation of software features and functionalities.
  • Anticipate and mitigate potential technical, data, and user-related issues.
  • Perform testing and troubleshoot software defects to maintain a robust and reliable codebase.
  • Contribute to the documentation of software design, coding, and testing activities.
  • Troubleshoot, debug, and develop fixes to developed applications and automated workflows.
  • Perform general administration tasks such as organizing documents and files.
  • Create and present reports and progress.
  • Lead a key business problem solving project as a highlight activity.

What you will learn:

  • Automation techniques
  • Process improvement and design
  • Process and systems management
  • Stakeholder management and communication
  • Workflow building and deployment for business and administrative processes
  • User-centered design

jobDescription:
Software Developer – Canadian Ice Service

Environment and Climate Change Canada is looking for students to join our Canadian Ice Service development team in the role of Software Developer.

You will have the opportunity to contribute to all aspects of the development process and work on complex scientific weather applications. While many organizations assign students to highly restricted roles, we expect students to grow into a role in which they participate fully in the development process. Assigned tasks may include design, coding, testing, performance analysis, debugging, system installation/configuration, code reviews, and documentation. To contribute effectively to our dynamic, team-based approach to software development, strong communication skills are required.

Geospatial Applications This team at the Canadian Ice Service is responsible for development of mission critical applications and tools in support of the Canadian Ice Service operations. These are complex and highly scalable client/server software systems with Oracle Database and various scientific algorithms developed in a combination of C/C#/C++, VB.NET, and Python languages. These systems are based on GIS and Remote Sensing technologies and are deployed in a mix of Linux and Windows environment. The successful candidate will work in a team of software developers of scientific applications and will be involved in any or all of the following: design, coding and testing of new or existing applications in support of the Canadian Ice Service to meet defined user requirements and established government standards.

Students are treated as full team members and participate in all developer roles including specification, design, development, testing, and reviews at all stages. Developers must be able to work effectively in teams and independently. Strong communication skills are necessary and are a key factor to success.

This position is most suitable for a student who enjoys and thrives in a challenging environment and wants to gain experience in enterprise development and constructing large-scale scientific processing systems.

Preferred Disciplines:

  • Software Engineering
  • Computer Engineering
  • Computer Science
  • Engineering Science (Electrical and Computer)

Geospatial Applications (Location: Ottawa or Toronto)

  • Experience in application programming in at least two (2) programming languages.
  • Being able to work at the office of Environment and Climate Change Canada – Canadian Ice Service, 719 Heron Road location in Ottawa OR at the Toronto location 4905 Dufferin Street
  • Assets: (desirable but non-essential qualifications for the position)
    • Experience with Microsoft Visual Studio IDE and build environment
    • Experience with Remote Sensing and GIS technologies, including ESRI ArcGIS or Open Source GDAL/QGIS
    • Experience with C++/C#/VB.NET
    • Experience with Python

Further Information

The positions are available for 12 to 16-month work terms from May 2023 to August 2024 for students that have completed their 3rd year of a Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Software Engineering, or Engineering Science (Electrical and Computer) degree. Please indicate on your cover letter your work term preference.

Preference may be given to students with higher academic standing. Students to whom an offer is made will be required to pass a check for Enhanced Security Clearance.

If selected for an interview, Canadian students must provide proof of citizenship and non-Canadian students must provide proof of permanent residence. Students must also provide proof of address.

Students must be prepared for technical and behavioral interviews which will be conducted remotely.

We provide a flexible/hybrid work environment combining in-office collaboration and remote working where employees will work in the office at least one two (May 2025) and then three (Sept 2025) days in the office. The candidate will be able to choose between Toronto’s Downsview office and Ottawa’s 719 Heron Road location.

About Environment and Climate Change Canada

At Environment and Climate Change Canada, our business is protecting the environment, conserving the country's natural heritage, and providing weather and meteorological information to keep Canadians informed and safe.

Environment and Climate Change Canada is building on its accomplishments with the environment through credible science, effective regulations and legislation, successful partnerships, and high-quality service delivery to Canadians.

We support sound environmental decisions. We work to repair the damage of the past, collect and pass on knowledge, and develop, implement and enforce policies to prevent future issues. We also work to ensure that Canadians have a safe, clean, and sustainable environment today, tomorrow, and well into the future.

Our workforce is made up of knowledgeable and dedicated employees from diverse backgrounds that are proud of the contribution they make to the environment. We have over 7000 employees from a broad range of fields including biology, chemistry, meteorology, climatology, engineering, commerce, communications, engineering, law enforcement, environmental sciences, hydrology, informatics, law, library science, policy, and more.

Environment and Climate Change Canada’s mandate is to:

Preserve and enhance the quality of the natural environment, including water, air, soil, flora and, fauna; Conserve Canada's renewable resources; Conserve and protect Canada's water resources; Forecast daily weather conditions and warnings, and provide detailed meteorological information to all of Canada; Enforce rules relating to boundary waters; and Coordinate environmental policies and programs for the federal government.

Please visit our website at: [ https://www.canada.ca ]
Download the WeatherCAN app at the Google play store or Apple store.

jobDescription:
The Power of Dreams is alive and well at Honda of Canada Mfg. (HCM). Located in Alliston, Ontario on 750 acres and employing more than 4,500 Associates, HCM is a 45-minute drive north of Toronto and 25 minutes south of Barrie. HCM began production in 1986 leading the way as the first Japanese automobile manufacturer to establish a production facility in Canada. Today, HCM is one of Honda's premier manufacturing facilities in the world producing the Honda Civic and CRV vehicles, including hybrid production. HCM is excited for its new chapter and journey towards electrification, including the highly anticipated EV and battery production plants that are expected in the coming years!

HCM has an exciting opportunity for a 16-month work term beginning May 2025 through August 2026. Successful candidates will become a team member in one of Honda’s many specialized departments (Welding, Paint, Assembly, Plastics, Forming, Die Cast, or Machining) and will be exposed to the latest technology in a highly automated manufacturing facility. Successful candidates will be assigned to a department following the acceptance of their offer. Don’t worry, we make sure to consider your preferences and where you will best fit!

Not sure what to expect while working as an Engineering Intern at HCM? As an Engineering Intern you will gain A LOT of project management experience – projects of all shapes and sizes, but nonetheless important. You will support our engineering, maintenance, reliability, and quality teams in improvements to our manufacturing process; support installation and construction projects; help identify and implement countermeasures for quality concerns; investigate equipment cycle time problems; as well as gain hands on work experience with Equipment Services and Production. Hear from our Interns by clicking this link: https://linktr.ee/HCMRecruitment

First time working in a professional work environment? Don't worry! All our Engineering Interns are assigned and will work alongside an experienced mentor in your department. You will also receive training and mentorship from the Intern you are replacing – a wonderful way to learn and set an example for the students that follow in your footsteps!

Following your internship, you will have a final report and presentation in order to be considered for a permanent (yes, permanent) position within our Engineering Development Program (EDP). What better way to return to school than knowing that you have a permanent position waiting for you following graduation?

Responsibilities:

  • Supporting engineering and project management activities with team members on small and large capital investment projects
  • Prepare and complete reports and documentation for downtime, root cause analysis, countermeasure activity, project status updates, and follow-up activities.
  • Supporting commissioning and installation/maintenance of new and existing equipment
  • Supporting department activities for ongoing improvements to Safety, Environmental, Quality, Cost and Delivery.
  • Supporting the production/assembly line when required (requirements vary by department)

Requirements:

  • Must be within eight months of graduation at the completion of the internship term (currently in year three of a four-year degree, or year four of a five-year degree).
  • Must demonstrate self-motivation and initiative to learn, adapt, and execute projects
  • Must be willing to work hands on – don’t worry, we will provide the training! All skill levels are welcome, you just need to show the willingness!
  • Must have excellent time management and communication
  • Must be willing to work overtime (and A LOT of it!)
    • Many roles will require weekend work, including holidays and our shutdowns (1 week in July, 1 week in December). We provide alternate days off throughout the week to compensate for this. Oh, and did we mention overtime is paid?
  • Must be willing to work on the production line (training provided)
    • We will have you work on the production line at the onset of your internship as part of your training. This ensures you are always trained to jump in and help, develop an appreciation for the manufacturing line, and help build a relationship with your customers (production associates).
  • Must be willing to work 2nd shift
    • You will occasionally be required to support our 2nd shift (4:30pm-1:00am). This will be for 1 week at a time (subject to change). It may not sound the most appealing, but we promise you learn a lot on 2nd shift!

Preferred Experience:

  • Microsoft Office Suite (brush up on your Excel skills!)
  • Demonstrated experience with CAD software’s for electrical or mechanical design, interpretation, and/or analysis (e.g. Catia, Solidworks, AutoCAD, etc.)
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills (including presentation skills) in order to communicate complex problems, schedule amongst team members, and/or coordinate with suppliers and vendors
    • We do a lot of presentations – you will be an expert by the end of this internship!
  • Demonstrated ability to work hands on with basic hand tools, power tools, field wiring, machine shop tools, or measurement equipment (e.g. Digital Multimeters, Oscilloscopes, Gauges, etc.)
    • Anything counts here! No experience? That’s okay! A pro at building Ikea furniture? Great! Show us you are willing to learn!
  • Experience in digital systems and programming (for electrical positions)
    • We use PLCs (Programmable Logic Controller) – want to learn more? We will teach you!
  • Large team project work or technical projects demonstrating ability to succeed in a team environment
  • Project management experience
    • Lean into your school or extra-curricular projects! We will teach you our Engineering Flow (E-Flow) including developing the project scope, schedule creation, status tracking, and coordinating and supervising contractors. You just need to show us you have the foundation to do so!
  • Demonstrated experience in or knowledge of automation equipment including hydraulics, pneumatics, robotics, vision systems, PLCs, HMI’s, VFD’s, conveyors, etc.
  • Ability to work in an open concept environment and be extremely flexible
    • No days are the same at HCM. What makes a successful associate is someone who can pivot and adjust to our ever-changing environment. You may be asked to do something that is completely new to you – embrace it, welcome it, and take it as an opportunity to grow! Future you will thank you.

Additional Information:

HCM offers many activities for associates to get involved in! We have an on-site recreation center (free of charge) that offers a fully equipped fitness center, full size indoor ice rink, and outdoor and indoor courts. We have a (highly loved) hockey, baseball, and soccer league; we offer exercise classes, cross fit, and yoga; drop-in basketball and pickle ball. HCM hosts a spectacular annual Holiday Party and associates always love our Summer BBQ! HCM is also very involved in our community – we annually participate in the Honda Waterfront Run and the Barrie Dragon Boat Festival.

Become even more involved and join your fellow Intern community! They are always getting together for bowling, pizza nights, games and more!

Thought that was a lot? HCM also has five Business Resource Groups (BRG) you can get involved with (think extra-curricular club, but better):

  • Honda Young Professionals: “Enhance experiences and develop careers of Honda’s Young Professional by building community, improving engagement, and providing career resources and guidance.”
  • Women Powering Honda: “Empowering Women at Honda through impactful engagement, and enhancement opportunities in a safe and supportive work environment.”
  • BIPOC of Honda: “Work to foster professional growth and development and to advocate for pathways for these developmental opportunities for BIPOC individuals at HCM.”
  • EARTH (Environmental Actions Rewarding to Honda): “Cultivate Honda associate opportunities for environmental engagement at the facility and in the community.”

Are you someone that’s into cars (I’d sure hope so)? HCM also has a Velocity Motorsports Club (VMC) ! Join a talented group of HCM associates as they prepare for another exciting race season! Not so much into racing but your personal car needs some work? Students are also eligible to use the fully equipped on-site vehicle service center.

At HCM, Respect for the Individual is a fundamental belief. We recognize, respect and value individual differences in one another. We are committed to creating equal opportunity for all associates togrow in adiverse and inclusivework environmentwhile driving continuous improvementwith Passion,deliveringJoy andValue to ourCustomers.

HCM is committed to providing accommodation in its recruitment processes to applicants with disabilities, upon request. The accommodation provided will consider the applicant’s

accessibility needs. If you require accommodation at any time during the recruitment process or to successfully submit an application, please include that information in your application.

jobDescription:
Software Infrastructure Intern

Alphawave Semi is looking for a highly motivated, excellent student to join its software infrastructure team. This is a cross functional software role where you will work with other teams to develop and maintain tools that help our software teams develop firmware, system, and application level software. You will be working closely with Firmware, Design Verification, DevOps, and other Software Infrastructure team members.

What you’ll be doing:

  • Define, develop and maintain performance testing for Alphawave Semi’s HW and SW platforms
  • Working closely with team members to troubleshoot and triage issues related with new SW updates
  • Building automated regression and visualization tools (we build tools in traditional web technologies like MongoDB, React, NextJS, Node, Python, Javascript)
  • Analyzing data and results of tests to help define additional metrics to improve our testing coverage

What we need to see:

  • Student of B.Sc. or equivalent experience in Computer Science / SW / Computer Engineering / Electrical Engineering / Communication Engineering
  • Experience with Python and C
  • Knowledge in Linux
  • Creative, motivated and value driven person

It’d be great if you had:

  • Experience with multi platform systems, both in HW/FW/SW
  • Knowledge of Verilog/SystemVerilog
  • Experience building responsive and reactive web apps
  • Background with Networking applications and protocols
  • Experience with CI tools and methodology (Git, Github Actions, Gitlab, Jenkins etc.)
  • Experience building open source projects and working in a Git Flow type environment

Diversity & Inclusivity

Alphawave Semi is based out of one of the most diverse countries in the world. This includes differences related to race, ethnicity, national origin, gender, gender expression and presentation, sexual orientation, religion, age, ability and socioeconomic status. To us, diversity is one our strongest assets to our organization. We commit ourselves to promoting the recognition and appreciation of our diverse and rich culture. We believe that it is critical to our success to promote freedom of thought and opinion in a respectful environment. The decisions we make are rooted by respectfully considering each other’s thoughts and opinions and by working towards a greater common goal.

Accommodation

Alphawave Semi is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from all qualified individuals, including visible minorities, Indigenous People, and persons with disabilities. We welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities. If as a qualified job applicant, you request accommodation, Alphawave Semi will consult with you to provide reasonable accommodations according to your specific needs. If you wish to make a request, you will be provided an opportunity if you’re applications is selected to proceed in our hiring process.

jobDescription:
Untether AI is a rapidly growing Toronto startup building a next generation hardware AI accelerators for neural net inference. We're designing integrated circuits that will run neural nets orders of magnitude faster and lower power. This class of chips will be the standard platform for running image recognition, speech synthesis, text to speech and many other applications in data centers, mobile phones and self-driving cars within the next 5 years.

We are looking for candidates with strong interest in spatial compiler development, graph and compiler optimizations, and platform specific code-generation. You can expect to be contributing to a small agile team, be working on our spatial compiler, and be provided with close mentoring and guidance from senior software engineers. As part of our fast-moving startup, you'll get to contribute to foundational infrastructure development, as well working on new, unsolved problems.

We encourage interdisciplinarity and learning, so if you have experience spanning hardware and software, come talk with us. But don't worry if you think your experience is too narrowly focused, we've got great projects for people with a wide range of interests and specializations.

Join our Compiler team and learn about our software projects. We have a large number of projects and we'll work together to set the code deliverables for your term with us. In general you can expect to work in Python, C++, and assembly in a loose agile environment (sprints, thorough code review, continuous integration etc.).

Some examples of topics:

  • Assess and integrate new and existing dialects and passes into the compiler flow
  • Design and implement new features in our path-finding algorithm
  • Create and apply heuristics to improve compilation performance
  • Debug emulation and hardware executed code
  • Identify performance bottlenecks and design optimization passes

We don't have strict skill requirements, but of course prior experience in the tools and skills we use is a plus:
- Tools and programming languages we use: python, C/C++, git, LLVM
- Topics we are interested in include: neural nets inference, compiler design, digital logic design and analysis, graphs and high dimensional spaces, path-finding algorithms
- Skills we are looking for: good data structures and algorithms knowledge, experience with software architecture patterns, confidence with low-level topics like bit manipulation, general hardware and/or HDL experience, assembly languages, AI experience

jobDescription:
About Arcadis
Arcadis is the world's leading company delivering sustainable design, engineering, and consultancy solutions for natural and built assets. We are more than 36,000 people, in over 70 countries, dedicated to improving quality of life. Everyone has an important role to play. With the power of many curious minds, together we can solve the world's most complex challenges and deliver more impact together.

Role Description & Accountabilities:

In this role you will work in multi-disciplinary project teams across North America. Sample technology systems that you will help plan, design, and deploy include:

•Fare collection (such as open payment, smart cards, and mobile apps)

•Fleet tracking and operations management (getting buses, streetcars, and trains in-service and keeping them on schedule)

•Customer information (from trip planners to arrival predictions)

•On-Demand Shared Mobility (multimodal trip integration and microtransit)

•Business intelligence (data integration, warehouses, and analytics)

•Security (onboard and in-facilities) Responsibilities:

•Research on transit technology and data solutions;

•Transit technology and data strategic planning;

•Support project management tasks;

•Transit data cleaning, manipulation, and visualization;

•Attend stakeholder workshops, conduct needs and gaps assessment;

•Develop functional requirements/specifications and procurement process documents;

•Evaluate vendor proposals and design documentation;

•Document and test software/hardware systems and user interfaces;

•Review documentation to verify compliance with industry standards; •

Prepare project schedules and cost estimates;

•Systems testing, including review of test procedures;

•Support of business development and proposal initiatives;

•Current-state business process documentation and future-state business process re-engineering; and

•Report/technical writing.

Qualifications & Experiences

• Candidates must be enrolled in an Engineering program, including civil, electrical, computer engineering (other disciplines will also be considered)

• Have demonstrably above average oral and written communications skills

• Able to work effectively both independently and on multiple teams

• Motivated to support and improve public transit, through use of technology/data to improve operations and the customer experience

Why Arcadis?
We can only achieve our goals when everyone is empowered to be their best. We believe everyone's contribution matters. It's why we are pioneering a skills-based approach, where you can harness your unique experience and expertise to carve your career path and maximize the impact we can make together.


You'll do meaningful work, and no matter what role, you'll be helping to deliver sustainable solutions for a more prosperous planet. Make your mark, on your career, your colleagues, your clients, your life and the world around you.

Together, we can create a lasting legacy.

Additional information
As part of Arcadis' selection process, candidates may be requested to consent to background checks relevant to the role under consideration for, prior to receiving a job offer (as applicable under state law). These could include work references, education and credential confirmation, employment verification and driver's license record.

We thank all applicants for their interest. However, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Arcadis is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability.

Join Arcadis. Create a legacy.

jobDescription:
Are you passionate about pushing the boundaries of biomedical innovation? At the Innovative Biomaterials Lab, led by Professor Yuhan Lee, and the Center for Accelerated Medical Innovation, led by Professor Jeffrey Karp, we are at the forefront of developing cutting-edge solutions in nanomedicine, regenerative medicine, and advanced biomaterials. As part of the Center for Nanomedicine at Brigham and Women’s Hospital, you’ll have the opportunity to collaborate with world-renowned researchers and contribute to life-changing medical breakthroughs.

We are seeking highly motivated individuals with a background in life sciences (biology, biochemistry, physiology), engineering (biological, chemical, biomedical, materials, mechanical), or related fields (chemistry, pharmaceutical sciences) to join our team. Some lab experience (4+ months) is preferred.

Key responsibilities include:

  • Conceiving, fabricating, and screening new biomaterials/devices for drug delivery.
  • Designing innovative in vitro and ex vivo models for biomaterial/device screening.
  • Synthesizing biomaterials/devices, such as microneedles or nanoparticles, using top-down and bottom-up approaches.
  • Utilizing standard biochemical and mechanical analysis techniques to validate and perform quality control on biomaterials/devices.
  • Testing biomaterials/devices in in vivo models to evaluate their performance.
  • Formalizing and documenting results through presentations and contributions to manuscript figures and text.

Highly desired skills (though we don’t expect candidates to have all) include:

  • Basic wet lab techniques (pipetting, making buffers, aseptic technique).
  • Device design and fabrication (soft lithography, solvent casting, heat molding, 3D printing, machining, laser cutting).
  • Biochemical analyses (RT-PCR, gel electrophoresis, SDS-PAGE, Western blots, ELISA, Luminex, enzymatic activity assays, histopathology, immunohistochemistry).
  • Chemical synthesis, purification, and analyses (HPLC/UPLC, mass spectrometry, mechanical analyses).

If you are ready to make a meaningful impact and accelerate the future of healthcare, we invite you to join us! This is a stipendiary position. Visa support is provided and the roles are open to students of all citizenship. This is a 12 month position with a flexible start date between May 2024 and September 2024.

Note : We are hiring interns via PreSearch (www.presearch.app). To apply, click “Sign Up as an Intern” and fill out the form to make your profile. Once you log into your profile you can choose which project(s) to apply for.

jobDescription:
Responsibilities
Within the Research and Technology team, the student will work as a developer on a fast-paced team to develop a Multi-Disciplinary Optimization (MDO) software tool to aid the initial design of aircraft landing gear based on early stage aircraft configuration data.

You are likely to succeed in this role if

  • Are an aerospace/mechanical engineering candidate with a knack for software development
  • You took programming courses in High School and actually enjoyed it
  • You prefer to write to do your lab reports in MatLab/python over Excel
  • You’ve been heavily involved with (or preferably led) a student team (bonus points if you’ve been working with avionics)
  • You’ve held a research position at your university
  • You’re a strong self-learner and have a proven track record of teaching yourself new skills

jobDescription:
Untether AI is a rapidly growing Toronto startup building a next generation hardware AI accelerator for neural net inference. We're designing integrated circuits that will run neural nets orders of magnitude faster and lower power. This class of chips will be the standard platform for running image recognition, speech synthesis, text to speech and many other applications in data centers, mobile phones and self-driving cars within the next 5 years.

We are looking for creative problem solvers who are interested in developing a deep understanding of our technology and applying that knowledge to the creation of high performance compute kernels. You can expect to be contributing to a team effort focused on delivering performant networks servicing real custom needs. The scope of your task would be limited only by your abilities and ambition. You would be provided with close mentoring and guidance from senior software engineers. As part of our fast-moving startup, you'll get to contribute to foundational infrastructure development, as well working on new, unsolved problems.

We encourage interdisciplinarity and learning, so if you have experience spanning hardware and software, come talk with us. But don't worry if you think your experience is too narrowly focussed, we've got great projects for people with a wide range of interests and specializations.

Join our product & customer software engineering team and come learn about the neural networks / architecture the industry is using today and write software that would enable our customers to run these networks on our chip.. We'll work together to set the deliverables for your term with us, but in general you can expect to work both in C/C++ and python scripting.

Some examples of topics:

  • Neural Net Performance Testing: Build, and compile neural networks for ingestion and performance analysis
  • Product Development: Support feature development for our internal neural network estimation tool to enhance its functionality, accuracy, and usability, ensuring it meets the evolving needs of our team
  • Research: Review cutting edge neural networks to understand underlying processes of neural network architecture and potentially optimize neural nets
  • Compute kernel: Understand, code, optimize and test compute kernels for common machine learning layers (eg convolution, upsample, NMS, etc).
  • Re-usable library components: Define, develop and test reusable library components that build towards the goal of efficient performant compute kernel development.
  • Run the customer networks on our chip to feel the petaops era. Debug and develop support to run these networks on the chip
  • Simplify the customer network pipeline to enable quicker and faster turnaround for these customer networks
  • Write optimized applications for our customers that would enable our chips to showcase the best performance.

We don't have strict skill requirements, but of course prior experience in the tools and skills we use is a plus, including:

Required Skills
- Experience with Python, C++, git, PyTorch, onnx
- Knowledge of AI algorithms
- Strong OOP and mathematics skills
- Enjoy solving very complex problems

Nice to Have Skills:
- Assembly language development experience
- CUDA or other low-level GPU or AI accelerator programming experience

jobDescription:
Hi, we’re ecobee. ecobee introduced the world’s first smart Wi-Fi thermostat to help millions of consumers save money, conserve energy, and bring home automation into their lives. That was just the beginning. We continue our pursuit to create technology that brings peace of mind into the home and allows people to focus on the moments that matter most. We take pride in making a meaningful difference to the environment, all while being part of the exciting, connected home revolution.

In 2021, ecobee became a subsidiary of Generac Power Systems. Generac introduced the first affordable backup generator and later created the category of automatic home standby generator. The company is committed to sustainable, cleaner energy products poised to revolutionize the 21st century electrical grid. Together, we take pride in making a meaningful difference to the environment, all while being part of the exciting, connected home revolution.

For more on ecobee: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RR4rKtkf1SY

The Role:

Software Developers do more than just product development! At ecobee, the Site Reliability Engineering team takes a software development approach to what was traditionally called “IT” or “Operations”. Our team is responsible for all the server infrastructure for our products: physical hardware and on cloud platforms like AWS and GCP.

Our aim is to imbue SRE principles throughout the organization through hands-on work like contributing directly to the code base, guiding services to production readiness, and building common tooling for all of engineering. We are all curious folks and strive to be constantly learning!

We are looking for a Site Reliability Engineer Intern to join our team for a 2023-2024 PEY work term!

How You’ll Make an Impact:

  • You will use your software development skills to solve challenges in performance measurement and tuning, software scalability, reliability, and security.
  • You will use cutting-edge tools like Kubernetes, Terraform, Prometheus, Ansible, Packer, Docker (the list goes on…) to automate infrastructure
  • Your Linux skills, network knowledge and fundamental security skills help ecobee to deliver superior customer experiences and products.

We’re up to incredible things. Come and be part of them.

What can you expect as an ecobee student?

  • The chance to meet and work with co-ops across all teams at ecobee
  • The opportunity to work in a fresh, dynamic, and ever-growing industry that is the SmartHome and IoT space
  • The visibility into a company that has an interesting mix of hardware and software consumer-facing businesses
  • Access to our headquarters, located near at the waterfront in Downtown Toronto, overlooking the lake (with complimentary pizza lunches every Thursday!)
  • The ability to make an environmental impact, both in your day job and outside the 9-5 with programs like ecobee acts!
  • Opportunities to learn and grow with our in-house learning enablement team, #ThinkLab
  • Small collaborative teams where you can impact both product and culture
  • Q&A sessions with senior leaders at ecobee
  • Weekly virtual game hangouts hosted by previous co-ops who’ve transitioned to full-time roles
  • Quarterly hack-a-thons, where you get a chance to work on whatever project you want!

ecobee believes all people have equal value and we are committed to providing a safe space for everyone . We welcome all applicants with diverse races, genders, ages, religions, identities, experiences, etc. and we will provide accommodation to all applicants throughout our hiring process.

jobDescription:
About Us

We believe AI will fundamentally transform how people live and work. CentML's mission is to massively reduce the cost of developing and deploying ML models so we can enable anyone to harness the power of AI and everyone to benefit from its potential.


Our founding team is made up of experts in AI, compilers, and ML hardware and has led efforts at companies like Amazon, Google, Microsoft Research, Nvidia, Intel, Qualcomm, and IBM. Our co-founder and CEO, Gennady Pekhimenko, is a world-renowned expert in ML systems who holds multiple academic and industry research awards from Google, Amazon, Facebook, and VMware.


Overview:

We are seeking highly motivated and skilled systems engineers to join our team to help in developing the CentML platform that offers a cost effective infrastructure for serving and training large scale machine learning models. As a systems engineer, you will play a crucial role in building a unified solution that brings our innovative in-house technologies such as Hidet compiler, DeepView, and other ML optimizations into a single, cohesive platform. Your expertise will drive the scalability, performance, and reliability of the platform, enabling our customers to seamlessly access and utilize a comprehensive suite of ML services that we offer.


This hybrid opportunity is based in CentML’s Downtown Toronto office, with a minimum of 3 days in the office. Business requirements may require office attendance for 5 days/week in the office for extended periods.

Responsibilities:

    • Taking part in the design and development of the CentML platform.
    • Designing and building solutions for scheduling large scale ML training and inference workloads on GPU clusters over multiple CSPs.
    • Communicate with our product teams and define use cases, and develop methodology & benchmarks to evaluate different approaches.

Who you are:

    • Strong coding skills (in at least one of Python and C++).
    • Solid fundamentals in other computer science and computer engineering topics: algorithms and data structures, operating systems, computer architecture, etc.
    • Experience working with ML/DL systems and frameworks
    • Excellent communication skills and the ability to work in a team.

jobDescription:
At The Six Semiconductor (TSS), our mission is to connect people and technology for a smarter world, by accelerating progress and bringing innovative ideas to life. As a semiconductor IP provider with a focus on System-on-Chip (SoC) memory sub-systems, we achieve this mission with our best-in-class mixed-signal designs combined with exceptional service. Our award-winning company is supported by a world-class engineering team with a long list of achievements and accomplishments in the semiconductor industry.

Job Summary

We are looking for a passionate and driven Digital Implementation Engineer Intern to join our engineering team. This internship offers a hands-on opportunity to work alongside experienced engineers, contributing to the digital design implementation process. You will gain valuable experience in digital circuit design, physical design, and the RTL-to-GDSII flow, as well as exposure to industry-standard EDA tools.

Key Responsibilities

  • Assist in Design Implementation: Support the digital design implementation process, including tasks such as synthesis, PnR, and timing analysis
  • Methodology Development: Develop and enhance design flows using scripting languages to streamline design processes and to improve product quality
  • EDA Tool Usage: Gain hands-on experience with EDA tools under the guidance of senior members of the team
  • Collaboration: Work closely with design and release engineering teams to understand the full design process and contribute to ongoing projects
  • Documentation: Assist in creating and maintaining design documentation and reports

Qualifications

  • Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or an equivalent field
  • Technical Skills:
    • Understanding of electrical circuits in both transistor and logic gate level
    • Basic understanding of RTL design principles and Verilog HDL language
    • Experience with scripting languages e.g. TCL, Perl, Python is an asset
    • Exposure to digital implementation EDA tools such as Cadence Genus, Innovus is an asset
  • Soft Skills:
    • Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities
    • Excellent communication skills

jobDescription:
Untether AI is a rapidly growing Toronto startup building a next generation hardware AI accelerator for neural net inference. We're designing integrated circuits that will run neural nets orders of magnitude faster, while using less power. This class of chips will be the standard platform for running image recognition, speech synthesis, text-to-speech, and many other applications in data centers, mobile phones, and self-driving cars within the next 5 years.

With our second generation speedAI silicon up and running in the lab, our firmware team is focused on a few primary areas:

  • Bringing speedAI to market:
    • Chip, board, and system validation (hands on lab work, scripting, etc.)
    • Firmware development and productization (Low level C++ coding)
  • Developing the next generation:
    • Pre-silicon firmware development using a novel subsystem firmware development framework
    • Closely working with firmware and Verilog RTL designers as well as Design Verification engineers to define and develop firmware for specific subsystems
    • Verification of firmware integration through co-simulation of firmware with RTL

We are looking for self motivated and innately curious candidates. You can expect to be put in charge of an important project that will challenge you to learn and you will be provided with mentoring and guidance from veteran hardware engineers. Because we're building new systems from the ground up, you'll get to work on new unsolved problems.

We encourage interdisciplinarity and learning, so if you have experience in hardware or software, come talk to us. But don't worry if you think your experience is too narrowly focused, we've got great projects for people with a wide range of interests and specializations.

Join our Firmware team and come learn about our hardware projects. You can pick your own project from a large number of topics, and we'll work together to set the deliverables for your term with us. In general, expect to work in a loose SCRUM like environment (weekly/biweekly work sprint with code deliverable) where you are submitting your designs or code for team review via git merge/pull request or group presentation.

Some examples of tasks:

  • Integrate third-party verilog RTL modules into our leading-edge AI chips
  • implement verilog hardware modules for peripherals of our core processor
  • create firmware routines that initialize hardware modules in a "c model" environment using VSCode
  • Verify the functionality of both the RTL and firmware designs together using a firmware/RTL co-simulation environment
  • Submit firmware and RTL routines for review through git

We don't have strict skill requirements, but of course prior experience in the tools and skills we use is a plus:
- c and c++, Makefiles, python, synopsys (VCS), verilog, git
- Topics and skills we are interested in include: cpu design, firmware design, digital logic design and verification

jobDescription:
Job Summary
We're looking for a Software Engineering Intern to join our team, where you will get the chance to build a modern patient care management platform on AWS using cloud-native technology. Our vision and product at MedMe have already disrupted the legacy platforms in pharmacy care delivery and we would love you to join us in further excelling our impact within our healthcare system.

Co-founders Purya, Nick & Rui built MedMe together after identifying the biggest problem to be existing pharmacy software built 20 years ago with the primary purpose to sell drugs. Purya was a health data scientist for the government, Nick a product engineer for the Tesla Roadster, and Rui is a Pharmacist. Our team is equally passionate about using pharmacists to provide more services for patients in the community.


We are building software for an industry that has relied on paper and pen for a long time. This is why crafting, building, and constantly improving the end-to-end customer experience is an essential part of our company. It's crucial that we listen deeply to the diverse needs of our pharmacies - located anywhere from dense urban jungles to northern remote communities - to design and build for their needs to ultimately provide more proactive and sustainable care for the patients in their communities.

Our mission
MedMe is building the operating system to transform pharmacies into community health hubs. Pharmacies are increasingly doing more than just selling drugs, offering services like vaccinations, prescribing meds, and blood tests. MedMe Health builds software that helps schedule, document, and manage these services at scale.

Our clients include the two largest pharmacy chains in Canada, servicing coast-to-coast in 4000+ pharmacies across 10 provinces, serving millions of patients.

The opportunity
- Building web applications using React and NodeJS (both in Typescript) using GraphQL and a Postgres database on AWS infrastructure
- Collaborating on key technology decisions to shape the architecture and product roadmap
- Mentorship from senior software engineers with depth of experience in healthtech from startups to large corporations
- Participating in the maintenance of a quality codebase through code reviews, sprint planning, and retrospectives
- Working with code and project management tools such as JIRA/Notion/Figma

As an example, here are some projects you could expect to work on:
- Creating new patient and pharmacist flows (eg. intakes, modules, features) to meet the needs of both our national enterprises and mom-and-pop pharmacy partners
- Scaling our test environments using the AWS CDK (IaC)
- Working with 3rd party digital health platforms (eg. EHRs/pharmacy software, remote monitoring devices) to facilitate integration and data interoperability that allows pharmacists to deliver more personalized, proactive care
- Building & versioning APIs that are consumed by third parties

Job Responsibilities:

  • Participate in agile development with our engineering and product teams
  • Build out high throughput, Cloud Native (AWS) infrastructure to support our workload
  • Ensure MedMe software meets the highest standards of security and reliability
  • Support the development of new features for our customers
  • Investigate needs for various stakeholder groups (i.e. pharmacists, patients, doctors) and new features to improve the user experience
  • Learn, have fun, and put your best foot forward as your role at MedMe will only be limited by your willingness to self-discover new product possibilities and verticals to champion
  • Opportunities for tasks related to UX Design, Database Design, Dev Ops, and/or QA depending on your interest

Required

  • Previous full-stack experience working in software/product development teams
  • Fundamental understanding of Object-Oriented or Functional Programming
  • Strong entrepreneurial drive to be part of an industry-disrupting start-up team
  • Motivated to learn about the healthcare industry and make an impact through technology
  • Demonstrated ability to effectively communicate and work well with others


Bonus

  • Previous DevOps / QA experience
  • Experience launching and scaling real-world customer-facing products
  • Proficiency in the following: React, JavaScript, Typescript, NodeJS, GraphQL, PostgreSQL


Don't worry if you don't check every box! We look for growth mindsets more so than checking boxes.

*Please include your GitHub account in your application.
