jobDescription:
By submitting your resume, you’re expressing interest in one of our 2025 Systems Software Engineering Internships . We’ll review resumes on an ongoing basis, and a recruiter may reach out if your experience fits one of our many internship opportunities.

NVIDIA pioneered accelerated computing to tackle challenges no one else can solve. Our work in AI and digital twins is transforming the world's largest industries and profoundly impacting society — from gaming to robotics, self-driving cars to life-saving healthcare, climate change to virtual worlds where we can all connect and create.

Our internships offer an excellent opportunity to expand your career and get hands on with one of our industry leading Hardware teams. We’re seeking strategic, ambitious, hard-working, and creative individuals who are passionate about helping us tackle challenges no one else can solve. Throughout the internship, students will work on projects that have a measurable impact on our business.

The hourly rate for our interns is 18 USD - 71 USD. Our internship hourly rates are a standard pay determined based on the position and your location, year in school, degree, and experience.

You will also be eligible for Intern benefits . NVIDIA accepts applications on an ongoing basis.

Potential Internships in this field include:

Systems Software

  • Defining, designing, and developing integrated (e.g., Jetson Orin) and discrete (e.g., Hopper H100) GPU system software components (e.g., runtime, math libraries) with focus on power and performance, as well as creating architecture and design specifications

  • Course or internship experience related to the following areas could be required: Operating Systems (Threads, Process Control, Memory/Resource Management, Virtual Memory), Multithreaded Debugging, Linux Kernel Development, RTOS Development on Embedded Platforms, Data Structures & Algorithm time/space complexity

Graphics Systems Software

  • Designing and implementing of OpenGL, OpenGL ES, and Vulkan graphics drivers, platform support, and conformance tests to support new hardware features in collaboration with other software, hardware, architecture, and support teams

  • Training and debugging various issues within the Tegra graphics software stack

  • Course or internship experience related to the following areas could be required: Computer Architecture, Operating Systems, Real-Time Systems Development, Device Driver Programming, Game Console Middleware, or other Low-Level Library Development, 3D/2D Graphics Theory, Implementation & Optimizations, Simulation or Emulation (writing & debugging tests)

Compiler

  • Working at the center of deep-learning compiler technology, spanning architecture design and support through functional languages

  • Investigating problems or optimization opportunities within the Compiler backend by working with global compiler, hardware, and application teams to oversee improvements and problem resolutions

  • Course or internship experience related to the following areas could be required: Compiler Development, Open Source Programming, High-Performance Computing (HPC)

Firmware & Embedded Software

  • Supporting development of firmware run on embedded microcontrollers within GPUs, while optimizing software to improve system robustness, performance, and security

  • Participating in testing new and existing firmware, and developing tools and infrastructure to improve our front-end design and verification process

  • Course or internship experience related to the following areas could be required: Operating Systems (Threads, Process Control, Memory/Resource Management, Virtual Memory), Embedded Systems Software Development, Data Structures & Algorithms, Computer Architecture, Computer Systems Software, Linux Kernel Development, Multi-Threaded or Multi-Process Programming, RTOS Development on Embedded Platforms

Software Security

  • Hardening and developing secure solutions across the software stack, spanning multi-node supercomputers down to microcontrollers and security co-processors

  • Building tools and infrastructure to scale security efforts across large organizations and codebases with millions of lines of code

  • Course or internship experience related to the following areas could be required: Operating Systems, Data Structures & Algorithms, Cybersecurity, Cryptography, Computer Systems Architecture, Microcontroller and Microprocessor fundamentals (Caches, Buses, Memory Controllers, DMA, etc.)

Qualifications:

-Currently pursuing a Bachelor's, Master's, or PhD degree within Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field

Depending on the internship role, prior experience or knowledge requirements could include the following programming skills and technologies:
-C, C++, CUDA, x86, ARM CPU, GPU, Linux, Perl, Bash/Shell Scripting
-Operating Systems (Threads, Process Control, Memory/Resource Management, Virtual Memory), Formal Verification Tools (Spark, Frama-C), Linux Kernel Development, Multi-Threaded or Multi-Process Programming, Open Source Tools (CLANG, LLBM, gcc), Testing Production/Automation Tools (XLA, TVM, Halide), Microprocessor Fundamentals (Caches, Buses, Memory Controllers, DMA, etc.)

jobTitle: Software Engineering Intern (Analytics Data Ingestion Team)
jobDescription:
About Us

Zynga is a leading developer of the world's most popular social games that are played by millions of people around the world each day. We are headquartered in San Francisco and have additional offices in the U.S., Canada, U.K and India. Since our founding in 2007, our mission has been to connect the world through games and delight consumers with social gaming experiences. To date, more than one billion people have played our games across the Web and mobile, including FarmVille, Zynga Poker, Words With Friends, Hit it Rich! Slots and CSR.

Our Teams

Zynga's software engineers don't just develop some of the world's largest games; they deliver highly scalable infrastructure used by tens of millions of users every day. Our software engineers are blazing trails in all facets of game design, mobile technologies, and massive scalability. Zynga faces a number of challenges - but many are unique to our situation: the large data requirements of online gaming require us to continually push boundaries to discover the best solutions. Zynga software engineers are willing to pick up any of the languages, technologies, or methodologies necessary to smite a challenge - and if a conventional solution doesn't exist, they innovate as necessary. Our software engineers are comfortable moving between frontend, backend, and architecture roles.

Job Responsibilities

The Analytics Data Ingestion team builds near real-time ingestion pipelines to collect and process data for our analytics systems and platforms that power reporting, business intelligence, player engagement, machine learning and user acquisition.

Join us as we solve challenges developing and operating products at scale, impacting millions of players daily and supporting our games to achieve the highest levels of success through expertly crafted software. And you will be doing it with a seasoned team of professionals, pushing the capabilities and quality of our products and technology. No gaming experience is needed for the right candidate.

Who You Are

  • You are smart, self-motivated, and eager to learn!
  • You love solving difficult problems, and are not afraid of taking on things that you know nothing about!
  • You love coding, and are passionate about making things more robust!
  • You love playing video games, board games, table tennis, or pool :)

What We Are Looking For

  • Working towards a Bachelor in Math, Engineering or a related technical discipline (or equivalent)
  • Solid foundation in Computer Science - data structures, algorithms and object-oriented design
  • Experience in Java, Go, C/C++, JavaScript, or Python
  • Knowledge of Unity, C# or native coding isn't required but is an asset

What We Offer You

  • Daily lunches, tons of snacks and beverages
  • Zynga happy hours and frequent employee events
  • Flexible working hours on many teams
  • Casual dress every single day
  • Culture of diversity and inclusion including employee resource groups
  • Work with cool people and impact millions of daily players

Equal Opportunity Employer Statement

Zynga is an equal opportunity employer. We are proud of our diverse community; we do not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, medical condition, disability, or any other class or characteristic protected by applicable law. We welcome candidates, players, employees, and partners from all backgrounds. Join us!

Zynga will consider for employment all qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with applicable law.

We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with physical or mental disabilities in order to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us at AccommodationRequest@zynga.com to request an accommodation associated with your application for an open position.

Zynga does not  engage in financial exchanges during the recruitment or onboarding process. We do not conduct job interviews over third-party messaging apps such as Telegram, WhatsApp or others. We will never ask you for your personal or financial information over unofficial chat channels. Our in-house recruitment team only contacts individuals via official company email addresses (i.e., via a zynga.com or naturalmotion.com email domain).

If you believe you have been the victim of a scam, you may wish to contact the authorities. In the United States, you may file a complaint with the FBI. More information is available here: https://www.ic3.gov .

jobTitle: Total Portfolio Investment Analyst, Student Intern
jobDescription:
Why you’ll love working here:

  • high-performance, people-focused culture

  • our commitment that equity, diversity and inclusion are fundamental to our work environment and business success, which helps employees feel valued and empowered to be their authentic selves

  • learning and development initiatives, including workshops, Speaker Series events and access to LinkedIn Learning, that support employees’ career growth

  • optional membership in HOOPP’s world class defined benefit pension plan, which can serve as an important part of your retirement security

  • virtual fitness, yoga and meditation classes, nutritional consultations and wellness seminars

  • flexible hybrid work model that embraces remote work

  • the opportunity to make a difference and help take care of those who care for us, by providing a financially secure retirement for Ontario healthcare workers

Application deadline: October 6, 2024

Application requirements: Resume, transcript and optional cover letter

*please note, this is a required 12-month internship starting in May 2025

Job Summary

About the Team

Created in 2020, the Total Portfolio Group (TPG) is tasked with stewarding the composition of the Fund’s overall investment portfolio to ensure that HOOPP can deliver on its pension promise over the long term. TPG acts as the brain trust of the Chief Investment Officer on all issues related to the total fund and is a central part of the Front Office in the Investment Management Division. TPG has several core functions: Macro-economic commentaries and how they impact the total portfolio, Portfolio construction and asset allocation, portfolio analytics, and total portfolio management including liquidity and currency management policies.

TPG advises the CIO and CEO on matters of strategic importance to the total Fund including recommendations on how to best orient the Policy portfolio. TPG provides additional research and analytical capabilities for internal cross-departmental initiatives relating to Value-Added platforms, risk management, investment technology, policies and procedures, benchmarks, and performance. The team accomplishes this by leading research initiatives as well as developing and implementing solutions collaboratively across the firm.

TPG is led by the Senior Managing Director, Total Portfolio, who has many years of experience in portfolio construction, asset allocation and risk modelling. He publishes multiple articles in leading international peer-reviewed journal articles in Finance and Engineering including leading-edge portfolio allocation research. The TPG management team includes a Managing Director, Total Portfolio, who is a seasoned investor and has a wide array of knowledge from portfolio strategy and asset allocation. The TPG management team also include access to a full-time Professor of Finance located in Toronto. He oversees TPG’s research projects and ensures they are backed by rigorous research and analysis. He not only has strong academic background but brings extensive industry experience from large pension funds and financial institutions.

About the Role

The candidate will be working with a high-caliber team with backgrounds in Investments, Finance, Statistics, Quantitative Analysis and Data Science. The candidate will participate in regular meetings within TPG and with the Senior Managing Director, TPG as well as the Chief Investment Officer at HOOPP. This role is ideal for students who would like to gain relevant fundamental knowledge in top-down strategic asset allocation, investment analytics, and cross-asset risk management and would like to build a career in the asset management and investing businesses. The candidate will be able to gain knowledge from experts on a regular basis while working in a small, collaborative team which operates in a flat organizational structure. The candidate will have rare access to a Professor of Finance on-site, ideal for students who wish to proceed in a higher education in Finance, or are passionate about continuous learning.

This role will assist in the design, development, and automation of existing and new portfolio management & risk analytics and reports suited to both top-down portfolio construction decision-making as well as securities-level bottom-up investing by public & private investment teams (e.g., Public Equities, Fixed Income, Credit, Real Estate, etc.). This is done by leveraging the Blackrock Aladdin system that HOOPP has recently brought online and other internally-built tools. This role will also aim to support TPG as well as other investment departments in other fund wide projects of strategic importance to HOOPP. The successful candidate’s contributions will be visible to the senior management team and the Chief Investment Officer (CIO) of HOOPP. The ideal candidate will be skilled in computer science / software engineering and potentially data science , and have a keen interest for financial markets and a strong desire to develop a career in Finance . This is an excellent opportunity to interact and learn from experienced investment professionals and contribute to real-world investment decision making.

What you will do:

  • Assist in designing and building reporting tools related to various risk exposures, including the design of specific reports for front office use

  • Help running daily front office reports and be able to independently troubleshoot issues

  • Assist in streamlining existing investment system processes, as required

  • Take on and automate daily reconciliation and error checking process for key reports on P&L (profit and loss), risk, and liquidity

  • Develop analysis and what-if tools to be used in total fund decision making, including various impacts of asset mix shifts

  • Support the Total Portfolio Group with portfolio analysis and financial modeling around private and public asset classes as well as emerging portfolio problems, as required

  • Collaborate with HOOPP’s technology team on internal technology initiatives

  • Assist in the preparation of oral and written materials for the Total Portfolio Group

  • Perform ad-hoc research on markets and/or model methodologies, as required

  • Participate in ad-hoc total fund projects, as required

What you bring:

  • Enrolled in a university program in Mathematics, Science, Engineering, Finance, or other quantitative discipline.

  • Proficiency in architecting and designing scalable software in Python.

  • Experience in software development using OOP language is desirable, but not required.

  • Strong Excel skills, especially working with large datasets and data manipulation.

  • Strong numeracy is critical.

  • Excellent work ethic, time management, organizational skills and the ability to meet tight deadlines.

  • Strong ability to deliver effective, sensible analyses in an environment of informational uncertainty.

  • Exceptional attention to detail with highly developed interpersonal and communication skills.

  • Progress towards CFA designation is an asset.

  • Passion and curiosity for financial markets and investing, intellectual curiosity, and willingness and ability to learn new concepts.
